/test/devkit/MCFinderLib.t.sol:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1 | // SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT
 2 | pragma solidity ^0.8.23;
 3 | 
 4 | import {MCTestBase, MessageHead as REASON, Dummy} from "@mc-devkit/Flattened.sol";
 5 | 
 6 | contract MCFinderLibTest is MCTestBase {
 7 |     /**
 8 |      * ----------------------------------
 9 |      *     🏠 Find Current Proxy Address
10 |      * ------------------------------------
11 |      */
12 |     function test_toProxyAddress_Success() public {
13 |         bytes4 selector = Dummy.functionSelector();
14 |         mc.use(selector, Dummy.functionAddress());
15 |         mc.useFacade(Dummy.facadeAddress());
16 |         mc.deploy();
17 | 
18 |         address proxy = mc.toProxyAddress();
19 | 
20 |         (bool success,) = proxy.call(abi.encodeWithSelector(selector));
21 |         assertTrue(success);
22 |     }
23 | 
24 |     function test_toProxyAddress_Revert_NoCurrentProxy() public {
25 |         mc.expectRevert(REASON.CURRENT_PROXY_NOT_EXIST);
26 |         mc.toProxyAddress();
27 |     }
28 | 
29 |     /**
30 |      * ----------------------------------------
31 |      *     📚 Find Current Dictionary Address
32 |      * ------------------------------------------
33 |      */
34 |     function test_toDictionaryAddress_Success() public {
35 |         bytes4 selector = Dummy.functionSelector();
36 |         address impl = Dummy.functionAddress();
37 |         mc.use(selector, impl);
38 |         mc.useFacade(Dummy.facadeAddress());
39 |         mc.deploy();
40 | 
41 |         address dictionary = mc.toDictionaryAddress();
42 | 
43 |         (bool success, bytes memory ret) =
44 |             dictionary.call(abi.encodeWithSignature("getImplementation(bytes4)", selector));
45 |         assertTrue(success);
46 |         assertEq(address(uint160(uint256(bytes32(ret)))), impl);
47 |     }
48 | 
49 |     function test_toDictionaryAddress_Revert_NoCurrentProxy() public {
50 |         mc.expectRevert(REASON.CURRENT_DICTIONARY_NOT_EXIST);
51 |         mc.toDictionaryAddress();
52 |     }
53 | }
54 | 


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
/site/docs/03-api/03-api-details/Flattened.sol/abstract.Proxy_0.md:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1 | # Proxy_0
 2 | [Git Source](https://github.com/metacontract/mc/blob/main/src/devkit/Flattened.sol)
 3 | 
 4 | *This abstract contract provides a fallback function that delegates all calls to another contract using the EVM
 5 | instruction `delegatecall`. We refer to the second contract as the _implementation_ behind the proxy, and it has to
 6 | be specified by overriding the virtual [_implementation](abstract.Proxy_0.md#_implementation) function.
 7 | Additionally, delegation to the implementation can be triggered manually through the {_fallback} function, or to a
 8 | different contract through the {_delegate} function.
 9 | The success and return data of the delegated call will be returned back to the caller of the proxy.*
10 | 
11 | 
12 | ## Functions
13 | ### _delegate
14 | 
15 | *Delegates the current call to `implementation`.
16 | This function does not return to its internal call site, it will return directly to the external caller.*
17 | 
18 | 
19 | ```solidity
20 | function _delegate(address implementation) internal virtual;
21 | ```
22 | 
23 | ### _implementation
24 | 
25 | *This is a virtual function that should be overridden so it returns the address to which the fallback
26 | function and [_fallback](abstract.Proxy_0.md#_fallback) should delegate.*
27 | 
28 | 
29 | ```solidity
30 | function _implementation() internal view virtual returns (address);
31 | ```
32 | 
33 | ### _fallback
34 | 
35 | *Delegates the current call to the address returned by `_implementation()`.
36 | This function does not return to its internal call site, it will return directly to the external caller.*
37 | 
38 | 
39 | ```solidity
40 | function _fallback() internal virtual;
41 | ```
42 | 
43 | ### fallback
44 | 
45 | *Fallback function that delegates calls to the address returned by `_implementation()`. Will run if no other
46 | function in the contract matches the call data.*
47 | 
48 | 
49 | ```solidity
50 | fallback() external payable virtual;
51 | ```
52 | 
53 | 


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

/site/docs/02-guides/02-development/04-using-internal-library.md:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1 | ---
 2 | keywords: [internal library, data management, schema, abstract data types]
 3 | tags: [internal library, data management, schema, abstract data types]
 4 | last_update:
 5 |   date: 2024-10-26
 6 |   author: Meta Contract Development Team
 7 | ---
 8 | 
 9 | # Using Internal Library
10 | 
11 | The Meta Contract DevKit uses a Schema-based data management system, and it is recommended to use Solidity's internal library for data operations. Conceptually, this approach is akin to handling abstract data types.
12 | 
13 | ## Overview
14 | 
15 | Using an internal library allows for efficient data management, enhancing consistency and reusability, and improving code maintainability.
16 | 
17 | <!-- ## Example Usage
18 | 
19 | Below is an example of managing data using an internal library.
20 | 
21 | ### Defining Schema
22 | 
23 | First, define the Schema to manage data. The Schema serves as a template for defining the structure of the data.
24 | 
25 | ```solidity
26 | library ProposalLib {
27 |     function addProposal(Proposal storage self, ProposalHeader memory header, ProposalBody[] memory bodies) internal {
28 |         self.header = header;
29 |         self.bodies = bodies;
30 |     }
31 |     function getProposalType(Proposal storage self) internal view returns (ProposalType) {
32 |         return self.header.proposalType;
33 |     }
34 | }
35 | ```
36 | 
37 | ### Usage
38 | 
39 | By using the internal library, data manipulation becomes straightforward. Below is an example of adding Proposal data.
40 | 
41 | ```solidity
42 | function createProposal(Proposal storage proposal, ProposalHeader memory header, ProposalBody[] memory bodies) internal {
43 |     ProposalLib.addProposal(proposal, header, bodies);
44 | }
45 | ```
46 | 
47 | ## Conclusion
48 | 
49 | Using an internal library makes data management more efficient and enhances code reusability. The Meta Contract DevKit recommends leveraging internal libraries for data operations, given its Schema-based data management approach. -->
50 | 


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
/site/docs/03-api/03-api-details/Flattened.sol/interface.IERC721Enumerable.md:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1 | # IERC721Enumerable
 2 | [Git Source](https://github.com/metacontract/mc/blob/main/src/devkit/Flattened.sol)
 3 | 
 4 | **Inherits:**
 5 | [IERC721](interface.IERC721.md)
 6 | 
 7 | *See https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-721
 8 | Note: the ERC-165 identifier for this interface is 0x780e9d63.*
 9 | 
10 | 
11 | ## Functions
12 | ### totalSupply
13 | 
14 | Count NFTs tracked by this contract
15 | 
16 | 
17 | ```solidity
18 | function totalSupply() external view returns (uint256);
19 | ```
20 | **Returns**
21 | 
22 | |Name|Type|Description|
23 | |----|----|-----------|
24 | |`<none>`|`uint256`|A count of valid NFTs tracked by this contract, where each one of them has an assigned and queryable owner not equal to the zero address|
25 | 
26 | 
27 | ### tokenByIndex
28 | 
29 | Enumerate valid NFTs
30 | 
31 | *Throws if `_index` >= `totalSupply()`.*
32 | 
33 | 
34 | ```solidity
35 | function tokenByIndex(uint256 _index) external view returns (uint256);
36 | ```
37 | **Parameters**
38 | 
39 | |Name|Type|Description|
40 | |----|----|-----------|
41 | |`_index`|`uint256`|A counter less than `totalSupply()`|
42 | 
43 | **Returns**
44 | 
45 | |Name|Type|Description|
46 | |----|----|-----------|
47 | |`<none>`|`uint256`|The token identifier for the `_index`th NFT, (sort order not specified)|
48 | 
49 | 
50 | ### tokenOfOwnerByIndex
51 | 
52 | Enumerate NFTs assigned to an owner
53 | 
54 | *Throws if `_index` >= `balanceOf(_owner)` or if
55 | `_owner` is the zero address, representing invalid NFTs.*
56 | 
57 | 
58 | ```solidity
59 | function tokenOfOwnerByIndex(address _owner, uint256 _index) external view returns (uint256);
60 | ```
61 | **Parameters**
62 | 
63 | |Name|Type|Description|
64 | |----|----|-----------|
65 | |`_owner`|`address`|An address where we are interested in NFTs owned by them|
66 | |`_index`|`uint256`|A counter less than `balanceOf(_owner)`|
67 | 
68 | **Returns**
69 | 
70 | |Name|Type|Description|
71 | |----|----|-----------|
72 | |`<none>`|`uint256`|The token identifier for the `_index`th NFT assigned to `_owner`, (sort order not specified)|
73 | 
74 | 
75 | 


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

/site/docs/03-api/01-overview.md:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1 | ---
 2 | keywords: [devkit, overview, features]
 3 | tags: [devkit, overview, features]
 4 | last_update:
 5 |   date: 2024-10-28
 6 |   author: Meta Contract Development Team
 7 | ---
 8 | 
 9 | # Overview
10 | 
11 | The Meta Contract DevKit is a comprehensive suite of tools and libraries designed to streamline the development process for Meta Contract projects. It provides developers with powerful utilities for scripting, testing, and managing the lifecycle of smart contract objects within the Meta Contract ecosystem.
12 | 
13 | ## Key Features
14 | 
15 | 1. **Testing Helpers**: Provides a set of functions and modifiers to simulate various scenarios and streamline the testing process.
16 | 
17 | 2. **Scripting Utilities**: Facilitates deployment and upgrade scripts and interaction sequences with built-in transaction broadcasting capabilities.
18 | 
19 | 3. **Object Lifecycle Management**: Offers a robust system for managing the states and transitions of core Meta Contract objects (Function, Bundle, Proxy, Dictionary) to efficiently handle the core architecture known as UCS.
20 | 
21 | 4. **Integration with Foundry**: Seamlessly integrates with the Foundry development environment, enhancing its capabilities for Meta Contract development.
22 | 
23 | 5. **Customizable Configurations**: Allows developers to easily configure and adapt the development environment to their specific project needs.
24 | 
25 | ## Components
26 | 
27 | The DevKit consists of two base contracts:
28 | 
29 | - **MCTest**: A base contract for writing and running tests. Within contracts that inherit from MCTest, you can utilize the primary object `mc` for various testing functionalities.
30 | 
31 | - **MCScript**: A base contract for deployment and interaction scripts. Contracts inheriting from MCScript can also use the primary object `mc` to facilitate deployment and interaction processes.
32 | 
33 | ## How to Use
34 | 
35 | To start using the Meta Contract DevKit, refer to the [Usage Guide](./02-usage.md) for detailed instructions on installation, setup, and basic usage patterns.
36 | 
37 | For a deep dive into the API and available functions, check out the [DevKit API Details](./03-api-details/index.md).
38 | 


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
/site/docs/03-api/03-api-details/Flattened.sol/contract.UpgradeableBeacon.md:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1 | # UpgradeableBeacon
 2 | [Git Source](https://github.com/metacontract/mc/blob/main/src/devkit/Flattened.sol)
 3 | 
 4 | **Inherits:**
 5 | [IBeacon](interface.IBeacon.md), [Ownable](abstract.Ownable.md)
 6 | 
 7 | *This contract is used in conjunction with one or more instances of {BeaconProxy} to determine their
 8 | implementation contract, which is where they will delegate all function calls.
 9 | An owner is able to change the implementation the beacon points to, thus upgrading the proxies that use this beacon.*
10 | 
11 | 
12 | ## State Variables
13 | ### _implementation
14 | 
15 | ```solidity
16 | address private _implementation;
17 | ```
18 | 
19 | 
20 | ## Functions
21 | ### constructor
22 | 
23 | *Sets the address of the initial implementation, and the initial owner who can upgrade the beacon.*
24 | 
25 | 
26 | ```solidity
27 | constructor(address implementation_, address initialOwner) Ownable(initialOwner);
28 | ```
29 | 
30 | ### implementation
31 | 
32 | *Returns the current implementation address.*
33 | 
34 | 
35 | ```solidity
36 | function implementation() public view virtual returns (address);
37 | ```
38 | 
39 | ### upgradeTo
40 | 
41 | *Upgrades the beacon to a new implementation.
42 | Emits an [Upgraded](contract.UpgradeableBeacon.md#upgraded) event.
43 | Requirements:
44 | - msg.sender must be the owner of the contract.
45 | - `newImplementation` must be a contract.*
46 | 
47 | 
48 | ```solidity
49 | function upgradeTo(address newImplementation) public virtual onlyOwner;
50 | ```
51 | 
52 | ### _setImplementation
53 | 
54 | *Sets the implementation contract address for this beacon
55 | Requirements:
56 | - `newImplementation` must be a contract.*
57 | 
58 | 
59 | ```solidity
60 | function _setImplementation(address newImplementation) private;
61 | ```
62 | 
63 | ## Events
64 | ### Upgraded
65 | *Emitted when the implementation returned by the beacon is changed.*
66 | 
67 | 
68 | ```solidity
69 | event Upgraded(address indexed implementation);
70 | ```
71 | 
72 | ## Errors
73 | ### BeaconInvalidImplementation
74 | *The `implementation` of the beacon is invalid.*
75 | 
76 | 
77 | ```solidity
78 | error BeaconInvalidImplementation(address implementation);
79 | ```
80 | 
81 |

/site/docs/02-guides/01-setup/01-installation.md:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1 | ---
 2 | keywords: [meta-contract, installation, setup, development-environment]
 3 | tags: [meta-contract, installation, setup, development-environment]
 4 | last_update:
 5 |   date: 2024-10-26
 6 |   author: Meta Contract Development Team
 7 | ---
 8 | 
 9 | # Installation
10 | 
11 | This guide will walk you through the process of installing Meta Contract, a Foundry-based smart contract framework.
12 | 
13 | ## Prerequisites
14 | 
15 | Before installing Meta Contract, ensure you have the following:
16 | 
17 | 1. [Foundry](https://book.getfoundry.sh/getting-started/installation) installed on your system (version 0.2.0 or later)
18 | 2. Git installed on your system
19 | 3. A code editor of your choice (e.g., Cursor, Visual Studio Code)
20 | 
21 | ## Installation Steps
22 | 
23 | 1. Initialize your project with the meta contract template:
24 | 
25 |     ```bash
26 |     forge init <project-name> -t metacontract/template
27 |     ```
28 | 
29 | 2. Navigate to your project directory:
30 | 
31 |     ```bash
32 |     cd <project-name>
33 |     ```
34 | 
35 | 3. Install the dependencies using Foundry:
36 | 
37 |     ```bash
38 |     forge install
39 |     ```
40 | 
41 | 4. Build the project:
42 | 
43 |     ```bash
44 |     forge build
45 |     ```
46 | 
47 | 5. Run the tests to ensure everything is working correctly:
48 | 
49 |     ```bash
50 |     forge test
51 |     ```
52 | 
53 | ## Troubleshooting
54 | 
55 | If you encounter any issues during the installation process, try the following:
56 | 
57 | 1. **Forge command not found**: Ensure that Foundry is correctly installed and added to your system PATH.
58 | 
59 | 2. **Dependency installation fails**: Check your internet connection and try running `forge install` again. If the issue persists, manually clone the required repositories into the `lib` directory.
60 | 
61 | 3. **Build errors**: Make sure you have the latest version of Foundry installed. You can update Foundry using `foundryup`.
62 | 
63 | If you're still experiencing issues, please reach out to [our community](https://github.com/orgs/metacontract/discussions) for support.
64 | 
65 | ## Next Steps
66 | 
67 | Now that you have Meta Contract installed, proceed to the [Basic Setup](02-basic-setup.md) guide to configure your development environment and start working on your first Meta Contract project.
68 | 


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
/site/script/soldocs/upsert_index_file.ts:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1 | import {
 2 | 	existsSync,
 3 | 	readFileSync,
 4 | 	readdirSync,
 5 | 	statSync,
 6 | 	unlinkSync,
 7 | } from "node:fs";
 8 | import { basename, join } from "node:path";
 9 | 
10 | import { logMessage, updateIndexFile } from "./utils";
11 | 
12 | export function upsertIndexFile(directoryPath: string) {
13 | 	const readmeFile = join(directoryPath, "README.md");
14 | 
15 | 	updateIndexFile(
16 | 		directoryPath,
17 | 		existsSync(readmeFile)
18 | 			? extractIndexItemsFrom(readmeFile)
19 | 			: generateIndexItemsFor(directoryPath),
20 | 	);
21 | }
22 | 
23 | function extractIndexItemsFrom(readmeFile: string): string {
24 | 	logMessage(`Extracting index items from ${readmeFile}`);
25 | 
26 | 	const readmeMarkdown = readFileSync(readmeFile, "utf-8");
27 | 	const indexItems = readmeMarkdown
28 | 		// Extract lines that match the pattern of an index item
29 | 		.match(/^- \[.*?\]\(.*?\)$/gm)
30 | 		// Replace the link with the correct path
31 | 		.map((line) => {
32 | 			const linkMatch = line.match(/\((.*?)\)/);
33 | 			if (linkMatch) {
34 | 				let linkPath = linkMatch[1];
35 | 				// Directory paths need to be converted to index.md
36 | 				if (linkPath.startsWith("/")) {
37 | 					linkPath = `${linkPath.split("/").pop()}/index.md`;
38 | 				}
39 | 				// Convert the link to a relative path
40 | 				linkPath = `./${linkPath}`;
41 | 				return line.replace(/\((.*?)\)/, `(${linkPath})`);
42 | 			}
43 | 			return line;
44 | 		})
45 | 		.join("\n");
46 | 
47 | 	// Remove the README.md file after extracting the index items
48 | 	unlinkSync(readmeFile);
49 | 	logMessage(`README.md removed: ${readmeFile}`);
50 | 
51 | 	return indexItems;
52 | }
53 | 
54 | function generateIndexItemsFor(directoryPath: string): string {
55 | 	logMessage(`Generating index items for ${directoryPath}`);
56 | 
57 | 	const items = readdirSync(directoryPath);
58 | 	let indexItems = "";
59 | 
60 | 	for (const item of items) {
61 | 		const itemStats = statSync(join(directoryPath, item));
62 | 
63 | 		if (itemStats.isDirectory()) {
64 | 			const dirname = basename(item);
65 | 			indexItems += `- [${dirname}](./${dirname}/index.md)\n`;
66 | 			continue;
67 | 		}
68 | 		if (itemStats.isFile()) {
69 | 			if (item === "index.md" || item === "README.md") continue;
70 | 			indexItems += `- [${basename(item, ".md")}](./${item})\n`;
71 | 		}
72 | 	}
73 | 
74 | 	return indexItems;
75 | }
76 | 


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
/site/docs/03-api/03-api-details/system/message/DecodeErrorString.sol/library.DecodeErrorString.md:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1 | # DecodeErrorString
 2 | [Git Source](https://github.com/metacontract/mc/blob/main/src/devkit/system/message/DecodeErrorString.sol)
 3 | 
 4 | 
 5 | ## Functions
 6 | ### decodeRevertReason
 7 | 
 8 | *Decodes a revert reason from ABI-encoded data.*
 9 | 
10 | 
11 | ```solidity
12 | function decodeRevertReason(bytes memory data) public pure returns (string memory);
13 | ```
14 | **Parameters**
15 | 
16 | |Name|Type|Description|
17 | |----|----|-----------|
18 | |`data`|`bytes`|ABI-encoded revert reason.|
19 | 
20 | **Returns**
21 | 
22 | |Name|Type|Description|
23 | |----|----|-----------|
24 | |`<none>`|`string`|reason The decoded revert reason as a string.|
25 | 
26 | 
27 | ### decodePanicCode
28 | 
29 | *Decodes a panic code from bytes.*
30 | 
31 | 
32 | ```solidity
33 | function decodePanicCode(bytes memory data) internal pure returns (uint256 code);
34 | ```
35 | **Parameters**
36 | 
37 | |Name|Type|Description|
38 | |----|----|-----------|
39 | |`data`|`bytes`|Bytes containing the panic code.|
40 | 
41 | **Returns**
42 | 
43 | |Name|Type|Description|
44 | |----|----|-----------|
45 | |`code`|`uint256`|The decoded panic code as a uint256.|
46 | 
47 | 
48 | ### decodeRevertReasonAndPanicCode
49 | 
50 | *Attempts to decode both revert reasons and panic codes.*
51 | 
52 | 
53 | ```solidity
54 | function decodeRevertReasonAndPanicCode(bytes memory data) internal pure returns (string memory result);
55 | ```
56 | **Parameters**
57 | 
58 | |Name|Type|Description|
59 | |----|----|-----------|
60 | |`data`|`bytes`|Bytes containing either a revert reason or a panic code.|
61 | 
62 | **Returns**
63 | 
64 | |Name|Type|Description|
65 | |----|----|-----------|
66 | |`result`|`string`|The decoded message as a string.|
67 | 
68 | 
69 | ### panicCodeToString
70 | 
71 | *Converts a panic code to a human-readable string. (These messages are not accurate and also need to be chase upstream implementation.)*
72 | 
73 | 
74 | ```solidity
75 | function panicCodeToString(uint256 code) private pure returns (string memory reason);
76 | ```
77 | **Parameters**
78 | 
79 | |Name|Type|Description|
80 | |----|----|-----------|
81 | |`code`|`uint256`|The panic code as a uint256.|
82 | 
83 | **Returns**
84 | 
85 | |Name|Type|Description|
86 | |----|----|-----------|
87 | |`reason`|`string`|The corresponding human-readable string.|
88 | 
89 | 
90 |

/site/docs/03-api/03-api-details/Flattened.sol/abstract.DictionaryBase.md:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1 | # DictionaryBase
  2 | [Git Source](https://github.com/metacontract/mc/blob/main/src/devkit/Flattened.sol)
  3 | 
  4 | **Inherits:**
  5 | [IDictionaryCore](interface.IDictionaryCore.md), [IVerifiable](interface.IVerifiable.md)
  6 | 
  7 | 
  8 | ## State Variables
  9 | ### functions
 10 | 
 11 | ```solidity
 12 | mapping(bytes4 selector => address implementation) internal functions;
 13 | ```
 14 | 
 15 | 
 16 | ### functionSelectorList
 17 | 
 18 | ```solidity
 19 | bytes4[] internal functionSelectorList;
 20 | ```
 21 | 
 22 | 
 23 | ### facade
 24 | 
 25 | ```solidity
 26 | address internal facade;
 27 | ```
 28 | 
 29 | 
 30 | ## Functions
 31 | ### getImplementation
 32 | 
 33 | 
 34 | ```solidity
 35 | function getImplementation(bytes4 selector) external view returns (address);
 36 | ```
 37 | 
 38 | ### implementation
 39 | 
 40 | 
 41 | ```solidity
 42 | function implementation() external view returns (address);
 43 | ```
 44 | 
 45 | ### supportsInterface
 46 | 
 47 | 
 48 | ```solidity
 49 | function supportsInterface(bytes4 interfaceId) external view returns (bool);
 50 | ```
 51 | **Parameters**
 52 | 
 53 | |Name|Type|Description|
 54 | |----|----|-----------|
 55 | |`interfaceId`|`bytes4`|equals to the function selector|
 56 | 
 57 | 
 58 | ### supportsInterfaces
 59 | 
 60 | Specification 3.1.1.2
 61 | 
 62 | 
 63 | ```solidity
 64 | function supportsInterfaces() external view returns (bytes4[] memory);
 65 | ```
 66 | 
 67 | ### _setImplementation
 68 | 
 69 | 
 70 | ```solidity
 71 | function _setImplementation(bytes4 _selector, address _impl) internal virtual;
 72 | ```
 73 | 
 74 | ### __deleteImplementation
 75 | 
 76 | 
 77 | ```solidity
 78 | function __deleteImplementation(bytes4 _selector) internal virtual;
 79 | ```
 80 | 
 81 | ### __updateFunctionSelectorList
 82 | 
 83 | 
 84 | ```solidity
 85 | function __updateFunctionSelectorList(bytes4 _selector) internal virtual;
 86 | ```
 87 | 
 88 | ### __existsSameSelector
 89 | 
 90 | 
 91 | ```solidity
 92 | function __existsSameSelector(bytes4 _selector) internal virtual returns (bool);
 93 | ```
 94 | 
 95 | ### __updateImplementation
 96 | 
 97 | 
 98 | ```solidity
 99 | function __updateImplementation(bytes4 _selector, address _impl) internal virtual;
100 | ```
101 | 
102 | ### _upgradeFacade
103 | 
104 | 
105 | ```solidity
106 | function _upgradeFacade(address _newFacade) internal virtual;
107 | ```
108 | 
109 |

/src/devkit/registry/FunctionRegistry.sol:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1 | // SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT
 2 | pragma solidity ^0.8.23;
 3 | /**
 4 |  * ---------------------
 5 |  *     Support Methods
 6 |  * -----------------------
 7 |  */
 8 | 
 9 | import {Tracer} from "@mc-devkit/system/Tracer.sol";
10 | // Validation
11 | import {Validator} from "@mc-devkit/system/Validator.sol";
12 | 
13 | // Context
14 | import {Current} from "@mc-devkit/registry/context/Current.sol";
15 | // Core Type
16 | import {Function} from "@mc-devkit/core/Function.sol";
17 | 
18 | //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
19 | //  📗 Functions Registry    /////////////////////////////////
20 | using FunctionRegistryLib for FunctionRegistry global;
21 | using Tracer for FunctionRegistry global;
22 | //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
23 | 
24 | struct FunctionRegistry {
25 |     mapping(string name => Function) functions;
26 |     Current current;
27 | }
28 | 
29 | library FunctionRegistryLib {
30 |     /**
31 |      * --------------------------
32 |      *     🗳️ Register Function
33 |      * ----------------------------
34 |      */
35 |     function register(FunctionRegistry storage registry, string memory name, bytes4 selector, address implementation)
36 |         internal
37 |         returns (FunctionRegistry storage)
38 |     {
39 |         uint256 pid = registry.startProcess("register");
40 |         Validator.MUST_NotEmptyName(name);
41 |         registry.functions[name].assign(name, selector, implementation);
42 |         registry.current.update(name);
43 |         return registry.finishProcess(pid);
44 |     }
45 | 
46 |     /**
47 |      * ----------------------
48 |      *     🔍 Find Function
49 |      * ------------------------
50 |      */
51 |     function find(FunctionRegistry storage registry, string memory name) internal returns (Function storage func) {
52 |         uint256 pid = registry.startProcess("find");
53 |         Validator.MUST_NotEmptyName(name);
54 |         Validator.MUST_Registered(registry, name);
55 |         func = registry.functions[name];
56 |         Validator.MUST_Completed(func);
57 |         registry.finishProcess(pid);
58 |     }
59 | 
60 |     function findCurrent(FunctionRegistry storage registry) internal returns (Function storage func) {
61 |         uint256 pid = registry.startProcess("findCurrent");
62 |         string memory name = registry.current.name;
63 |         Validator.MUST_NotEmptyName(name);
64 |         func = registry.find(name);
65 |         registry.finishProcess(pid);
66 |     }
67 | }
68 | 


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
/site/script/soldocs/generate_and_move_forge_docs.ts:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1 | import { execSync } from "node:child_process";
 2 | import { readdirSync, statSync } from "node:fs";
 3 | import { join } from "node:path";
 4 | import { copySync, removeSync } from "fs-extra";
 5 | import { config } from "../config";
 6 | import { logError, logInfo, logMessage, logSuccess } from "./utils";
 7 | 
 8 | function compareAndDeleteDirectories(from: string, to: string) {
 9 | 	const fromFiles = new Set(readdirSync(from));
10 | 	const toFiles = readdirSync(to);
11 | 
12 | 	for (const file of toFiles) {
13 | 		// Ignore 'index.md' files
14 | 		if (file === "index.md") {
15 | 			continue;
16 | 		}
17 | 
18 | 		const fromFilePath = join(from, file);
19 | 		const toFilePath = join(to, file);
20 | 
21 | 		if (!fromFiles.has(file)) {
22 | 			removeSync(toFilePath);
23 | 			logError(
24 | 				`Deleted file or directory in 'to' but not in 'from': ${toFilePath}`,
25 | 				true,
26 | 			);
27 | 		} else if (statSync(toFilePath).isDirectory()) {
28 | 			// If it's a directory, recurse into it
29 | 			compareAndDeleteDirectories(fromFilePath, toFilePath);
30 | 		}
31 | 	}
32 | }
33 | 
34 | export function generateAndMoveForgeDocs() {
35 | 	try {
36 | 		// // Ensure the PATH includes the directory where forge is installed
37 | 		// process.env.PATH = `${process.env.HOME}/.foundry/bin:${process.env.PATH}`;
38 | 
39 | 		// // Generate solidity docs into the temporary directory using `forge doc`
40 | 		// execSync(`cd ${config.rootPath} && forge doc -o ${config.tempDir}`, {
41 | 		// 	stdio: "inherit",
42 | 		// });
43 | 		// logInfo(`Generated solidity docs in ${config.rootPath}/${config.tempDir}`);
44 | 
45 | 		// Move generated docs to appropriate directories
46 | 		if (config.copyPaths.length > 0) {
47 | 			for (const copyPath of config.copyPaths) {
48 | 				const from = join(
49 | 					config.rootPath,
50 | 					config.tempDir,
51 | 					config.tempDirOffset,
52 | 					copyPath.from,
53 | 				);
54 | 				const to = join(config.rootPath, config.docsDir, copyPath.to);
55 | 				logMessage(`Copying ${from} to ${to}`);
56 | 				copySync(from, to);
57 | 
58 | 				// Recursively compare and delete files and directories in 'to' that are not in 'from'
59 | 				compareAndDeleteDirectories(from, to);
60 | 			}
61 | 		}
62 | 
63 | 		// // Remove unnecessary temporary directory
64 | 		// removeSync(`${config.rootPath}/${config.tempDir}`);
65 | 		// logInfo(`Removed temporary directory ${config.rootPath}/${config.tempDir}`);
66 | 
67 | 		logSuccess("Successfully generated and moved solidity docs");
68 | 	} catch (error) {
69 | 		console.error("Failed to generate and move solidity docs:\n", error);
70 | 		process.exit(1);
71 | 	}
72 | }
73 | 


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
/site/docs/00-getting-started.md:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1 | ---
 2 | sidebar_label: Getting Started
 3 | keywords: [meta-contract, installation, setup, development-environment]
 4 | tags: [meta-contract, installation, setup, development-environment]
 5 | last_update:
 6 |   date: 2024-10-26
 7 |   author: Meta Contract Development Team
 8 | ---
 9 | 
10 | # Meta Contract
11 | 
12 | Meta Contract is a Foundry-based smart contract framework designed to create flexible, upgradeable, and scalable blockchain applications. It implements the UCS (Upgradeable Clone for Scalable Contracts) architecture, providing developers with powerful tools to build and maintain complex decentralized systems.
13 | 
14 | :::caution
15 | Please note that as it is still in the development version, there may be potentially breaking changes made without notice. Use it with caution.
16 | :::
17 | 
18 | ## Quick Start
19 | 
20 | Just run this:
21 | 
22 | ```bash
23 | forge init <project-name> -t metacontract/template
24 | ```
25 | 
26 | After the installation, run the following command to test the _Counter_ sample project and see how it works:
27 | 
28 | ```bash
29 | cd <project-name>
30 | forge test
31 | ```
32 | 
33 | If you want to learn more about meta contract installation, please refer to [installation guide](./02-guides/01-setup/01-installation.md).
34 | 
35 | ## Features
36 | 
37 | - **Upgradeability 🔄**: Meta Contracts can be upgraded without changing their address, allowing for seamless improvements and bug fixes.
38 | - **Modularity 🗂️**: The framework separates contract logic into distinct, manageable components, enhancing code organization and reusability.
39 | - **Scalability 📈**: Meta Contracts are designed to handle growth efficiently, making them suitable for large-scale applications.
40 | - **Flexibility ⚙️**: Developers can easily extend and customize Meta Contracts to suit specific project needs.
41 | - **Testability ✅**: The modular structure of Meta Contracts facilitates comprehensive testing, including unit tests for individual functions and integration tests for the entire system.
42 | 
43 | ## Documentation Overview
44 | 
45 | This documentation is structured to guide you through the Meta Contract framework:
46 | 
47 | 1. **[Concepts](./01-concepts/index.md)**: Understand the fundamental concepts and architecture of Meta Contract.
48 | 2. **[Guides](./02-guides/index.md)**: Learn about best practices for development, deployment, and operations.
49 | 3. **[API Reference](./03-api/index.md)**: Explore the API details and usage of the Meta Contract DevKit.
50 | 4. **[Examples](./04-examples/index.md)**: Review examples of various use cases.
51 | 
52 | Each section provides detailed information to help you effectively use and understand the Meta Contract framework. For more information, follow the links to each section.
53 | 


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
/site/script/soldocs/update_links.ts:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1 | import { readFileSync, readdirSync, writeFileSync } from "node:fs";
 2 | import { join, relative } from "node:path";
 3 | 
 4 | import { config } from "../config";
 5 | import { logError, logInfo, logMessage, logSuccess } from "./utils";
 6 | 
 7 | export function updateLinks(directoryPath: string) {
 8 | 	const markdownFiles = getMarkdownFiles(directoryPath);
 9 | 
10 | 	for (const file of markdownFiles) {
11 | 		const originalMarkdown = readFileSync(file, "utf-8");
12 | 		const replacedMarkdown = replaceLinks(originalMarkdown, directoryPath);
13 | 
14 | 		writeFileSync(file, replacedMarkdown, "utf-8");
15 | 		logMessage(`Updated: ${file}`);
16 | 	}
17 | 
18 | 	logSuccess("Successfully converted links.");
19 | }
20 | 
21 | function getMarkdownFiles(directoryPath: string): string[] {
22 | 	return readdirSync(directoryPath)
23 | 		.filter((file) => file.endsWith(".md"))
24 | 		.map((file) => join(directoryPath, file));
25 | }
26 | 
27 | function replaceLinks(markdown: string, directoryPath: string) {
28 | 	// logMessage("replaceLinks", true);
29 | 
30 | 	return markdown
31 | 		.replace(
32 | 			/\[([^\]]+)\]\((\/[^)]+\.md)(#[^\s)]+)?\)/g,
33 | 			(match, text, path, fragment) => {
34 | 				logMessage(path);
35 | 				if (!path.startsWith("/")) return match;
36 | 
37 | 				const newPath = getNewPath(path, directoryPath);
38 | 				return `[${text}](${newPath}${fragment || ""})`;
39 | 			},
40 | 		)
41 | 		.replace(
42 | 			/\[([^\]]+)\]\((https:\/\/github\.com\/[^)]+)(#[^\s)]+)?\)/g,
43 | 			(match, text, path, fragment) => {
44 | 				if (path.startsWith("https://github.com/")) {
45 | 					// logMessage(path, true);
46 | 					const updatedPath = updateGitHubPath(path);
47 | 					// logMessage(updatedPath, true);
48 | 					return `[${text}](${updatedPath}${fragment || ""})`;
49 | 				}
50 | 				return match;
51 | 			},
52 | 		);
53 | }
54 | 
55 | function updateGitHubPath(githubPath: string): string {
56 | 	const urlPattern = /blob\/([^/]+)\/(.+)/;
57 | 	const match = githubPath.match(urlPattern);
58 | 
59 | 	if (match) {
60 | 		// Remove the <commit> part from the path
61 | 		const [, , rest] = match; // Extract the part after <commit>
62 | 		return `https://github.com/metacontract/mc/blob/main/${rest}`; // Return the part after 'blob/'
63 | 	}
64 | 
65 | 	return null; // Return null if pattern doesn't match
66 | }
67 | 
68 | function getNewPath(path: string, directoryPath: string): string {
69 | 	let newPath = path;
70 | 	for (const copyPath of config.copyPaths) {
71 | 		if (newPath.startsWith(`/${copyPath.from}`)) {
72 | 			newPath = newPath.replace(`/${copyPath.from}`, `/${copyPath.to}`);
73 | 		}
74 | 	}
75 | 	logMessage(directoryPath);
76 | 	logMessage(newPath);
77 | 	return relative(
78 | 		directoryPath,
79 | 		join(config.rootPath, config.docsDir, newPath),
80 | 	);
81 | }
82 | 


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
/site/docs/02-guides/05-project-management/01-documentation-guidelines.md:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1 | ---
 2 | keywords: [documentation, guidelines, best-practices]
 3 | tags: [documentation, guidelines, best-practices]
 4 | last_update:
 5 |   date: 2024-10-28
 6 |   author: Meta Contract Development Team
 7 | ---
 8 | 
 9 | # Documentation Guidelines
10 | 
11 | This guide outlines the standards and best practices for creating and maintaining documentation in the Meta Contract project.
12 | 
13 | ## General Principles
14 | 
15 | 1. Write clear, concise, and accurate documentation.
16 | 2. Keep documentation up-to-date with code changes.
17 | 3. Use a consistent style and format across all documentation.
18 | 4. Write for your audience, considering their technical background.
19 | 
20 | ## File Naming Convention
21 | 
22 | Use kebab-case for all documentation file names:
23 | 
24 | ```
25 | what-is-meta-contract.md
26 | key-concepts.md
27 | ```
28 | 
29 | ## Markdown Formatting
30 | 
31 | 1. Use ATX-style headers (`#` for h1, `##` for h2, etc.).
32 | 2. Use backticks for inline code and triple backticks for code blocks.
33 | 3. Use appropriate language identifiers for code blocks (e.g., ```solidity).
34 | 4. Use unordered lists (`-`) for most lists, and ordered lists (`1.`) when sequence matters.
35 | 
36 | ## Documentation Header
37 | 
38 | Each documentation file should start with a metadata block followed by the document content:
39 | 
40 | ```markdown
41 | ---
42 | keywords: [keyword1, keyword2, keyword3]
43 | tags: [tag1, tag2, tag3]
44 | last_update:
45 |   date: YYYY-MM-DD
46 |   author: [Author Names]
47 | ---
48 | 
49 | # Document Title
50 | 
51 | Brief description or introduction to the document content.
52 | 
53 | [Main document content starts here]
54 | ```
55 | 
56 | See details in [Docusaurus Frontmatter](https://docusaurus.io/docs/create-doc#doc-front-matter). Ensure to add any necessary elements according to the Docusaurus frontmatter guidelines.
57 | 
58 | ## Code Documentation
59 | 
60 | ### Solidity
61 | 
62 | Use [NatSpec](https://docs.soliditylang.org/en/latest/natspec-format.html) comments for all public and external functions:
63 | 
64 | ```solidity
65 | /**
66 |  * @notice Calculates the sum of two numbers
67 |  * @param a The first number
68 |  * @param b The second number
69 |  * @return The sum of a and b
70 |  */
71 | function calculateSum(uint256 a, uint256 b) public pure returns (uint256) {
72 |     return a + b;
73 | }
74 | ```
75 | 
76 | ## Diagrams
77 | 
78 | Use [Mermaid](https://mermaid.js.org/intro/syntax-reference.html) for creating diagrams in documentation. Include the diagram source in the Markdown file:
79 | 
80 | ```mermaid
81 | graph TD
82 |     A[Proxy Contract] --> B{Dictionary Contract}
83 |     B --> C[Function Contract 1]
84 |     B --> D[Function Contract 2]
85 |     B --> E[Function Contract 3]
86 | ```
87 | 


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
/.github/workflows/ci.yml:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1 | name: Continuous Integration
 2 | 
 3 | on:
 4 |   pull_request:
 5 |     types:
 6 |       - opened
 7 |       - reopened
 8 |       - synchronize
 9 |       - ready_for_review
10 |       - edited
11 | 
12 | # env:
13 | #   FOUNDRY_PROFILE: ci
14 | 
15 | jobs:
16 | 
17 |   # format-check:
18 |   #   runs-on: ubuntu-latest
19 |   #   steps:
20 |   #     - uses: actions/checkout@v4
21 |   #       with:
22 |   #         submodules: recursive
23 |   #     - name: Install Foundry
24 |   #       uses: foundry-rs/foundry-toolchain@v1
25 |   #       with:
26 |   #         version: nightly
27 |   #     - name: Run format check
28 |   #       run: |
29 |   #         forge fmt --check
30 | 
31 |   tests:
32 |     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
33 |     steps:
34 |       - uses: actions/checkout@v4
35 |         with:
36 |           submodules: recursive
37 |       - name: Install Foundry
38 |         uses: foundry-rs/foundry-toolchain@v1
39 |         with:
40 |           version: nightly
41 |       - name: Run tests
42 |         run: |
43 |           forge test
44 | 
45 |   install-with-template-test:
46 |     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
47 |     steps:
48 |       - uses: actions/checkout@v4
49 |         with:
50 |           submodules: recursive
51 |       - name: Install Foundry
52 |         uses: foundry-rs/foundry-toolchain@v1
53 |         with:
54 |           version: nightly
55 |       - name: Setup Git user
56 |         run: |
57 |           git config --global user.email "github-actions@example.com"
58 |           git config --global user.name "GitHub Actions"
59 |       - name: Run forge init with metacontract/template
60 |         run: |
61 |           mkdir /tmp/install-with-template-test
62 |           cd /tmp/install-with-template-test
63 |           forge init mc-example-project -t metacontract/template
64 |       - name: Run forge test
65 |         run: |
66 |           cd /tmp/install-with-template-test/mc-example-project
67 |           forge test
68 | 
69 |   # slither:
70 |   #   runs-on: ubuntu-latest
71 |   #   steps:
72 |   #     - uses: actions/checkout@v4
73 |   #       with:
74 |   #         submodules: recursive
75 |   #     - name: Run Slither
76 |   #       uses: crytic/slither-action@v0.2.0
77 |   #       continue-on-error: true
78 |   #       with:
79 |   #         node-version: 16
80 | 
81 |   # coverage:
82 |   #   runs-on: ubuntu-latest
83 |   #   steps:
84 |   #     - uses: actions/checkout@v4
85 |   #       with:
86 |   #         submodules: recursive
87 |   #     - name: Install Foundry
88 |   #       uses: foundry-rs/foundry-toolchain@v1
89 |   #       with:
90 |   #         version: nightly
91 |   #     - name: Generate coverage report
92 |   #       run: |

95 |   #       uses: codecov/codecov-action@v3

/site/docs/03-api/03-api-details/Flattened.sol/library.Logger.md:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1 | # Logger
  2 | [Git Source](https://github.com/metacontract/mc/blob/main/src/devkit/Flattened.sol)
  3 | 
  4 | ===============
  5 | 📊 Logger
  6 | =================
  7 | 
  8 | 
  9 | ## State Variables
 10 | ### CRITICAL
 11 | 
 12 | ```solidity
 13 | string constant CRITICAL = "\u001b[91m[\xF0\x9F\x9A\xA8CRITICAL]\u001b[0m";
 14 | ```
 15 | 
 16 | 
 17 | ### ERROR
 18 | 
 19 | ```solidity
 20 | string constant ERROR = "\u001b[91m[\u2716 ERROR]\u001b[0m\n\t";
 21 | ```
 22 | 
 23 | 
 24 | ### WARN
 25 | 
 26 | ```solidity
 27 | string constant WARN = "\u001b[93m[WARNING]\u001b[0m";
 28 | ```
 29 | 
 30 | 
 31 | ### INFO
 32 | 
 33 | ```solidity
 34 | string constant INFO = "\u001b[92m[INFO]\u001b[0m";
 35 | ```
 36 | 
 37 | 
 38 | ### DEBUG
 39 | 
 40 | ```solidity
 41 | string constant DEBUG = "\u001b[94m[DEBUG]\u001b[0m";
 42 | ```
 43 | 
 44 | 
 45 | ## Functions
 46 | ### log
 47 | 
 48 | ------------------
 49 | 💬 Logging
 50 | --------------------
 51 | 
 52 | 
 53 | ```solidity
 54 | function log(string memory message) internal pure;
 55 | ```
 56 | 
 57 | ### log
 58 | 
 59 | 
 60 | ```solidity
 61 | function log(string memory header, string memory message) internal pure;
 62 | ```
 63 | 
 64 | ### logException
 65 | 
 66 | 
 67 | ```solidity
 68 | function logException(string memory messageHead, string memory messageBody) internal view;
 69 | ```
 70 | 
 71 | ### logCritical
 72 | 
 73 | 
 74 | ```solidity
 75 | function logCritical(string memory messageHead) internal pure;
 76 | ```
 77 | 
 78 | ### logError
 79 | 
 80 | 
 81 | ```solidity
 82 | function logError(string memory message) internal view;
 83 | ```
 84 | 
 85 | ### logWarn
 86 | 
 87 | 
 88 | ```solidity
 89 | function logWarn(string memory message) internal view;
 90 | ```
 91 | 
 92 | ### logInfo
 93 | 
 94 | 
 95 | ```solidity
 96 | function logInfo(string memory message) internal view;
 97 | ```
 98 | 
 99 | ### logDebug
100 | 
101 | 
102 | ```solidity
103 | function logDebug(string memory message) internal view;
104 | ```
105 | 
106 | ### exportTo
107 | 
108 | -------------------
109 | 💾 Export Log
110 | ---------------------
111 | 
112 | 
113 | ```solidity
114 | function exportTo(string memory fileName) internal;
115 | ```
116 | 
117 | ### currentLevel
118 | 
119 | 
120 | ```solidity
121 | function currentLevel() internal view returns (Level);
122 | ```
123 | 
124 | ### shouldLog
125 | 
126 | 
127 | ```solidity
128 | function shouldLog(Level level) internal view returns (bool);
129 | ```
130 | 
131 | ### isDisable
132 | 
133 | 
134 | ```solidity
135 | function isDisable() internal view returns (bool);
136 | ```

144 |     Error,
145 |     Warn,
146 |     Info,
147 |     Debug
148 | }
149 | ```

  5 | 📊 Logger
  6 | =================

 14 | ```

/src/devkit/core/Proxy.sol:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1 | // SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT
 2 | pragma solidity ^0.8.23;
 3 | /**
 4 |  * ---------------------
 5 |  *     Support Methods
 6 |  * -----------------------
 7 |  */
 8 | 
 9 | import {Tracer, param} from "@mc-devkit/system/Tracer.sol";
10 | import {Inspector} from "@mc-devkit/types/Inspector.sol";
11 | import {TypeGuard, TypeStatus} from "@mc-devkit/types/TypeGuard.sol";
12 | // Validation
13 | import {Validator} from "@mc-devkit/system/Validator.sol";
14 | 
15 | // External Lib Contract
16 | import {Proxy as UCSProxy} from "@ucs.mc/proxy/Proxy.sol";
17 | // Mock Contract
18 | import {SimpleMockProxy} from "@mc-devkit/test/mocks/SimpleMockProxy.sol";
19 | 
20 | // Core Types
21 | import {Dictionary} from "@mc-devkit/core/Dictionary.sol";
22 | import {Function} from "@mc-devkit/core/Function.sol";
23 | 
24 | ///////////////////////////////////////////
25 | //  🏠 Proxy   ////////////////////////////
26 | using ProxyLib for Proxy global;
27 | using Tracer for Proxy global;
28 | using Inspector for Proxy global;
29 | using TypeGuard for Proxy global;
30 | ///////////////////////////////////////////
31 | 
32 | struct Proxy {
33 |     address addr;
34 |     ProxyKind kind;
35 |     TypeStatus status;
36 | }
37 | 
38 | library ProxyLib {
39 |     /**
40 |      * ---------------------
41 |      *     🚀 Deploy Proxy
42 |      * -----------------------
43 |      */
44 |     function deploy(Dictionary memory dictionary, bytes memory initData) internal returns (Proxy memory proxy) {
45 |         uint256 pid = proxy.startProcess("deploy", param(dictionary, initData));
46 |         Validator.MUST_Completed(dictionary);
47 |         proxy.startBuilding();
48 |         proxy.addr = address(new UCSProxy(dictionary.addr, initData));
49 |         proxy.kind = ProxyKind.Verifiable;
50 |         proxy.finishBuilding();
51 |         return proxy.finishProcess(pid);
52 |     }
53 | 
54 |     /**
55 |      * --------------------------
56 |      *     🤖 Create Proxy Mock
57 |      * ----------------------------
58 |      */
59 |     function createSimpleMock(Function[] memory functions) internal returns (Proxy memory mockProxy) {
60 |         uint256 pid = mockProxy.startProcess("createSimpleMock", param(functions));
61 |         for (uint256 i; i < functions.length; ++i) {
62 |             Validator.MUST_Completed(functions[i]);
63 |         }
64 |         mockProxy.startBuilding();
65 |         mockProxy.addr = address(new SimpleMockProxy(functions));
66 |         mockProxy.kind = ProxyKind.Mock;
67 |         mockProxy.finishBuilding();
68 |         return mockProxy.finishProcess(pid);
69 |     }
70 | }
71 | 
72 | /**
73 |  * ---------------
74 |  *     Proxy Kind
75 |  * -----------------
76 |  */
77 | enum ProxyKind {
78 |     undefined,
79 |     Normal,
80 |     Verifiable,
81 |     Mock
82 | }
83 | 
84 | using Inspector for ProxyKind global;
85 | 


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
/site/docs/03-api/03-api-details/Flattened.sol/interface.IERC20.md:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1 | # IERC20
  2 | [Git Source](https://github.com/metacontract/mc/blob/main/src/devkit/Flattened.sol)
  3 | 
  4 | *Interface of the ERC20 standard as defined in the EIP.*
  5 | 
  6 | *This includes the optional name, symbol, and decimals metadata.*
  7 | 
  8 | 
  9 | ## Functions
 10 | ### totalSupply
 11 | 
 12 | Returns the amount of tokens in existence.
 13 | 
 14 | 
 15 | ```solidity
 16 | function totalSupply() external view returns (uint256);
 17 | ```
 18 | 
 19 | ### balanceOf
 20 | 
 21 | Returns the amount of tokens owned by `account`.
 22 | 
 23 | 
 24 | ```solidity
 25 | function balanceOf(address account) external view returns (uint256);
 26 | ```
 27 | 
 28 | ### transfer
 29 | 
 30 | Moves `amount` tokens from the caller's account to `to`.
 31 | 
 32 | 
 33 | ```solidity
 34 | function transfer(address to, uint256 amount) external returns (bool);
 35 | ```
 36 | 
 37 | ### allowance
 38 | 
 39 | Returns the remaining number of tokens that `spender` is allowed
 40 | to spend on behalf of `owner`
 41 | 
 42 | 
 43 | ```solidity
 44 | function allowance(address owner, address spender) external view returns (uint256);
 45 | ```
 46 | 
 47 | ### approve
 48 | 
 49 | Sets `amount` as the allowance of `spender` over the caller's tokens.
 50 | 
 51 | *Be aware of front-running risks: https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/issues/20#issuecomment-263524729*
 52 | 
 53 | 
 54 | ```solidity
 55 | function approve(address spender, uint256 amount) external returns (bool);
 56 | ```
 57 | 
 58 | ### transferFrom
 59 | 
 60 | Moves `amount` tokens from `from` to `to` using the allowance mechanism.
 61 | `amount` is then deducted from the caller's allowance.
 62 | 
 63 | 
 64 | ```solidity
 65 | function transferFrom(address from, address to, uint256 amount) external returns (bool);
 66 | ```
 67 | 
 68 | ### name
 69 | 
 70 | Returns the name of the token.
 71 | 
 72 | 
 73 | ```solidity
 74 | function name() external view returns (string memory);
 75 | ```
 76 | 
 77 | ### symbol
 78 | 
 79 | Returns the symbol of the token.
 80 | 
 81 | 
 82 | ```solidity
 83 | function symbol() external view returns (string memory);
 84 | ```
 85 | 
 86 | ### decimals
 87 | 
 88 | Returns the decimals places of the token.
 89 | 
 90 | 
 91 | ```solidity
 92 | function decimals() external view returns (uint8);
 93 | ```
 94 | 
 95 | ## Events
 96 | ### Transfer
 97 | *Emitted when `value` tokens are moved from one account (`from`) to another (`to`).*
 98 | 
 99 | 
100 | ```solidity
101 | event Transfer(address indexed from, address indexed to, uint256 value);
102 | ```
103 | 
104 | ### Approval
105 | *Emitted when the allowance of a `spender` for an `owner` is set, where `value`
106 | is the new allowance.*
107 | 
108 | 
109 | ```solidity
110 | event Approval(address indexed owner, address indexed spender, uint256 value);
111 | ```
112 | 
113 | 


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
/src/devkit/core/Bundle.sol:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1 | // SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT
 2 | pragma solidity ^0.8.23;
 3 | /**
 4 |  * ---------------------
 5 |  *     Support Methods
 6 |  * -----------------------
 7 |  */
 8 | 
 9 | import {Tracer, param} from "@mc-devkit/system/Tracer.sol";
10 | import {Inspector} from "@mc-devkit/types/Inspector.sol";
11 | import {TypeGuard, TypeStatus} from "@mc-devkit/types/TypeGuard.sol";
12 | // Validation
13 | import {Validator} from "@mc-devkit/system/Validator.sol";
14 | 
15 | // Core Type
16 | import {Function} from "@mc-devkit/core/Function.sol";
17 | 
18 | ///////////////////////////////////////////
19 | //  🗂️ Bundle   ///////////////////////////
20 | using BundleLib for Bundle global;
21 | using Tracer for Bundle global;
22 | using Inspector for Bundle global;
23 | using TypeGuard for Bundle global;
24 | ///////////////////////////////////////////
25 | 
26 | struct Bundle {
27 |     string name;
28 |     Function[] functions;
29 |     address facade;
30 |     TypeStatus status;
31 | }
32 | 
33 | library BundleLib {
34 |     /**
35 |      * --------------------
36 |      *     📛 Assign Name
37 |      * ----------------------
38 |      */
39 |     function assignName(Bundle storage bundle, string memory name) internal returns (Bundle storage) {
40 |         uint256 pid = bundle.startProcess("assignName", param(name));
41 |         Validator.MUST_NotEmptyName(name);
42 |         bundle.startBuilding();
43 |         bundle.name = name;
44 |         bundle.finishBuilding();
45 |         return bundle.finishProcess(pid);
46 |     }
47 | 
48 |     /**
49 |      * -------------------------
50 |      *     🧩 Push Function(s)
51 |      * ---------------------------
52 |      */
53 |     function pushFunction(Bundle storage bundle, Function storage func) internal returns (Bundle storage) {
54 |         uint256 pid = bundle.startProcess("pushFunction", param(func));
55 |         Validator.MUST_Completed(func);
56 |         Validator.MUST_HaveUniqueSelector(bundle, func);
57 |         bundle.startBuilding();
58 |         bundle.functions.push(func);
59 |         bundle.finishBuilding();
60 |         return bundle.finishProcess(pid);
61 |     }
62 | 
63 |     function pushFunctions(Bundle storage bundle, Function[] storage functions) internal returns (Bundle storage) {
64 |         uint256 pid = bundle.startProcess("pushFunctions", param(functions));
65 |         for (uint256 i; i < functions.length; ++i) {
66 |             bundle.pushFunction(functions[i]);
67 |         }
68 |         return bundle.finishProcess(pid);
69 |     }
70 | 
71 |     /**
72 |      * ----------------------
73 |      *     🪟 Assign Facade
74 |      * ------------------------
75 |      */
76 |     function assignFacade(Bundle storage bundle, address facade) internal returns (Bundle storage) {
77 |         uint256 pid = bundle.startProcess("assignFacade", param(facade));
78 |         Validator.MUST_AddressIsContract(facade);
79 |         bundle.startBuilding();
80 |         bundle.facade = facade;
81 |         bundle.finishBuilding();
82 |         return bundle.finishProcess(pid);
83 |     }
84 | }
85 | 


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
/site/src/theme/Navbar/index.tsx:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1 | import type { WrapperProps } from "@docusaurus/types";
 2 | import Navbar from "@theme-original/Navbar";
 3 | import type NavbarType from "@theme/Navbar";
 4 | import React, { useEffect } from "react";
 5 | 
 6 | type Props = WrapperProps<typeof NavbarType>;
 7 | 
 8 | const addClickListeners = (elements: NodeListOf<Element>) => {
 9 | 	for (const item of elements) {
10 | 		item.addEventListener("click", handleClick);
11 | 	}
12 | };
13 | 
14 | const handleClick = (event: Event) => {
15 | 	console.log("Link clicked:", (event.target as HTMLElement).innerText);
16 | 
17 | 	const target = event.target as HTMLElement;
18 | 	const liElement = target.closest("li.theme-doc-sidebar-item-category");
19 | 	if (liElement) {
20 | 		const isActive = target.classList.contains("menu__link--active");
21 | 		if (isActive) {
22 | 			liElement.classList.toggle("menu__list-item--collapsed");
23 | 		} else {
24 | 			liElement.classList.remove("menu__list-item--collapsed");
25 | 		}
26 | 
27 | 		const siblingUl = liElement.querySelector("ul");
28 | 		if (siblingUl) {
29 | 			if (isActive) {
30 | 				siblingUl.style.display =
31 | 					siblingUl.style.display === "none" ? "block" : "none";
32 | 			} else {
33 | 				siblingUl.style.display = "block";
34 | 			}
35 | 		}
36 | 	}
37 | };
38 | 
39 | const identifyBoundaryBetweenLinkAndCategory = () => {
40 | 	const listItems = document.querySelectorAll("ul.theme-doc-sidebar-menu > li");
41 | 	let lastLinkItem: Element | null = null;
42 | 	for (const item of listItems) {
43 | 		if (item.classList.contains("theme-doc-sidebar-item-link")) {
44 | 			lastLinkItem = item;
45 | 		} else if (item.classList.contains("theme-doc-sidebar-item-category")) {
46 | 			if (lastLinkItem) {
47 | 				lastLinkItem.classList.add("last-link-before-category");
48 | 				lastLinkItem = null; // Reset after adding class
49 | 			}
50 | 		}
51 | 	}
52 | };
53 | 
54 | const observeMutations = (callback: MutationCallback) => {
55 | 	const observer = new MutationObserver(callback);
56 | 	observer.observe(document.body, {
57 | 		childList: true,
58 | 		subtree: true,
59 | 	});
60 | 	return observer;
61 | };
62 | 
63 | export default function NavbarWrapper(props: Props): JSX.Element {
64 | 	useEffect(() => {
65 | 		// Add click listeners to all sidebar items
66 | 		const sidebarItems = document.querySelectorAll("a.menu__link--sublist");
67 | 		addClickListeners(sidebarItems);
68 | 
69 | 		// Identify the boundary between link and category
70 | 		identifyBoundaryBetweenLinkAndCategory();
71 | 
72 | 		// Observe mutations
73 | 		const observer = observeMutations((mutations) => {
74 | 			for (const mutation of mutations) {
75 | 				if (mutation.type === "childList") {
76 | 					const newItems = document.querySelectorAll("a.menu__link--sublist");
77 | 					addClickListeners(newItems);
78 | 				}
79 | 			}
80 | 		});
81 | 
82 | 		// Cleanup function to remove event listeners
83 | 		return () => {
84 | 			for (const item of sidebarItems) {
85 | 				item.removeEventListener("click", handleClick);
86 | 			}
87 | 			observer.disconnect();
88 | 		};
89 | 	}, []);
90 | 
91 | 	return <Navbar {...props} />;
92 | }
93 | 


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
/site/docs/03-api/03-api-details/Flattened.sol/abstract.Ownable.md:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1 | # Ownable
  2 | [Git Source](https://github.com/metacontract/mc/blob/main/src/devkit/Flattened.sol)
  3 | 
  4 | **Inherits:**
  5 | [Context](abstract.Context.md)
  6 | 
  7 | *Contract module which provides a basic access control mechanism, where
  8 | there is an account (an owner) that can be granted exclusive access to
  9 | specific functions.
 10 | The initial owner is set to the address provided by the deployer. This can
 11 | later be changed with [transferOwnership](abstract.Ownable.md#transferownership).
 12 | This module is used through inheritance. It will make available the modifier
 13 | `onlyOwner`, which can be applied to your functions to restrict their use to
 14 | the owner.*
 15 | 
 16 | 
 17 | ## State Variables
 18 | ### _owner
 19 | 
 20 | ```solidity
 21 | address private _owner;
 22 | ```
 23 | 
 24 | 
 25 | ## Functions
 26 | ### constructor
 27 | 
 28 | *Initializes the contract setting the address provided by the deployer as the initial owner.*
 29 | 
 30 | 
 31 | ```solidity
 32 | constructor(address initialOwner);
 33 | ```
 34 | 
 35 | ### onlyOwner
 36 | 
 37 | *Throws if called by any account other than the owner.*
 38 | 
 39 | 
 40 | ```solidity
 41 | modifier onlyOwner();
 42 | ```
 43 | 
 44 | ### owner
 45 | 
 46 | *Returns the address of the current owner.*
 47 | 
 48 | 
 49 | ```solidity
 50 | function owner() public view virtual returns (address);
 51 | ```
 52 | 
 53 | ### _checkOwner
 54 | 
 55 | *Throws if the sender is not the owner.*
 56 | 
 57 | 
 58 | ```solidity
 59 | function _checkOwner() internal view virtual;
 60 | ```
 61 | 
 62 | ### renounceOwnership
 63 | 
 64 | *Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call
 65 | `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner.
 66 | NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner,
 67 | thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.*
 68 | 
 69 | 
 70 | ```solidity
 71 | function renounceOwnership() public virtual onlyOwner;
 72 | ```
 73 | 
 74 | ### transferOwnership
 75 | 
 76 | *Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`).
 77 | Can only be called by the current owner.*
 78 | 
 79 | 
 80 | ```solidity
 81 | function transferOwnership(address newOwner) public virtual onlyOwner;
 82 | ```
 83 | 
 84 | ### _transferOwnership
 85 | 
 86 | *Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`).
 87 | Internal function without access restriction.*
 88 | 
 89 | 
 90 | ```solidity
 91 | function _transferOwnership(address newOwner) internal virtual;
 92 | ```
 93 | 
 94 | ## Events
 95 | ### OwnershipTransferred
 96 | 
 97 | ```solidity
 98 | event OwnershipTransferred(address indexed previousOwner, address indexed newOwner);
 99 | ```
100 | 
101 | ## Errors
102 | ### OwnableUnauthorizedAccount
103 | *The caller account is not authorized to perform an operation.*
104 | 
105 | 
106 | ```solidity
107 | error OwnableUnauthorizedAccount(address account);
108 | ```
109 | 
110 | ### OwnableInvalidOwner
111 | *The owner is not a valid owner account. (eg. `address(0)`)*
112 | 
113 | 
114 | ```solidity
115 | error OwnableInvalidOwner(address owner);
116 | ```
117 | 
118 | 


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
/site/docs/02-guides/05-project-management/02-branching-and-release-strategy.md:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1 | ---
 2 | sidebar_label: Branching and Release
 3 | keywords: [versioning, strategy, best-practices, release-management, branching]
 4 | tags: [versioning, strategy, best-practices, release-management, branching]
 5 | last_update:
 6 |   date: 2024-10-28
 7 |   author: Meta Contract Development Team
 8 | ---
 9 | 
10 | # Branching and Release Strategy
11 | 
12 | This guide outlines the branching and release management practices for the Meta Contract project using [GitHub Flow](https://docs.github.com/get-started/quickstart/github-flow) and [Semantic Versioning](https://semver.org/).
13 | 
14 | ## Basics of GitHub Flow
15 | 
16 | - **main**: Always maintain a stable state.
17 | - **feature branches**: Short-lived branches for new features or fixes. Created from `main` and merged back into `main` once work is complete.
18 | 
19 | ## Branch Naming Conventions
20 | 
21 | - **Prefix**: Use an appropriate prefix to indicate the purpose of the branch.
22 | - **Lowercase and Hyphens**: Use lowercase letters for branch names and separate words with hyphens.
23 | 
24 | ### Examples:
25 |   - `feature/user-authentication`
26 |   - `bugfix/fix-login-error`
27 | 
28 | ## Semantic Versioning (SemVer)
29 | 
30 | Semantic Versioning follows the format `MAJOR.MINOR.PATCH`, where:
31 | 
32 | - **MAJOR**: Incremented for incompatible API changes.
33 | - **MINOR**: Incremented for adding functionality in a backwards-compatible manner.
34 | - **PATCH**: Incremented for backwards-compatible bug fixes.
35 | 
36 | ## Versioning Workflow
37 | 
38 | 1. **New Feature Addition**:
39 |    - Increment the MINOR version.
40 |    - Example: From `v1.0.0` to `v1.1.0`.
41 | 
42 | 2. **Bug Fix**:
43 |    - Increment the PATCH version.
44 |    - Example: From `v1.1.0` to `v1.1.1`.
45 | 
46 | 3. **Incompatible Changes**:
47 |    - Increment the MAJOR version and reset MINOR and PATCH to zero.
48 |    - Example: From `v1.1.1` to `v2.0.0`.
49 | 
50 | 4. **Hotfix**:
51 |    - Increment the PATCH version for urgent fixes.
52 |    - Example: From `v2.0.0` to `v2.0.1`.
53 | 
54 | ## Release Process
55 | 
56 | ### Stable Releases
57 | 
58 | 1. Create a feature branch from `main` for new releases.
59 | 2. Once the release is ready, merge it back into `main` and tag with the new version number.
60 | 
61 | ### Hotfix Releases
62 | 
63 | 1. Create a hotfix branch from `main` for urgent fixes.
64 | 2. Once the hotfix is ready, merge it back into `main` and tag with the new version number.
65 | 
66 | ## Example Workflow
67 | 
68 | ```mermaid
69 | gitGraph
70 |     commit id: "Initial commit"
71 |     commit tag: "v0.1.0"
72 |     branch feature/feature-name
73 |     commit id: "Add feature 1"
74 |     checkout main
75 |     merge feature/feature-name
76 |     branch bugfix/bug-name
77 |     commit id: "Fix bug 1"
78 |     checkout main
79 |     merge bugfix/bug-name tag: "v0.1.1"
80 | ```
81 | 
82 | ## Conclusion
83 | 
84 | By adopting GitHub Flow and Semantic Versioning, we maintain a clear and consistent development and release process, facilitating easier understanding of project state and changes over time. For more details, refer to [GitHub Flow](https://docs.github.com/en/get-started/quickstart/github-flow).
85 |

/src/devkit/system/Logger.sol:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1 | // SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT
 2 | pragma solidity ^0.8.23;
 3 | 
 4 | // Forge-std
 5 | import {console} from "forge-std/console.sol";
 6 | // System
 7 | import {System} from "@mc-devkit/system/System.sol";
 8 | import {Tracer} from "@mc-devkit/system/Tracer.sol";
 9 | import {Formatter} from "@mc-devkit/types/Formatter.sol";
10 | 
11 | /**
12 |  * ===============
13 |  *     📊 Logger
14 |  * =================
15 |  */
16 | library Logger {
17 |     // forgefmt: disable-start
18 |     enum Level {
19 |         Critical,   // Display critical error messages only
20 |         Error,      // Display error messages only
21 |         Warn,       // Display warning and error messages
22 |         Info,       // Display info, warning, and error messages
23 |         Debug       // Display all messages including debug details
24 |     }
25 |     // forgefmt: disable-end
26 | 
27 |     // Message Header
28 |     string constant CRITICAL = "\u001b[91m[\xF0\x9F\x9A\xA8CRITICAL]\u001b[0m";
29 |     string constant ERROR = "\u001b[91m[\u2716 ERROR]\u001b[0m\n\t";
30 |     string constant WARN = "\u001b[93m[WARNING]\u001b[0m";
31 |     string constant INFO = "\u001b[92m[INFO]\u001b[0m";
32 |     string constant DEBUG = "\u001b[94m[DEBUG]\u001b[0m";
33 | 
34 |     /**
35 |      * ------------------
36 |      *     💬 Logging
37 |      * --------------------
38 |      */
39 |     function log(string memory message) internal pure {
40 |         console.log(message);
41 |     }
42 | 
43 |     function log(string memory header, string memory message) internal pure {
44 |         console.log(header, message);
45 |     }
46 | 
47 |     function logException(string memory messageHead, string memory messageBody) internal view {
48 |         if (currentLevel() == Level.Critical) logCritical(messageHead);
49 |         if (currentLevel() >= Level.Error) logError(Formatter.toMessage(messageHead, messageBody));
50 |     }
51 | 
52 |     function logCritical(string memory messageHead) internal pure {
53 |         log(CRITICAL, messageHead);
54 |     }
55 | 
56 |     function logError(string memory message) internal view {
57 |         log(ERROR, message);
58 |         log(Tracer.traceErrorLocations());
59 |     }
60 | 
61 |     function logWarn(string memory message) internal view {
62 |         if (shouldLog(Level.Warn)) log(WARN, message);
63 |     }
64 | 
65 |     function logInfo(string memory message) internal view {
66 |         if (shouldLog(Level.Info)) log(INFO, message);
67 |     }
68 | 
69 |     function logDebug(string memory message) internal view {
70 |         if (shouldLog(Level.Debug)) log(DEBUG, message);
71 |     }
72 | 
73 |     /**
74 |      * -------------------
75 |      *     💾 Export Log
76 |      * ---------------------
77 |      */
78 |     function exportTo(string memory fileName) internal {}
79 | 
80 |     // Check Current Log Level
81 |     function currentLevel() internal view returns (Level) {
82 |         return System.Config().SYSTEM.LOG_LEVEL;
83 |     }
84 | 
85 |     function shouldLog(Level level) internal view returns (bool) {
86 |         Level _currentLevel = currentLevel();
87 |         return level <= _currentLevel;
88 |     }
89 | 
90 |     function isDisable() internal view returns (bool) {
91 |         return currentLevel() == Level.Critical;
92 |     }
93 | }
94 |

/README.md:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1 | # Meta Contract ![Solidity][solidity-shield] [![License:MIT][license-shield]](./LICENSE)
 2 | <!-- [![CI][ci-shield]][ci-url] -->
 3 | 
 4 | [solidity-shield]: https://img.shields.io/badge/Built_with-Solidity-rgb(85,84,217)
 5 | [license-shield]: https://img.shields.io/badge/license-MIT-blue.svg
 6 | [ci-shield]: https://img.shields.io/github/actions/workflow/status/metacontract/mc/ci.yml?branch=main&label=build
 7 | [ci-url]: https://github.com/metacontract/mc/actions/workflows/ci.yml
 8 | 
 9 | Meta Contract is a Foundry-based smart contract framework designed to create flexible, upgradeable, and scalable blockchain applications. It implements the UCS ([ERC-7546: Upgradeable Clone for Scalable Contracts](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-7546)) architecture, providing developers with powerful tools to build and maintain complex decentralized systems.
10 | 
11 | > [!WARNING]
12 | > This is still in the development version, which means it is an early version intended for testing and feedback purposes. Please be cautious when using this version in production environments, as it may contain bugs, incomplete features, or unexpected behavior.
13 | 
14 | ## Features
15 | 
16 | - **Upgradeability**: Meta Contracts can be upgraded without changing their address, allowing for seamless improvements and bug fixes.
17 | - **Modularity**: The framework separates contract logic into distinct, manageable components, enhancing code organization and reusability.
18 | - **Scalability**: Meta Contracts are designed to handle growth efficiently, making them suitable for large-scale applications.
19 | - **Flexibility**: Developers can easily extend and customize Meta Contracts to suit specific project needs.
20 | - **Testability**: The modular structure of Meta Contracts facilitates comprehensive testing, including unit tests for individual functions and integration tests for the entire system.
21 | 
22 | ## Getting Started
23 | 
24 | ### Prerequisites
25 | 
26 | To use mc, you need to have [Foundry](https://github.com/foundry-rs/foundry) installed.
27 | 
28 | ### Quick Start
29 | 
30 | Just run this:
31 | 
32 | ```bash
33 | forge init <Your Project Name> -t metacontract/template
34 | ```
35 | 
36 | After the installation, run the following command to test the _Counter_ sample project and see how it works:
37 | 
38 | ```bash
39 | cd <Your Project Name>
40 | forge test
41 | ```
42 | 
43 | If you want to learn more about meta contract installation, please refer to [installation guide](https://mc-book.ecdysis.xyz/guides/setup/installation).
44 | 
45 | ## Documentation
46 | 
47 | The [MC Book](https://mc-book.ecdysis.xyz/) serves as a comprehensive guide for developing with the meta contract. Also, you can find the markdown documents in [docs](./site/docs) directory.
48 | 
49 | ## Contributing
50 | 
51 | We welcome contributions from the community! If you'd like to contribute to mc, please check out our [Contributing Guide](./CONTRIBUTING.md) for detailed instructions on how to:
52 | - Report issues and bugs
53 | - Submit feature requests
54 | - Create pull requests
55 | - Follow our [project management guidelines](https://mc-book.ecdysis.xyz/guides/project-management)
56 | - Participate in discussions and decision-making
57 | 
58 | We appreciate your help in making meta contract even better!
59 | 
60 | ## License
61 | This meta contract is released under the [MIT License](./LICENSE).
62 | 


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
/site/docs/01-concepts/01-what-is-meta-contract.md:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1 | ---
 2 | keywords: [meta-contract, introduction, overview, features, benefits]
 3 | tags: [meta-contract, introduction, overview, features, benefits]
 4 | last_update:
 5 |   date: 2024-10-26
 6 |   author: Meta Contract Development Team
 7 | ---
 8 | 
 9 | # What is Meta Contract?
10 | 
11 | Meta Contract (MC) is an innovative smart contract framework designed to create flexible, upgradeable, and scalable blockchain applications. It implements the UCS (Upgradeable Clone for Scalable Contracts, defined in [ERC-7546](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-7546)) architecture, providing developers with powerful tools to build and maintain complex decentralized systems.
12 | 
13 | ## Key Features
14 | 
15 | 1. **Upgradeability**: Meta Contracts can be upgraded without changing their address, allowing for seamless improvements and bug fixes.
16 | 2. **Modularity**: The framework separates contract logic into distinct, manageable components, enhancing code organization and reusability.
17 | 3. **Scalability**: Meta Contracts are designed to handle growth efficiently, making them suitable for large-scale applications.
18 | 4. **Flexibility**: Developers can easily extend and customize Meta Contracts to suit specific project needs.
19 | 5. **Testability**: The modular structure of Meta Contracts facilitates comprehensive testing, including unit tests for individual functions and integration tests for the entire system.
20 | 
21 | ## How It Works
22 | 
23 | Meta Contract utilizes three main components:
24 | 
25 | 1. **Proxy Contract**: Maintains the state and delegates calls to the appropriate function contracts.
26 | 2. **Dictionary Contract**: Manages a mapping of function selectors to their corresponding function contract addresses.
27 | 3. **Function Contracts**: Contain the actual logic for various contract functions.
28 | 
29 | This separation allows for granular updates and optimizations without disrupting the entire system.
30 | 
31 | ## Benefits
32 | 
33 | - **Reduced Development Time**: Reusable components and a structured architecture speed up the development process.
34 | - **Lower Maintenance Costs**: Upgradeability features make it easier and cheaper to maintain and improve contracts over time.
35 | - **Enhanced Security**: The ability to quickly patch vulnerabilities without changing contract addresses improves overall security.
36 | - **Future-Proofing**: As blockchain technology evolves, Meta Contracts can adapt without requiring complete system overhauls.
37 | - **Improved Testing**: The modular nature of Meta Contracts allows for more thorough and targeted testing of individual components.
38 | 
39 | ## Use Cases
40 | 
41 | Meta Contracts are particularly well-suited for:
42 | 
43 | - Decentralized Finance (DeFi) protocols
44 | - Governance systems
45 | - NFT platforms
46 | - Complex multi-contract systems
47 | - Any application that may require future upgrades or extensions
48 | 
49 | ## Next Steps
50 | 
51 | To start building with Meta Contract:
52 | 
53 | 1. Explore the [Key Concepts](./02-key-concepts.md) to understand the core principles.
54 | 2. Follow our [Installation Guide](../02-guides/01-setup/01-installation.md) to set up your development environment.
55 | 3. Check out our [Examples](../04-examples/index.md).
56 | 
57 | For any questions or support, join our [community forum](https://github.com/orgs/metacontract/discussions).
58 | 


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
/site/docs/03-api/03-api-details/Flattened.sol/library.ForgeHelper.md:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1 | # ForgeHelper
  2 | [Git Source](https://github.com/metacontract/mc/blob/main/src/devkit/Flattened.sol)
  3 | 
  4 | 🛠 Helper Methods for Forge Std
  5 | 
  6 | 
  7 | ## Functions
  8 | ### loadPrivateKey
  9 | 
 10 | -------------------
 11 | 🔧 Env File
 12 | ---------------------
 13 | 
 14 | 
 15 | ```solidity
 16 | function loadPrivateKey(string memory envKey) internal view returns (uint256);
 17 | ```
 18 | 
 19 | ### loadAddressFromEnv
 20 | 
 21 | 
 22 | ```solidity
 23 | function loadAddressFromEnv(string memory envKey) internal view returns (address);
 24 | ```
 25 | 
 26 | ### getAddress
 27 |

/src/devkit/system/Config.sol:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1 | // SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT
 2 | pragma solidity ^0.8.23;
 3 | 
 4 | import {ForgeHelper, vm} from "@mc-devkit/utils/ForgeHelper.sol";
 5 | 
 6 | using ForgeHelper for string;
 7 | 
 8 | import {Logger} from "@mc-devkit/system/Logger.sol";
 9 | import {Validator} from "@mc-devkit/system/Validator.sol";
10 | 
11 | import {Parser} from "@mc-devkit/types/Parser.sol";
12 | 
13 | using Parser for string;
14 | 
15 | /**
16 |  * ----------------------
17 |  *     📝 Config
18 |  * ------------------------
19 |  */
20 | using ConfigLib for ConfigState global;
21 | 
22 | /**
23 |  * ===============\
24 |  * |   📝 Config     |
25 |  * \================
26 |  */
27 | /// @custom:storage-location erc7201:mc.devkit.config
28 | struct ConfigState {
29 |     SetupConfig SETUP;
30 |     SystemConfig SYSTEM;
31 |     NamingConfig DEFAULT_NAME;
32 | }
33 | 
34 | struct SetupConfig {
35 |     bool STD_FUNCS;
36 | }
37 | 
38 | struct SystemConfig {
39 |     Logger.Level LOG_LEVEL;
40 |     uint256 SCAN_RANGE;
41 | }
42 | 
43 | struct NamingConfig {
44 |     string DICTIONARY;
45 |     string DICTIONARY_DUPLICATED;
46 |     string DICTIONARY_MOCK;
47 |     string PROXY;
48 |     string PROXY_MOCK;
49 |     string BUNDLE;
50 |     string FUNCTION;
51 | }
52 | 
53 | library ConfigLib {
54 |     function load(ConfigState storage config) internal {
55 |         loadFromLibMC(config);
56 |         loadFromProjectRoot(config);
57 |     }
58 | 
59 |     function loadFromLibMC(ConfigState storage config) internal {
60 |         string memory path = string.concat(vm.projectRoot(), "/lib/mc/mc.toml");
61 |         if (Validator.SHOULD_FileExists(path)) config.loadFrom(path);
62 |     }
63 | 
64 |     function loadFromProjectRoot(ConfigState storage config) internal {
65 |         string memory path = string.concat(vm.projectRoot(), "/mc.toml");
66 |         if (Validator.SHOULD_FileExists(path)) config.loadFrom(path);
67 |     }
68 | 
69 |     function loadFrom(ConfigState storage config, string memory path) internal {
70 |         string memory toml = vm.readFile(path);
71 |         // Setup
72 |         config.SETUP.STD_FUNCS = toml.readBoolOr(".setup.STD_FUNCS", config.SETUP.STD_FUNCS);
73 |         // System
74 |         config.SYSTEM.LOG_LEVEL = toml.readLogLevelOr(".system.LOG_LEVEL", config.SYSTEM.LOG_LEVEL);
75 |         config.SYSTEM.SCAN_RANGE = toml.readUintOr(".system.SCAN_RANGE", config.SYSTEM.SCAN_RANGE);
76 |         // Naming
77 |         config.DEFAULT_NAME.DICTIONARY =
78 |             toml.readStringOr(".naming.DEFAULT_DICTIONARY", "config.DEFAULT_NAME.DICTIONARY");
79 |         config.DEFAULT_NAME.DICTIONARY_DUPLICATED =
80 |             toml.readStringOr(".naming.DEFAULT_DICTIONARY_DUPLICATED", "config.DEFAULT_NAME.DICTIONARY_DUPLICATED");
81 |         config.DEFAULT_NAME.DICTIONARY_MOCK =
82 |             toml.readStringOr(".naming.DEFAULT_DICTIONARY_MOCK", "config.DEFAULT_NAME.DICTIONARY_MOCK");
83 |         config.DEFAULT_NAME.PROXY = toml.readStringOr(".naming.DEFAULT_PROXY", "config.DEFAULT_NAME.PROXY");
84 |         config.DEFAULT_NAME.PROXY_MOCK =
85 |             toml.readStringOr(".naming.DEFAULT_PROXY_MOCK", "config.DEFAULT_NAME.PROXY_MOCK");
86 |         config.DEFAULT_NAME.BUNDLE = toml.readStringOr(".naming.DEFAULT_BUNDLE", "config.DEFAULT_NAME.BUNDLE");
87 |         config.DEFAULT_NAME.FUNCTION = toml.readStringOr(".naming.DEFAULT_FUNCTION", "config.DEFAULT_NAME.FUNCTION");
88 |     }
89 | }
90 |
