/src/devkit/registry/StdRegistry.sol:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1 | // SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT
 2 | pragma solidity ^0.8.23;
 3 | /**
 4 |  * ---------------------
 5 |  *     Support Methods
 6 |  * -----------------------
 7 |  */
 8 | 
 9 | import {Tracer} from "@mc-devkit/system/Tracer.sol";
10 | import {TypeGuard, TypeStatus} from "@mc-devkit/types/TypeGuard.sol";
11 | // Validation
12 | import {Validator} from "@mc-devkit/system/Validator.sol";
13 | 
14 | // Core Types
15 | import {Function} from "@mc-devkit/core/Function.sol";
16 | import {Bundle} from "@mc-devkit/core/Bundle.sol";
17 | import {StdFunctions} from "@mc-devkit/registry/StdFunctions.sol";
18 | // MC Std
19 | import {Clone} from "@mc-std/functions/Clone.sol";
20 | import {GetFunctions} from "@mc-std/functions/GetFunctions.sol";
21 | import {FeatureToggle} from "@mc-std/functions/protected/FeatureToggle.sol";
22 | import {InitSetAdmin} from "@mc-std/functions/protected/InitSetAdmin.sol";
23 | import {UpgradeDictionary} from "@mc-std/functions/protected/UpgradeDictionary.sol";
24 | import {StdFacade} from "@mc-std/interfaces/StdFacade.sol";
25 | 
26 | ////////////////////////////////////////////////////
27 | //  🏛 Standard Registry    ////////////////////////
28 | using StdRegistryLib for StdRegistry global;
29 | using Tracer for StdRegistry global;
30 | using TypeGuard for StdRegistry global;
31 | ////////////////////////////////////////////////////
32 | 
33 | struct StdRegistry {
34 |     StdFunctions functions;
35 |     Bundle all;
36 |     TypeStatus status;
37 | }
38 | 
39 | library StdRegistryLib {
40 |     /**
41 |      * ----------------------------------
42 |      *     🟢 Complete Standard Registry
43 |      * ------------------------------------
44 |      */
45 |     function complete(StdRegistry storage registry) internal returns (StdRegistry storage) {
46 |         uint256 pid = registry.startProcess("complete");
47 |         registry.functions.complete();
48 |         registry.configureStdBundle();
49 |         registry.lock();
50 |         return registry.finishProcess(pid);
51 |     }
52 | 
53 |     /**
54 |      * ----------------------------------
55 |      *     🔧 Configure Standard Bundles
56 |      * ------------------------------------
57 |      */
58 |     function configureStdBundle(StdRegistry storage registry) internal returns (StdRegistry storage) {
59 |         uint256 pid = registry.startProcess("configureStdBundle");
60 |         registry.startBuilding();
61 |         registry.configureStdBundle_All();
62 |         registry.finishBuilding();
63 |         return registry.finishProcess(pid);
64 |     }
65 |     /**
66 |      * ===== Each Std Bundle =====
67 |      */
68 | 
69 |     function configureStdBundle_All(StdRegistry storage registry) internal returns (StdRegistry storage) {
70 |         uint256 pid = registry.startProcess("configureStdBundle_All");
71 |         registry.all.assignName("ALL_STD_FUNCTIONS").pushFunction(registry.functions.initSetAdmin).pushFunction(
72 |             registry.functions.getFunctions
73 |         ).pushFunction(registry.functions.clone).assignFacade(address(new StdFacade()));
74 |         return registry.finishProcess(pid);
75 |     }
76 | }
77 | 
78 | /**
79 |  *
80 |  *     🧩 Std Ops Primitive Utils for Arguments
81 |  *
82 |  */
83 | library StdFunctionsArgs {
84 |     function initSetAdminBytes(address admin) internal pure returns (bytes memory) {
85 |         return abi.encodeCall(InitSetAdmin.initSetAdmin, admin);
86 |     }
87 | }
88 |

/src/devkit/registry/BundleRegistry.sol:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1 | // SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT
 2 | pragma solidity ^0.8.23;
 3 | /**
 4 |  * ---------------------
 5 |  *     Support Methods
 6 |  * -----------------------
 7 |  */
 8 | 
 9 | import {Tracer, param} from "@mc-devkit/system/Tracer.sol";
10 | import {Inspector} from "@mc-devkit/types/Inspector.sol";
11 | import {NameGenerator} from "@mc-devkit/utils/mapping/NameGenerator.sol";
12 | // Validation
13 | import {Validator} from "@mc-devkit/system/Validator.sol";
14 | 
15 | // Context
16 | import {Current} from "@mc-devkit/registry/context/Current.sol";
17 | // Core Type
18 | import {Bundle} from "@mc-devkit/core/Bundle.sol";
19 | import {Function} from "@mc-devkit/core/Function.sol";
20 | 
21 | //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
22 | //  📙 Bundle Registry    ////////////////////////////////
23 | using BundleRegistryLib for BundleRegistry global;
24 | using Tracer for BundleRegistry global;
25 | using Inspector for BundleRegistry global;
26 | //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
27 | 
28 | struct BundleRegistry {
29 |     mapping(string name => Bundle) bundles;
30 |     Current current;
31 | }
32 | 
33 | library BundleRegistryLib {
34 |     using Tracer for string;
35 |     using NameGenerator for mapping(string => Bundle);
36 | 
37 |     /**
38 |      * ---------------------
39 |      *     🌱 Init Bundle
40 |      * -----------------------
41 |      */
42 |     function init(BundleRegistry storage registry, string memory name) internal returns (BundleRegistry storage) {
43 |         uint256 pid = registry.startProcess("init", param(name));
44 |         Validator.MUST_NotEmptyName(name);
45 |         Bundle storage bundle = registry.bundles[name];
46 |         Validator.MUST_NotInitialized(bundle);
47 |         bundle.assignName(name);
48 |         registry.current.update(name);
49 |         return registry.finishProcess(pid);
50 |     }
51 | 
52 |     function ensureInit(BundleRegistry storage registry) internal returns (BundleRegistry storage) {
53 |         uint256 pid = registry.startProcess("ensureInit");
54 |         Validator.SHOULD_ExistCurrentBundle(registry) ? registry : registry.init(registry.genUniqueName());
55 |         return registry.finishProcess(pid);
56 |     }
57 | 
58 |     /**
59 |      * --------------------
60 |      *     🔍 Find Bundle
61 |      * ----------------------
62 |      */
63 |     function find(BundleRegistry storage registry, string memory name) internal returns (Bundle storage bundle) {
64 |         uint256 pid = registry.startProcess("find", param(name));
65 |         Validator.MUST_NotEmptyName(name);
66 |         bundle = registry.bundles[name];
67 |         Validator.SHOULD_Completed(bundle);
68 |         registry.finishProcess(pid);
69 |     }
70 | 
71 |     function findCurrent(BundleRegistry storage registry) internal returns (Bundle storage bundle) {
72 |         uint256 pid = registry.startProcess("findCurrent");
73 |         Validator.MUST_ExistCurrentName(registry);
74 |         bundle = registry.find(registry.current.name);
75 |         registry.finishProcess(pid);
76 |     }
77 | 
78 |     /**
79 |      * -----------------------------
80 |      *     🏷 Generate Unique Name
81 |      * -------------------------------
82 |      */
83 |     function genUniqueName(BundleRegistry storage registry) internal returns (string memory name) {
84 |         uint256 pid = registry.startProcess("genUniqueName");
85 |         name = registry.bundles.genUniqueName();
86 |         registry.finishProcess(pid);
87 |     }
88 | }
89 |

/src/devkit/registry/ProxyRegistry.sol:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1 | // SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT
 2 | pragma solidity ^0.8.23;
 3 | /**
 4 |  * ---------------------
 5 |  *     Support Methods
 6 |  * -----------------------
 7 |  */
 8 | 
 9 | import {Tracer, param} from "@mc-devkit/system/Tracer.sol";
10 | import {Inspector} from "@mc-devkit/types/Inspector.sol";
11 | import {NameGenerator} from "@mc-devkit/utils/mapping/NameGenerator.sol";
12 | // Validation
13 | import {Validator} from "@mc-devkit/system/Validator.sol";
14 | 
15 | // Context
16 | import {Current} from "@mc-devkit/registry/context/Current.sol";
17 | // Core Type
18 | import {Proxy, ProxyLib} from "@mc-devkit/core/Proxy.sol";
19 | import {Dictionary} from "@mc-devkit/core/Dictionary.sol";
20 | 
21 | ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
22 | //  📕 Proxy Registry    ///////////////////////////////
23 | using ProxyRegistryLib for ProxyRegistry global;
24 | using Tracer for ProxyRegistry global;
25 | using Inspector for ProxyRegistry global;
26 | ////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
27 | 
28 | struct ProxyRegistry {
29 |     mapping(string name => Proxy) proxies;
30 |     Current current;
31 | }
32 | 
33 | library ProxyRegistryLib {
34 |     using NameGenerator for mapping(string => Proxy);
35 | 
36 |     /**
37 |      * -----------------------
38 |      *     🗳️ Register Proxy
39 |      * -------------------------
40 |      */
41 |     function register(ProxyRegistry storage registry, string memory name, Proxy memory _proxy)
42 |         internal
43 |         returns (Proxy storage proxy)
44 |     {
45 |         uint256 pid = registry.startProcess("register", param(name, _proxy));
46 |         Validator.MUST_NotEmptyName(name);
47 |         Validator.MUST_Completed(_proxy);
48 |         Validator.MUST_NotRegistered(registry, name);
49 |         proxy = registry.proxies[name] = _proxy;
50 |         registry.current.update(name);
51 |         registry.finishProcess(pid);
52 |     }
53 | 
54 |     /**
55 |      * -------------------
56 |      *     🔍 Find Proxy
57 |      * ---------------------
58 |      */
59 |     function find(ProxyRegistry storage registry, string memory name) internal returns (Proxy storage proxy) {
60 |         uint256 pid = registry.startProcess("find", param(name));
61 |         Validator.MUST_NotEmptyName(name);
62 |         proxy = registry.proxies[name];
63 |         Validator.MUST_Completed(proxy);
64 |         registry.finishProcess(pid);
65 |     }
66 | 
67 |     function findCurrent(ProxyRegistry storage registry) internal returns (Proxy storage proxy) {
68 |         uint256 pid = registry.startProcess("findCurrent");
69 |         Validator.MUST_ExistCurrentName(registry);
70 |         proxy = registry.find(registry.current.name);
71 |         registry.finishProcess(pid);
72 |     }
73 | 
74 |     /**
75 |      * -----------------------------
76 |      *     🏷 Generate Unique Name
77 |      * -------------------------------
78 |      */
79 |     function genUniqueName(ProxyRegistry storage registry) internal returns (string memory name) {
80 |         uint256 pid = registry.startProcess("genUniqueName");
81 |         name = registry.proxies.genUniqueName();
82 |         registry.finishProcess(pid);
83 |     }
84 | 
85 |     function genUniqueMockName(ProxyRegistry storage registry, string memory baseName)
86 |         internal
87 |         returns (string memory name)
88 |     {
89 |         uint256 pid = registry.startProcess("genUniqueMockName");
90 |         name = registry.proxies.genUniqueMockName(baseName);
91 |         registry.finishProcess(pid);
92 |     }
93 | }
94 |

127 | ## Structs

134 | }

144 | }
145 | ```

149 | ```solidity

153 |     uint256 value;
154 |     bytes callData;
155 | }
156 | ```

163 |     bytes returnData;
164 | }
165 | ```

/site/docs/03-api/03-api-details/types/TypeGuard.sol/library.TypeGuard.md:

  1 | # TypeGuard

/site/script/soldocs/utils.ts:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1 | import { execSync } from "node:child_process";
  2 | import {
  3 | 	existsSync,
  4 | 	readFileSync,
  5 | 	readdirSync,
  6 | 	statSync,
  7 | 	writeFileSync,
  8 | } from "node:fs";
  9 | import { join } from "node:path";
 10 | import { config } from "../config";
 11 | 
 12 | export interface Config {
 13 | 	copyPaths: { from: string; to: string }[];
 14 | 	log: boolean;
 15 | 	rootPath: string;
 16 | 	tempDir: string;
 17 | 	tempDirOffset: string;
 18 | 	docsDir: string;
 19 | }
 20 | 
 21 | export const defaultConfig: Config = {
 22 | 	copyPaths: [],
 23 | 	log: false,
 24 | 	rootPath: execSync("git rev-parse --show-toplevel").toString().trim(),
 25 | 	tempDir: "temp_soldocs",
 26 | 	tempDirOffset: "src",
 27 | 	docsDir: "docs",
 28 | };
 29 | 
 30 | export function logMessage(message: string, alwaysShow = false) {
 31 | 	if (config.log || alwaysShow) {
 32 | 		console.log(message);
 33 | 	}
 34 | }
 35 | 
 36 | const colors = {
 37 | 	red: "\x1b[31m",
 38 | 	green: "\x1b[32m",
 39 | 	blue: "\x1b[34m",
 40 | 	reset: "\x1b[0m",
 41 | };
 42 | 
 43 | export function logSuccess(message: string, alwaysShow = false) {
 44 | 	logMessage(`${colors.green}${message}${colors.reset}`, alwaysShow);
 45 | }
 46 | 
 47 | export function logInfo(message: string, alwaysShow = false) {
 48 | 	logMessage(`${colors.blue}${message}${colors.reset}`, alwaysShow);
 49 | }
 50 | 
 51 | export function logError(message: string, alwaysShow = false) {
 52 | 	logMessage(`${colors.red}${message}${colors.reset}`, alwaysShow);
 53 | }
 54 | 
 55 | export function updateIndexFile(directoryPath: string, indexItems: string) {
 56 | 	if (!indexItems) {
 57 | 		logMessage(
 58 | 			"No index items generated. The directory might be empty or contain only index.md/README.md.",
 59 | 		);
 60 | 		return;
 61 | 	}
 62 | 
 63 | 	const indexFilePath = join(directoryPath, "index.md");
 64 | 	const startMarker = "<!-- START_INDEX -->";
 65 | 	const endMarker = "<!-- END_INDEX -->";
 66 | 
 67 | 	let indexContent = "";
 68 | 	if (existsSync(indexFilePath)) {
 69 | 		indexContent = readFileSync(indexFilePath, "utf-8");
 70 | 	}
 71 | 
 72 | 	const newIndexContent =
 73 | 		indexContent.includes(startMarker) && indexContent.includes(endMarker)
 74 | 			? indexContent.replace(
 75 | 					new RegExp(`${startMarker}[\\s\\S]*${endMarker}`),
 76 | 					`${startMarker}\n${indexItems}\n${endMarker}`,
 77 | 				)
 78 | 			: `# Index\n\n${startMarker}\n${indexItems}\n${endMarker}`;
 79 | 
 80 | 	writeFileSync(indexFilePath, newIndexContent, "utf-8");
 81 | 	logInfo(`Index file updated: ${indexFilePath}`);
 82 | }
 83 | 
 84 | export function getSubdirectories(directoryPath: string): string[] {
 85 | 	return readdirSync(directoryPath).filter((subdir) => {
 86 | 		const subdirPath = join(directoryPath, subdir);
 87 | 		return statSync(subdirPath).isDirectory();
 88 | 	});
 89 | }
 90 | 
 91 | export function processPathsInSubdirectories(
 92 | 	paths: string[],
 93 | 	callbacks: ((path: string) => void)[],
 94 | 	isResolved = false,
 95 | ) {
 96 | 	for (const path of paths) {
 97 | 		const resolvedPath = isResolved ? path : resolvePath(path);
 98 | 		for (const callback of callbacks) {
 99 | 			callback(resolvedPath);
100 | 		}
101 | 
102 | 		const subdirs = getSubdirectories(resolvedPath);
103 | 		for (const subdir of subdirs) {
104 | 			processPathsInSubdirectories(
105 | 				[join(resolvedPath, subdir)],
106 | 				callbacks,
107 | 				true,
108 | 			);
109 | 		}
110 | 	}
111 | }
112 | 
113 | export function resolvePath(path: string): string {
114 | 	const rootPath = execSync("git rev-parse --show-toplevel").toString().trim();
115 | 	return join(rootPath, path);
116 | }
117 | 
118 | export function extractPaths(copyPaths: Config["copyPaths"]): string[] {
119 | 	return copyPaths.map((copyPath) => join(config.docsDir, copyPath.to));
120 | }
121 | 


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
/site/docs/03-api/03-api-details/Flattened.sol/library.StorageSlot.md:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1 | # StorageSlot
  2 | [Git Source](https://github.com/metacontract/mc/blob/main/src/devkit/Flattened.sol)
  3 | 
  4 | *Library for reading and writing primitive types to specific storage slots.
  5 | Storage slots are often used to avoid storage conflict when dealing with upgradeable contracts.
  6 | This library helps with reading and writing to such slots without the need for inline assembly.
  7 | The functions in this library return Slot structs that contain a `value` member that can be used to read or write.
  8 | Example usage to set ERC1967 implementation slot:
  9 | ```solidity
 10 | contract ERC1967 {
 11 | bytes32 internal constant _IMPLEMENTATION_SLOT = 0x360894a13ba1a3210667c828492db98dca3e2076cc3735a920a3ca505d382bbc;
 12 | function _getImplementation() internal view returns (address) {
 13 | return StorageSlot.getAddressSlot(_IMPLEMENTATION_SLOT).value;
 14 | }
 15 | function _setImplementation(address newImplementation) internal {
 16 | require(newImplementation.code.length > 0);
 17 | StorageSlot.getAddressSlot(_IMPLEMENTATION_SLOT).value = newImplementation;
 18 | }
 19 | }
 20 | ```*
 21 | 
 22 | 
 23 | ## Functions
 24 | ### getAddressSlot
 25 | 
 26 | *Returns an `AddressSlot` with member `value` located at `slot`.*
 27 | 
 28 | 
 29 | ```solidity
 30 | function getAddressSlot(bytes32 slot) internal pure returns (AddressSlot storage r);
 31 | ```
 32 | 
 33 | ### getBooleanSlot
 34 | 
 35 | *Returns an `BooleanSlot` with member `value` located at `slot`.*
 36 | 
 37 | 
 38 | ```solidity
 39 | function getBooleanSlot(bytes32 slot) internal pure returns (BooleanSlot storage r);
 40 | ```
 41 | 
 42 | ### getBytes32Slot
 43 | 
 44 | *Returns an `Bytes32Slot` with member `value` located at `slot`.*
 45 | 
 46 | 
 47 | ```solidity
 48 | function getBytes32Slot(bytes32 slot) internal pure returns (Bytes32Slot storage r);
 49 | ```
 50 | 
 51 | ### getUint256Slot
 52 | 
 53 | *Returns an `Uint256Slot` with member `value` located at `slot`.*
 54 | 
 55 | 
 56 | ```solidity
 57 | function getUint256Slot(bytes32 slot) internal pure returns (Uint256Slot storage r);
 58 | ```
 59 | 
 60 | ### getStringSlot
 61 | 
 62 | *Returns an `StringSlot` with member `value` located at `slot`.*
 63 | 
 64 | 
 65 | ```solidity
 66 | function getStringSlot(bytes32 slot) internal pure returns (StringSlot storage r);
 67 | ```
 68 | 
 69 | ### getStringSlot
 70 | 
 71 | *Returns an `StringSlot` representation of the string storage pointer `store`.*
 72 | 
 73 | 
 74 | ```solidity
 75 | function getStringSlot(string storage store) internal pure returns (StringSlot storage r);
 76 | ```
 77 | 
 78 | ### getBytesSlot
 79 | 
 80 | *Returns an `BytesSlot` with member `value` located at `slot`.*
 81 | 
 82 | 
 83 | ```solidity
 84 | function getBytesSlot(bytes32 slot) internal pure returns (BytesSlot storage r);
 85 | ```
 86 | 
 87 | ### getBytesSlot
 88 | 
 89 | *Returns an `BytesSlot` representation of the bytes storage pointer `store`.*
 90 | 
 91 | 
 92 | ```solidity
 93 | function getBytesSlot(bytes storage store) internal pure returns (BytesSlot storage r);
 94 | ```
 95 | 
 96 | ## Structs
 97 | ### AddressSlot
 98 | 
 99 | ```solidity
100 | struct AddressSlot {
101 |     address value;
102 | }
103 | ```
104 | 
105 | ### BooleanSlot
106 | 
107 | ```solidity
108 | struct BooleanSlot {
109 |     bool value;
110 | }
111 | ```
112 | 
113 | ### Bytes32Slot
114 | 
115 | ```solidity
116 | struct Bytes32Slot {
117 |     bytes32 value;
118 | }
119 | ```
120 | 
121 | ### Uint256Slot
122 | 
123 | ```solidity
124 | struct Uint256Slot {
125 |     uint256 value;
126 | }
127 | ```
128 | 
129 | ### StringSlot
130 | 
131 | ```solidity
132 | struct StringSlot {
133 |     string value;
134 | }
135 | ```
136 | 
137 | ### BytesSlot
138 | 
139 | ```solidity
140 | struct BytesSlot {
141 |     bytes value;
142 | }
143 | ```
144 |

/src/devkit/utils/global/MCInitLib.sol:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1 | // SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT
  2 | pragma solidity ^0.8.23;
  3 | 
  4 | import {MCDevKit} from "@mc-devkit/MCDevKit.sol";
  5 | // Validation
  6 | import {Validator} from "@mc-devkit/system/Validator.sol";
  7 | // Utils
  8 | import {ForgeHelper} from "@mc-devkit/utils/ForgeHelper.sol";
  9 | import {param} from "@mc-devkit/system/Tracer.sol";
 10 | // Core
 11 | import {Function} from "@mc-devkit/core/Function.sol";
 12 | import {Bundle} from "@mc-devkit/core/Bundle.sol";
 13 | 
 14 | import {NameGenerator} from "@mc-devkit/utils/mapping/NameGenerator.sol";
 15 | 
 16 | using NameGenerator for mapping(string => Bundle);
 17 | 
 18 | /**
 19 |  *
 20 |  *  🎁 MC Initial Configuration
 21 |  *      🌱 Init Bundle
 22 |  *      🔗 Use Function
 23 |  *      🪟 Use Facade
 24 |  *      🏰 Setup Standard Functions
 25 |  *
 26 |  */
 27 | library MCInitLib {
 28 |     /**
 29 |      * --------------------
 30 |      *     🌱 Init Bundle
 31 |      * ----------------------
 32 |      */
 33 |     function init(MCDevKit storage mc, string memory name) internal returns (MCDevKit storage) {
 34 |         uint256 pid = mc.startProcess("init", param(name));
 35 |         mc.bundle.init(name);
 36 |         return mc.finishProcess(pid);
 37 |     }
 38 | 
 39 |     function init(MCDevKit storage mc) internal returns (MCDevKit storage) {
 40 |         return init(mc, mc.bundle.genUniqueName());
 41 |     }
 42 | 
 43 |     /**
 44 |      * ---------------------
 45 |      *     🔗 Use Function
 46 |      * -----------------------
 47 |      */
 48 |     function use(MCDevKit storage mc, string memory name, bytes4 selector, address implementation)
 49 |         internal
 50 |         returns (MCDevKit storage)
 51 |     {
 52 |         uint256 pid = mc.startProcess("use", param(name, selector, implementation));
 53 |         // Register new function
 54 |         Validator.MUST_NotEmptyName(name);
 55 |         Validator.SHOULD_NotEmptySelector(selector);
 56 |         Validator.MUST_AddressIsContract(implementation);
 57 |         mc.functions.register(name, selector, implementation);
 58 |         // Push to current bundle
 59 |         mc.bundle.ensureInit();
 60 |         mc.bundle.findCurrent().pushFunction(mc.functions.find(name));
 61 |         return mc.finishProcess(pid);
 62 |     }
 63 | 
 64 |     function use(MCDevKit storage mc, bytes4 selector, address implementation) internal returns (MCDevKit storage) {
 65 |         return use(mc, ForgeHelper.getLabel(implementation), selector, implementation);
 66 |     }
 67 | 
 68 |     function use(MCDevKit storage mc, Function storage func) internal returns (MCDevKit storage) {
 69 |         return use(mc, func.name, func.selector, func.implementation);
 70 |     }
 71 | 
 72 |     function use(MCDevKit storage mc, string memory functionName) internal returns (MCDevKit storage) {
 73 |         return use(mc, mc.functions.find(functionName));
 74 |     }
 75 | 
 76 |     /**
 77 |      * ------------------
 78 |      *     🪟 Use Facade
 79 |      * --------------------
 80 |      */
 81 |     /// @notice Assign facade address to current bundle
 82 |     function useFacade(MCDevKit storage mc, address facade) internal returns (MCDevKit storage) {
 83 |         uint256 pid = mc.startProcess("useFacade", param(facade));
 84 |         mc.bundle.ensureInit();
 85 |         mc.bundle.findCurrent().assignFacade(facade);
 86 |         return mc.finishProcess(pid);
 87 |     }
 88 | 
 89 |     /**
 90 |      * --------------------------------
 91 |      *     🏰 Setup Standard Functions
 92 |      * ----------------------------------
 93 |      */
 94 |     function setupStdFunctions(MCDevKit storage mc) internal returns (MCDevKit storage) {
 95 |         uint256 pid = mc.startProcess("setupStdFunctions");
 96 |         mc.std.complete();
 97 |         return mc.finishProcess(pid);
 98 |     }
 99 | }
100 |

178 | ### console2_log_StdCheats
179 | 
180 | 
181 | ```solidity
182 | function console2_log_StdCheats(string memory p0) private view;
183 | ```
184 | 
185 | 


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
/src/devkit/core/Function.sol:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1 | // SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT
  2 | pragma solidity ^0.8.23;
  3 | /**
  4 |  * ---------------------
  5 |  *     Support Methods
  6 |  * -----------------------
  7 |  */
  8 | 
  9 | import {Tracer, param} from "@mc-devkit/system/Tracer.sol";
 10 | import {Inspector} from "@mc-devkit/types/Inspector.sol";
 11 | import {TypeGuard, TypeStatus} from "@mc-devkit/types/TypeGuard.sol";
 12 | import {Formatter} from "@mc-devkit/types/Formatter.sol";
 13 | // Validation
 14 | import {Validator} from "@mc-devkit/system/Validator.sol";
 15 | // Loader
 16 | import {loadAddressFrom} from "@mc-devkit/utils/ForgeHelper.sol";
 17 | 
 18 | //////////////////////////////////////////////
 19 | //  🧩 Function   ////////////////////////////
 20 | using FunctionLib for Function global;
 21 | using Tracer for Function global;
 22 | using Inspector for Function global;
 23 | using TypeGuard for Function global;
 24 | using Formatter for Function global;
 25 | //////////////////////////////////////////////
 26 | 
 27 | struct Function {
 28 |     /// @dev TODO Function may be different depending on the op version.
 29 |     string name;
 30 |     bytes4 selector;
 31 |     address implementation;
 32 |     TypeStatus status;
 33 | }
 34 | 
 35 | library FunctionLib {
 36 |     /**
 37 |      * --------------------
 38 |      *     📛 Assign Name
 39 |      * ----------------------
 40 |      */
 41 |     function assignName(Function storage func, string memory name) internal returns (Function storage) {
 42 |         uint256 pid = func.startProcess("assignName", param(name));
 43 |         func.startBuilding();
 44 |         func.name = name;
 45 |         func.finishBuilding();
 46 |         return func.finishProcess(pid);
 47 |     }
 48 | 
 49 |     /**
 50 |      * ------------------------
 51 |      *     🎯 Assign Selector
 52 |      * --------------------------
 53 |      */
 54 |     function assignSelector(Function storage func, bytes4 selector) internal returns (Function storage) {
 55 |         uint256 pid = func.startProcess("assignSelector", param(selector));
 56 |         func.startBuilding();
 57 |         func.selector = selector;
 58 |         func.finishBuilding();
 59 |         return func.finishProcess(pid);
 60 |     }
 61 | 
 62 |     /**
 63 |      * ------------------------------
 64 |      *     🎨 Assign Implementation
 65 |      * --------------------------------
 66 |      */
 67 |     function assignImplementation(Function storage func, address implementation) internal returns (Function storage) {
 68 |         uint256 pid = func.startProcess("assignImplementation", param(implementation));
 69 |         func.startBuilding();
 70 |         func.implementation = implementation;
 71 |         func.finishBuilding();
 72 |         return func.finishProcess(pid);
 73 |     }
 74 | 
 75 |     /**
 76 |      * ---------------
 77 |      *     🌈 Assign
 78 |      * -----------------
 79 |      */
 80 |     function assign(Function storage func, string memory name, bytes4 selector, address implementation)
 81 |         internal
 82 |         returns (Function storage)
 83 |     {
 84 |         uint256 pid = func.startProcess("assign", param(name, selector, implementation));
 85 |         func.assignName(name);
 86 |         func.assignSelector(selector);
 87 |         func.assignImplementation(implementation);
 88 |         return func.finishProcess(pid);
 89 |     }
 90 | 
 91 |     /**
 92 |      * -----------------------
 93 |      *     📨 Fetch Function
 94 |      * -------------------------
 95 |      */
 96 |     function fetch(Function storage func, string memory envKey) internal returns (Function storage) {
 97 |         uint256 pid = func.startProcess("fetch", param(envKey));
 98 |         Validator.MUST_NotEmptyEnvKey(envKey);
 99 |         func.assignName(envKey);
100 |         func.assignImplementation(loadAddressFrom(envKey));
101 |         return func.finishProcess(pid);
102 |     }
103 | }
104 |

--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
/CONTRIBUTING.md:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 1 | # Contributing Guideline
 2 | 
 3 | Thank you for your interest in contributing to meta contract! We welcome contributions from everyone, whether it's reporting an issue, submitting a pull request, or suggesting improvements.
 4 | 
 5 | ## Reporting Issues
 6 | 
 7 | If you encounter a bug or have a feature request, please use the provided templates when [opening a new issue](https://github.com/metacontract/mc/issues/new/choose). This helps us address your concerns more effectively.
 8 | 
 9 | ## Development Workflow
10 | 
11 | ### Submitting Pull Requests
12 | 
13 | When submitting a Pull Request (PR), please keep in mind the following:
14 | 
15 | - PRs that contain backward-compatible bug fixes or minor changes will generally be merged directly.
16 | - PRs that introduce new features or include backward-incompatible changes may be included in an upcoming Major or Minor release.
17 | - The maintainer(s) will evaluate the scope of each PR and determine if it should be part of the next release cycle or if it can be merged immediately as a patch.
18 | 
19 | <details>
20 | <summary>How to submit PR</summary>
21 | 
22 | 1. Fork the repository and create a new branch from the `main` branch for your feature or bug fix.
23 | 2. Make your changes and commit them with descriptive commit messages.
24 | 3. Push your changes to your forked repository.
25 | 4. Open a new pull request against the `main` branch of the main repository, describing your changes in detail.
26 | 5. Ensure your branch is up to date with the `main` branch before requesting a review.
27 | 6. Address any review comments and make necessary changes.
28 | 7. Once approved, the PR will be merged into the `main` branch.
29 | 
30 | </details>
31 | 
32 | 
33 | ### Documentation Style and Format
34 | 
35 | - Follow the Markdown formatting guidelines as outlined in the [Documentation Guidelines](https://mc-book.ecdysis.xyz/guides/project-management/documentation-guidelines).
36 | - Use kebab-case for all documentation file names.
37 | 
38 | ### Coding Style
39 | 
40 | - Adhere to the [Solidity Style Guide](https://docs.soliditylang.org/en/latest/style-guide.html) with project-specific additions as outlined in the [Coding Standards](https://mc-book.ecdysis.xyz/guides/project-management/coding-standards).
41 | - Use `forge fmt` for consistent code formatting.
42 | 
43 | ### Test Strategy
44 | 
45 | - Follow the comprehensive test strategy outlined in the [Test Strategy](https://mc-book.ecdysis.xyz/guides/project-management/test-strategy).
46 | - Write unit tests for all functions and ensure high code coverage.
47 | 
48 | ### Release Process
49 | 
50 | - Follow the branching and release strategy as outlined in the [Branching and Release Strategy](https://mc-book.ecdysis.xyz/guides/project-management/branching-and-release-strategy).
51 | - Use Semantic Versioning for all releases.
52 | 
53 | 
54 | ### Versioning Policy
55 | 
56 | This project follows [Semantic Versioning](https://semver.org/) and uses version numbers in the format _MAJOR.MINOR.PATCH_.
57 | - Version number updates will be determined and applied by the assigned maintainer(s).
58 | 
59 | * For the initial v0.1.0 release, we expect to make frequent breaking changes.
60 | 
61 | ### Changelog
62 | 
63 | A changelog will be maintained in [CHANGELOG.md](./CHANGELOG.md) to document all notable changes in each version.
64 | 
65 | - Changelog entries should follow the [Keep a Changelog](https://keepachangelog.com/) format.
66 | - Each version section should include the following subsections:
67 |   - `Added` for new features.
68 |   - `Changed` for changes in existing functionality.
69 |   - `Deprecated` for soon-to-be removed features.
70 |   - `Removed` for now removed features.
71 |   - `Fixed` for any bug fixes.
72 |   - `Security` in case of vulnerabilities.
73 | - Entries should be written in imperative mood, e.g., "Add feature" instead of "Added feature".
74 | - Entries should include a reference to the related issue or pull request, e.g., "(#123)".
75 | - Breaking changes should be clearly indicated with a "BREAKING CHANGE:" prefix.
76 | 


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
/src/devkit/registry/DictionaryRegistry.sol:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1 | // SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT
  2 | pragma solidity ^0.8.23;
  3 | /**
  4 |  * ---------------------
  5 |  *     Support Methods
  6 |  * -----------------------
  7 |  */
  8 | 
  9 | import {Tracer, param} from "@mc-devkit/system/Tracer.sol";
 10 | import {Inspector} from "@mc-devkit/types/Inspector.sol";
 11 | import {NameGenerator} from "@mc-devkit/utils/mapping/NameGenerator.sol";
 12 | // Validation
 13 | import {Validator} from "@mc-devkit/system/Validator.sol";
 14 | 
 15 | // Context
 16 | import {Current} from "@mc-devkit/registry/context/Current.sol";
 17 | // Core Type
 18 | import {Dictionary, DictionaryLib} from "@mc-devkit/core/Dictionary.sol";
 19 | import {Bundle} from "@mc-devkit/core/Bundle.sol";
 20 | 
 21 | //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
 22 | //  📘 Dictionary Registry    ////////////////////////////////////
 23 | using DictionaryRegistryLib for DictionaryRegistry global;
 24 | using Tracer for DictionaryRegistry global;
 25 | using Inspector for DictionaryRegistry global;
 26 | //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
 27 | 
 28 | struct DictionaryRegistry {
 29 |     mapping(string name => Dictionary) dictionaries;
 30 |     Current current;
 31 | }
 32 | 
 33 | library DictionaryRegistryLib {
 34 |     using NameGenerator for mapping(string => Dictionary);
 35 | 
 36 |     /**
 37 |      * ---------------------------
 38 |      *     🗳️ Register Dictionary
 39 |      * -----------------------------
 40 |      */
 41 |     function register(DictionaryRegistry storage registry, Dictionary memory _dictionary)
 42 |         internal
 43 |         returns (Dictionary storage dictionary)
 44 |     {
 45 |         uint256 pid = registry.startProcess("register", param(_dictionary));
 46 |         Validator.MUST_Completed(_dictionary);
 47 |         string memory uniqueName = registry.genUniqueName(_dictionary.name);
 48 |         _dictionary.assignName(uniqueName);
 49 |         dictionary = registry.dictionaries[uniqueName] = _dictionary;
 50 |         registry.current.update(uniqueName);
 51 |         registry.finishProcess(pid);
 52 |     }
 53 | 
 54 |     /**
 55 |      * ------------------------
 56 |      *     🔍 Find Dictionary
 57 |      * --------------------------
 58 |      */
 59 |     function find(DictionaryRegistry storage registry, string memory name)
 60 |         internal
 61 |         returns (Dictionary storage dictionary)
 62 |     {
 63 |         uint256 pid = registry.startProcess("find", param(name));
 64 |         Validator.MUST_NotEmptyName(name);
 65 |         Validator.MUST_Registered(registry, name);
 66 |         dictionary = registry.dictionaries[name];
 67 |         Validator.MUST_Completed(dictionary);
 68 |         registry.finishProcess(pid);
 69 |     }
 70 | 
 71 |     function findCurrent(DictionaryRegistry storage registry) internal returns (Dictionary storage dictionary) {
 72 |         uint256 pid = registry.startProcess("findCurrent");
 73 |         Validator.MUST_ExistCurrentName(registry);
 74 |         dictionary = registry.find(registry.current.name);
 75 |         registry.finishProcess(pid);
 76 |     }
 77 | 
 78 |     /**
 79 |      * -----------------------------
 80 |      *     🏷 Generate Unique Name
 81 |      * -------------------------------
 82 |      */
 83 |     function genUniqueName(DictionaryRegistry storage registry, string memory baseName)
 84 |         internal
 85 |         returns (string memory name)
 86 |     {
 87 |         uint256 pid = registry.startProcess("genUniqueName", param(baseName));
 88 |         name = registry.dictionaries.genUniqueName(baseName);
 89 |         registry.finishProcess(pid);
 90 |     }
 91 | 
 92 |     function genUniqueMockName(DictionaryRegistry storage registry, string memory baseName)
 93 |         internal
 94 |         returns (string memory name)
 95 |     {
 96 |         uint256 pid = registry.startProcess("genUniqueMockName");
 97 |         name = registry.dictionaries.genUniqueMockName(baseName);
 98 |         registry.finishProcess(pid);
 99 |     }
100 | }
101 | 


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

/site/src/pages/index.module.css:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1 | /**
  2 |  * CSS files with the .module.css suffix will be treated as CSS modules
  3 |  * and scoped locally.
  4 |  */
  5 | 
  6 | :root {
  7 |   --prism-background-color: aqua;
  8 | }
  9 | 
 10 | .home__container {
 11 |   padding: 5rem 2rem 4rem;
 12 | }
 13 | 
 14 | /* Header styling */
 15 | 
 16 | .home__headerContainer {
 17 |   display: flex;
 18 |   flex-direction: row;
 19 |   justify-content: space-evenly;

 2 | pragma solidity ^0.8.23;

 4 | /// @title Message Head
 5 | library MessageHead {
 6 |     // Config
 7 |     string constant CONFIG_FILE_MISSING = "Config File Missing";
 8 |     string constant CONFIG_FILE_REQUIRED = "Config File Required";
 9 |     // Primitives
10 |     string constant NAME_REQUIRED = "Name Required";
11 |     string constant ENV_KEY_REQUIRED = "EnvKey Required";
12 |     string constant SELECTOR_RECOMMENDED = "Empty Selector";

14 |     string constant FACADE_NOT_CONTRACT = "Facade Not Contract";
15 |     string constant OWNER_ZERO_ADDRESS_RECOMMENDED = "Owner Zero Address";
16 |     // Current Context
17 |     string constant CURRENT_NAME_NOT_FOUND = "Current Name Not Found";
18 |     // Function
19 |     string constant FUNC_NAME_UNASSIGNED = "Function Name Unassigned";
20 |     string constant FUNC_CONTRACT_UNASSIGNED = "Implementation Contract Unassigned";
21 |     string constant FUNC_NOT_COMPLETE = "Function Not Complete";
22 |     string constant FUNC_LOCKED = "Function Locked";

28 |     string constant NO_FUNCTIONS_IN_BUNDLE = "No Functions in Bundle";
29 |     string constant BUNDLE_FACADE_UNASSIGNED = "Bundle Facade Unassigned";
30 |     string constant BUNDLE_NOT_INITIALIZED = "Bundle Not Initialized";
31 |     string constant BUNDLE_NOT_COMPLETE = "Bundle Not Complete";
32 |     string constant BUNDLE_CONTAINS_SAME_SELECTOR = "Bundle Contains Same Selector";
33 |     string constant BUNDLE_LOCKED = "Bundle Locked";
34 |     string constant BUNDLE_NOT_BUILDING = "Bundle Not Building";
35 |     string constant BUNDLE_NOT_BUILT = "Bundle Not Built";
36 |     string constant CURRENT_BUNDLE_NOT_EXIST = "Current Bundle Not Exist";
37 |     // Proxy

39 |     string constant PROXY_KIND_UNDEFINED = "Proxy Kind Undefined";
40 |     string constant PROXY_NOT_COMPLETE = "Proxy Not Complete";
41 |     string constant PROXY_LOCKED = "Proxy Locked";

  1 | # MockERC721
  2 | [Git Source](https://github.com/metacontract/mc/blob/main/src/devkit/Flattened.sol)
  3 | 
  4 | **Inherits:**
  5 | [IERC721Metadata](interface.IERC721Metadata.md)
  6 | 
  7 | This is a mock contract of the ERC721 standard for testing purposes only, it SHOULD NOT be used in production.
  8 | 
  9 | *Forked from: https://github.com/transmissions11/solmate/blob/0384dbaaa4fcb5715738a9254a7c0a4cb62cf458/src/tokens/ERC721.sol*
 10 |

 17 | ```

 24 | ```

122 | ```

/site/docs/03-api/03-api-details/Flattened.sol/abstract.StdChains.md:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1 | # StdChains
  2 | [Git Source](https://github.com/metacontract/mc/blob/main/src/devkit/Flattened.sol)
  3 | 
  4 | StdChains provides information about EVM compatible chains that can be used in scripts/tests.
  5 | For each chain, the chain's name, chain ID, and a default RPC URL are provided. Chains are
  6 | identified by their alias, which is the same as the alias in the `[rpc_endpoints]` section of
  7 | the `foundry.toml` file. For best UX, ensure the alias in the `foundry.toml` file match the
  8 | alias used in this contract, which can be found as the first argument to the
  9 | `setChainWithDefaultRpcUrl` call in the `initializeStdChains` function.
 10 | There are two main ways to use this contract:
 11 | 1. Set a chain with `setChain(string memory chainAlias, ChainData memory chain)` or
 12 | `setChain(string memory chainAlias, Chain memory chain)`
 13 | 2. Get a chain with `getChain(string memory chainAlias)` or `getChain(uint256 chainId)`.
 14 | The first time either of those are used, chains are initialized with the default set of RPC URLs.
 15 | This is done in `initializeStdChains`, which uses `setChainWithDefaultRpcUrl`. Defaults are recorded in
 16 | `defaultRpcUrls`.
 17 | The `setChain` function is straightforward, and it simply saves off the given chain data.
 18 | The `getChain` methods use `getChainWithUpdatedRpcUrl` to return a chain. For example, let's say
 19 | we want to retrieve the RPC URL for `mainnet`:
 20 | - If you have specified data with `setChain`, it will return that.
 21 | - If you have configured a mainnet RPC URL in `foundry.toml`, it will return the URL, provided it
 22 | is valid (e.g. a URL is specified, or an environment variable is given and exists).
 23 | - If neither of the above conditions is met, the default data is returned.
 24 | Summarizing the above, the prioritization hierarchy is `setChain` -> `foundry.toml` -> environment variable -> defaults.
 25 | 
 26 | 
 27 | ## State Variables
 28 | ### vm
 29 | 
 30 | ```solidity
 31 | VmSafe private constant vm = VmSafe(address(uint160(uint256(keccak256("hevm cheat code")))));
 32 | ```
 33 |

 39 | ```

 46 | ```

 53 | ```

 58 | ```solidity

 60 | ```

 67 | ```

  1 | # function param

  1 | // SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT
  2 | pragma solidity ^0.8.23;
  3 | // Validation
  4 | 
  5 | import {Validator} from "@mc-devkit/system/Validator.sol";
  6 | 
  7 | import {MCDevKit} from "@mc-devkit/MCDevKit.sol";
  8 | import {System} from "@mc-devkit/system/System.sol";
  9 | // Utils
 10 | import {param} from "@mc-devkit/system/Tracer.sol";
 11 | import {ForgeHelper} from "@mc-devkit/utils/ForgeHelper.sol";
 12 | // Core
 13 | //  functions
 14 | import {Bundle} from "@mc-devkit/core/Bundle.sol";
 15 | import {Function} from "@mc-devkit/core/Function.sol";
 16 | //  proxy
 17 | import {Proxy, ProxyLib} from "@mc-devkit/core/Proxy.sol";
 18 | //  dictionary
 19 | import {Dictionary, DictionaryLib} from "@mc-devkit/core/Dictionary.sol";
 20 | 
 21 | /**
 22 |  *
 23 |  *  🎭 Mock
 24 |  *      🌞 Mocking Meta Contract
 25 |  *      🏠 Mocking Proxy
 26 |  *      📚 Mocking Dictionary
 27 |  *
 28 |  */
 29 | library MCMockLib {
 30 |     /**
 31 |      * -----------------------------
 32 |      *     🌞 Mocking Meta Contract
 33 |      * -------------------------------
 34 |      */
 35 | 
 36 |     /**
 37 |      * ---------------------
 38 |      *     🏠 Mocking Proxy
 39 |      * -----------------------
 40 |      */
 41 |     function createMockProxy(MCDevKit storage mc, Bundle storage bundle, bytes memory initData)
 42 |         internal
 43 |         returns (Proxy storage mockProxy)
 44 |     {
 45 |         uint256 pid = mc.startProcess("createMockProxy", param(bundle, initData));
 46 |         Validator.MUST_Completed(bundle);
 47 |         Proxy memory _mockProxy = ProxyLib.createSimpleMock(bundle.functions);
 48 |         mockProxy = mc.proxy.register(mc.proxy.genUniqueMockName(bundle.name), _mockProxy);
 49 |         mc.finishProcess(pid);
 50 |     }
 51 | 
 52 |     function createMockProxy(MCDevKit storage mc, Bundle storage bundle) internal returns (Proxy storage mockProxy) {
 53 |         uint256 pid = mc.startProcess("createMockProxy", param(bundle));
 54 |         mockProxy = mc.createMockProxy(bundle, "");
 55 |         mc.finishProcess(pid);
 56 |     }
 57 | 
 58 |     function createMockProxy(MCDevKit storage mc, bytes memory initData) internal returns (Proxy storage mockProxy) {
 59 |         uint256 pid = mc.startProcess("createMockProxy", param(initData));
 60 |         mockProxy = mc.createMockProxy(mc.bundle.findCurrent(), initData);
 61 |         mc.finishProcess(pid);
 62 |     }
 63 | 
 64 |     function createMockProxy(MCDevKit storage mc) internal returns (Proxy storage mockProxy) {
 65 |         uint256 pid = mc.startProcess("createMockProxy");
 66 |         mockProxy = mc.createMockProxy(mc.bundle.findCurrent(), "");
 67 |         mc.finishProcess(pid);
 68 |     }
 69 | 
 70 |     /**
 71 |      * -------------------------
 72 |      *     📚 Mocking Dictionary
 73 |      * ---------------------------
 74 |      */
 75 |     function createMockDictionary(MCDevKit storage mc, Bundle storage bundle, address owner)
 76 |         internal
 77 |         returns (Dictionary storage mockDictionary)
 78 |     {
 79 |         uint256 pid = mc.startProcess("createMockDictionary", param(bundle, owner));
 80 |         Validator.MUST_Completed(bundle);
 81 |         Validator.SHOULD_OwnerIsNotZeroAddress(owner);
 82 |         Dictionary memory _mockDictionary =
 83 |             DictionaryLib.createMock(bundle, owner).assignName(mc.dictionary.genUniqueMockName(bundle.name));
 84 |         mockDictionary = mc.dictionary.register(_mockDictionary);
 85 |         mc.finishProcess(pid);
 86 |     }
 87 |     // With Default Value
 88 | 
 89 |     function createMockDictionary(MCDevKit storage mc) internal returns (Dictionary storage mockDictionary) {
 90 |         uint256 pid = mc.startProcess("createMockDictionary");
 91 |         mockDictionary = mc.createMockDictionary(mc.bundle.findCurrent(), ForgeHelper.msgSender());
 92 |         mc.finishProcess(pid);
 93 |     }
 94 | 
 95 |     function createMockDictionary(MCDevKit storage mc, Bundle storage bundle)
 96 |         internal
 97 |         returns (Dictionary storage mockDictionary)
 98 |     {
 99 |         uint256 pid = mc.startProcess("createMockDictionary", param(bundle));
100 |         mockDictionary = mc.createMockDictionary(bundle, ForgeHelper.msgSender());
101 |         mc.finishProcess(pid);
102 |     }
103 | 
104 |     function createMockDictionary(MCDevKit storage mc, address owner)
105 |         internal
106 |         returns (Dictionary storage mockDictionary)
107 |     {
108 |         uint256 pid = mc.startProcess("createMockDictionary", param(owner));
109 |         mockDictionary = mc.createMockDictionary(mc.bundle.findCurrent(), owner);
110 |         mc.finishProcess(pid);
111 |     }
112 | }
113 |

  1 | import Link from "@docusaurus/Link";
  2 | import useDocusaurusContext from "@docusaurus/useDocusaurusContext";
  3 | import CodeBlock from "@theme/CodeBlock";
  4 | import Layout from "@theme/Layout";
  5 | import TabItem from "@theme/TabItem";
  6 | import Tabs from "@theme/Tabs";
  7 | import clsx from "clsx";
  8 | import {
  9 | 	CheckCircle,
 10 | 	Layers,
 11 | 	MoveUpRight,
 12 | 	RefreshCw,
 13 | 	Settings,
 14 | 	TrendingUp,
 15 | } from "lucide-react";
 16 | import type React from "react";
 17 | 
 18 | import styles from "./index.module.css";
 19 | 
 20 | export default function Home(): JSX.Element {
 21 | 	const { siteConfig } = useDocusaurusContext();
 22 | 	return (
 23 | 		<Layout
 24 | 			title={`${siteConfig.title}`}
 25 | 			description="Description will go into a meta tag in <head />"
 26 | 		>
 27 | 			<div className={styles.home__container}>
 28 | 				<header className={styles.home__headerContainer}>
 29 | 					<section className={styles.home__hero}>
 30 | 						<h1 className={styles.home__title}>{siteConfig.title}</h1>
 31 | 						<div className={styles.home__tagline}>{siteConfig.tagline}</div>
 32 | 						<div className={styles.home__buttonGroup}>
 33 | 							<Link
 34 | 								className={clsx(
 35 | 									"button",
 36 | 									styles.home__header__button,
 37 | 									styles.primaryButton,
 38 | 								)}
 39 | 								to="/getting-started"
 40 | 							>
 41 | 								Get started
 42 | 							</Link>
 43 | 							<Link
 44 | 								className={clsx(
 45 | 									"button",
 46 | 									styles.home__header__button,
 47 | 									styles.secondaryButton,
 48 | 								)}
 49 | 								to="https://github.com/metacontract/mc/"
 50 | 							>
 51 | 								View on GitHub{" "}
 52 | 								<MoveUpRight className={styles.externalLinkIcon} />
 53 | 							</Link>
 54 | 						</div>
 55 | 					</section>
 56 | 					<section className={styles.home__install}>
 57 | 						<Tabs>
 58 | 							<TabItem value="deployment" label="Deployment">
 59 | 								<CodeBlock className="language-solidity">
 60 | 									{`${siteConfig.customFields.deploymentCode}`}
 61 | 								</CodeBlock>
 62 | 							</TabItem>
 63 | 							{/* <TabItem value="upgrade" label="Upgrade">
 64 | 							<CodeBlock className="language-solidity">
 65 | 								{`${siteConfig.customFields.upgradeCode}`}
 66 | 							</CodeBlock>
 67 | 						</TabItem> */}
 68 | 						</Tabs>
 69 | 					</section>
 70 | 				</header>
 71 | 
 72 | 				<main className={styles.home__main}>
 73 | 					<article className={styles.article}>
 74 | 						<h3 className={styles.article__title}>
 75 | 							<RefreshCw className={styles.article__icon} />
 76 | 							Upgradeability
 77 | 						</h3>
 78 | 						<p className={styles.article__description}>
 79 | 							Meta Contracts can be upgraded without changing their address,
 80 | 							allowing for seamless improvements and bug fixes.
 81 | 						</p>
 82 | 					</article>
 83 | 
 84 | 					<article className={styles.article}>
 85 | 						<h3 className={styles.article__title}>
 86 | 							<Layers className={styles.article__icon} />
 87 | 							Modularity
 88 | 						</h3>
 89 | 						<p className={styles.article__description}>
 90 | 							The framework separates contract logic into distinct, manageable
 91 | 							components, enhancing code organization and reusability.
 92 | 						</p>
 93 | 					</article>
 94 | 
 95 | 					<article className={styles.article}>
 96 | 						<h3 className={styles.article__title}>
 97 | 							<TrendingUp className={styles.article__icon} />
 98 | 							Scalability
 99 | 						</h3>
100 | 						<p className={styles.article__description}>
101 | 							Meta Contracts are designed to handle growth efficiently, making
102 | 							them suitable for large-scale applications.
103 | 						</p>
104 | 					</article>
105 | 
106 | 					<article className={styles.article}>
107 | 						<h3 className={styles.article__title}>
108 | 							<Settings className={styles.article__icon} />
109 | 							Flexibility
110 | 						</h3>
111 | 						<p className={styles.article__description}>
112 | 							Developers can easily extend and customize Meta Contracts to suit
113 | 							specific project needs.
114 | 						</p>
115 | 					</article>
116 | 
117 | 					<article className={styles.article}>
118 | 						<h3 className={styles.article__title}>
119 | 							<CheckCircle className={styles.article__icon} />
120 | 							Testability
121 | 						</h3>
122 | 						<p className={styles.article__description}>
123 | 							The modular structure of Meta Contracts facilitates comprehensive
124 | 							testing, including unit tests for individual functions and
125 | 							integration tests for the entire system.
126 | 						</p>
127 | 					</article>
128 | 				</main>
129 | 			</div>
130 | 		</Layout>
131 | 	);
132 | }

/site/docs/03-api/03-api-details/Flattened.sol/contract.MockERC20.md:

  1 | # MockERC20
  2 | [Git Source](https://github.com/metacontract/mc/blob/main/src/devkit/Flattened.sol)
  3 | 
  4 | **Inherits:**
  5 | [IERC20](interface.IERC20.md)
  6 | 
  7 | This is a mock contract of the ERC20 standard for testing purposes only, it SHOULD NOT be used in production.
  8 | 
  9 | *Forked from: https://github.com/transmissions11/solmate/blob/0384dbaaa4fcb5715738a9254a7c0a4cb62cf458/src/tokens/ERC20.sol*
 10 | 
 11 | 
 12 | ## State Variables
 13 | ### _name
 14 | 
 15 | ```solidity
 16 | string internal _name;
 17 | ```
 18 | 
 19 | 
 20 | ### _symbol
 21 | 
 22 | ```solidity
 23 | string internal _symbol;
 24 | ```
 25 | 
 26 | 
 27 | ### _decimals
 28 | 
 29 | ```solidity
 30 | uint8 internal _decimals;
 31 | ```
 32 | 
 33 | 
 34 | ### _totalSupply
 35 | 
 36 | ```solidity
 37 | uint256 internal _totalSupply;
 38 | ```
 39 | 
 40 | 
 41 | ### _balanceOf
 42 | 
 43 | ```solidity
 44 | mapping(address => uint256) internal _balanceOf;
 45 | ```
 46 | 
 47 | 
 48 | ### _allowance
 49 | 
 50 | ```solidity
 51 | mapping(address => mapping(address => uint256)) internal _allowance;
 52 | ```
 53 | 
 54 | 
 55 | ### INITIAL_CHAIN_ID
 56 | 
 57 | ```solidity
 58 | uint256 internal INITIAL_CHAIN_ID;
 59 | ```
 60 | 
 61 | 
 62 | ### INITIAL_DOMAIN_SEPARATOR
 63 | 
 64 | ```solidity
 65 | bytes32 internal INITIAL_DOMAIN_SEPARATOR;
 66 | ```
 67 | 
 68 | 
 69 | ### nonces
 70 | 
 71 | ```solidity
 72 | mapping(address => uint256) public nonces;
 73 | ```
 74 | 
 75 | 
 76 | ### initialized
 77 | *A bool to track whether the contract has been initialized.*
 78 | 
 79 | 
 80 | ```solidity
 81 | bool private initialized;
 82 | ```
 83 | 
 84 | 
 85 | ## Functions
 86 | ### name
 87 | 
 88 | 
 89 | ```solidity
 90 | function name() external view override returns (string memory);
 91 | ```
 92 | 
 93 | ### symbol
 94 | 
 95 | 
 96 | ```solidity
 97 | function symbol() external view override returns (string memory);
 98 | ```
 99 | 
100 | ### decimals
101 | 
102 | 
103 | ```solidity
104 | function decimals() external view override returns (uint8);
105 | ```
106 | 
107 | ### totalSupply
108 | 
109 | 
110 | ```solidity
111 | function totalSupply() external view override returns (uint256);
112 | ```
113 | 
114 | ### balanceOf
115 | 
116 | 
117 | ```solidity
118 | function balanceOf(address owner) external view override returns (uint256);
119 | ```
120 | 
121 | ### allowance
122 | 
123 | 
124 | ```solidity
125 | function allowance(address owner, address spender) external view override returns (uint256);
126 | ```
127 | 
128 | ### initialize
129 | 
130 | *To hide constructor warnings across solc versions due to different constructor visibility requirements and
131 | syntaxes, we add an initialization function that can be called only once.*
132 | 
133 | 
134 | ```solidity
135 | function initialize(string memory name_, string memory symbol_, uint8 decimals_) public;
136 | ```
137 | 
138 | ### approve
139 | 
140 | 
141 | ```solidity
142 | function approve(address spender, uint256 amount) public virtual override returns (bool);
143 | ```
144 | 
145 | ### transfer
146 | 
147 | 
148 | ```solidity
149 | function transfer(address to, uint256 amount) public virtual override returns (bool);
150 | ```
151 | 
152 | ### transferFrom
153 | 
154 | 
155 | ```solidity
156 | function transferFrom(address from, address to, uint256 amount) public virtual override returns (bool);
157 | ```
158 | 
159 | ### permit
160 | 
161 | 
162 | ```solidity
163 | function permit(address owner, address spender, uint256 value, uint256 deadline, uint8 v, bytes32 r, bytes32 s)
164 |     public
165 |     virtual;
166 | ```
167 | 
168 | ### DOMAIN_SEPARATOR
169 | 
170 | 
171 | ```solidity
172 | function DOMAIN_SEPARATOR() public view virtual returns (bytes32);
173 | ```
174 | 
175 | ### computeDomainSeparator
176 | 
177 | 
178 | ```solidity
179 | function computeDomainSeparator() internal view virtual returns (bytes32);
180 | ```
181 | 
182 | ### _mint
183 | 
184 | 
185 | ```solidity
186 | function _mint(address to, uint256 amount) internal virtual;
187 | ```
188 | 
189 | ### _burn
190 | 
191 | 
192 | ```solidity
193 | function _burn(address from, uint256 amount) internal virtual;
194 | ```
195 | 
196 | ### _add
197 | 
198 | 
199 | ```solidity
200 | function _add(uint256 a, uint256 b) internal pure returns (uint256);
201 | ```
202 | 
203 | ### _sub
204 | 
205 | 
206 | ```solidity
207 | function _sub(uint256 a, uint256 b) internal pure returns (uint256);
208 | ```
209 | 
210 | ### _viewChainId
211 | 
212 | 
213 | ```solidity
214 | function _viewChainId() private view returns (uint256 chainId);
215 | ```
216 | 
217 | ### _pureChainId
218 | 
219 | 
220 | ```solidity
221 | function _pureChainId() private pure returns (uint256 chainId);
222 | ```
223 |

/site/docs/02-guides/02-development/03-std-functions/01-common/index.md:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1 | # Common Functions
  2 | <!-- Utilizing Standard Ops in your UCS projects can significantly streamline the development process. This section delves into the available Standard Ops, how to integrate them into your contracts, and best practices for combining them effectively.
  3 | 
  4 | - [Overview of Standard Ops](./overview)
  5 | - [Integrating Standard Ops into Your Contracts](./integrating)
  6 | - [Best Practices for Combining Standard Ops](./best-practice)
  7 | 
  8 | # Overview of Standard Ops
  9 | Start by exploring the range of Standard Ops provided by the UCS framework. This overview should include a brief description of each Op, its intended use case, and any key functionalities it offers. Highlighting the versatility and utility of these Ops can help developers understand how they can enhance their smart contracts. -->
 10 | 
 11 | <!-- description, selector, function signature, storage, version, deployed contract address by chain -->
 12 | 
 13 | <!-- :::danger
 14 | Most of the Ops are in the early stages of development, so their use outside of testing purposes is not recommended.
 15 | ::: -->
 16 | 
 17 | <!-- ## DefaultOps
 18 | - ### InitSetAdmin
 19 | - ### GetDeps
 20 | 
 21 | ## Factory
 22 | - ### Clone
 23 | 
 24 | ## Dictionary
 25 | - ### ChangeDictionary
 26 | - ### SetImplementation
 27 | - ### TransferDictionaryOwnership
 28 | - ### FeatureToggle
 29 | 
 30 | ## DAO Ops
 31 | - ### Propose
 32 | - ### Fork
 33 | - ### MajorityVote
 34 | - ### BordaVote
 35 | - ### Tally
 36 | - ### Execute
 37 | 
 38 | ## DAO PassOps
 39 | - ### Swap
 40 | - ### DepositTo
 41 | - ### WithdrawFrom
 42 | 
 43 | ## ERC-20 Ops
 44 | - ### ERC20Transfer
 45 | - ### ERC20Approve
 46 | - ### ERC20TransferFrom
 47 | - ### ERC20BalanceOf
 48 | 
 49 | 
 50 | # Integrating Standard Ops into Your Contracts
 51 | Incorporating Standard Ops into your smart contracts enhances their functionality and flexibility. This guide will walk you through the process of adding and configuring Standard Ops in your UCS projects, using clear instructions and practical examples.
 52 | 
 53 | ## Step 1: Identify Required Standard Ops
 54 | Begin by identifying the Standard Ops that suit your project's needs. Consider the functionalities you want to implement, such as access control or token management, etc. Review the documentation for Standard Ops to understand their features and requirements.
 55 | 
 56 | ## Step 2: Update Your Contract
 57 | Once you've selected the necessary Standard Ops, it's time to integrate them into your contract. Open your smart contract file and prepare to import and use the Ops.
 58 | 
 59 | ### Importing Standard Ops
 60 | Import the required Standard Ops from the UCS library at the beginning of your contract file. For example, to add a token management Op, you might use:
 61 | 
 62 | ```solidity
 63 | import "ucs-ops/src/ops/TokenManagementOp.sol";
 64 | ```
 65 | 
 66 | ### Adding Ops to Your Contract
 67 | Incorporate the Ops into your contract by extending them or calling their functions. This could be done in the constructor or specific functions, depending on your contract's design.
 68 | 
 69 | ```solidity
 70 | contract MyContract {
 71 |     // Extend a Standard Op (if applicable)
 72 |     // or declare a variable of the Op type
 73 |     TokenManagementOp tokenManagement;
 74 | 
 75 |     constructor() {
 76 |         // Initialize or configure the Op
 77 |         tokenManagement = new TokenManagementOp();
 78 |     }
 79 | }
 80 | ```
 81 | 
 82 | ## Step 3: Configure the Ops
 83 | Some Ops require initial configuration to function correctly. This might involve setting permissions, initializing state variables, or defining key parameters.
 84 | 
 85 | ```solidity
 86 | function initializeTokenManagement() public {
 87 |     // Configure the Op with necessary parameters
 88 |     tokenManagement.setTokenDetails("MyToken", "MTK", 18);
 89 | }
 90 | ```
 91 | 
 92 | ## Step 4: Testing the Integration
 93 | After integrating the Standard Ops into your contract, thoroughly test the contract to ensure the Ops function as expected. Utilize the UCS testing utilities and consider writing unit tests for each Op's functionality within your contract.
 94 | 
 95 | ```solidity
 96 | // Example test case for token management
 97 | function testTokenManagement() public {
 98 |     // Initialize the contract and Op
 99 |     MyContract contract = new MyContract();
100 |     contract.initializeTokenManagement();
101 | 
102 |     // Test Op functionalities
103 |     assertTrue(contract.tokenManagement.totalSupply() == 0, "Initial supply should be 0");
104 | }
105 | ```
106 | 
107 | ## Step 5: Deployment and Verification
108 | Once testing is complete and you're satisfied with the integration, deploy your contract to the desired network. Remember to verify your contract on platforms like Etherscan, especially if you've used Etherscan-verifiable Ops.
109 |  -->
110 |

/site/docs/03-api/03-api-details/Flattened.sol/library.Formatter.md:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1 | # Formatter
  2 | [Git Source](https://github.com/metacontract/mc/blob/main/src/devkit/Flattened.sol)
  3 | 
  4 | ==================
  5 | 🗒️ Formatter
  6 | ====================
  7 | 
  8 | 
  9 | ## Functions
 10 | ### toString
 11 | 
 12 | ==================
 13 | 🧩 Function
 14 | ====================
 15 | 
 16 | 
 17 | ```solidity
 18 | function toString(Function memory func) internal pure returns (string memory message);
 19 | ```
 20 | 
 21 | ### toString
 22 | 
 23 | ===============
 24 | 🗂️ Bundle
 25 | =================
 26 | 
 27 | 
 28 | ```solidity
 29 | function toString(Bundle storage bundle) internal view returns (string memory message);
 30 | ```
 31 | 
 32 | ### toLocation
 33 | 
 34 | =================
 35 | ⛓️ Process
 36 | ===================
 37 | 
 38 | 
 39 | ```solidity
 40 | function toLocation(Process memory process) internal pure returns (string memory);
 41 | ```
 42 | 
 43 | ### formatPid
 44 | 
 45 | 
 46 | ```solidity
 47 | function formatPid(uint256 pid) internal pure returns (string memory);
 48 | ```
 49 | 
 50 | ### toStart
 51 | 
 52 | 
 53 | ```solidity
 54 | function toStart(Process memory process, uint256 pid) internal pure returns (string memory);
 55 | ```
 56 | 
 57 | ### toFinish
 58 | 
 59 | 
 60 | ```solidity
 61 | function toFinish(Process memory process, uint256 pid) internal pure returns (string memory);
 62 | ```
 63 | 
 64 | ### toMessage
 65 | 
 66 | 
 67 | ```solidity
 68 | function toMessage(string memory head, string memory body) internal pure returns (string memory);
 69 | ```
 70 | 
 71 | ### append
 72 | 
 73 | ===================
 74 | 🧱 Primitives
 75 | =====================
 76 | 📝 String
 77 | 
 78 | 
 79 | ```solidity
 80 | function append(string memory str, string memory addition) internal pure returns (string memory);
 81 | ```

 88 | ```

 95 | ```

102 | ```

202 | ### toBytes32
203 | 
204 | 
205 | ```solidity
206 | function toBytes32(address addr) internal pure returns (bytes32);
207 | ```
208 | 
209 | ### toString
210 | 
211 | 
212 | ```solidity
213 | function toString(bytes4 selector) internal pure returns (string memory);
214 | ```
215 | 
216 | ### toBytes
217 | 
218 | 
219 | ```solidity
220 | function toBytes(string memory str) internal pure returns (bytes memory);
221 | ```
222 | 
223 | ### substring
224 | 
225 | 
226 | ```solidity
227 | function substring(string memory str, uint256 n) internal pure returns (string memory);
228 | ```
229 | 
230 |

/site/docs/02-guides/01-setup/02-basic-setup.md:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1 | ---
  2 | keywords: [setup, configuration, development-environment]
  3 | tags: [setup, configuration, development-environment]
  4 | last_update:
  5 |   date: 2024-10-28
  6 |   author: Meta Contract Development Team
  7 | ---
  8 | 
  9 | # Basic Setup
 10 | 
 11 | This guide will walk you through the process of setting up your development environment for working with Meta Contract.
 12 | 
 13 | ## Prerequisites
 14 | 
 15 | Before proceeding with the setup, ensure you have completed the [installation process](./01-installation.md) for Meta Contract.
 16 | 
 17 | ## Development Environment Setup
 18 | 
 19 | ### 1. Code Editor Configuration
 20 | 
 21 | We recommend using [Cursor](https://www.cursor.sh/) / [Visual Studio Code (VSCode)](https://code.visualstudio.com/) with the following extensions:
 22 | 
 23 | - [Hardhat VSCode Extension](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=NomicFoundation.hardhat-solidity) (Extension ID: `nomicfoundation.hardhat-solidity`)
 24 | 
 25 |   To install this extensions:
 26 |   1. Open Cursor/VSCode
 27 |   2. Go to the Extensions view
 28 |   3. Search for and install extension
 29 | 
 30 |   See details in [official instruction](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=NomicFoundation.hardhat-solidity#installation).
 31 | 
 32 | :::info
 33 | [Solidity by Juan Blanco](https://github.com/juanfranblanco/vscode-solidity) is also very useful, but in the current version, it does not integrate well with the remappings that foundry uses by default, resulting in continuous import errors.
 34 | :::
 35 | 
 36 | ### 2. Configuring Foundry
 37 | 
 38 | Meta Contract uses Foundry as its development framework. To configure Foundry for your project:
 39 | 
 40 | 1. Create a [foundry.toml](https://github.com/metacontract/template/blob/main/foundry.toml) file in your project root if it doesn't exist already:
 41 | 
 42 | ```toml
 43 | [profile.default]
 44 | src = "src"
 45 | out = "out"
 46 | libs = ["lib"]
 47 | fs_permissions = [{ access = "read", path = "./mc.toml" }, { access = "read", path = "./lib/mc/mc.toml" }]
 48 | ```
 49 | 
 50 | This configuration file specifies:
 51 | - `src`: The directory containing your source files
 52 | - `out`: The directory where compiled artifacts will be stored
 53 | - `libs`: The directory containing your project dependencies
 54 | - `fs_permissions`: Permissions for reading specific files (in this case, MC configuration files)
 55 | 
 56 | ### 3. Setting Up Environment Variables
 57 | 
 58 | Create a `.env` file in your project root to store sensitive information:
 59 | 
 60 | [Example .env file](https://github.com/metacontract/template/blob/main/.env.sample)
 61 | 
 62 | ```
 63 | # Signer
 64 | DEPLOYER_ADDR=
 65 | DEPLOYER_PRIV_KEY=
 66 | 
 67 | # External services
 68 | RPC_URL=https://your-mainnet-rpc-url
 69 | SEPOLIA_RPC_URL=https://your-sepolia-rpc-url
 70 | VERIFIER=etherscan-api-endpoint
 71 | ETHERSCAN_API_KEY=your-etherscan-api-key
 72 | ```
 73 | 
 74 | These environment variables are used for:
 75 | - `DEPLOYER_ADDR` and `DEPLOYER_PRIV_KEY`: The address and private key of the account used for deploying contracts
 76 | - `RPC_URL` and `SEPOLIA_RPC_URL`: RPC endpoints for interacting with the Ethereum mainnet and Sepolia testnet
 77 | - `VERIFIER` and `ETHERSCAN_API_KEY`: Used for contract verification on Etherscan
 78 | 
 79 | Make sure to add `.env` to your `.gitignore` file to prevent accidentally committing sensitive information.
 80 | 
 81 | ### 4. Project Structure
 82 | 
 83 | Organize your project files as follows:
 84 | 
 85 | ```
 86 | your-project/
 87 | ├── src/
 88 | │   ├── [bundle name]
 89 | │   │   ├── storages
 90 | │   │   │   │── Schema.sol
 91 | │   │   │   └── Storage.sol
 92 | │   │   ├── interfaces
 93 | │   │   │   └── [e.g. Facade, IBundle, IFunctions, IErrors, IEvents files]
 94 | │   │   ├── functions
 95 | │   │   │   └── MyFunction.sol
 96 | │   ├── [other bundle directories if needed]
 97 | │   └── [shared utilities directory]
 98 | ├── test/
 99 | │   └── MyContract.t.sol
100 | ├── script/
101 | │   └── Deploy.s.sol
102 | ├── lib/
103 | ├── foundry.toml
104 | ├── .env
105 | └── .gitignore
106 | ```
107 | 
108 | ## Verifying the Setup
109 | 
110 | To ensure your setup is correct:
111 | 
112 | 1. Build example counter contracts and run tests:
113 | 
114 | ```bash
115 | forge test
116 | ```
117 | 
118 | If this command executes without errors, your basic setup is complete and working correctly.
119 | 
120 | ## Next Steps
121 | 
122 | Now that your development environment is set up, you're ready to start building with Meta Contract 🚀🚀🚀
123 | 
124 | - Refer to the [Development Guide](../02-development/index.md), [Operation Guide](../03-operations/index.md) and [Middleware Guide](../04-middlewares/index.md) for best practices and tips.
125 | - Find implementation examples in the [Examples](../../04-examples/index.md) section.
126 | - Check out the [MC DevKit API Reference](../../03-api/index.md) for detailed information about the development tools available.
127 | 
128 | For any issues or questions, reach out to our [community support channels](https://github.com/metacontract/mc/discussions).
129 | 


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

 28 | ```

 77 | ```solidity
 78 | function deploy(MCDevKit storage mc, bytes memory initData) internal returns (MCDevKit storage);
 79 | ```
 80 | 
 81 | ### deployProxy
 82 | 
 83 | ---------------------
 84 | 🏠 Deploy Proxy
 85 | -----------------------
 86 | 
 87 | 
 88 | ```solidity
 89 | function deployProxy(MCDevKit storage mc, Dictionary_1 storage dictionary, bytes memory initData)
 90 |     internal
 91 |     returns (Proxy_2 memory proxy);
 92 | ```
 93 | 
 94 | ### deployProxy
 95 | 
 96 | *Accepts any initData as input*
 97 | 
 98 | 
 99 | ```solidity
100 | function deployProxy(MCDevKit storage mc) internal returns (Proxy_2 memory proxy);
101 | ```
102 | 
103 | ### deployProxy
104 | 
105 | 
106 | ```solidity
107 | function deployProxy(MCDevKit storage mc, Dictionary_1 storage dictionary) internal returns (Proxy_2 memory proxy);
108 | ```
109 | 
110 | ### deployProxy
111 | 
112 | 
113 | ```solidity
114 | function deployProxy(MCDevKit storage mc, bytes memory initData) internal returns (Proxy_2 memory proxy);
115 | ```
116 | 
117 | ### deployDictionary
118 | 
119 | -------------------------
120 | 📚 Deploy Dictionary
121 | ---------------------------
122 | 
123 | 
124 | ```solidity
125 | function deployDictionary(MCDevKit storage mc, Bundle storage bundle, address owner)
126 |     internal
127 |     returns (Dictionary_1 storage dictionary);
128 | ```
129 | 
130 | ### deployDictionary
131 | 
132 | 
133 | ```solidity
134 | function deployDictionary(MCDevKit storage mc) internal returns (Dictionary_1 storage dictionary);
135 | ```
136 | 
137 | ### deployDictionary
138 | 
139 | 
140 | ```solidity
141 | function deployDictionary(MCDevKit storage mc, Bundle storage bundle)
142 |     internal
143 |     returns (Dictionary_1 storage dictionary);
144 | ```
145 | 
146 | ### deployDictionary
147 | 
148 | 
149 | ```solidity
150 | function deployDictionary(MCDevKit storage mc, address owner) internal returns (Dictionary_1 storage dictionary);
151 | ```
152 | 
153 | ### duplicateDictionary
154 | 
155 | ----------------------------
156 | 🔂 Duplicate Dictionary
157 | ------------------------------
158 | 
159 | 
160 | ```solidity
161 | function duplicateDictionary(MCDevKit storage mc, Dictionary_1 storage dictionary, address owner)
162 |     internal
163 |     returns (Dictionary_1 storage duplicatedDictionary);
164 | ```
165 | 
166 | ### duplicateDictionary
167 | 
168 | 
169 | ```solidity
170 | function duplicateDictionary(MCDevKit storage mc) internal returns (Dictionary_1 storage duplicatedDictionary);
171 | ```
172 | 
173 | ### duplicateDictionary
174 | 
175 | 
176 | ```solidity
177 | function duplicateDictionary(MCDevKit storage mc, Dictionary_1 storage dictionary)
178 |     internal
179 |     returns (Dictionary_1 storage duplicatedDictionary);
180 | ```
181 | 
182 | ### duplicateDictionary
183 | 
184 | 
185 | ```solidity
186 | function duplicateDictionary(MCDevKit storage mc, address owner)
187 |     internal
188 |     returns (Dictionary_1 storage duplicatedDictionary);
189 | ```
190 | 
191 | ### loadDictionary
192 | 
193 | ------------------------
194 | 💽 Load Dictionary
195 | --------------------------
196 | 
197 | 
198 | ```solidity
199 | function loadDictionary(MCDevKit storage mc, string memory name, address dictionaryAddr)
200 |     internal
201 |     returns (Dictionary_1 storage dictionary);
202 | ```

/test/devkit/MCDeployLib.t.sol:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1 | // SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT
  2 | pragma solidity ^0.8.23;
  3 | 
  4 | import {MCTestBase, Dummy} from "@mc-devkit/Flattened.sol";
  5 | 
  6 | contract MCDeployLibTest is MCTestBase {
  7 |     /**
  8 |      * -----------------------------
  9 |      *     🌞 Deploy Meta Contract
 10 |      * -------------------------------
 11 |      */
 12 |     function test_deploy_Success() public {
 13 |         string memory name = Dummy.bundleName();
 14 |         bytes4 selector = Dummy.functionSelector();
 15 |         mc.init(name);
 16 |         mc.use(selector, Dummy.functionAddress());
 17 |         mc.useFacade(Dummy.facadeAddress());
 18 | 
 19 |         address proxy = mc.deploy().toProxyAddress();
 20 | 
 21 |         assertTrue(mc.dictionary.find(name).isVerifiable());
 22 |         assertTrue(mc.dictionary.find(name).isComplete());
 23 |         assertTrue(mc.proxy.find(name).isComplete());
 24 | 
 25 |         (bool success,) = proxy.call(abi.encodeWithSelector(selector));
 26 |         assertTrue(success);
 27 |     }
 28 | 
 29 |     /**
 30 |      * ---------------------
 31 |      *     🏠 Deploy Proxy
 32 |      * -----------------------
 33 |      */
 34 |     function test_deployProxy_Success() public {
 35 |         string memory name = Dummy.bundleName();
 36 |         bytes4 selector = Dummy.functionSelector();
 37 |         mc.init(name);
 38 |         mc.use(selector, Dummy.functionAddress());
 39 |         mc.useFacade(Dummy.facadeAddress());
 40 |         mc.deployDictionary();
 41 | 
 42 |         address proxy = mc.deployProxy().addr;
 43 | 
 44 |         assertTrue(mc.proxy.find(name).isComplete());
 45 | 
 46 |         (bool success,) = proxy.call(abi.encodeWithSelector(selector));
 47 |         assertTrue(success);
 48 |     }
 49 | 
 50 |     /**
 51 |      * -------------------------
 52 |      *     📚 Deploy Dictionary
 53 |      * ---------------------------
 54 |      */
 55 |     function test_deployDictionary_Success() public {
 56 |         string memory name = Dummy.bundleName();
 57 |         bytes4 selector = Dummy.functionSelector();
 58 |         address impl = Dummy.functionAddress();
 59 |         mc.init(name);
 60 |         mc.use(selector, impl);
 61 |         mc.useFacade(Dummy.facadeAddress());
 62 | 
 63 |         address dictionary = mc.deployDictionary().addr;
 64 | 
 65 |         assertTrue(mc.dictionary.find(name).isVerifiable());
 66 |         assertTrue(mc.dictionary.find(name).isComplete());
 67 |         assertEq(mc.dictionary.findCurrent().addr, dictionary);
 68 | 
 69 |         (bool success, bytes memory ret) =
 70 |             dictionary.call(abi.encodeWithSignature("getImplementation(bytes4)", selector));
 71 |         assertTrue(success);
 72 |         assertEq(address(uint160(uint256(bytes32(ret)))), impl);
 73 |     }
 74 | 
 75 |     /**
 76 |      * ----------------------------
 77 |      *     🔂 Duplicate Dictionary
 78 |      * ------------------------------
 79 |      */
 80 |     function test_duplicateDictionary_Success() public {
 81 |         string memory name = Dummy.bundleName();
 82 |         bytes4 selector = Dummy.functionSelector();
 83 |         address impl = Dummy.functionAddress();
 84 |         mc.init(name);
 85 |         mc.use(selector, impl);
 86 |         mc.useFacade(Dummy.facadeAddress());
 87 |         mc.deployDictionary().addr;
 88 |         string memory duplicatedDictionaryName = mc.dictionary.genUniqueName(name);
 89 | 
 90 |         address dictionary = mc.duplicateDictionary().addr;
 91 | 
 92 |         assertTrue(mc.dictionary.find(duplicatedDictionaryName).isVerifiable());
 93 |         assertTrue(mc.dictionary.find(duplicatedDictionaryName).isComplete());
 94 |         assertEq(mc.dictionary.findCurrent().addr, dictionary);
 95 | 
 96 |         (bool success, bytes memory ret) =
 97 |             dictionary.call(abi.encodeWithSignature("getImplementation(bytes4)", selector));
 98 |         assertTrue(success);
 99 |         assertEq(address(uint160(uint256(bytes32(ret)))), impl);
100 |     }
101 | 
102 |     /**
103 |      * ------------------------
104 |      *     💽 Load Dictionary
105 |      * --------------------------
106 |      */
107 |     function test_loadDictionary_Success() public {
108 |         string memory name = Dummy.bundleName();
109 |         bytes4 selector = Dummy.functionSelector();
110 |         address impl = Dummy.functionAddress();
111 |         mc.init(name);
112 |         mc.use(selector, impl);
113 |         mc.useFacade(Dummy.facadeAddress());
114 |         address mockDictionary = mc.createMockDictionary().addr;
115 | 
116 |         address dictionary = mc.loadDictionary("LoadedDictionary", mockDictionary).addr;
117 | 
118 |         assertTrue(mc.dictionary.find("LoadedDictionary").isVerifiable());
119 |         assertTrue(mc.dictionary.find("LoadedDictionary").isComplete());
120 |         assertEq(mc.dictionary.findCurrent().addr, dictionary);
121 | 
122 |         (bool success, bytes memory ret) =
123 |             dictionary.call(abi.encodeWithSignature("getImplementation(bytes4)", selector));
124 |         assertTrue(success);
125 |         assertEq(address(uint160(uint256(bytes32(ret)))), impl);
126 |     }
127 | }
128 |
