/site/docs/03-api/03-api-details/Flattened.sol/library.Address.md:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1 | # Address
  2 | [Git Source](https://github.com/metacontract/mc/blob/main/src/devkit/Flattened.sol)
  3 | 
  4 | *Collection of functions related to the address type*
  5 | 
  6 | 
  7 | ## Functions
  8 | ### sendValue
  9 | 
 10 | *Replacement for Solidity's `transfer`: sends `amount` wei to
 11 | `recipient`, forwarding all available gas and reverting on errors.
 12 | https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-1884[EIP1884] increases the gas cost
 13 | of certain opcodes, possibly making contracts go over the 2300 gas limit
 14 | imposed by `transfer`, making them unable to receive funds via
 15 | `transfer`. [sendValue](library.Address.md#sendvalue) removes this limitation.
 16 | https://consensys.net/diligence/blog/2019/09/stop-using-soliditys-transfer-now/[Learn more].
 17 | IMPORTANT: because control is transferred to `recipient`, care must be
 18 | taken to not create reentrancy vulnerabilities. Consider using
 19 | {ReentrancyGuard} or the
 20 | https://solidity.readthedocs.io/en/v0.8.20/security-considerations.html#use-the-checks-effects-interactions-pattern[checks-effects-interactions pattern].*
 21 | 
 22 | 
 23 | ```solidity
 24 | function sendValue(address payable recipient, uint256 amount) internal;
 25 | ```
 26 | 
 27 | ### functionCall
 28 | 
 29 | *Performs a Solidity function call using a low level `call`. A
 30 | plain `call` is an unsafe replacement for a function call: use this
 31 | function instead.
 32 | If `target` reverts with a revert reason or custom error, it is bubbled
 33 | up by this function (like regular Solidity function calls). However, if
 34 | the call reverted with no returned reason, this function reverts with a
 35 | [FailedInnerCall](library.Address.md#failedinnercall) error.
 36 | Returns the raw returned data. To convert to the expected return value,
 37 | use https://solidity.readthedocs.io/en/latest/units-and-global-variables.html?highlight=abi.decode#abi-encoding-and-decoding-functions[`abi.decode`].
 38 | Requirements:
 39 | - `target` must be a contract.
 40 | - calling `target` with `data` must not revert.*
 41 | 
 42 | 
 43 | ```solidity
 44 | function functionCall(address target, bytes memory data) internal returns (bytes memory);
 45 | ```
 46 | 
 47 | ### functionCallWithValue
 48 | 
 49 | *Same as [`functionCall`](../../../lib/ucs-contracts/lib/openzeppelin-contracts/contracts/mocks/token/ERC20Reentrant.sol/contract.ERC20Reentrant.md#functioncall),
 50 | but also transferring `value` wei to `target`.
 51 | Requirements:
 52 | - the calling contract must have an ETH balance of at least `value`.
 53 | - the called Solidity function must be `payable`.*
 54 | 
 55 | 
 56 | ```solidity
 57 | function functionCallWithValue(address target, bytes memory data, uint256 value) internal returns (bytes memory);
 58 | ```
 59 | 
 60 | ### functionStaticCall
 61 | 
 62 | *Same as [`functionCall`](../../../lib/ucs-contracts/lib/openzeppelin-contracts/contracts/mocks/token/ERC20Reentrant.sol/contract.ERC20Reentrant.md#functioncall),
 63 | but performing a static call.*
 64 | 
 65 | 
 66 | ```solidity
 67 | function functionStaticCall(address target, bytes memory data) internal view returns (bytes memory);
 68 | ```
 69 | 
 70 | ### functionDelegateCall
 71 | 
 72 | *Same as [`functionCall`](../../../lib/ucs-contracts/lib/openzeppelin-contracts/contracts/mocks/token/ERC20Reentrant.sol/contract.ERC20Reentrant.md#functioncall),
 73 | but performing a delegate call.*
 74 | 
 75 | 
 76 | ```solidity
 77 | function functionDelegateCall(address target, bytes memory data) internal returns (bytes memory);
 78 | ```
 79 | 
 80 | ### verifyCallResultFromTarget
 81 | 
 82 | *Tool to verify that a low level call to smart-contract was successful, and reverts if the target
 83 | was not a contract or bubbling up the revert reason (falling back to [FailedInnerCall](library.Address.md#failedinnercall)) in case of an
 84 | unsuccessful call.*
 85 | 
 86 | 
 87 | ```solidity
 88 | function verifyCallResultFromTarget(address target, bool success, bytes memory returndata)
 89 |     internal
 90 |     view
 91 |     returns (bytes memory);
 92 | ```
 93 | 
 94 | ### verifyCallResult
 95 | 
 96 | *Tool to verify that a low level call was successful, and reverts if it wasn't, either by bubbling the
 97 | revert reason or with a default [FailedInnerCall](library.Address.md#failedinnercall) error.*
 98 | 
 99 | 
100 | ```solidity
101 | function verifyCallResult(bool success, bytes memory returndata) internal pure returns (bytes memory);
102 | ```
103 | 
104 | ### _revert
105 | 
106 | *Reverts with returndata if present. Otherwise reverts with [FailedInnerCall](library.Address.md#failedinnercall).*
107 | 
108 | 
109 | ```solidity
110 | function _revert(bytes memory returndata) private pure;
111 | ```
112 | 
113 | ## Errors
114 | ### AddressInsufficientBalance
115 | *The ETH balance of the account is not enough to perform the operation.*
116 | 
117 | 
118 | ```solidity
119 | error AddressInsufficientBalance(address account);
120 | ```
121 | 
122 | ### AddressEmptyCode
123 | *There's no code at `target` (it is not a contract).*
124 | 
125 | 
126 | ```solidity
127 | error AddressEmptyCode(address target);
128 | ```
129 | 
130 | ### FailedInnerCall
131 | *A call to an address target failed. The target may have reverted.*
132 | 
133 | 
134 | ```solidity
135 | error FailedInnerCall();
136 | ```
137 | 
138 | 


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
/src/devkit/utils/mapping/NameGenerator.sol:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1 | // SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT
  2 | pragma solidity ^0.8.23;
  3 | 
  4 | import {Validator} from "@mc-devkit/system/Validator.sol";
  5 | import {System} from "@mc-devkit/system/System.sol";
  6 | // Core Types
  7 | import {Bundle} from "@mc-devkit/core/Bundle.sol";
  8 | import {Function} from "@mc-devkit/core/Function.sol";
  9 | import {Dictionary} from "@mc-devkit/core/Dictionary.sol";
 10 | import {Proxy} from "@mc-devkit/core/Proxy.sol";
 11 | // Utils
 12 | import {Formatter} from "@mc-devkit/types/Formatter.sol";
 13 | 
 14 | using Formatter for string;
 15 | 
 16 | /**
 17 |  * =======================
 18 |  *     🏷️ Name Generator
 19 |  * =========================
 20 |  */
 21 | library NameGenerator {
 22 |     string constant MOCK = "Mock";
 23 | 
 24 |     /**
 25 |      * ------------------------
 26 |      *     🗂️ Bundle Mapping
 27 |      * --------------------------
 28 |      */
 29 |     function genUniqueName(mapping(string => Bundle) storage bundle, string memory baseName)
 30 |         internal
 31 |         view
 32 |         returns (string memory name)
 33 |     {
 34 |         for (uint256 i = 1; i <= System.Config().SYSTEM.SCAN_RANGE; ++i) {
 35 |             name = baseName.toSequential(i);
 36 |             if (bundle[name].isUninitialized()) return name; // TODO
 37 |         }
 38 |         Validator.MUST_FoundInRange();
 39 |     }
 40 | 
 41 |     function genUniqueName(mapping(string => Bundle) storage bundle) internal view returns (string memory name) {
 42 |         return genUniqueName(bundle, System.Config().DEFAULT_NAME.BUNDLE);
 43 |     }
 44 | 
 45 |     /**
 46 |      * -------------------------
 47 |      *     🧩 Function Mapping
 48 |      * ---------------------------
 49 |      */
 50 |     function genUniqueName(mapping(string => Function) storage func, string memory baseName)
 51 |         internal
 52 |         view
 53 |         returns (string memory name)
 54 |     {
 55 |         for (uint256 i = 1; i <= System.Config().SYSTEM.SCAN_RANGE; ++i) {
 56 |             name = baseName.toSequential(i);
 57 |             if (func[name].isUninitialized()) return name;
 58 |         }
 59 |         Validator.MUST_FoundInRange();
 60 |     }
 61 | 
 62 |     function genUniqueName(mapping(string => Function) storage func) internal view returns (string memory name) {
 63 |         return genUniqueName(func, System.Config().DEFAULT_NAME.FUNCTION);
 64 |     }
 65 | 
 66 |     /**
 67 |      * ---------------------------
 68 |      *     📚 Dictionary Mapping
 69 |      * -----------------------------
 70 |      */
 71 |     function genUniqueName(mapping(string => Dictionary) storage dictionary, string memory baseName)
 72 |         internal
 73 |         view
 74 |         returns (string memory name)
 75 |     {
 76 |         for (uint256 i = 1; i <= System.Config().SYSTEM.SCAN_RANGE; ++i) {
 77 |             name = baseName.toSequential(i);
 78 |             if (dictionary[name].isUninitialized()) return name;
 79 |         }
 80 |         Validator.MUST_FoundInRange();
 81 |     }
 82 |     /*----- Dictionary -----*/
 83 | 
 84 |     function genUniqueName(mapping(string => Dictionary) storage dictionary)
 85 |         internal
 86 |         view
 87 |         returns (string memory name)
 88 |     {
 89 |         return genUniqueName(dictionary, System.Config().DEFAULT_NAME.DICTIONARY);
 90 |     }
 91 |     /*----- Duplicated Dictionary -----*/
 92 | 
 93 |     function genUniqueDuplicatedName(mapping(string => Dictionary) storage dictionary)
 94 |         internal
 95 |         view
 96 |         returns (string memory name)
 97 |     {
 98 |         return genUniqueName(dictionary, System.Config().DEFAULT_NAME.DICTIONARY_DUPLICATED);
 99 |     }
100 |     /*----- Mock Dictionary -----*/
101 | 
102 |     function genUniqueMockName(mapping(string => Dictionary) storage dictionary, string memory baseName)
103 |         internal
104 |         view
105 |         returns (string memory name)
106 |     {
107 |         return genUniqueName(dictionary, MOCK.append(baseName));
108 |         // return genUniqueName(dictionary, System.Config().DEFAULT_NAME.DICTIONARY_MOCK);
109 |     }
110 | 
111 |     /**
112 |      * -----------------------
113 |      *     🏠 Proxy Mapping
114 |      * -------------------------
115 |      */
116 |     /*----- Mock Proxy -----*/
117 |     function genUniqueName(mapping(string => Proxy) storage proxy, string memory baseName)
118 |         internal
119 |         view
120 |         returns (string memory name)
121 |     {
122 |         for (uint256 i = 1; i <= System.Config().SYSTEM.SCAN_RANGE; ++i) {
123 |             name = baseName.toSequential(i);
124 |             if (proxy[name].isUninitialized()) return name;
125 |         }
126 |         Validator.MUST_FoundInRange();
127 |     }
128 |     /*----- Proxy -----*/
129 | 
130 |     function genUniqueName(mapping(string => Proxy) storage proxy) internal view returns (string memory name) {
131 |         return genUniqueName(proxy, System.Config().DEFAULT_NAME.PROXY);
132 |     }
133 |     /*----- Mock Proxy -----*/
134 | 
135 |     function genUniqueMockName(mapping(string => Proxy) storage proxy, string memory baseName)
136 |         internal
137 |         view
138 |         returns (string memory name)
139 |     {
140 |         return genUniqueName(proxy, MOCK.append(baseName));
141 |         // return genUniqueName(proxy, System.Config().DEFAULT_NAME.PROXY_MOCK);
142 |     }
143 | }
144 |

/site/docs/02-guides/03-operations/01-deployment.md:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1 | ---
  2 | keywords: [deployment, smart-contracts, blockchain, foundry, metacontract]
  3 | tags: [deployment, smart-contracts, blockchain, foundry, metacontract]
  4 | last_update:
  5 |   date: 2024-10-28
  6 |   author: Meta Contract DevOps Team
  7 | ---
  8 | 
  9 | # Deployment
 10 | 
 11 | This guide outlines the best practices and strategies for deploying Meta Contract projects to various blockchain networks using Foundry.
 12 | 
 13 | ## Table of Contents
 14 | 
 15 | 1. [Pre-Deployment Checklist](#pre-deployment-checklist)
 16 | 2. [Deployment Process](#deployment-process)
 17 | 3. [Post-Deployment Steps](#post-deployment-steps)
 18 | 4. [Security Considerations](#security-considerations)
 19 | 5. [Gas Optimization](#gas-optimization)
 20 | 
 21 | ## Pre-Deployment Checklist
 22 | 
 23 | Before deploying your Meta Contract project, ensure you've completed the following:
 24 | 
 25 | 1. **Code Review**: Conduct thorough code reviews, including peer reviews and potentially external audits.
 26 | 2. **Testing**: Complete all unit and integration tests with high coverage using Foundry.
 27 | 3. **Gas Optimization**: Perform gas optimization to ensure efficient contract execution.
 28 | 4. **Documentation**: Prepare comprehensive documentation for your contract's functions and usage.
 29 | 
 30 | ## Deployment Process
 31 | 
 32 | ### 1. Choose the Deployment Network
 33 | 
 34 | - **Testnet Deployment**: Always deploy to a testnet (e.g., Sepolia, Holesky) before mainnet deployment.
 35 | - **Mainnet Deployment**: Only deploy to mainnet after thorough testing and auditing.
 36 | 
 37 | ### 2. Prepare Deployment Scripts
 38 | 
 39 | Use Foundry's `script` feature and mc's custom script template to create deployment scripts:
 40 | 
 41 | ```solidity
 42 | // script/DeployVotingSystem.s.sol
 43 | 
 44 | // SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT
 45 | pragma solidity ^0.8.24;
 46 | 
 47 | import {MCScript} from "@mc-devkit/Flattened.sol";
 48 | import {VotingSystemDeployer} from "script/VotingSystemDeployer.sol";
 49 | 
 50 | contract DeployVotingSystemScript is MCScript {
 51 |     function run() public startBroadcastWith("DEPLOYER_PRIV_KEY") {
 52 |         VotingSystemDeployer.deploy(mc, deployer);
 53 |     }
 54 | }
 55 | ```
 56 | 
 57 | ```solidity
 58 | // script/VotingSystemDeployer.s.sol
 59 | 
 60 | // SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT
 61 | pragma solidity ^0.8.24;
 62 | 
 63 | import {VotingSystemFacade} from "bundle/voting-system/interfaces/VotingSystemFacade.sol";
 64 | 
 65 | library VotingSystemDeployer {
 66 |     string internal constant BUNDLE_NAME = "VotingSystem";
 67 | 
 68 |     /**
 69 |      * @dev Deploys the VotingSystem contract
 70 |      * @param mc MCDevKit storage reference
 71 |      * @return votingSystem Address of the deployed VotingSystem proxy
 72 |      */
 73 |     function deploy(MCDevKit storage mc, address initialMember) internal returns(address votingSystem) {
 74 |         mc.init(BUNDLE_NAME);
 75 | 
 76 |         address _vote = address(new Vote());
 77 |         _use(Vote.vote.selector, _vote);
 78 |         address _tally = address(new Tally());
 79 |         _use(Tally.tally.selector, _tally);
 80 | 
 81 |         mc.useFacade(address(new VotingSystemFacade())); // for Etherscan proxy read/write
 82 | 
 83 |         return mc.deploy(
 84 |             abi.encodeCall(Initialize.initialize, (initialMember))
 85 |         ).toProxyAddress();
 86 |     }
 87 | }
 88 | ```
 89 | 
 90 | ### 3. Deploy the Contract
 91 | 
 92 | 1. Run and check the result the deployment script using Foundry in the local environment with on-chain state:
 93 |     ```bash
 94 |     forge script DeployVotingSystemScript --rpc-url <YOUR_RPC_URL>
 95 |     ```
 96 | 
 97 | 2. Run the script with sending transactions
 98 |     ```bash
 99 |     forge script DeployVotingSystemScript --rpc-url <YOUR_RPC_URL> --broadcast --verify
100 |     ```
101 | 
102 | ### 4. Verify Contract Source Code
103 | 
104 | Foundry automatically verifies the contract if the `--verify` flag is used during deployment. If manual verification is needed:
105 | 
106 | ```bash
107 | forge verify-contract <DEPLOYED_CONTRACT_ADDRESS> src/MyContract.sol:MyContract
108 | ```
109 | 
110 | ## Post-Deployment Steps
111 | 
112 | 1. **Functional Testing**: Perform thorough testing on the deployed contract to ensure all functions work as expected.
113 | 2. **Monitoring Setup**: Implement monitoring solutions to track contract interactions and events.
114 | 3. **Documentation Update**: Update your project documentation with the deployed contract addresses and any network-specific information.
115 | 
116 | ## Security Considerations
117 | 
118 | - **Private Key Management**: Use secure methods to manage private keys, such as hardware wallets or key management services.
119 | - **Multisig Wallets**: Consider using multisig wallets for contract ownership and management of valuable assets.
120 | - **Gradual Rollout**: For high-value contracts, consider a gradual rollout strategy to minimize potential risks.
121 | 
122 | ## Gas Optimization
123 | 
124 | Foundry provides tools for gas optimization:
125 | 
126 | 1. Use `forge snapshot` to track gas usage over time.
127 | 2. Implement gas optimizations in your contract code.
128 | 3. Use Foundry's gas reports to identify high-gas-usage functions:
129 |     ```bash
130 |     forge test --gas-report
131 |     ```
132 | 
133 | By following this deployment guide, you can ensure a smooth and secure deployment process for your Meta Contract projects using Foundry.
134 | 


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
/site/docusaurus.config.ts:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1 | import type * as Preset from "@docusaurus/preset-classic";
  2 | import type { Config } from "@docusaurus/types";
  3 | import { themes as prismThemes } from "prism-react-renderer";
  4 | 
  5 | const config: Config = {
  6 | 	title: "Meta Contract",
  7 | 	tagline:
  8 | 		"A flexible and upgradeable smart contract framework optimized for AI integration and DevOps efficiency, enabling streamlined development and testing.",
  9 | 	favicon: "img/favicon.ico",
 10 | 
 11 | 	url: "https://mc-book.ecdysis.xyz",
 12 | 	baseUrl: "/",
 13 | 
 14 | 	organizationName: "metacontract",
 15 | 	projectName: "mc",
 16 | 
 17 | 	onBrokenLinks: "warn",
 18 | 	onBrokenMarkdownLinks: "warn",
 19 | 
 20 | 	i18n: {
 21 | 		defaultLocale: "en",
 22 | 		locales: ["en"],
 23 | 	},
 24 | 
 25 | 	plugins: [require.resolve("docusaurus-lunr-search")],
 26 | 
 27 | 	headTags: [
 28 | 		{
 29 | 			tagName: "link",
 30 | 			attributes: {
 31 | 				rel: "preconnect",
 32 | 				href: "https://fonts.googleapis.com",
 33 | 			},
 34 | 		},
 35 | 		{
 36 | 			tagName: "link",
 37 | 			attributes: {
 38 | 				rel: "preconnect",
 39 | 				href: "https://fonts.gstatic.com",
 40 | 				crossorigin: "anonymous",
 41 | 			},
 42 | 		},
 43 | 		{
 44 | 			tagName: "link",
 45 | 			attributes: {
 46 | 				rel: "stylesheet",
 47 | 				href: "https://fonts.googleapis.com/css2?family=Noto+Serif:ital,wght@0,100..900;1,100..900&display=swap",
 48 | 			},
 49 | 		},
 50 | 	],
 51 | 
 52 | 	presets: [
 53 | 		[
 54 | 			"classic",
 55 | 			{
 56 | 				docs: {
 57 | 					path: "./docs",
 58 | 					routeBasePath: "/",
 59 | 					sidebarPath: require.resolve("./sidebars.ts"),
 60 | 					async sidebarItemsGenerator({
 61 | 						defaultSidebarItemsGenerator,
 62 | 						...args
 63 | 					}) {
 64 | 						const items = await defaultSidebarItemsGenerator(args);
 65 | 						// Filter out index.md from the sidebar items
 66 | 						return items.filter((item) => {
 67 | 							// Add a type guard to check if 'item' has an 'id' property
 68 | 							return !("id" in item) || !item.id.endsWith("index");
 69 | 						});
 70 | 					},
 71 | 					editUrl: "https://github.com/metacontract/mc/tree/main/site",
 72 | 					breadcrumbs: false,
 73 | 					showLastUpdateTime: true,
 74 | 				},
 75 | 				theme: {
 76 | 					customCss: "./src/css/custom.css",
 77 | 				},
 78 | 			} satisfies Preset.Options,
 79 | 		],
 80 | 	],
 81 | 
 82 | 	markdown: {
 83 | 		mermaid: true,
 84 | 		format: "detect",
 85 | 	},

/src/devkit/utils/ForgeHelper.sol:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1 | // SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT
  2 | pragma solidity ^0.8.23;
  3 | 
  4 | // Forge-std
  5 | import {Vm, VmSafe} from "forge-std/Vm.sol";
  6 | import {stdToml} from "forge-std/StdToml.sol";
  7 | // MC Devkit
  8 | import {Logger} from "@mc-devkit/system/Logger.sol";
  9 | import {Parser} from "@mc-devkit/types/Parser.sol";
 10 | import {ProxyUtils} from "@ucs.mc/proxy/ProxyUtils.sol";
 11 | 
 12 | // Constants
 13 | /// @dev address(uint160(uint256(keccak256("hevm cheat code"))));
 14 | Vm constant vm = Vm(0x7109709ECfa91a80626fF3989D68f67F5b1DD12D);
 15 | 
 16 | function loadAddressFrom(string memory envKey) view returns (address) {
 17 |     return ForgeHelper.loadAddressFromEnv(envKey);
 18 | }
 19 | 
 20 | /**
 21 |  *
 22 |  *     🛠 Helper Methods for Forge Std
 23 |  *
 24 |  */
 25 | library ForgeHelper {
 26 |     using stdToml for string;
 27 |     using Parser for string;
 28 | 
 29 |     /**
 30 |      * -------------------
 31 |      *     🔧 Env File
 32 |      * ---------------------
 33 |      */
 34 |     function loadPrivateKey(string memory envKey) internal view returns (uint256) {
 35 |         return uint256(vm.envBytes32(envKey));
 36 |     }
 37 | 
 38 |     function loadAddressFromEnv(string memory envKey) internal view returns (address) {
 39 |         return vm.envOr(envKey, address(0));
 40 |     }
 41 | 
 42 |     /**
 43 |      * ------------------
 44 |      *     📍 Address
 45 |      * --------------------
 46 |      */
 47 |     function getAddress(address target, bytes32 slot) internal view returns (address) {
 48 |         return address(uint160(uint256(vm.load(target, slot))));
 49 |     }
 50 | 
 51 |     function getDictionaryAddress(address proxy) internal view returns (address) {
 52 |         return getAddress(proxy, ProxyUtils.DICTIONARY_SLOT);
 53 |     }
 54 | 
 55 |     function injectCode(address target, bytes memory runtimeBytecode) internal {
 56 |         vm.etch(target, runtimeBytecode);
 57 |     }
 58 | 
 59 |     function injectAddressToStorage(address target, bytes32 slot, address addr) internal {
 60 |         vm.store(target, slot, bytes32(uint256(uint160(addr))));
 61 |     }
 62 | 
 63 |     function injectDictionary(address proxy, address dictionary) internal {
 64 |         injectAddressToStorage(proxy, ProxyUtils.DICTIONARY_SLOT, dictionary);
 65 |     }
 66 | 
 67 |     function assumeAddressIsNotReserved(address addr) internal pure {
 68 |         // forgefmt: disable-start
 69 |         vm.assume(
 70 |             addr != address(1) &&
 71 |             addr != address(2) &&
 72 |             addr != address(3) &&
 73 |             addr != address(4) &&
 74 |             addr != address(5) &&
 75 |             addr != address(6) &&
 76 |             addr != address(7) &&
 77 |             addr != address(8) &&
 78 |             addr != address(9) &&
 79 |             addr != 0x4e59b44847b379578588920cA78FbF26c0B4956C &&
 80 |             addr != 0x7109709ECfa91a80626fF3989D68f67F5b1DD12D &&
 81 |             addr != 0x000000000000000000636F6e736F6c652e6c6f67
 82 |         );
 83 |         // forgefmt: disable-end
 84 |     }
 85 | 
 86 |     /**
 87 |      * ----------------
 88 |      *     📓 Context
 89 |      * ------------------
 90 |      */
 91 |     function msgSender() internal returns (address) {
 92 |         (VmSafe.CallerMode callerMode_, address msgSender_,) = vm.readCallers();
 93 |         if (callerMode_ == VmSafe.CallerMode.None) return address(this);
 94 |         return msgSender_;
 95 |     }
 96 | 
 97 |     /**
 98 |      * ---------------
 99 |      *     🏷️ Label
100 |      * -----------------
101 |      */
102 |     function assignLabel(address addr, string memory name) internal returns (address) {
103 |         vm.label(addr, name);
104 |         return addr;
105 |     }
106 | 
107 |     function getLabel(address addr) internal view returns (string memory) {
108 |         return vm.getLabel(addr);
109 |     }
110 | 
111 |     /**
112 |      * --------------
113 |      *     📂 TOML
114 |      * ----------------
115 |      */
116 |     function readBoolOr(string memory toml, string memory key, bool or) internal view returns (bool) {
117 |         return vm.keyExistsToml(toml, key) ? toml.readBool(key) : or;
118 |     }
119 | 
120 |     function readStringOr(string memory toml, string memory key, string memory or)
121 |         internal
122 |         view
123 |         returns (string memory)
124 |     {
125 |         return vm.keyExistsToml(toml, key) ? toml.readString(key) : or;
126 |     }
127 | 
128 |     function readUintOr(string memory toml, string memory key, uint256 or) internal view returns (uint256) {
129 |         return vm.keyExistsToml(toml, key) ? toml.readUint(key) : or;
130 |     }
131 | 
132 |     function readLogLevelOr(string memory toml, string memory key, Logger.Level or)
133 |         internal
134 |         view
135 |         returns (Logger.Level)
136 |     {
137 |         return vm.keyExistsToml(toml, key) ? toml.readString(key).toLogLevel() : or;
138 |     }
139 | 
140 |     /**
141 |      * ------------------
142 |      *     📡 Broadcast
143 |      * --------------------
144 |      */
145 |     function pauseBroadcast() internal returns (bool isBroadcasting, address) {
146 |         (, address currentSender,) = vm.readCallers();
147 |         isBroadcasting = vm.isContext(VmSafe.ForgeContext.ScriptBroadcast);
148 |         if (isBroadcasting) vm.stopBroadcast();
149 |         return (isBroadcasting, currentSender);
150 |     }
151 | 
152 |     function resumeBroadcast(bool isBroadcasting, address currentSender) internal {
153 |         if (isBroadcasting) vm.startBroadcast(currentSender);
154 |     }
155 | }
156 | 


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
/site/docs/02-guides/03-operations/04-ci-cd.md:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1 | ---
  2 | keywords: [ci-cd, automation, testing, deployment]
  3 | tags: [ci-cd, automation, testing, deployment]
  4 | last_update:
  5 |   date: 2024-10-28
  6 |   author: Meta Contract DevOps Team
  7 | ---
  8 | 
  9 | # CI/CD
 10 | 
 11 | This guide outlines the CI/CD (Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment) practices for Meta Contract development, ensuring code quality, security, and efficient deployment processes.
 12 | 
 13 | ## Overview
 14 | 
 15 | CI/CD in Meta Contract development automates the process of integrating code changes, running tests, and deploying contracts. This automation helps maintain code quality, catch errors early, and streamline the deployment process.
 16 | 
 17 | <!-- ## Continuous Integration (CI)
 18 | 
 19 | ### 1. Automated Testing
 20 | 
 21 | Every pull request triggers the following automated tests:
 22 | 
 23 | - Unit tests
 24 | - Integration tests
 25 | - Gas optimization tests
 26 | 
 27 | ```yaml
 28 | name: Tests
 29 | 
 30 | on: [push, pull_request]
 31 | 
 32 | jobs:
 33 |   tests:
 34 |     name: Tests
 35 |     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
 36 |     steps:
 37 |       - uses: actions/checkout@v3
 38 |       - name: Install Foundry
 39 |         uses: foundry-rs/foundry-toolchain@v1
 40 |       - name: Run tests
 41 |         run: forge test
 42 |       - name: Run gas snapshot
 43 |         run: forge snapshot
 44 | ```
 45 | 
 46 | ### 2. Code Quality Checks
 47 | 
 48 | Automated code quality checks include:
 49 | 
 50 | - Solidity linting (using Solhint)
 51 | - Code formatting checks (using Prettier)
 52 | 
 53 | ```yaml
 54 | name: Linting
 55 | 
 56 | on: [push, pull_request]
 57 | 
 58 | jobs:
 59 |   lint:
 60 |     name: Linting
 61 |     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
 62 |     steps:
 63 |       - uses: actions/checkout@v3
 64 |       - name: Install dependencies
 65 |         run: npm ci
 66 |       - name: Run Solhint
 67 |         run: npx solhint 'src/**/*.sol'
 68 |       - name: Check formatting
 69 |         run: npx prettier --check '**/*.sol'
 70 | ```
 71 | 
 72 | ### 3. Security Analysis
 73 | 
 74 | Automated security checks using tools like:
 75 | 
 76 | - Slither
 77 | - Mythril
 78 | 
 79 | ```yaml
 80 | name: Security Analysis
 81 | 
 82 | on: [push, pull_request]
 83 | 
 84 | jobs:
 85 |   security:
 86 |     name: Security Analysis
 87 |     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
 88 |     steps:
 89 |       - uses: actions/checkout@v3
 90 |       - name: Run Slither
 91 |         uses: crytic/slither-action@v0.1.1
 92 |       - name: Run Mythril
 93 |         uses: consensys/mythril-action@v1.1.2
 94 | ```
 95 | 
 96 | ## Continuous Deployment (CD)
 97 | 
 98 | ### 1. Staging Deployment
 99 | 
100 | Automated deployment to a staging environment for final testing:
101 | 
102 | ```yaml
103 | name: Staging Deployment
104 | 
105 | on:
106 |   push:
107 |     branches:
108 |       - develop
109 | 
110 | jobs:
111 |   deploy-staging:
112 |     name: Deploy to Staging
113 |     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
114 |     steps:
115 |       - uses: actions/checkout@v3
116 |       - name: Install Foundry
117 |         uses: foundry-rs/foundry-toolchain@v1
118 |       - name: Deploy to staging
119 |         run: forge script script/DeployStaging.s.sol --rpc-url ${{ secrets.STAGING_RPC_URL }} --private-key ${{ secrets.DEPLOYER_PRIVATE_KEY }}
120 | ```
121 | 
122 | ### 2. Production Deployment
123 | 
124 | Deployment to production requires manual approval:
125 | 
126 | ```yaml
127 | name: Production Deployment
128 | 
129 | on:
130 |   release:
131 |     types: [created]
132 | 
133 | jobs:
134 |   deploy-production:
135 |     name: Deploy to Production
136 |     runs-on: ubuntu-latest
137 |     steps:
138 |       - uses: actions/checkout@v3
139 |       - name: Install Foundry
140 |         uses: foundry-rs/foundry-toolchain@v1
141 |       - name: Deploy to production
142 |         run: forge script script/DeployProduction.s.sol --rpc-url ${{ secrets.PRODUCTION_RPC_URL }} --private-key ${{ secrets.DEPLOYER_PRIVATE_KEY }}
143 | ```
144 | 
145 | ## Best Practices
146 | 
147 | 1. **Version Control**: Use semantic versioning for releases.
148 | 2. **Environment Separation**: Maintain separate environments for development, staging, and production.
149 | 3. **Secrets Management**: Use GitHub Secrets or a secure vault for managing sensitive information.
150 | 4. **Monitoring**: Implement monitoring and alerting for deployed contracts.
151 | 5. **Rollback Plan**: Always have a rollback strategy in case of deployment issues.
152 | 
153 | ## Upgradeability Considerations
154 | 
155 | When deploying upgradeable Meta Contracts:
156 | 
157 | 1. Ensure the upgrade process is thoroughly tested in the staging environment.
158 | 2. Implement a time-lock or multi-sig requirement for production upgrades.
159 | 3. Verify that the new implementation is compatible with the existing storage layout.
160 | 
161 | For more details on upgrades, refer to the [Upgrades Guide](../03-upgrades.md).
162 | 
163 | ## Security Considerations
164 | 
165 | 1. Regularly update dependencies and tooling.
166 | 2. Implement access controls for deployment and upgrade processes.
167 | 3. Conduct regular security audits, especially before major releases.
168 | 
169 | ## Conclusion
170 | 
171 | Implementing a robust CI/CD pipeline is crucial for maintaining the quality and security of Meta Contract projects. By automating testing, security checks, and deployment processes, teams can focus on developing innovative features while ensuring the reliability of their smart contracts.
172 | 
173 | For more information on Meta Contract architecture and best practices, refer to the [ERC-7546 Specification](../../05-resources/02-architecture/01-erc7546.md). -->
174 | 


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

/src/devkit/utils/global/MCHelpers.sol:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1 | // SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT
  2 | pragma solidity ^0.8.23;
  3 | 
  4 | import {ProxyUtils} from "@ucs.mc/proxy/ProxyUtils.sol";
  5 | 
  6 | import {Logger} from "@mc-devkit/system/Logger.sol";
  7 | 
  8 | // Validation
  9 | import {Validator} from "@mc-devkit/system/Validator.sol";
 10 | 
 11 | import {MCDevKit} from "@mc-devkit/MCDevKit.sol";
 12 | import {System} from "@mc-devkit/system/System.sol";
 13 | // Utils
 14 | import {param} from "@mc-devkit/system/Tracer.sol";
 15 | import {ForgeHelper, vm} from "@mc-devkit/utils/ForgeHelper.sol";
 16 | // Core
 17 | //  functions
 18 | import {Bundle} from "@mc-devkit/core/Bundle.sol";
 19 | import {Function} from "@mc-devkit/core/Function.sol";
 20 | //  proxy
 21 | import {Proxy, ProxyLib} from "@mc-devkit/core/Proxy.sol";
 22 | //  dictionary
 23 | import {Dictionary, DictionaryLib} from "@mc-devkit/core/Dictionary.sol";
 24 | 
 25 | /**
 26 |  *
 27 |  *  🛠️ Helper
 28 |  *      ♻️ Reset Current Context
 29 |  *      🤲 Set Storage Reader
 30 |  *
 31 |  */
 32 | library MCHelpers {
 33 |     /**
 34 |      * -----------------------------
 35 |      *     ♻️ Reset Current Context
 36 |      * -------------------------------
 37 |      */
 38 |     function reset(MCDevKit storage mc) internal returns (MCDevKit storage) {
 39 |         uint256 pid = mc.startProcess("reset");
 40 |         mc.bundle.current.reset();
 41 |         mc.functions.current.reset();
 42 |         mc.dictionary.current.reset();
 43 |         mc.proxy.current.reset();
 44 |         return mc.finishProcess(pid);
 45 |     }
 46 | 
 47 |     /**
 48 |      * --------------------------
 49 |      *     🤲 Set Storage Reader
 50 |      * ----------------------------
 51 |      */
 52 |     function setStorageReader(
 53 |         MCDevKit storage mc,
 54 |         Dictionary memory dictionary,
 55 |         bytes4 selector,
 56 |         address implementation
 57 |     ) internal returns (MCDevKit storage) {
 58 |         uint256 pid = mc.startProcess("setStorageReader", param(dictionary, selector, implementation));
 59 |         dictionary.set(selector, implementation);
 60 |         return mc.finishProcess(pid);
 61 |     }
 62 | 
 63 |     function setStorageReader(MCDevKit storage mc, string memory bundleName, bytes4 selector, address implementation)
 64 |         internal
 65 |         returns (MCDevKit storage)
 66 |     {
 67 |         return mc.setStorageReader(mc.dictionary.find(bundleName), selector, implementation);
 68 |     }
 69 | 
 70 |     function setStorageReader(MCDevKit storage mc, bytes4 selector, address implementation)
 71 |         internal
 72 |         returns (MCDevKit storage)
 73 |     {
 74 |         return mc.setStorageReader(mc.dictionary.findCurrent(), selector, implementation);
 75 |     }
 76 | 
 77 |     /// ForgeHelper Wrapper
 78 | 
 79 |     /**
 80 |      * -------------------
 81 |      *     🔧 Env File
 82 |      * ---------------------
 83 |      */
 84 |     function loadPrivateKey(MCDevKit storage, string memory envKey) internal view returns (uint256) {
 85 |         return ForgeHelper.loadPrivateKey(envKey);
 86 |     }
 87 | 
 88 |     function loadAddressFromEnv(MCDevKit storage, string memory envKey) internal view returns (address) {
 89 |         return ForgeHelper.loadAddressFromEnv(envKey);
 90 |     }
 91 | 
 92 |     /**
 93 |      * -------------------------
 94 |      *     📍 Address Operation
 95 |      * ---------------------------
 96 |      */
 97 |     function injectCode(MCDevKit storage, address target, bytes memory runtimeBytecode) internal {
 98 |         ForgeHelper.injectCode(target, runtimeBytecode);
 99 |     }
100 | 
101 |     function injectDictionary(MCDevKit storage, address proxy, address dictionary) internal {
102 |         ForgeHelper.injectDictionary(proxy, dictionary);
103 |     }
104 | 
105 |     function getAddress(MCDevKit storage, address target, bytes32 slot) internal view returns (address) {
106 |         return ForgeHelper.getAddress(target, slot);
107 |     }
108 | 
109 |     function getDictionaryAddress(MCDevKit storage, address proxy) internal view returns (address) {
110 |         return ForgeHelper.getDictionaryAddress(proxy);
111 |     }
112 | 
113 |     function assumeAddressIsNotReserved(MCDevKit storage, address addr) internal pure {
114 |         ForgeHelper.assumeAddressIsNotReserved(addr);
115 |     }
116 | 
117 |     /**
118 |      * ----------------
119 |      *     📓 Context
120 |      * ------------------
121 |      */
122 |     function msgSender(MCDevKit storage) internal returns (address) {
123 |         return ForgeHelper.msgSender();
124 |     }
125 | 
126 |     /**
127 |      * ---------------
128 |      *     🏷️ Label
129 |      * -----------------
130 |      */
131 |     function assignLabel(MCDevKit storage, address addr, string memory name) internal returns (address) {
132 |         return ForgeHelper.assignLabel(addr, name);
133 |     }
134 | 
135 |     function getLabel(MCDevKit storage, address addr) internal view returns (string memory) {
136 |         return ForgeHelper.getLabel(addr);
137 |     }
138 | 
139 |     /**
140 |      * ------------------
141 |      *     📡 Broadcast
142 |      * --------------------
143 |      */
144 |     function pauseBroadcast(MCDevKit storage) internal {
145 |         ForgeHelper.pauseBroadcast();
146 |     }
147 | 
148 |     function resumeBroadcast(MCDevKit storage, bool isBroadcasting, address currentSender) internal {
149 |         ForgeHelper.resumeBroadcast(isBroadcasting, currentSender);
150 |     }
151 | 
152 |     /**
153 |      * ----------------------
154 |      *     🛠️ Forge Extender
155 |      * ------------------------
156 |      */
157 |     function expectRevert(MCDevKit storage, string memory message) internal {
158 |         vm.expectRevert(bytes(message));
159 |     }
160 | }
161 | 


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1 | # Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
  2 | 
  3 | ## Our Pledge
  4 | 
  5 | We as members, contributors, and leaders pledge to make participation in our
  6 | community a harassment-free experience for everyone, regardless of age, body
  7 | size, visible or invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender
  8 | identity and expression, level of experience, education, socio-economic status,
  9 | nationality, personal appearance, race, religion, or sexual identity
 10 | and orientation.
 11 | 
 12 | We pledge to act and interact in ways that contribute to an open, welcoming,
 13 | diverse, inclusive, and healthy community.
 14 | 
 15 | ## Our Standards
 16 | 
 17 | Examples of behavior that contributes to a positive environment for our
 18 | community include:
 19 | 
 20 | * Demonstrating empathy and kindness toward other people
 21 | * Being respectful of differing opinions, viewpoints, and experiences
 22 | * Giving and gracefully accepting constructive feedback
 23 | * Accepting responsibility and apologizing to those affected by our mistakes,
 24 |   and learning from the experience
 25 | * Focusing on what is best not just for us as individuals, but for the
 26 |   overall community
 27 | 
 28 | Examples of unacceptable behavior include:
 29 | 
 30 | * The use of sexualized language or imagery, and sexual attention or
 31 |   advances of any kind
 32 | * Trolling, insulting or derogatory comments, and personal or political attacks
 33 | * Public or private harassment
 34 | * Publishing others' private information, such as a physical or email
 35 |   address, without their explicit permission
 36 | * Other conduct which could reasonably be considered inappropriate in a
 37 |   professional setting
 38 | 
 39 | ## Enforcement Responsibilities
 40 | 
 41 | Community leaders are responsible for clarifying and enforcing our standards of
 42 | acceptable behavior and will take appropriate and fair corrective action in
 43 | response to any behavior that they deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive,
 44 | or harmful.
 45 | 
 46 | Community leaders have the right and responsibility to remove, edit, or reject
 47 | comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, and other contributions that are
 48 | not aligned to this Code of Conduct, and will communicate reasons for moderation
 49 | decisions when appropriate.
 50 | 
 51 | ## Scope
 52 | 
 53 | This Code of Conduct applies within all community spaces, and also applies when
 54 | an individual is officially representing the community in public spaces.
 55 | Examples of representing our community include using an official e-mail address,
 56 | posting via an official social media account, or acting as an appointed
 57 | representative at an online or offline event.
 58 | 
 59 | ## Enforcement
 60 | 
 61 | Instances of abusive, harassing, or otherwise unacceptable behavior may be
 62 | reported to the community leaders responsible for enforcement at
 63 | <TODO>.
 64 | All complaints will be reviewed and investigated promptly and fairly.
 65 | 
 66 | All community leaders are obligated to respect the privacy and security of the
 67 | reporter of any incident.
 68 | 
 69 | ## Enforcement Guidelines
 70 | 
 71 | Community leaders will follow these Community Impact Guidelines in determining
 72 | the consequences for any action they deem in violation of this Code of Conduct:
 73 | 
 74 | ### 1. Correction
 75 | 
 76 | **Community Impact**: Use of inappropriate language or other behavior deemed
 77 | unprofessional or unwelcome in the community.
 78 | 
 79 | **Consequence**: A private, written warning from community leaders, providing
 80 | clarity around the nature of the violation and an explanation of why the
 81 | behavior was inappropriate. A public apology may be requested.
 82 | 
 83 | ### 2. Warning
 84 | 
 85 | **Community Impact**: A violation through a single incident or series
 86 | of actions.
 87 | 
 88 | **Consequence**: A warning with consequences for continued behavior. No
 89 | interaction with the people involved, including unsolicited interaction with
 90 | those enforcing the Code of Conduct, for a specified period of time. This
 91 | includes avoiding interactions in community spaces as well as external channels
 92 | like social media. Violating these terms may lead to a temporary or
 93 | permanent ban.
 94 | 
 95 | ### 3. Temporary Ban
 96 | 
 97 | **Community Impact**: A serious violation of community standards, including
 98 | sustained inappropriate behavior.
 99 | 
100 | **Consequence**: A temporary ban from any sort of interaction or public
101 | communication with the community for a specified period of time. No public or
102 | private interaction with the people involved, including unsolicited interaction
103 | with those enforcing the Code of Conduct, is allowed during this period.
104 | Violating these terms may lead to a permanent ban.
105 | 
106 | ### 4. Permanent Ban
107 | 
108 | **Community Impact**: Demonstrating a pattern of violation of community
109 | standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior,  harassment of an
110 | individual, or aggression toward or disparagement of classes of individuals.
111 | 
112 | **Consequence**: A permanent ban from any sort of public interaction within
113 | the community.
114 | 
115 | ## Attribution
116 | 
117 | This Code of Conduct is adapted from the [Contributor Covenant][homepage],
118 | version 2.0, available at
119 | https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/0/code_of_conduct.html.
120 | 
121 | Community Impact Guidelines were inspired by [Mozilla's code of conduct
122 | enforcement ladder](https://github.com/mozilla/diversity).
123 | 
124 | [homepage]: https://www.contributor-covenant.org
125 | 
126 | For answers to common questions about this code of conduct, see the FAQ at
127 | https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations are available at
128 | https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.
129 | 


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
/site/docs/03-api/03-api-details/Flattened.sol/library.ERC1967Utils.md:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1 | # ERC1967Utils
  2 | [Git Source](https://github.com/metacontract/mc/blob/main/src/devkit/Flattened.sol)
  3 | 
  4 | *This abstract contract provides getters and event emitting update functions for
  5 | https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-1967[EIP1967] slots.*
  6 | 
  7 | 
  8 | ## State Variables
  9 | ### IMPLEMENTATION_SLOT
 10 | *Storage slot with the address of the current implementation.
 11 | This is the keccak-256 hash of "eip1967.proxy.implementation" subtracted by 1.*
 12 | 
 13 | 
 14 | ```solidity
 15 | bytes32 internal constant IMPLEMENTATION_SLOT = 0x360894a13ba1a3210667c828492db98dca3e2076cc3735a920a3ca505d382bbc;
 16 | ```
 17 | 
 18 | 
 19 | ### ADMIN_SLOT
 20 | *Storage slot with the admin of the contract.
 21 | This is the keccak-256 hash of "eip1967.proxy.admin" subtracted by 1.*
 22 | 
 23 | 
 24 | ```solidity
 25 | bytes32 internal constant ADMIN_SLOT = 0xb53127684a568b3173ae13b9f8a6016e243e63b6e8ee1178d6a717850b5d6103;
 26 | ```
 27 | 
 28 | 
 29 | ### BEACON_SLOT
 30 | *The storage slot of the UpgradeableBeacon contract which defines the implementation for this proxy.
 31 | This is the keccak-256 hash of "eip1967.proxy.beacon" subtracted by 1.*
 32 | 
 33 | 
 34 | ```solidity
 35 | bytes32 internal constant BEACON_SLOT = 0xa3f0ad74e5423aebfd80d3ef4346578335a9a72aeaee59ff6cb3582b35133d50;
 36 | ```
 37 | 
 38 | 
 39 | ## Functions
 40 | ### getImplementation
 41 | 
 42 | *Returns the current implementation address.*
 43 | 
 44 | 
 45 | ```solidity
 46 | function getImplementation() internal view returns (address);
 47 | ```
 48 | 
 49 | ### _setImplementation
 50 | 
 51 | *Stores a new address in the EIP1967 implementation slot.*
 52 | 
 53 | 
 54 | ```solidity
 55 | function _setImplementation(address newImplementation) private;
 56 | ```
 57 | 
 58 | ### upgradeToAndCall
 59 | 
 60 | *Performs implementation upgrade with additional setup call if data is nonempty.
 61 | This function is payable only if the setup call is performed, otherwise `msg.value` is rejected
 62 | to avoid stuck value in the contract.
 63 | Emits an [IERC1967-Upgraded](contract.UpgradeableBeacon.md#upgraded) event.*
 64 | 
 65 | 
 66 | ```solidity
 67 | function upgradeToAndCall(address newImplementation, bytes memory data) internal;
 68 | ```
 69 | 
 70 | ### getAdmin
 71 | 
 72 | *Returns the current admin.
 73 | TIP: To get this value clients can read directly from the storage slot shown below (specified by EIP1967) using
 74 | the https://eth.wiki/json-rpc/API#eth_getstorageat[`eth_getStorageAt`] RPC call.
 75 | `0xb53127684a568b3173ae13b9f8a6016e243e63b6e8ee1178d6a717850b5d6103`*
 76 | 
 77 | 
 78 | ```solidity
 79 | function getAdmin() internal view returns (address);
 80 | ```
 81 | 
 82 | ### _setAdmin
 83 | 
 84 | *Stores a new address in the EIP1967 admin slot.*
 85 | 
 86 | 
 87 | ```solidity
 88 | function _setAdmin(address newAdmin) private;
 89 | ```
 90 | 
 91 | ### changeAdmin
 92 | 
 93 | *Changes the admin of the proxy.
 94 | Emits an [IERC1967-AdminChanged](../../../lib/ucs-contracts/lib/openzeppelin-contracts/contracts/proxy/ERC1967/ERC1967Utils.sol/library.ERC1967Utils.md#adminchanged) event.*
 95 | 
 96 | 
 97 | ```solidity
 98 | function changeAdmin(address newAdmin) internal;
 99 | ```
100 | 
101 | ### getBeacon
102 | 
103 | *Returns the current beacon.*
104 | 
105 | 
106 | ```solidity
107 | function getBeacon() internal view returns (address);
108 | ```
109 | 
110 | ### _setBeacon
111 | 
112 | *Stores a new beacon in the EIP1967 beacon slot.*
113 | 
114 | 
115 | ```solidity
116 | function _setBeacon(address newBeacon) private;
117 | ```
118 | 
119 | ### upgradeBeaconToAndCall
120 | 
121 | *Change the beacon and trigger a setup call if data is nonempty.
122 | This function is payable only if the setup call is performed, otherwise `msg.value` is rejected
123 | to avoid stuck value in the contract.
124 | Emits an [IERC1967-BeaconUpgraded](../../../lib/ucs-contracts/lib/openzeppelin-contracts/contracts/proxy/ERC1967/ERC1967Utils.sol/library.ERC1967Utils.md#beaconupgraded) event.
125 | CAUTION: Invoking this function has no effect on an instance of {BeaconProxy} since v5, since
126 | it uses an immutable beacon without looking at the value of the ERC-1967 beacon slot for
127 | efficiency.*
128 | 
129 | 
130 | ```solidity
131 | function upgradeBeaconToAndCall(address newBeacon, bytes memory data) internal;
132 | ```
133 | 
134 | ### _checkNonPayable
135 | 
136 | *Reverts if `msg.value` is not zero. It can be used to avoid `msg.value` stuck in the contract
137 | if an upgrade doesn't perform an initialization call.*
138 | 
139 | 
140 | ```solidity
141 | function _checkNonPayable() private;
142 | ```
143 | 
144 | ## Events
145 | ### Upgraded
146 | *Emitted when the implementation is upgraded.*
147 | 
148 | 
149 | ```solidity
150 | event Upgraded(address indexed implementation);
151 | ```
152 | 
153 | ### AdminChanged
154 | *Emitted when the admin account has changed.*
155 | 
156 | 
157 | ```solidity
158 | event AdminChanged(address previousAdmin, address newAdmin);
159 | ```
160 | 
161 | ### BeaconUpgraded
162 | *Emitted when the beacon is changed.*
163 | 
164 | 
165 | ```solidity
166 | event BeaconUpgraded(address indexed beacon);
167 | ```
168 | 
169 | ## Errors
170 | ### ERC1967InvalidImplementation
171 | *The `implementation` of the proxy is invalid.*
172 | 
173 | 
174 | ```solidity
175 | error ERC1967InvalidImplementation(address implementation);
176 | ```
177 | 
178 | ### ERC1967InvalidAdmin
179 | *The `admin` of the proxy is invalid.*
180 | 
181 | 
182 | ```solidity
183 | error ERC1967InvalidAdmin(address admin);
184 | ```
185 | 
186 | ### ERC1967InvalidBeacon
187 | *The `beacon` of the proxy is invalid.*
188 | 
189 | 
190 | ```solidity
191 | error ERC1967InvalidBeacon(address beacon);
192 | ```
193 | 
194 | ### ERC1967NonPayable
195 | *An upgrade function sees `msg.value > 0` that may be lost.*
196 | 
197 | 
198 | ```solidity
199 | error ERC1967NonPayable();
200 | ```
201 | 
202 | 


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
/test/devkit/MCInitLib.t.sol:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1 | // SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT
  2 | pragma solidity ^0.8.23;
  3 | 
  4 | import {
  5 |     MCTestBase,
  6 |     MessageHead as HEAD,
  7 |     Function,
  8 |     Inspector,
  9 |     Bundle,
 10 |     DummyFunction,
 11 |     DummyFacade
 12 | } from "@mc-devkit/Flattened.sol";
 13 | 
 14 | import {InitSetAdmin} from "@mc-std/functions/protected/InitSetAdmin.sol";
 15 | import {GetFunctions} from "@mc-std/functions/GetFunctions.sol";
 16 | import {Clone} from "@mc-std/functions/Clone.sol";
 17 | 
 18 | contract MCInitLibTest is MCTestBase {
 19 |     using Inspector for string;
 20 |     using Inspector for address;
 21 | 
 22 |     function _isInitSetAdmin(Function memory func) internal returns (bool) {
 23 |         return func.name.isEqual("InitSetAdmin") && func.selector == InitSetAdmin.initSetAdmin.selector
 24 |             && func.implementation.isContract();
 25 |     }
 26 | 
 27 |     function _isGetFunctions(Function memory func) internal view returns (bool) {
 28 |         return func.name.isEqual("GetFunctions") && func.selector == GetFunctions.getFunctions.selector
 29 |             && func.implementation.isContract();
 30 |     }
 31 | 
 32 |     function _isClone(Function memory func) internal view returns (bool) {
 33 |         return func.name.isEqual("Clone") && func.selector == Clone.clone.selector && func.implementation.isContract();
 34 |     }
 35 | 
 36 |     /**
 37 |      * --------------------
 38 |      *     🌱 Init Bundle
 39 |      * ----------------------
 40 |      */
 41 |     function test_init_Success_withName() public {
 42 |         string memory name = "TestBundleName";
 43 |         mc.init(name);
 44 | 
 45 |         assertTrue(mc.bundle.bundles[name].name.isEqual(name));
 46 |         assertTrue(mc.bundle.current.name.isEqual(name));
 47 |     }
 48 | 
 49 |     /**
 50 |      * ---------------------
 51 |      *     🔗 Use Function
 52 |      * -----------------------
 53 |      */
 54 |     function assertFunctionAdded(
 55 |         string memory bundleName,
 56 |         uint256 functionsIndex,
 57 |         string memory functionName,
 58 |         bytes4 selector,
 59 |         address impl
 60 |     ) internal view {
 61 |         Bundle memory bundle = mc.bundle.bundles[bundleName];
 62 |         assertEq(bundle.name, bundleName);
 63 |         assertEq(bundle.facade, address(0));
 64 |         Function memory func = mc.functions.functions[functionName];
 65 |         assertEq(func.name, functionName);
 66 |         assertEq(func.selector, selector);
 67 |         assertEq(func.implementation, impl);
 68 |         assertTrue(bundle.functions[functionsIndex].isEqual(func));
 69 |         assertEq(mc.functions.current.name, functionName);
 70 |     }
 71 | 
 72 |     function test_use_Success() public {
 73 |         string memory bundleName = mc.bundle.genUniqueName();
 74 | 
 75 |         string memory functionName = "DummyFunction";
 76 |         bytes4 selector = DummyFunction.dummy.selector;
 77 |         address impl = address(new DummyFunction());
 78 | 
 79 |         mc.use(functionName, selector, impl);
 80 | 
 81 |         assertFunctionAdded(bundleName, 0, functionName, selector, impl);
 82 |     }
 83 | 
 84 |     function test_use_Success_WithDifferentSelector() public {
 85 |         string memory bundleName = mc.bundle.genUniqueName();
 86 | 
 87 |         string memory functionName = "DummyFunction";
 88 |         bytes4 selector = DummyFunction.dummy.selector;
 89 |         bytes4 selector2 = DummyFunction.dummy2.selector;
 90 |         address impl = address(new DummyFunction());
 91 | 
 92 |         mc.use(functionName, selector, impl);
 93 |         mc.use(functionName, selector2, impl);
 94 | 
 95 |         assertFunctionAdded(bundleName, 1, functionName, selector2, impl);
 96 |     }
 97 | 
 98 |     function test_use_Revert_WithSameSelector() public {
 99 |         string memory functionName = "DummyFunction";
100 |         bytes4 selector = DummyFunction.dummy.selector;
101 |         address impl = address(new DummyFunction());
102 | 
103 |         mc.use(functionName, selector, impl);
104 | 
105 |         mc.expectRevert(HEAD.BUNDLE_CONTAINS_SAME_SELECTOR);
106 |         mc.use(functionName, selector, impl);
107 |     }
108 | 
109 |     function test_use_Revert_EmptyName() public {
110 |         string memory functionName = "";
111 |         bytes4 selector = DummyFunction.dummy.selector;
112 |         address impl = address(new DummyFunction());
113 | 
114 |         mc.expectRevert(HEAD.NAME_REQUIRED);
115 |         mc.use(functionName, selector, impl);
116 |     }
117 | 
118 |     function test_use_Revert_NotContract() public {
119 |         string memory functionName = "DummyFunction";
120 |         bytes4 selector = DummyFunction.dummy.selector;
121 |         address impl = makeAddr("EOA");
122 | 
123 |         mc.expectRevert(HEAD.ADDRESS_NOT_CONTRACT);
124 |         mc.use(functionName, selector, impl);
125 |     }
126 | 
127 |     /**
128 |      * ------------------
129 |      *     🪟 Use Facade
130 |      * --------------------
131 |      */
132 |     function test_useFacade_Success() public {
133 |         address facade = address(new DummyFacade());
134 |         mc.init();
135 |         mc.useFacade(facade);
136 |     }
137 | 
138 |     /**
139 |      * --------------------------------
140 |      *     🏰 Setup Standard Functions
141 |      * ----------------------------------
142 |      */
143 |     function test_setupStdFuncs_Success() public {
144 |         mc.setupStdFunctions();
145 | 
146 |         assertTrue(_isInitSetAdmin(mc.std.functions.initSetAdmin));
147 |         assertTrue(_isGetFunctions(mc.std.functions.getFunctions));
148 |         assertTrue(_isClone(mc.std.functions.clone));
149 | 
150 |         assertTrue(mc.std.all.functions.length == 3);
151 |         assertTrue(_isInitSetAdmin(mc.std.all.functions[0]));
152 |         assertTrue(_isGetFunctions(mc.std.all.functions[1]));
153 |         assertTrue(_isClone(mc.std.all.functions[2]));
154 |     }
155 | }
156 |

/src/devkit/registry/StdFunctions.sol:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1 | // SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT
  2 | pragma solidity ^0.8.23;
  3 | /**
  4 |  * ---------------------
  5 |  *     Support Methods
  6 |  * -----------------------
  7 |  */
  8 | 
  9 | import {Tracer} from "@mc-devkit/system/Tracer.sol";
 10 | import {TypeGuard, TypeStatus} from "@mc-devkit/types/TypeGuard.sol";
 11 | // Validation
 12 | import {Validator} from "@mc-devkit/system/Validator.sol";
 13 | import {Logger} from "@mc-devkit/system/Logger.sol";
 14 | 
 15 | // Core Types
 16 | import {Function} from "@mc-devkit/core/Function.sol";
 17 | // MC Std
 18 | import {Clone} from "@mc-std/functions/Clone.sol";
 19 | import {GetFunctions} from "@mc-std/functions/GetFunctions.sol";
 20 | import {FeatureToggle} from "@mc-std/functions/protected/FeatureToggle.sol";
 21 | import {InitSetAdmin} from "@mc-std/functions/protected/InitSetAdmin.sol";
 22 | import {UpgradeDictionary} from "@mc-std/functions/protected/UpgradeDictionary.sol";
 23 | import {StdFacade} from "@mc-std/interfaces/StdFacade.sol";
 24 | 
 25 | //////////////////////////////////////////////////////
 26 | //  🏰 Standard Functions    /////////////////////////
 27 | using StdFunctionsLib for StdFunctions global;
 28 | using Tracer for StdFunctions global;
 29 | using TypeGuard for StdFunctions global;
 30 | //////////////////////////////////////////////////////
 31 | 
 32 | struct StdFunctions {
 33 |     Function initSetAdmin;
 34 |     Function getFunctions;
 35 |     Function clone;
 36 |     TypeStatus status;
 37 | }
 38 | 
 39 | library StdFunctionsLib {
 40 |     /**
 41 |      * ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
 42 |      *     🟢 Complete Standard Functions
 43 |      *     📨 Fetch Standard Functions from Env
 44 |      *     🚀 Deploy Standard Functions If Not Exists
 45 |      * ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
 46 |      */
 47 | 
 48 |     /**
 49 |      * ------------------------------------
 50 |      *     🟢 Complete Standard Functions
 51 |      * --------------------------------------
 52 |      */
 53 |     function complete(StdFunctions storage std) internal returns (StdFunctions storage) {
 54 |         uint256 pid = std.startProcess("complete");
 55 |         std.fetch();
 56 |         std.deployIfNotExists();
 57 |         std.lock();
 58 |         return std.finishProcess(pid);
 59 |     }
 60 | 
 61 |     /**
 62 |      * -----------------------------------------
 63 |      *     📨 Fetch Standard Functions from Env
 64 |      * -------------------------------------------
 65 |      */
 66 |     function fetch(StdFunctions storage std) internal returns (StdFunctions storage) {
 67 |         uint256 pid = std.startProcess("fetch");
 68 |         std.startBuilding();
 69 |         std.fetch_InitSetAdmin().fetch_GetFunctions().fetch_Clone();
 70 |         std.finishBuilding();
 71 |         return std.finishProcess(pid);
 72 |     }
 73 | 
 74 |     /**
 75 |      * ===== Each Std Function =====
 76 |      */
 77 |     function fetch_InitSetAdmin(StdFunctions storage std) internal returns (StdFunctions storage) {
 78 |         uint256 pid = std.startProcess("fetch_InitSetAdmin");
 79 |         std.initSetAdmin.fetch("InitSetAdmin").assignSelector(InitSetAdmin.initSetAdmin.selector);
 80 |         Logger.logDebug(std.initSetAdmin.toString());
 81 |         return std.finishProcess(pid);
 82 |     }
 83 | 
 84 |     function fetch_GetFunctions(StdFunctions storage std) internal returns (StdFunctions storage) {
 85 |         uint256 pid = std.startProcess("fetch_GetFunctions");
 86 |         std.getFunctions.fetch("GetFunctions").assignSelector(GetFunctions.getFunctions.selector);
 87 |         Logger.logDebug(std.getFunctions.toString());
 88 |         return std.finishProcess(pid);
 89 |     }
 90 | 
 91 |     function fetch_Clone(StdFunctions storage std) internal returns (StdFunctions storage) {
 92 |         uint256 pid = std.startProcess("fetch_Clone");
 93 |         std.clone.fetch("Clone").assignSelector(Clone.clone.selector);
 94 |         Logger.logDebug(std.clone.toString());
 95 |         return std.finishProcess(pid);
 96 |     }
 97 | 
 98 |     /**
 99 |      * -----------------------------------------------
100 |      *     🚀 Deploy Standard Functions If Not Exists
101 |      *     TODO versioning
102 |      * -------------------------------------------------
103 |      */
104 |     function deployIfNotExists(StdFunctions storage std) internal returns (StdFunctions storage) {
105 |         uint256 pid = std.startProcess("deployIfNotExists");
106 |         std.startBuilding();
107 |         std.deployIfNotExists_InitSetAdmin().deployIfNotExists_GetFunctions().deployIfNotExists_Clone();
108 |         std.finishBuilding();
109 |         return std.finishProcess(pid);
110 |     }
111 |     /**
112 |      * ===== Each Std Function =====
113 |      */
114 | 
115 |     function deployIfNotExists_InitSetAdmin(StdFunctions storage std) internal returns (StdFunctions storage) {
116 |         uint256 pid = std.startProcess("deployIfNotExists_InitSetAdmin");
117 |         if (std.initSetAdmin.hasNotContract()) {
118 |             std.initSetAdmin.assignImplementation(address(new InitSetAdmin()));
119 |         }
120 |         return std.finishProcess(pid);
121 |     }
122 | 
123 |     function deployIfNotExists_GetFunctions(StdFunctions storage std) internal returns (StdFunctions storage) {
124 |         uint256 pid = std.startProcess("deployIfNotExists_GetFunctions");
125 |         if (std.getFunctions.hasNotContract()) {
126 |             std.getFunctions.assignImplementation(address(new GetFunctions()));
127 |         }
128 |         return std.finishProcess(pid);
129 |     }
130 | 
131 |     function deployIfNotExists_Clone(StdFunctions storage std) internal returns (StdFunctions storage) {
132 |         uint256 pid = std.startProcess("deployIfNotExists_Clone");
133 |         if (std.clone.hasNotContract()) {
134 |             std.clone.assignImplementation(address(new Clone()));
135 |         }
136 |         return std.finishProcess(pid);
137 |     }
138 | }
139 |

148 | ### hashInitCode
149 | 
150 | *returns the hash of the init code (creation code + no args) used in CREATE2 with no constructor arguments*
151 | 
152 | 
153 | ```solidity
154 | function hashInitCode(bytes memory creationCode) internal pure returns (bytes32);
155 | ```
156 | **Parameters**
157 | 
158 | |Name|Type|Description|
159 | |----|----|-----------|
160 | |`creationCode`|`bytes`|the creation code of a contract C, as returned by type(C).creationCode|
161 | 
162 | 
163 | ### hashInitCode
164 | 
165 | *returns the hash of the init code (creation code + ABI-encoded args) used in CREATE2*
166 | 
167 | 
168 | ```solidity
169 | function hashInitCode(bytes memory creationCode, bytes memory args) internal pure returns (bytes32);
170 | ```
171 | **Parameters**
172 | 
173 | |Name|Type|Description|
174 | |----|----|-----------|
175 | |`creationCode`|`bytes`|the creation code of a contract C, as returned by type(C).creationCode|
176 | |`args`|`bytes`|the ABI-encoded arguments to the constructor of C|
177 | 
178 |

/site/docs/03-api/02-usage.md:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1 | ---
  2 | keywords: [devkit, usage, scripting, testing, UCS]
  3 | tags: [devkit, usage, scripting, testing, UCS]
  4 | last_update:
  5 |   date: 2024-10-28
  6 |   author: Meta Contract Development Team
  7 | ---
  8 | 
  9 | # Usage Guide
 10 | 
 11 | This guide provides an overview of key functions and modifiers in the Meta Contract DevKit, focusing on their usage in scripting and testing scenarios.
 12 | 
 13 | ## Primary Object
 14 | 
 15 | The primary object `mc` is available in both `MCTest` and `MCScript` base contracts. It provides a set of functions and modifiers for testing and scripting.
 16 | 
 17 | ### mc.init
 18 | 
 19 | This function initializes the **bundle** with a given name, which is a set of functions acting as a proxy for the current meta contract. It prepares the bundle for use in both testing and scripting scenarios.
 20 | 
 21 | - Example usage:
 22 |     ```solidity
 23 |     function setUp() public {
 24 |         mc.init("MyBundle");
 25 |     }
 26 |     ```
 27 | 
 28 | ### mc.use
 29 | 
 30 | This function sets the **function** with a given name, selector and address to be used for the current bundle.
 31 | 
 32 | - Example usage:
 33 |     ```solidity
 34 |     function setUp() public {
 35 |         mc.use("MyFunctionA", MyFunctionA.myFunctionA.selector, address(new MyFunctionA()));
 36 |         mc.use("MyFunctionB", MyFunctionB.myFunctionB.selector, address(new MyFunctionB()));
 37 |     }
 38 |     ```
 39 | 
 40 | ### mc.deploy
 41 | 
 42 | This function deploys all contracts (including the bundled functions, dictionary and proxy) with a given init bytecode.
 43 | 
 44 | - Example usage:
 45 |     ```solidity
 46 |     function setUp() public {
 47 |         mc.deploy(abi.encodeCall(Initialize.initialize, (params1, params2)));
 48 |     }
 49 |     ```
 50 | 
 51 | ### mc.toProxyAddress
 52 | 
 53 | This function returns the address of the proxy contract.
 54 | 
 55 | - Example usage:
 56 |     ```solidity
 57 |     function setUp() public {
 58 |         address myMetaContract = mc.toProxyAddress();
 59 |     }
 60 |     ```
 61 | 
 62 | ## For Testing
 63 | 
 64 | For writing tests, you'll use the `MCTest` base contract. Here are some key functions and modifiers:
 65 | 
 66 | ### startPrankWithDeployer
 67 | 
 68 | This modifier is used in testing to simulate transactions or function calls from the deployer's address.
 69 | 
 70 | ```solidity
 71 | modifier startPrankWithDeployer();
 72 | ```
 73 | 
 74 | **Example:**
 75 | ```solidity
 76 | function setUp() public startPrankWithDeployer {
 77 |     // Test setup logic here
 78 | }
 79 | ```
 80 | 
 81 | ### setDictionary
 82 | 
 83 | This function allows manual setting or updating of the dictionary contract address for a target contract in tests.
 84 | 
 85 | ```solidity
 86 | function setDictionary(address target, address dictionary) internal;
 87 | ```
 88 | 
 89 | **Example:**
 90 | ```solidity
 91 | setDictionary(proxy, dictionary);
 92 | ```
 93 | 
 94 | ### ignorePrecompiles
 95 | 
 96 | This function excludes precompiled contracts from consideration in certain test cases.
 97 | 
 98 | ```solidity
 99 | function ignorePrecompiles(address target) internal;
100 | ```
101 | 
102 | **Example:**
103 | ```solidity
104 | ignorePrecompiles(dictionary);
105 | ```
106 | 
107 | ## For Scripting
108 | 
109 | When writing deployment or interaction scripts, you'll typically use the `MCScript` base contract. Here's a key modifier you'll often use:
110 | 
111 | ### startBroadcastWithDeployerPrivKey
112 | 
113 | This modifier is used in scripting to broadcast transactions using the deployer's private key.
114 | 
115 | ```solidity
116 | modifier startBroadcastWithDeployerPrivKey();
117 | ```
118 | 
119 | **Example:**
120 | ```solidity
121 | function run() public startBroadcastWithDeployerPrivKey {
122 |     // Deployment script logic here
123 | }
124 | ```
125 | 
126 | ## Object Lifecycle Management
127 | 
128 | The DevKit provides a system for managing the lifecycle of core Meta Contract objects (Function, Bundle, Proxy, Dictionary) to efficiently handle the core architecture known as UCS.
129 | 
130 | ### Core Objects
131 | - Function
132 | - Bundle
133 | - Proxy
134 | - Dictionary
135 | 
136 | ### States
137 | - ***Uninitialized***: The initial state of an object when it is created but not yet initialized.
138 | - ***Building***: The state where the object is being constructed, and its member variables are being set.
139 | - ***Built***: The state where the object is fully constructed and ready for use.
140 | - ***Locked***: The state where the object is locked and cannot be modified.
141 | 
142 | ### Methods
143 | Key methods for lifecycle management include:
144 | 
145 | 1. `startBuilding()`
146 |     - Transitions the object from the _Uninitialized_ or _Built_ state to the _Building_ state.
147 |     - Called when the object's member variables need to be modified.
148 |     - Allows the object to be modified even if it was previously in the _Built_ state.
149 | 2. `finishBuilding()`
150 |     - Attempts to transition the object from the _Building_ state to the _Built_ state.
151 |     - Called after the object's member variables have been modified.
152 |     - Checks if all the member variables are in a valid state.
153 |         - If successful, transitions the object to the _Built_ state.
154 |         - If unsuccessful, outputs a warning and keeps the object in the _Building_ state.
155 | 3. `lock()`
156 |     - Transitions the object from the _Built_ state to the _Locked_ state.
157 |     - Prevents any further modifications to the object.
158 | 
159 | ### Diagram
160 | ```mermaid
161 | stateDiagram-v2
162 |     state Uninitialized
163 |     state Building
164 |     state Built
165 |     state Locked
166 |     state try <<choice>>
167 |     Uninitialized --> Building: startBuilding()
168 |     Building --> Building: startBuilding()
169 |     Building --> try: finishBuilding()
170 |     try --> Built: success
171 |     try --> Building: failure
172 |     Built --> Locked: lock()
173 |     Built --> Building: startBuilding()
174 | 
175 |     classDef uninitialized fill:#FFD700,color:#333
176 |     classDef building fill:#FFA500,color:#333
177 |     classDef built fill:#7FFF00,color:#333
178 |     classDef locked fill:#87CEEB,color:#333
179 |     class Uninitialized uninitialized
180 |     class Building building
181 |     class Built built
182 |     class Locked locked
183 | ```
184 | 
185 | ## Best Practices
186 | 
187 | 1. Always use the appropriate base contract (`MCTest` for testing, `MCScript` for scripting) to ensure access to all relevant DevKit features.
188 | 2. Leverage the object lifecycle management system to maintain the integrity of your Meta Contract objects throughout their usage.
189 | 3. Use the provided modifiers and functions to simulate different scenarios in your tests, ensuring comprehensive coverage of your contract's behavior.
190 | 
191 | For more advanced usage patterns and detailed API documentation, refer to the [DevKit API Details](./03-api-details/index.md) section.
192 | 


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
/src/devkit/types/Formatter.sol:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1 | // SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT
  2 | pragma solidity ^0.8.23;
  3 | 
  4 | // Forge-std
  5 | import {StdStyle} from "forge-std/StdStyle.sol";
  6 | 
  7 | // Core Types
  8 | import {Function} from "@mc-devkit/core/Function.sol";
  9 | import {Bundle} from "@mc-devkit/core/Bundle.sol";
 10 | // Utils
 11 | import {vm} from "@mc-devkit/utils/ForgeHelper.sol";
 12 | import {Process} from "@mc-devkit/system/Tracer.sol";
 13 | 
 14 | /**
 15 |  * ==================
 16 |  *     🗒️ Formatter
 17 |  * ====================
 18 |  */
 19 | library Formatter {
 20 |     using Formatter for string;
 21 |     using Formatter for bytes4;
 22 |     using Formatter for address;
 23 |     using StdStyle for string;
 24 | 
 25 |     /**
 26 |      * ==================
 27 |      *     🧩 Function
 28 |      * ====================
 29 |      */
 30 |     function toString(Function memory func) internal pure returns (string memory message) {
 31 |         return message.append("Impl: ").append(func.implementation).comma().append("Selector: ").append(func.selector)
 32 |             .comma().append("Name: ").append(func.name);
 33 |     }
 34 | 
 35 |     /**
 36 |      * ===============
 37 |      *     🗂️ Bundle
 38 |      * =================
 39 |      */
 40 |     function toString(Bundle storage bundle) internal view returns (string memory message) {
 41 |         message = message.append("Facade: ").append(bundle.facade);
 42 |         Function[] memory _funcs = bundle.functions;
 43 |         for (uint256 i; i < _funcs.length; ++i) {
 44 |             message = message.br().append(toString(_funcs[i]));
 45 |         }
 46 |     }
 47 | 
 48 |     /**
 49 |      * =================
 50 |      *     ⛓️ Process
 51 |      * ===================
 52 |      */
 53 |     function toLocation(Process memory process) internal pure returns (string memory) {
 54 |         string memory at = "\t    at ";
 55 |         return at.append(process.libName.dot().append(process.funcName.addParens())).dim().br();
 56 |     }
 57 | 
 58 |     function formatPid(uint256 pid) internal pure returns (string memory) {
 59 |         string memory PID = "pid:";
 60 |         string memory strPid = vm.toString(pid);
 61 |         string memory paddedPid = pid < 10 ? string.concat("0", strPid) : strPid;
 62 |         return PID.append(paddedPid).sp();
 63 |     }
 64 | 
 65 |     function toStart(Process memory process, uint256 pid) internal pure returns (string memory) {
 66 |         string memory header = formatPid(pid);
 67 |         string memory nest;
 68 |         for (uint256 i; i <= process.nest; ++i) {
 69 |             nest = string.concat(nest, "> ");
 70 |         }
 71 |         return header.append(nest.dim()).append(process.libName.dot().append(process.funcName)).append(
 72 |             process.params.parens().dim().italic()
 73 |         );
 74 |     }
 75 | 
 76 |     function toFinish(Process memory process, uint256 pid) internal pure returns (string memory) {
 77 |         string memory header = formatPid(pid);
 78 |         string memory nest;
 79 |         for (uint256 i; i <= process.nest; ++i) {
 80 |             nest = string.concat(nest, "< ");
 81 |         }
 82 |         return header.append(nest).append(process.libName.dot().append(process.funcName.addParens())).dim();
 83 |     }
 84 | 
 85 |     function toMessage(string memory head, string memory body) internal pure returns (string memory) {
 86 |         return head.sp().append(body);
 87 |     }
 88 | 
 89 |     /**
 90 |      * ===================
 91 |      *     🧱 Primitives
 92 |      * =====================
 93 |      */
 94 |     /// 📝 String
 95 |     function append(string memory str, string memory addition) internal pure returns (string memory) {
 96 |         return string.concat(str, addition);
 97 |     }
 98 | 
 99 |     function append(string memory str, address addr) internal pure returns (string memory) {
100 |         return str.append(vm.toString(addr));
101 |     }
102 | 
103 |     function append(string memory str, bytes4 selector) internal pure returns (string memory) {
104 |         return str.append(selector.toString());
105 |     }
106 | 
107 |     function append(string memory str, uint256 num) internal pure returns (string memory) {
108 |         return str.append(vm.toString(num));
109 |     }
110 | 
111 |     function br(string memory str) internal pure returns (string memory) {
112 |         return string.concat(str, "\n");
113 |     }
114 | 
115 |     function sp(string memory str) internal pure returns (string memory) {
116 |         return string.concat(str, " ");
117 |     }
118 | 
119 |     function indent(string memory str) internal pure returns (string memory) {
120 |         return string.concat(str, "\t");
121 |     }
122 | 
123 |     function comma(string memory str) internal pure returns (string memory) {
124 |         return string.concat(str, ", ");
125 |     }
126 | 
127 |     function comma(string memory str, string memory addition) internal pure returns (string memory) {
128 |         return string.concat(str, ", ", addition);
129 |     }
130 | 
131 |     function comma(string memory str, bytes4 b4) internal pure returns (string memory) {
132 |         return string.concat(str, ", ", b4.toString());
133 |     }
134 | 
135 |     function comma(string memory str, address addr) internal pure returns (string memory) {
136 |         return string.concat(str, ", ", addr.toString());
137 |     }
138 | 
139 |     function dot(string memory str) internal pure returns (string memory) {
140 |         return string.concat(str, ".");
141 |     }
142 | 
143 |     function addParens(string memory str) internal pure returns (string memory) {
144 |         return string.concat(str, "()");
145 |     }
146 | 
147 |     function parens(string memory str) internal pure returns (string memory) {
148 |         return string.concat("(", str, ")");
149 |     }
150 | 
151 |     function brackL(string memory str) internal pure returns (string memory) {
152 |         return string.concat("[", str);
153 |     }
154 | 
155 |     function brackR(string memory str) internal pure returns (string memory) {
156 |         return string.concat(str, "]");
157 |     }
158 | 
159 |     function toSequential(string memory str, uint256 i) internal pure returns (string memory) {
160 |         return i == 1 ? str : str.append(i);
161 |     }
162 | 
163 |     function toString(address addr) internal pure returns (string memory) {
164 |         return vm.toString(addr);
165 |     }
166 | 
167 |     function toBytes32(address addr) internal pure returns (bytes32) {
168 |         return bytes32(uint256(uint160(addr)));
169 |     }
170 | 
171 |     function toString(bytes4 selector) internal pure returns (string memory) {
172 |         return vm.toString(selector).substring(10);
173 |     }
174 | 
175 |     function toBytes(string memory str) internal pure returns (bytes memory) {
176 |         return bytes(str);
177 |     }
178 | 
179 |     function substring(string memory str, uint256 n) internal pure returns (string memory) {
180 |         bytes memory strBytes = bytes(str);
181 |         bytes memory result = new bytes(n);
182 |         for (uint256 i = 0; i < n; i++) {
183 |             result[i] = strBytes[i];
184 |         }
185 |         return string(result);
186 |     }
187 | }
188 |

  1 | ---
