  5 |   date: 2024-10-26
  6 |   author: Meta Contract Development Team
  7 | ---
  8 | 
  9 | # Key Concepts and Architecture
 10 | 
 11 | Meta Contract implements the UCS (Upgradeable Clone for Scalable Contracts) architecture, providing a flexible and modular approach to smart contract development. This document outlines the key concepts of Meta Contract and provides an overview of its architecture, explaining how its components interact to create upgradeable and scalable smart contract systems.
 12 | 
 13 | ## Core Components and Concepts
 14 | 
 15 | The UCS architecture consists of three main components:
 16 | 
 17 | 1. Proxy Contract
 18 | 2. Dictionary Contract
 19 | 3. Function Contracts
 20 | 
 21 | Let's explore each of these components, their roles in the system, and the key concepts they embody.
 22 | 
 23 | ### 1. Proxy Contract
 24 | 
 25 | The Proxy Contract is the entry point for all interactions with a Meta Contract. It serves two primary purposes:
 26 | 
 27 | - **State Management**: The Proxy Contract stores and manages the state of the entire Meta Contract system.
 28 | - **Function Delegation**: It delegates function calls to the appropriate Function Contracts based on the function selector.
 29 | 
 30 | Key points:
 31 | - The Proxy Contract's address remains constant, even when upgrading functionality.
 32 | - It uses `delegatecall` to execute functions in other contracts while maintaining its own state.
 33 | - When a user interacts with the Meta Contract, they send their transaction to the Proxy Contract's address.
 34 | 
 35 | ### 2. Dictionary Contract
 36 | 
 37 | The Dictionary Contract acts as a registry for all Function Contracts within a Meta Contract. Its main responsibilities are:
 38 | 
 39 | - Mapping function selectors to the addresses of their corresponding Function Contracts.
 40 | - Providing a mechanism to update these mappings, enabling upgrades.
 41 | 
 42 | Key points:
 43 | - The Dictionary Contract can be upgraded to add new functions or change existing function mappings.
 44 | - It plays a crucial role in the upgradeability and modularity of Meta Contracts.
 45 | - When the Proxy Contract receives a call, it consults the Dictionary Contract to find the address of the appropriate Function Contract.
 46 | 
 47 | ### 3. Function Contracts
 48 | 
 49 | Function Contracts contain the actual logic for individual functions or groups of related functions. They are the building blocks of a Meta Contract's functionality.
 50 | 
 51 | Key characteristics:
 52 | - Each Function Contract is independent and can be upgraded separately.
 53 | - They don't store state directly but instead work with the state stored in the Proxy Contract.
 54 | - Function Contracts can be shared across multiple Meta Contract instances, promoting code reuse.
 55 | - They are designed to be stateless, working with the state stored in the Proxy Contract.
 56 | - In Meta Contracts, a collection of multiple functions made available together is referred to as a ***bundle***.
 57 | 
 58 | ## Architecture Overview
 59 | 
 60 | The following diagram illustrates how these components interact within the UCS architecture:
 61 | 
 62 | ```mermaid
 63 | graph TD
 64 |     A[User] -->|Interacts with| B[Proxy Contract]
 65 |     B -->|Looks up function| C[Dictionary Contract]
 66 |     C -->|Returns function address| B
 67 |     B -->|Delegates call| D[Function Contract]
 68 |     D -->|Executes logic| B
 69 |     B -->|Returns result| A
 70 | 
 71 |     style A color:#000000,fill:#ffffcc,stroke:#cccc00,stroke-width:2px
 72 |     style B color:#000000,fill:#ffcccc,stroke:#ff0000,stroke-width:2px
 73 |     style C color:#000000,fill:#ccffcc,stroke:#00ff00,stroke-width:2px
 74 |     style D color:#000000,fill:#ccccff,stroke:#0000ff,stroke-width:2px
 75 | ```
 76 | 
 77 | ## Key Features
 78 | 
 79 | ### 1. Upgradeability
 80 | 
 81 | Upgradeability is a core feature of Meta Contracts, allowing for the evolution of contract functionality without changing the contract's address or losing its state. This allows for granular upgrades without changing the Proxy Contract's address or disrupting the overall system.
 82 | 
 83 | How it works:
 84 | - To upgrade a function, deploy a new Function Contract and update the Dictionary Contract to point to the new address.
 85 | - The Proxy Contract will then delegate calls to the new Function Contract automatically.
 86 | 
 87 | Benefits:
 88 | - Bug fixes and feature improvements can be implemented without disrupting the entire system.
 89 | - Reduces the need for complex migration processes when updating contract logic.
 90 | 
 91 | ### 2. Cloneability
 92 | 
 93 | Cloneability refers to the ability to create multiple instances of a Meta Contract with minimal gas costs.
 94 | 
 95 | Key aspects:
 96 | - Multiple Proxy Contracts can be deployed, each with its own state.
 97 | - These Proxy Contracts can share the same Dictionary Contract and Function Contracts.
 98 | - This approach reduces deployment costs and allows for the creation of multiple instances of standardized contracts.
 99 | 
100 | Use cases:
101 | - Creating multiple instances of a standardized contract (e.g., token contracts, voting systems).
102 | - Deploying personalized contract instances for users or organizations. (e.g. contract wallets, DAO contracts)
103 | 
104 | ### 3. Contract Size Management
105 | 
106 | By splitting logic into individual Function Contracts, Meta Contracts effectively bypass the 24.576kB contract size limit. This modular approach allows for more complex and feature-rich contracts without being constrained by size limitations.
107 | 
108 | ### 4. Schema-based Storage Management
109 | 
110 | The use of a schema-based storage management system simplifies handling storage conflicts during contract upgrades. This system ensures that storage layouts remain consistent and conflicts are minimized, facilitating smoother upgrades and maintenance.
111 | 
112 | ## Security Considerations
113 | 
114 | While the Meta Contract architecture offers great flexibility, it's important to consider security aspects:
115 | 
116 | - Access controls should be implemented to restrict who can update the Dictionary Contract.
117 | - Thorough testing and auditing of new Function Contracts is crucial before deployment.
118 | - Monitoring and fail-safe mechanisms should be in place to detect and respond to potential issues.
119 | 
120 | ## Conclusion
121 | 
122 | The Meta Contract architecture, based on the UCS model, provides a powerful and flexible approach to smart contract development. By separating concerns between state management, function mapping, and logic implementation, it enables upgradeable, modular, and scalable smart contract systems.
123 | 
124 | These key concepts and architectural components work together to create a flexible, upgradeable, and efficient smart contract system. As you progress through this documentation, you'll see how these concepts are applied in practice and how they contribute to the power and versatility of Meta Contracts.
125 | 
126 | For more detailed information on specific aspects of Meta Contracts, please refer to the following resources:
127 | 
128 | - [Meta Contract Deployment](../02-guides/03-operations/01-deployment.md)
129 | - [Upgrading Meta Contracts](../02-guides/03-operations/03-upgrades.md)
130 | 


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------

/src/devkit/types/TypeGuard.sol:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1 | // SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT
  2 | pragma solidity ^0.8.23;
  3 | 
  4 | import {Inspector} from "@mc-devkit/types/Inspector.sol";
  5 | import {Validator} from "@mc-devkit/system/Validator.sol";
  6 | // Core Types
  7 | import {Function} from "@mc-devkit/core/Function.sol";
  8 | import {Bundle} from "@mc-devkit/core/Bundle.sol";
  9 | import {Dictionary} from "@mc-devkit/core/Dictionary.sol";
 10 | import {Proxy} from "@mc-devkit/core/Proxy.sol";
 11 | import {StdRegistry} from "@mc-devkit/registry/StdRegistry.sol";
 12 | import {StdFunctions} from "@mc-devkit/registry/StdFunctions.sol";
 13 | 
 14 | using Inspector for TypeStatus global;
 15 | 
 16 | enum TypeStatus {
 17 |     Uninitialized,
 18 |     Building,
 19 |     Built,
 20 |     Locked
 21 | }
 22 | 
 23 | /**
 24 |  * ==================================================
 25 |  *     🔒 Type Guard
 26 |  *     @dev See details in docs/object_lifecycle.md
 27 |  * ====================================================
 28 |  */
 29 | library TypeGuard {
 30 |     using Inspector for bool;
 31 | 
 32 |     /**
 33 |      * ==================
 34 |      *     🧩 Function
 35 |      * ====================
 36 |      */
 37 |     function startBuilding(Function storage func) internal returns (Function storage) {
 38 |         uint256 pid = func.startProcess("startBuilding");
 39 |         Validator.MUST_NotLocked(func);
 40 |         func.status = TypeStatus.Building;
 41 |         return func.finishProcess(pid);
 42 |     }
 43 | 
 44 |     function finishBuilding(Function storage func) internal returns (Function storage) {
 45 |         uint256 pid = func.startProcess("finishBuilding");
 46 |         Validator.MUST_Building(func);
 47 |         if (Validator.ValidateBuilder(func)) func.status = TypeStatus.Built;
 48 |         return func.finishProcess(pid);
 49 |     }
 50 | 
 51 |     function lock(Function storage func) internal returns (Function storage) {
 52 |         uint256 pid = func.startProcess("lock");
 53 |         Validator.MUST_Built(func);
 54 |         func.status = TypeStatus.Locked;
 55 |         return func.finishProcess(pid);
 56 |     }
 57 | 
 58 |     /**
 59 |      * ================
 60 |      *     🗂️ Bundle
 61 |      * ==================
 62 |      */
 63 |     function startBuilding(Bundle storage bundle) internal returns (Bundle storage) {
 64 |         uint256 pid = bundle.startProcess("startBuilding");
 65 |         Validator.MUST_NotLocked(bundle);
 66 |         bundle.status = TypeStatus.Building;
 67 |         return bundle.finishProcess(pid);
 68 |     }
 69 | 
 70 |     function finishBuilding(Bundle storage bundle) internal returns (Bundle storage) {
 71 |         uint256 pid = bundle.startProcess("finishBuilding");
 72 |         Validator.MUST_Building(bundle);
 73 |         if (Validator.ValidateBuilder(bundle)) bundle.status = TypeStatus.Built;
 74 |         return bundle.finishProcess(pid);
 75 |     }
 76 | 
 77 |     function lock(Bundle storage bundle) internal returns (Bundle storage) {
 78 |         uint256 pid = bundle.startProcess("lock");
 79 |         Validator.MUST_Built(bundle);
 80 |         bundle.status = TypeStatus.Locked;
 81 |         return bundle.finishProcess(pid);
 82 |     }
 83 | 
 84 |     /**
 85 |      * ===============
 86 |      *     🏠 Proxy
 87 |      * =================
 88 |      */
 89 |     function startBuilding(Proxy memory proxy) internal returns (Proxy memory) {
 90 |         uint256 pid = proxy.startProcess("startBuilding");
 91 |         Validator.MUST_NotLocked(proxy);
 92 |         proxy.status = TypeStatus.Building;
 93 |         return proxy.finishProcess(pid);
 94 |     }
 95 | 
 96 |     function finishBuilding(Proxy memory proxy) internal returns (Proxy memory) {
 97 |         uint256 pid = proxy.startProcess("finishBuilding");
 98 |         Validator.MUST_Building(proxy);
 99 |         if (Validator.ValidateBuilder(proxy)) proxy.status = TypeStatus.Built;
100 |         return proxy.finishProcess(pid);
101 |     }
102 | 
103 |     function lock(Proxy storage proxy) internal returns (Proxy storage) {
104 |         uint256 pid = proxy.startProcess("lock");
105 |         Validator.MUST_Built(proxy);
106 |         proxy.status = TypeStatus.Locked;
107 |         return proxy.finishProcessInStorage(pid);
108 |     }
109 | 
110 |     /**
111 |      * ====================
112 |      *     📚 Dictionary
113 |      * ======================
114 |      */
115 |     function startBuilding(Dictionary memory dictionary) internal returns (Dictionary memory) {
116 |         uint256 pid = dictionary.startProcess("startBuilding");
117 |         Validator.MUST_NotLocked(dictionary);
118 |         dictionary.status = TypeStatus.Building;
119 |         return dictionary.finishProcess(pid);
120 |     }
121 | 
122 |     function finishBuilding(Dictionary memory dictionary) internal returns (Dictionary memory) {
123 |         uint256 pid = dictionary.startProcess("finishBuilding");
124 |         Validator.MUST_Building(dictionary);
125 |         if (Validator.ValidateBuilder(dictionary)) dictionary.status = TypeStatus.Built;
126 |         return dictionary.finishProcess(pid);
127 |     }
128 | 
129 |     function lock(Dictionary storage dictionary) internal returns (Dictionary storage) {
130 |         uint256 pid = dictionary.startProcess("lock");
131 |         Validator.MUST_Built(dictionary);
132 |         dictionary.status = TypeStatus.Locked;
133 |         return dictionary.finishProcessInStorage(pid);
134 |     }
135 | 
136 |     /**
137 |      * ==========================
138 |      *     🏛 Standard Registry
139 |      * ============================
140 |      */
141 |     function startBuilding(StdRegistry storage registry) internal returns (StdRegistry storage) {
142 |         uint256 pid = registry.startProcess("startBuilding");
143 |         Validator.MUST_NotLocked(registry);
144 |         registry.status = TypeStatus.Building;
145 |         return registry.finishProcess(pid);
146 |     }
147 | 
148 |     function finishBuilding(StdRegistry storage registry) internal returns (StdRegistry storage) {
149 |         uint256 pid = registry.startProcess("finishBuilding");
150 |         Validator.MUST_Building(registry);
151 |         if (Validator.ValidateBuilder(registry)) registry.status = TypeStatus.Built;
152 |         return registry.finishProcess(pid);
153 |     }
154 | 
155 |     function lock(StdRegistry storage registry) internal returns (StdRegistry storage) {
156 |         uint256 pid = registry.startProcess("lock");
157 |         Validator.MUST_Built(registry);
158 |         registry.status = TypeStatus.Locked;
159 |         return registry.finishProcess(pid);
160 |     }
161 | 
162 |     /**
163 |      * ==========================
164 |      *     🏰 Standard Functions
165 |      * ============================
166 |      */
167 |     function startBuilding(StdFunctions storage std) internal returns (StdFunctions storage) {
168 |         uint256 pid = std.startProcess("startBuilding");
169 |         Validator.MUST_NotLocked(std);
170 |         std.status = TypeStatus.Building;
171 |         return std.finishProcess(pid);
172 |     }
173 | 
174 |     function finishBuilding(StdFunctions storage std) internal returns (StdFunctions storage) {
175 |         uint256 pid = std.startProcess("finishBuilding");
176 |         Validator.MUST_Building(std);
177 |         if (Validator.ValidateBuilder(std)) std.status = TypeStatus.Built;
178 |         return std.finishProcess(pid);
179 |     }
180 | 
181 |     function lock(StdFunctions storage std) internal returns (StdFunctions storage) {
182 |         uint256 pid = std.startProcess("lock");
183 |         Validator.MUST_Built(std);
184 |         std.status = TypeStatus.Locked;
185 |         return std.finishProcess(pid);
186 |     }
187 | }
188 |

/site/docs/03-api/03-api-details/Flattened.sol/interface.IERC721.md:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1 | # IERC721
  2 | [Git Source](https://github.com/metacontract/mc/blob/main/src/devkit/Flattened.sol)
  3 | 
  4 | **Inherits:**
  5 | [IERC165_0](interface.IERC165_0.md)
  6 | 
  7 | *See https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-721
  8 | Note: the ERC-165 identifier for this interface is 0x80ac58cd.*
  9 | 
 10 | 
 11 | ## Functions
 12 | ### balanceOf
 13 | 
 14 | Count all NFTs assigned to an owner
 15 | 
 16 | *NFTs assigned to the zero address are considered invalid, and this
 17 | function throws for queries about the zero address.*
 18 | 
 19 | 
 20 | ```solidity
 21 | function balanceOf(address _owner) external view returns (uint256);
 22 | ```
 23 | **Parameters**
 24 | 
 25 | |Name|Type|Description|
 26 | |----|----|-----------|
 27 | |`_owner`|`address`|An address for whom to query the balance|
 28 | 
 29 | **Returns**
 30 | 
 31 | |Name|Type|Description|
 32 | |----|----|-----------|
 33 | |`<none>`|`uint256`|The number of NFTs owned by `_owner`, possibly zero|
 34 | 
 35 | 
 36 | ### ownerOf
 37 | 
 38 | Find the owner of an NFT
 39 | 
 40 | *NFTs assigned to zero address are considered invalid, and queries
 41 | about them do throw.*
 42 | 
 43 | 
 44 | ```solidity
 45 | function ownerOf(uint256 _tokenId) external view returns (address);
 46 | ```
 47 | **Parameters**
 48 | 
 49 | |Name|Type|Description|
 50 | |----|----|-----------|
 51 | |`_tokenId`|`uint256`|The identifier for an NFT|
 52 | 
 53 | **Returns**
 54 | 
 55 | |Name|Type|Description|
 56 | |----|----|-----------|
 57 | |`<none>`|`address`|The address of the owner of the NFT|
 58 | 
 59 | 
 60 | ### safeTransferFrom
 61 | 
 62 | Transfers the ownership of an NFT from one address to another address
 63 | 
 64 | *Throws unless `msg.sender` is the current owner, an authorized
 65 | operator, or the approved address for this NFT. Throws if `_from` is
 66 | not the current owner. Throws if `_to` is the zero address. Throws if
 67 | `_tokenId` is not a valid NFT. When transfer is complete, this function
 68 | checks if `_to` is a smart contract (code size > 0). If so, it calls
 69 | `onERC721Received` on `_to` and throws if the return value is not
 70 | `bytes4(keccak256("onERC721Received(address,address,uint256,bytes)"))`.*
 71 | 
 72 | 
 73 | ```solidity
 74 | function safeTransferFrom(address _from, address _to, uint256 _tokenId, bytes calldata data) external payable;
 75 | ```
 76 | **Parameters**
 77 | 
 78 | |Name|Type|Description|
 79 | |----|----|-----------|
 80 | |`_from`|`address`|The current owner of the NFT|
 81 | |`_to`|`address`|The new owner|
 82 | |`_tokenId`|`uint256`|The NFT to transfer|
 83 | |`data`|`bytes`|Additional data with no specified format, sent in call to `_to`|
 84 | 
 85 | 
 86 | ### safeTransferFrom
 87 | 
 88 | Transfers the ownership of an NFT from one address to another address
 89 | 
 90 | *This works identically to the other function with an extra data parameter,
 91 | except this function just sets data to "".*
 92 | 
 93 | 
 94 | ```solidity
 95 | function safeTransferFrom(address _from, address _to, uint256 _tokenId) external payable;
 96 | ```
 97 | **Parameters**
 98 | 
 99 | |Name|Type|Description|
100 | |----|----|-----------|
101 | |`_from`|`address`|The current owner of the NFT|
102 | |`_to`|`address`|The new owner|
103 | |`_tokenId`|`uint256`|The NFT to transfer|
104 | 
105 | 
106 | ### transferFrom
107 | 
108 | Transfer ownership of an NFT -- THE CALLER IS RESPONSIBLE
109 | TO CONFIRM THAT `_to` IS CAPABLE OF RECEIVING NFTS OR ELSE
110 | THEY MAY BE PERMANENTLY LOST
111 | 
112 | *Throws unless `msg.sender` is the current owner, an authorized
113 | operator, or the approved address for this NFT. Throws if `_from` is
114 | not the current owner. Throws if `_to` is the zero address. Throws if
115 | `_tokenId` is not a valid NFT.*
116 | 
117 | 
118 | ```solidity
119 | function transferFrom(address _from, address _to, uint256 _tokenId) external payable;
120 | ```
121 | **Parameters**
122 | 
123 | |Name|Type|Description|
124 | |----|----|-----------|
125 | |`_from`|`address`|The current owner of the NFT|
126 | |`_to`|`address`|The new owner|
127 | |`_tokenId`|`uint256`|The NFT to transfer|
128 | 
129 | 
130 | ### approve
131 | 
132 | Change or reaffirm the approved address for an NFT
133 | 
134 | *The zero address indicates there is no approved address.
135 | Throws unless `msg.sender` is the current NFT owner, or an authorized
136 | operator of the current owner.*
137 | 
138 | 
139 | ```solidity
140 | function approve(address _approved, uint256 _tokenId) external payable;
141 | ```
142 | **Parameters**
143 | 
144 | |Name|Type|Description|
145 | |----|----|-----------|
146 | |`_approved`|`address`|The new approved NFT controller|
147 | |`_tokenId`|`uint256`|The NFT to approve|
148 | 
149 | 
150 | ### setApprovalForAll
151 | 
152 | Enable or disable approval for a third party ("operator") to manage
153 | all of `msg.sender`'s assets
154 | 
155 | *Emits the ApprovalForAll event. The contract MUST allow
156 | multiple operators per owner.*
157 | 
158 | 
159 | ```solidity
160 | function setApprovalForAll(address _operator, bool _approved) external;
161 | ```
162 | **Parameters**
163 | 
164 | |Name|Type|Description|
165 | |----|----|-----------|
166 | |`_operator`|`address`|Address to add to the set of authorized operators|
167 | |`_approved`|`bool`|True if the operator is approved, false to revoke approval|
168 | 
169 | 
170 | ### getApproved
171 | 
172 | Get the approved address for a single NFT
173 | 
174 | *Throws if `_tokenId` is not a valid NFT.*
175 | 
176 | 
177 | ```solidity
178 | function getApproved(uint256 _tokenId) external view returns (address);
179 | ```
180 | **Parameters**
181 | 
182 | |Name|Type|Description|
183 | |----|----|-----------|
184 | |`_tokenId`|`uint256`|The NFT to find the approved address for|
185 | 
186 | **Returns**
187 | 
188 | |Name|Type|Description|
189 | |----|----|-----------|
190 | |`<none>`|`address`|The approved address for this NFT, or the zero address if there is none|
191 | 
192 | 
193 | ### isApprovedForAll
194 | 
195 | Query if an address is an authorized operator for another address
196 | 
197 | 
198 | ```solidity
199 | function isApprovedForAll(address _owner, address _operator) external view returns (bool);
200 | ```
201 | **Parameters**
202 | 
203 | |Name|Type|Description|
204 | |----|----|-----------|
205 | |`_owner`|`address`|The address that owns the NFTs|
206 | |`_operator`|`address`|The address that acts on behalf of the owner|
207 | 
208 | **Returns**
209 | 
210 | |Name|Type|Description|
211 | |----|----|-----------|
212 | |`<none>`|`bool`|True if `_operator` is an approved operator for `_owner`, false otherwise|
213 | 
214 | 
215 | ## Events
216 | ### Transfer
217 | *This emits when ownership of any NFT changes by any mechanism.
218 | This event emits when NFTs are created (`from` == 0) and destroyed
219 | (`to` == 0). Exception: during contract creation, any number of NFTs
220 | may be created and assigned without emitting Transfer. At the time of
221 | any transfer, the approved address for that NFT (if any) is reset to none.*
222 | 
223 | 
224 | ```solidity
225 | event Transfer(address indexed _from, address indexed _to, uint256 indexed _tokenId);
226 | ```
227 | 
228 | ### Approval
229 | *This emits when the approved address for an NFT is changed or
230 | reaffirmed. The zero address indicates there is no approved address.
231 | When a Transfer event emits, this also indicates that the approved
232 | address for that NFT (if any) is reset to none.*
233 | 
234 | 
235 | ```solidity
236 | event Approval(address indexed _owner, address indexed _approved, uint256 indexed _tokenId);
237 | ```
238 | 
239 | ### ApprovalForAll
240 | *This emits when an operator is enabled or disabled for an owner.
241 | The operator can manage all NFTs of the owner.*
242 | 
243 | 
244 | ```solidity
245 | event ApprovalForAll(address indexed _owner, address indexed _operator, bool _approved);
246 | ```
247 | 
248 | 


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
/site/docs/02-guides/03-operations/03-upgrades.md:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1 | ---
  2 | keywords: [upgrades, smart-contracts, blockchain, foundry, metacontract]
  3 | tags: [upgrades, smart-contracts, blockchain, foundry, metacontract]
  4 | last_update:
  5 |   date: 2024-10-28
  6 |   author: Meta Contract DevOps Team
  7 | ---
  8 | 
  9 | # Upgrades
 10 | 
 11 | This guide outlines the upgrade mechanisms available in Meta Contract and how to safely implement contract upgrades using Foundry.
 12 | 
 13 | ## Table of Contents
 14 | 
 15 | 1. [Understanding Meta Contract Upgrades](#understanding-meta-contract-upgrades)
 16 | 2. [Preparing for an Upgrade](#preparing-for-an-upgrade)
 17 | 3. [Implementing the Upgrade](#implementing-the-upgrade)
 18 | <!-- 4. [Testing Upgraded Contracts](#testing-upgraded-contracts) -->
 19 | 5. [Deploying the Upgrade](#deploying-the-upgrade)
 20 | 6. [Post-Upgrade Verification](#post-upgrade-verification)
 21 | <!-- 7. [Security Considerations](#security-considerations) -->
 22 | <!-- 8. [Best Practices](#best-practices) -->
 23 | 
 24 | ## Understanding Meta Contract Upgrades
 25 | 
 26 | Meta Contract uses a unique upgradeability system that allows for:
 27 | 
 28 | 1. **Function-Level Upgrades**: Ability to upgrade specific functions without affecting the entire contract.
 29 | 2. **Storage Layout Preservation**: Ensures that existing storage is not corrupted during upgrades.
 30 | 3. **Upgrade Access Control**: Restricts who can perform upgrades to maintain security.
 31 | 
 32 | ## Preparing for an Upgrade
 33 | 
 34 | 1. **Identify the Need**: Determine which functions or components need upgrading.
 35 | 2. **Design the Upgrade**: Plan the changes, ensuring they don't conflict with existing storage layout.
 36 | 3. **Create New Implementation**: Write the new implementation contract with the upgraded functions.
 37 | 
 38 | ## Implementing the Upgrade
 39 | 
 40 | Use Foundry and Meta Contract's DevKit to create and test the upgrade:
 41 | 
 42 | 1. Create a new implementation contract:
 43 | 
 44 |     ```solidity
 45 |     // File: src/voting-system/functions/VoteV2.sol
 46 | 
 47 |     // SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT
 48 |     pragma solidity ^0.8.24;
 49 | 
 50 |     import {Storage, Schema} from "bundle/voting-system/storages/Storage.sol";
 51 | 
 52 |     contract VoteV2 {
 53 |         // Implementation
 54 |         function vote(uint256 proposalId) public {
 55 |             Schema.Proposal storage $proposal = Storage.Proposals().getProposal(proposalId);
 56 | 
 57 |             // Check if the proposal exists
 58 |             if (!$proposal.exists()) revert VotingSystemErrors.ProposalNotFound();
 59 | 
 60 |             // Check if the voter has already voted
 61 |             if ($proposal.hasVoted(msg.sender)) revert VotingSystemErrors.AlreadyVoted();
 62 | 
 63 |             // Record the vote
 64 |             $proposal.setVote(msg.sender, true);
 65 | 
 66 |             // Emit event
 67 |             emit VoteCast(proposalId, msg.sender);
 68 |         }
 69 |     }
 70 | 
 71 |     // Unit Testing
 72 |     import {MCTest} from "@mc-devkit/Flattened.sol";
 73 |     import {VotingSystemErrors} from "bundle/voting-system/interfaces/VotingSystemErrors.sol";
 74 |     import {VotingSystemEvents} from "bundle/voting-system/interfaces/VotingSystemEvents.sol";
 75 | 
 76 |     contract VoteV2Test is MCTest {
 77 |         function setUp() public {
 78 |             address _voteV2 = address(new VoteV2());
 79 |             _use(Vote.vote.selector, _voteV2);
 80 |         }
 81 | 
 82 |         function test_vote_success() public {
 83 |             // Setup: Create a proposal
 84 |             uint256 proposalId = 1;
 85 |             Storage.Proposals().createProposal(proposalId, Schema.Proposal({exists: true, ...}));
 86 | 
 87 |             // Test: Expect VoteCast event
 88 |             vm.expectEmit();
 89 |             emit VoteCast(proposalId, address(this));
 90 | 
 91 |             // Action: Cast a vote
 92 |             Vote(target).vote(proposalId);
 93 | 
 94 |             // Assert: Check that the vote was recorded
 95 |             assertTrue(Storage.Proposals().getProposal(proposalId).hasVoted(address(this)));
 96 |         }
 97 | 
 98 |         function test_vote_alreadyVoted() public {
 99 |             // Setup: Create a proposal and record a vote
100 |             uint256 proposalId = 1;
101 |             Storage.Proposals().createProposal(proposalId, Schema.Proposal({exists: true, ...}));
102 |             Storage.Proposals().setVote(proposalId, address(this), true);
103 | 
104 |             // Test: Expect revert
105 |             vm.expectRevert(VotingSystemErrors.AlreadyVoted.selector);
106 | 
107 |             // Action: Attempt to vote again
108 |             Vote(target).vote(proposalId);
109 |         }
110 |     }
111 |     ```
112 | 
113 | 2. Create an upgrade script:
114 | 
115 |     ```solidity
116 |     // scripts/Upgrade.s.sol
117 | 
118 |     // SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT
119 |     pragma solidity ^0.8.24;
120 | 
121 |     import {MCScript} from "@mc-devkit/Flattened.sol";
122 |     import {VotingSystemUpgrader} from "script/VotingSystemUpgrader.sol";
123 | 
124 |     contract UpgradeVoteToV2Script is MCScript {
125 |         function run() public startBroadcastWith("DEPLOYER_PRIV_KEY") {
126 |             address votingSystem = vm.envAddress("VOTING_SYSTEM_PROXY_ADDR");
127 |             VotingSystemUpgrader.upgradeVoteToV2(mc, votingSystem);
128 |         }
129 |     }
130 |     ```
131 | 
132 |     ```solidity
133 |     // script/VotingSystemUpgrader.s.sol
134 | 
135 |     // SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT
136 |     pragma solidity ^0.8.24;
137 | 
138 |     import {VoteV2} from "bundle/voting-system/functions/VoteV2.sol";
139 |     import {VotingSystemFacade} from "bundle/voting-system/interfaces/VotingSystemFacade.sol";
140 | 
141 |     library VotingSystemUpgrader {
142 |         /**
143 |         * @dev Upgrade the VotingSystem contract
144 |         * @param mc MCDevKit storage reference
145 |         * @return votingSystem Address of the deployed VotingSystem proxy
146 |         */
147 |         function upgradeVoteToV2(MCDevKit storage mc, address votingSystem) internal {
148 |             Dictionary memory _dictionary = mc.loadDictionary("Dictionary", mc.getDictionaryAddress(votingSystem));
149 |             address _voteV2_ = address(new VoteV2());
150 |             _dictionary.set(VoteV2.vote.selector, _voteV2);
151 | 
152 |             // Upgrade facade if needed
153 |             _dictionary.upgradeFacade(address(new VotingSystemFacade()));
154 |         }
155 |     }
156 |     ```
157 | 
158 | <!-- ## Testing Upgraded Contracts
159 | 
160 | 1. Write tests for the new implementation:
161 | 
162 |     ```solidity
163 |     // test/MyContractV2.t.sol
164 |     pragma solidity ^0.8.13;
165 | 
166 |     import "forge-std/Test.sol";
167 |     import "../contracts/MyContractV2.sol";
168 | 
169 |     contract MyContractV2Test is Test {
170 |         MyContractV2 public myContract;
171 | 
172 |         function setUp() public {
173 |             myContract = new MyContractV2();
174 |             myContract.initializer();
175 |         }
176 | 
177 |         function testNewFunction() public {
178 |             assertEq(myContract.newFunction(), "This is a new function");
179 |         }
180 | 
181 |         function testUpgradedExistingFunction() public {
182 |             assertEq(myContract.existingFunction(), 42);
183 |         }
184 |     }
185 |     ```
186 | 
187 | 2. Run the tests:
188 | 
189 |     ```bash
190 |     forge test
191 |     ``` -->
192 | 
193 | ## Deploying the Upgrade
194 | 
195 | 1. Run and check the result the upgrade script using Foundry in the local environment with on-chain state:
196 |     ```bash
197 |     forge script UpgradeVoteToV2Script --rpc-url <YOUR_RPC_URL>
198 |     ```
199 | 
200 | 2. Run the script with sending transactions
201 |     ```bash
202 |     forge script UpgradeVoteToV2Script --rpc-url <YOUR_RPC_URL> --broadcast
203 |     ```
204 | 
205 | ## Post-Upgrade Verification
206 | 
207 | 1. **Functional Testing**: Verify that new functions work and existing functions haven't been adversely affected.
208 | 2. **Storage Integrity**: Ensure that existing data in the contract has been preserved.
209 | 3. **Event Monitoring**: Check for successful upgrade events emitted by the dictionary contract.
210 | 4. **Documentation Update**: Update project documentation to reflect the changes in the new version.
211 | 
212 | By following this guide, you can safely plan, implement, and deploy upgrades to your Meta Contract projects using Foundry.
213 | 


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
/site/docs/03-api/03-api-details/Flattened.sol/library.MessageHead.md:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1 | # MessageHead
  2 | [Git Source](https://github.com/metacontract/mc/blob/main/src/devkit/Flattened.sol)
  3 | 
  4 | 
  5 | ## State Variables
  6 | ### CONFIG_FILE_MISSING
  7 | 
  8 | ```solidity
  9 | string constant CONFIG_FILE_MISSING = "Config File Missing";
 10 | ```
 11 | 
 12 | 
 13 | ### CONFIG_FILE_REQUIRED
 14 | 
 15 | ```solidity
 16 | string constant CONFIG_FILE_REQUIRED = "Config File Required";
 17 | ```
 18 | 
 19 | 
 20 | ### NAME_REQUIRED
 21 | 
 22 | ```solidity
 23 | string constant NAME_REQUIRED = "Name Required";
 24 | ```
 25 | 
 26 | 
 27 | ### ENV_KEY_REQUIRED
 28 | 
 29 | ```solidity
 30 | string constant ENV_KEY_REQUIRED = "EnvKey Required";
 31 | ```
 32 | 
 33 | 
 34 | ### SELECTOR_RECOMMENDED
 35 | 
 36 | ```solidity
 37 | string constant SELECTOR_RECOMMENDED = "Empty Selector";
 38 | ```
 39 | 
 40 | 
 41 | ### ADDRESS_NOT_CONTRACT
 42 | 
 43 | ```solidity
 44 | string constant ADDRESS_NOT_CONTRACT = "Address Not Contract";
 45 | ```
 46 | 
 47 | 
 48 | ### FACADE_NOT_CONTRACT
 49 | 
 50 | ```solidity
 51 | string constant FACADE_NOT_CONTRACT = "Facade Not Contract";
 52 | ```
 53 | 
 54 | 
 55 | ### OWNER_ZERO_ADDRESS_RECOMMENDED
 56 | 
 57 | ```solidity
 58 | string constant OWNER_ZERO_ADDRESS_RECOMMENDED = "Owner Zero Address";
 59 | ```
 60 | 
 61 | 
 62 | ### CURRENT_NAME_NOT_FOUND
 63 | 
 64 | ```solidity
 65 | string constant CURRENT_NAME_NOT_FOUND = "Current Name Not Found";
 66 | ```
 67 | 
 68 | 
 69 | ### FUNC_NAME_UNASSIGNED
 70 | 
 71 | ```solidity
 72 | string constant FUNC_NAME_UNASSIGNED = "Function Name Unassigned";
 73 | ```
 74 | 
 75 | 
 76 | ### FUNC_CONTRACT_UNASSIGNED
 77 | 
 78 | ```solidity
 79 | string constant FUNC_CONTRACT_UNASSIGNED = "Implementation Contract Unassigned";
 80 | ```
 81 | 
 82 | 
 83 | ### FUNC_NOT_COMPLETE
 84 | 
 85 | ```solidity
 86 | string constant FUNC_NOT_COMPLETE = "Function Not Complete";
 87 | ```
 88 | 
 89 | 
 90 | ### FUNC_LOCKED
 91 | 
 92 | ```solidity
 93 | string constant FUNC_LOCKED = "Function Locked";
 94 | ```

  2 |  * Any CSS included here will be global. The classic template
  3 |  * bundles Infima by default. Infima is a CSS framework designed to
  4 |  * work well for content-centric websites.
  5 |  */
  6 | 
  7 | /* You can override the default Infima variables here. */

  9 |   --ifm-color-primary: #5b5bd6;

  4 | 
  5 | ## Functions
  6 | ### start
  7 | 
  8 | ----------------------------
  9 | 📈 Execution Tracking
 10 | ------------------------------
 11 | 
 12 | 
 13 | ```solidity
 14 | function start(string memory libName, string memory funcName, string memory params) internal returns (uint256 pid);
 15 | ```
 16 | 
 17 | ### finish
 18 | 
 19 | 
 20 | ```solidity
 21 | function finish(uint256 pid) internal;
 22 | ```
 23 | 
 24 | ### traceErrorLocations
 25 | 
 26 | 
 27 | ```solidity
 28 | function traceErrorLocations() internal view returns (string memory locations);
 29 | ```
 30 | 
 31 | ### startProcess
 32 | 
 33 | -----------
 34 | 🌞 mc
 35 | -------------
 36 | 
 37 | 
 38 | ```solidity
 39 | function startProcess(MCDevKit storage, string memory name, string memory params) internal returns (uint256);
 40 | ```

 47 | ```

 53 | function finishProcess(MCDevKit storage mc, uint256 pid) internal returns (MCDevKit storage);
 54 | ```

 61 | ```

241 | ### readBytesArrayOr

243 | 
244 | ```solidity
245 | function readBytesArrayOr(string memory toml, string memory key, bytes[] memory defaultValue)
246 |     internal
247 |     view
248 |     returns (bytes[] memory);
249 | ```
250 | 
251 | ### serialize
252 | 
253 | 
254 | ```solidity
255 | function serialize(string memory jsonKey, string memory rootObject) internal returns (string memory);
256 | ```
257 | 
258 | ### serialize
259 | 
260 | 
261 | ```solidity
262 | function serialize(string memory jsonKey, string memory key, bool value) internal returns (string memory);
263 | ```
264 | 
265 | ### serialize
266 | 
267 | 
268 | ```solidity
269 | function serialize(string memory jsonKey, string memory key, bool[] memory value) internal returns (string memory);
270 | ```
271 | 
272 | ### serialize
273 | 
274 | 
275 | ```solidity
276 | function serialize(string memory jsonKey, string memory key, uint256 value) internal returns (string memory);
277 | ```
278 | 
279 | ### serialize
280 | 
281 | 
282 | ```solidity
283 | function serialize(string memory jsonKey, string memory key, uint256[] memory value) internal returns (string memory);
284 | ```
285 | 
286 | ### serialize
287 | 
288 | 
289 | ```solidity
290 | function serialize(string memory jsonKey, string memory key, int256 value) internal returns (string memory);
291 | ```
292 | 
293 | ### serialize
294 | 
295 | 
296 | ```solidity
297 | function serialize(string memory jsonKey, string memory key, int256[] memory value) internal returns (string memory);
298 | ```
299 | 
300 | ### serialize
301 | 
302 | 
303 | ```solidity
304 | function serialize(string memory jsonKey, string memory key, address value) internal returns (string memory);
305 | ```
306 | 
307 | ### serialize
308 | 
309 | 
310 | ```solidity
311 | function serialize(string memory jsonKey, string memory key, address[] memory value) internal returns (string memory);
312 | ```
313 | 
314 | ### serialize
315 | 
316 | 
317 | ```solidity
318 | function serialize(string memory jsonKey, string memory key, bytes32 value) internal returns (string memory);
319 | ```
320 | 
321 | ### serialize
322 | 
323 | 
324 | ```solidity
325 | function serialize(string memory jsonKey, string memory key, bytes32[] memory value) internal returns (string memory);
326 | ```
327 | 
328 | ### serialize
329 | 
330 | 
331 | ```solidity
332 | function serialize(string memory jsonKey, string memory key, bytes memory value) internal returns (string memory);
333 | ```
334 | 
335 | ### serialize
336 | 
337 | 
338 | ```solidity
339 | function serialize(string memory jsonKey, string memory key, bytes[] memory value) internal returns (string memory);
340 | ```
341 | 
342 | ### serialize
343 | 
344 | 
345 | ```solidity
346 | function serialize(string memory jsonKey, string memory key, string memory value) internal returns (string memory);
347 | ```
348 | 
349 | ### serialize
350 | 
351 | 
352 | ```solidity
353 | function serialize(string memory jsonKey, string memory key, string[] memory value) internal returns (string memory);
354 | ```
355 | 
356 | ### write
357 | 
358 | 
359 | ```solidity
360 | function write(string memory jsonKey, string memory path) internal;
361 | ```
362 | 
363 | ### write
364 | 
365 | 
366 | ```solidity
367 | function write(string memory jsonKey, string memory path, string memory valueKey) internal;
368 | ```
369 |
