--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
/src/devkit/types/Inspector.sol:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1 | // SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT
  2 | pragma solidity ^0.8.23;
  3 | 
  4 | import {Validator} from "@mc-devkit/system/Validator.sol";
  5 | import {Inspector} from "@mc-devkit/types/Inspector.sol";
  6 | import {TypeStatus} from "@mc-devkit/types/TypeGuard.sol";
  7 | import {ForgeHelper} from "@mc-devkit/utils/ForgeHelper.sol";
  8 | // External Library
  9 | import {IDictionary} from "@ucs.mc/dictionary/interfaces/IDictionary.sol";
 10 | import {IBeacon as IVerifiable} from "@oz.mc/proxy/beacon/IBeacon.sol";
 11 | // Core Types
 12 | import {Function} from "@mc-devkit/core/Function.sol";
 13 | import {Bundle} from "@mc-devkit/core/Bundle.sol";
 14 | import {BundleRegistry} from "@mc-devkit/registry/BundleRegistry.sol";
 15 | import {Proxy, ProxyKind} from "@mc-devkit/core/Proxy.sol";
 16 | import {ProxyRegistry} from "@mc-devkit/registry/ProxyRegistry.sol";
 17 | import {Dictionary, DictionaryKind} from "@mc-devkit/core/Dictionary.sol";
 18 | import {DictionaryRegistry} from "@mc-devkit/registry/DictionaryRegistry.sol";
 19 | 
 20 | /**
 21 |  * ===================
 22 |  *     🕵️‍♀️ Inspector
 23 |  * =====================
 24 |  */
 25 | library Inspector {
 26 |     using Inspector for string;
 27 |     using Inspector for bytes4;
 28 |     using Inspector for address;
 29 |     using Inspector for bool;
 30 | 
 31 |     /**
 32 |      * ==================
 33 |      *     🧩 Function
 34 |      * ====================
 35 |      */
 36 |     function hasNotContract(Function storage func) internal view returns (bool) {
 37 |         return func.implementation.isNotContract();
 38 |     }
 39 | 
 40 |     function isEqual(Function memory a, Function memory b) internal pure returns (bool) {
 41 |         return keccak256(abi.encode(a)) == keccak256(abi.encode(b));
 42 |     }
 43 | 
 44 |     function isComplete(Function memory func) internal pure returns (bool) {
 45 |         return func.status.isComplete();
 46 |     }
 47 | 
 48 |     function isUninitialized(Function storage func) internal view returns (bool) {
 49 |         return func.status.isUninitialized();
 50 |     }
 51 | 
 52 |     /**
 53 |      * ===============
 54 |      *     🗂️ Bundle
 55 |      * =================
 56 |      */
 57 |     function hasSameSelector(Bundle storage bundle, Function storage func) internal view returns (bool flag) {
 58 |         for (uint256 i; i < bundle.functions.length; ++i) {
 59 |             if (func.selector == bundle.functions[i].selector) return true;
 60 |         }
 61 |     }
 62 | 
 63 |     function hasNotSameSelector(Bundle storage bundle, Function storage func) internal view returns (bool) {
 64 |         return hasSameSelector(bundle, func).isFalse();
 65 |     }
 66 | 
 67 |     function isComplete(Bundle storage bundle) internal view returns (bool) {
 68 |         return bundle.status.isComplete();
 69 |     }
 70 | 
 71 |     function isUninitialized(Bundle storage bundle) internal view returns (bool) {
 72 |         return bundle.status.isUninitialized();
 73 |     }
 74 |     /**
 75 |      * =======================
 76 |      *     📙 Bundle Registry
 77 |      * =========================
 78 |      */
 79 | 
 80 |     function hasCurrentBundle(BundleRegistry storage bundle) internal view returns (bool) {
 81 |         return bundle.current.name.isNotEmpty();
 82 |     }
 83 | 
 84 |     function hasNotCurrentBundle(BundleRegistry storage bundle) internal view returns (bool) {
 85 |         return bundle.hasCurrentBundle().isNot();
 86 |     }
 87 | 
 88 |     /**
 89 |      * ==============
 90 |      *     🏠 Proxy
 91 |      * ================
 92 |      */
 93 |     function isComplete(Proxy memory proxy) internal pure returns (bool) {
 94 |         return proxy.status.isComplete();
 95 |     }
 96 | 
 97 |     function isInitialized(Proxy storage proxy) internal view returns (bool) {
 98 |         return proxy.status.isInitialized();
 99 |     }
100 | 
101 |     function isUninitialized(Proxy storage proxy) internal view returns (bool) {
102 |         return proxy.status.isUninitialized();
103 |     }
104 |     /**
105 |      * ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
106 |      *     🏠 Proxy Kind
107 |      * ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
108 |      */
109 | 
110 |     function isNotUndefined(ProxyKind kind) internal pure returns (bool) {
111 |         return kind != ProxyKind.undefined;
112 |     }
113 | 
114 |     /**
115 |      * ====================
116 |      *     📚 Dictionary
117 |      * ======================
118 |      */
119 |     function isSupported(Dictionary memory dictionary, bytes4 selector) internal view returns (bool) {
120 |         return IDictionary(dictionary.addr).supportsInterface(selector);
121 |     }
122 | 
123 |     function isVerifiable(Dictionary memory dictionary) internal returns (bool) {
124 |         (bool success,) = dictionary.addr.call(abi.encodeWithSelector(IVerifiable.implementation.selector));
125 |         return success;
126 |     }
127 | 
128 |     function isComplete(Dictionary memory dictionary) internal pure returns (bool) {
129 |         return dictionary.status.isComplete();
130 |     }
131 | 
132 |     function isUninitialized(Dictionary storage dictionary) internal view returns (bool) {
133 |         return dictionary.status.isUninitialized();
134 |     }
135 |     /**
136 |      * ------------------------
137 |      *     📚 Dictionary Kind
138 |      * --------------------------
139 |      */
140 | 
141 |     function isNotUndefined(DictionaryKind kind) internal pure returns (bool) {
142 |         return kind != DictionaryKind.undefined;
143 |     }
144 | 
145 |     /**
146 |      * ===================
147 |      *     🧱 Primitives
148 |      * =====================
149 |      */
150 |     /// 📝 String
151 |     function isAssigned(string storage str) internal pure returns (bool) {
152 |         return str.isNotEmpty();
153 |     }
154 | 
155 |     function isEmpty(string memory str) internal pure returns (bool) {
156 |         return bytes(str).length == 0;
157 |     }
158 | 
159 |     function isNotEmpty(string memory str) internal pure returns (bool) {
160 |         return str.isEmpty().isNot();
161 |     }
162 | 
163 |     function isEqual(string memory a, string memory b) internal pure returns (bool) {
164 |         return keccak256(abi.encode(a)) == keccak256(abi.encode(b));
165 |     }
166 | 
167 |     function isNotEqual(string memory a, string memory b) internal pure returns (bool) {
168 |         return a.isEqual(b).isNot();
169 |     }
170 |     /// 💾 Bytes4
171 | 
172 |     function isAssigned(bytes4 selector) internal pure returns (bool) {
173 |         return selector.isNotEmpty();
174 |     }
175 | 
176 |     function isEmpty(bytes4 selector) internal pure returns (bool) {
177 |         return selector == bytes4(0);
178 |     }
179 | 
180 |     function isNotEmpty(bytes4 selector) internal pure returns (bool) {
181 |         return selector.isEmpty().isFalse();
182 |     }
183 | 
184 |     function isEqual(bytes4 a, bytes4 b) internal pure returns (bool) {
185 |         return a == b;
186 |     }
187 | 
188 |     function isNotEqual(bytes4 a, bytes4 b) internal pure returns (bool) {
189 |         return a.isEqual(b).isFalse();
190 |     }
191 |     /// 📌 Address
192 | 
193 |     function isZero(address addr) internal pure returns (bool) {
194 |         return addr == address(0);
195 |     }
196 | 
197 |     function isNotZero(address addr) internal pure returns (bool) {
198 |         return addr.isZero().isNot();
199 |     }
200 | 
201 |     function hasCode(address addr) internal view returns (bool) {
202 |         return addr.code.length != 0;
203 |     }
204 | 
205 |     function hasNotCode(address addr) internal view returns (bool) {
206 |         return addr.hasCode().isNot();
207 |     }
208 | 
209 |     function isContract(address addr) internal view returns (bool) {
210 |         return addr.hasCode();
211 |     }
212 | 
213 |     function isNotContract(address addr) internal view returns (bool) {
214 |         return addr.isContract().isNot();
215 |     }
216 |     /// ✅ Bool
217 | 
218 |     function isNot(bool flag) internal pure returns (bool) {
219 |         return !flag;
220 |     }
221 | 
222 |     function isFalse(bool flag) internal pure returns (bool) {
223 |         return flag == false;
224 |     }
225 |     /// #️⃣ Uint
226 | 
227 |     function isNotZero(uint256 num) internal pure returns (bool) {
228 |         return num != 0;
229 |     }
230 | 
231 |     /**
232 |      * ===================
233 |      *     🔒 Type Guard
234 |      * =====================
235 |      */
236 |     function isUninitialized(TypeStatus status) internal pure returns (bool) {
237 |         return status == TypeStatus.Uninitialized;
238 |     }
239 | 
240 |     function isInitialized(TypeStatus status) internal pure returns (bool) {
241 |         return status != TypeStatus.Uninitialized;
242 |     }
243 | 
244 |     function isBuilding(TypeStatus status) internal pure returns (bool) {
245 |         return status == TypeStatus.Building;
246 |     }
247 | 
248 |     function isBuilt(TypeStatus status) internal pure returns (bool) {
249 |         return status == TypeStatus.Built;
250 |     }
251 | 
252 |     function isLocked(TypeStatus status) internal pure returns (bool) {
253 |         return status == TypeStatus.Locked;
254 |     }
255 | 
256 |     function isNotLocked(TypeStatus status) internal pure returns (bool) {
257 |         return status.isLocked().isNot();
258 |     }
259 | 
260 |     function isComplete(TypeStatus status) internal pure returns (bool) {
261 |         return status.isBuilt() || status.isLocked();
262 |     }
263 | }
264 | 


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
/site/docs/02-guides/05-project-management/04-test-strategy.md:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1 | ---
  2 | keywords: [smart-contracts, testing, test-strategy, solidity, best-practices]
  3 | tags: [smart-contracts, testing, test-strategy, solidity, best-practices]
  4 | last_update:
  5 |   date: 2024-10-28
  6 |   author: Meta Contract Development Team
  7 | ---
  8 | 
  9 | # Test Strategy
 10 | 
 11 | This document outlines the comprehensive test strategy for the Meta Contract smart contracts. It provides guidelines for writing and maintaining tests, ensuring code quality, and optimizing gas usage.
 12 | 
 13 | ## Test Types
 14 | 
 15 | 1. Unit Tests
 16 | 2. Integration Tests
 17 | 3. State-Focused Integration Tests
 18 | 4. Behavior-Focused Integration Tests
 19 | 5. Fuzzing Tests
 20 | 6. Gas Optimization Tests
 21 | 7. Upgrade Tests
 22 | 8. Snapshot Tests
 23 | 
 24 | ## Test Location
 25 | 
 26 | Given the structure of the Meta Contract where functions are separated into individual files, we adopt the following test location strategy:
 27 | 
 28 | 1. Unit Tests: Colocated with the function implementation in the same file under the `src` directory.
 29 | 2. Integration Tests: Located in separate files under the `test` directory.
 30 | 3. Upgrade Tests: Located in the `test` directory, typically in a file named `UpgradeTest.sol` or similar.
 31 | 4. Snapshot Tests: Incorporated into State-Focused Integration Tests or other test types as needed.
 32 | 
 33 | ## Test File Structure
 34 | 
 35 | A typical Solidity file containing a function implementation and its unit tests should have the following structure:
 36 | 
 37 | ```solidity
 38 | // SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT
 39 | pragma solidity ^0.8.24;
 40 | 
 41 | import "...";
 42 | 
 43 | contract SomeFunction {
 44 |     // Function implementation
 45 | }
 46 | 
 47 | // Testing
 48 | import {MCTest} from "@mc-devkit/Flattened.sol";
 49 | 
 50 | contract SomeFunctionTest is MCTest {
 51 |     // Unit tests
 52 | }
 53 | ```
 54 | 
 55 | ## Test Function Naming Convention
 56 | 
 57 | Use the following format for test function names:
 58 | 
 59 | ```
 60 | test_[MethodName]_[ExpectedBehavior]_[TestCondition]()
 61 | ```
 62 | 
 63 | Example:
 64 | ```solidity
 65 | function test_propose_success_withValidInput() public {
 66 |     // Test implementation
 67 | }
 68 | ```
 69 | 
 70 | ## Integration Testing Strategy
 71 | 
 72 | ### State-Focused Integration Tests
 73 | 
 74 | These tests utilize MC's State Fuzzing capabilities to test individual functions and state transitions.
 75 | 
 76 | Example:
 77 | 
 78 | ```solidity
 79 | function test_someStateCondition() public {
 80 |     Schema.Proposal storage $proposal = Storage.Deliberation().getProposal(0);
 81 |     // ... perform state modifications and assertions
 82 | }
 83 | ```
 84 | 
 85 | ### Behavior-Focused Integration Tests
 86 | 
 87 | These tests simulate end-to-end flows and specific use cases of the TextDAO system from an end-user perspective.
 88 | 
 89 | Example:
 90 | 
 91 | ```solidity
 92 | function test_fullProposalLifecycle() public {
 93 |     uint256 proposalId = textDAO.propose("Test Proposal", new Schema.Action[](0));
 94 |     textDAO.vote(proposalId, someVote);
 95 |     // ... other interactions and assertions
 96 | }
 97 | ```
 98 | 
 99 | ## Fuzzing Tests
100 | 
101 | For fuzz tests, include "Random" in the name and describe the varying input:
102 | 
103 | ```solidity
104 | function test_vote_success_withRandomVoteValues(uint8 rnd_headerChoice, uint8 rnd_commandChoice) public {
105 |     // Implement test with random inputs
106 | }
107 | ```
108 | 
109 | ## Gas Optimization Testing
110 | 
111 | Include gas usage checks for potentially heavy operations:
112 | 
113 | ```solidity
114 | function test_heavyOperation_gasUsage(uint256 inputSize) public {
115 |     vm.assume(inputSize > 0 && inputSize <= 1000);
116 | 
117 |     uint256 gasStart = gasleft();
118 |     // Perform the heavy operation
119 |     uint256 gasUsed = gasStart - gasleft();
120 | 
121 |     uint256 expectedMaxGas = inputSize * 5000; // Adjust based on operation complexity
122 |     assertLt(gasUsed, expectedMaxGas, "Gas usage exceeds expected maximum");
123 | }
124 | ```
125 | 
126 | ## Upgrade Tests
127 | 
128 | Ensure that contract upgrades maintain expected functionality:
129 | 
130 | 1. Test the upgrade process itself
131 | 2. Verify that existing state is preserved after an upgrade
132 | 3. Test new functionality introduced in the upgrade
133 | 4. Ensure that existing functionality continues to work as expected post-upgrade
134 | 
135 | Example:
136 | 
137 | ```solidity
138 | function testUpgrade() public {
139 |     // Set up initial state
140 |     // ...
141 | 
142 |     // Perform upgrade
143 |     textDAO.upgrade(newImplementationAddress);
144 | 
145 |     // Verify state preservation
146 |     // ...
147 | 
148 |     // Test new functionality
149 |     // ...
150 | 
151 |     // Verify existing functionality
152 |     // ...
153 | }
154 | ```
155 | 
156 | ## Snapshot Tests
157 | 
158 | Use Foundry's snapshot feature to capture and verify the state of the system at specific points:
159 | 
160 | ```solidity
161 | function testSnapshot() public {
162 |     // Initial setup
163 |     textDAO.propose("Test Proposal", new Schema.Action[](0));
164 | 
165 |     uint256 snapshotId = vm.snapshot();
166 | 
167 |     // Modify state
168 |     textDAO.vote(0, someVote);
169 |     textDAO.tally(0);
170 | 
171 |     // Verify changed state
172 |     // ... assertions ...
173 | 
174 |     // Revert to snapshot
175 |     vm.revertTo(snapshotId);
176 | 
177 |     // Verify reverted state
178 |     // ... assertions ...
179 | }
180 | ```
181 | 
182 | ## Best Practices
183 | 
184 | 1. Use descriptive test names that clearly indicate what is being tested.
185 | 2. Write both positive and negative test cases.
186 | 3. Use mock contracts when testing interactions with external contracts.
187 | 4. Leverage MC DevKit's capabilities for state management and testing.
188 | 5. Keep tests independent and idempotent.
189 | 6. Use setup functions to initialize common test scenarios.
190 | 
191 | ## Assertion Best Practices
192 | 
193 | 1. Use specific assertion messages to provide clear feedback on test failures.
194 | 2. Prefer equality assertions (`assertEq`) over boolean assertions when possible.
195 | 3. Use fuzzing to test with a wide range of inputs.
196 | 
197 | Example:
198 | 
199 | ```solidity
200 | function test_calculateScore_success(uint256 votes) public {
201 |     vm.assume(votes > 0 && votes <= 1000000);
202 |     uint256 expectedScore = votes * 2;
203 |     uint256 actualScore = textDAO.calculateScore(votes);
204 |     assertEq(actualScore, expectedScore, "Score calculation incorrect");
205 | }
206 | ```
207 | 
208 | ## Code Coverage
209 | 
210 | Aim for high code coverage, but remember that coverage alone doesn't guarantee comprehensive testing:
211 | 
212 | 1. Use Foundry's coverage reports to identify untested code paths.
213 | 2. Aim for 100% coverage of critical contract logic.
214 | 3. Write tests that cover edge cases and boundary conditions.
215 | 
216 | ## Continuous Integration
217 | 
218 | Integrate testing into the CI/CD pipeline:
219 | 
220 | 1. Run all tests as part of the CI process.
221 | 2. Include gas usage checks in CI to catch performance regressions.
222 | 3. Use static analysis tools (e.g., Slither) in conjunction with tests.
223 | 
224 | ## Test Maintenance
225 | 
226 | 1. Review and update tests when contract logic changes.
227 | 2. Regularly run the full test suite to catch regressions.
228 | 3. Refactor tests as needed to improve clarity and reduce duplication.
229 | 
230 | ## MC DevKit Specific Testing
231 | 
232 | Leverage MC DevKit's features for enhanced testing:
233 | 
234 | 1. Use State Fuzzing for comprehensive state testing.
235 | 2. Utilize MC DevKit's storage management utilities in tests.
236 | 3. Implement custom state generators for complex scenarios.
237 | 
238 | Example:
239 | 
240 | ```solidity
241 | function test_complexScenario_withCustomState() public {
242 |     Schema.Deliberation memory delib = generateCustomDeliberation();
243 |     // ... use the custom state in your test
244 | }
245 | 
246 | function generateCustomDeliberation() internal returns (Schema.Deliberation memory) {
247 |     // Generate and return a custom Deliberation state
248 | }
249 | ```
250 | 
251 | ## Security-Focused Testing
252 | 
253 | 1. Implement specific tests for known vulnerabilities (e.g., reentrancy, integer overflow).
254 | 2. Use symbolic execution tools to identify potential security issues.
255 | 3. Test access control and permission systems thoroughly.
256 | 
257 | ## Performance Testing
258 | 
259 | For critical operations, include performance tests:
260 | 
261 | 1. Measure execution time and resource usage.
262 | 2. Set performance benchmarks and ensure they are met in each release.
263 | 3. Test performance under various network conditions and gas prices.
264 | 
265 | ## Documentation
266 | 
267 | 1. Include inline comments explaining the purpose and setup of complex tests.
268 | 2. Maintain a separate document describing the overall test strategy and any test-specific setup required.
269 | 
270 | ## Conclusion
271 | 
272 | This test strategy provides a comprehensive approach to ensuring the quality, security, and performance of the TextDAO smart contracts. By following these guidelines and leveraging the power of MC DevKit and Foundry, developers can create robust and reliable tests that contribute to the overall stability of the TextDAO ecosystem.
273 | 
274 | Remember that testing is an ongoing process. As new features are added and the system evolves, the test suite should be continuously updated and expanded to maintain comprehensive coverage.
275 | 


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
/site/docs/02-guides/05-project-management/03-coding-standards.md:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1 | ---
  2 | keywords: [smart-contracts, coding-standards, solidity, best-practices]
  3 | tags: [smart-contracts, coding-standards, solidity, best-practices]
  4 | last_update:
  5 |   date: 2024-10-28
  6 |   author: Meta Contract Development Team
  7 | ---
  8 | 
  9 | # Coding Standards
 10 | 
 11 | This guide outlines the coding standards and best practices for developing smart contracts in the Meta Contract project. Adhering to these standards ensures consistency, readability, and maintainability across the codebase.
 12 | 
 13 | ## General Guidelines
 14 | 
 15 | 1. Use Solidity version 0.8.24 or later.
 16 | 2. Follow the official [Solidity Style Guide](https://docs.soliditylang.org/en/latest/style-guide.html) as a baseline.
 17 | 3. Use `pragma solidity ^0.8.24;` at the beginning of each file. See [solidity versioning](https://docs.soliditylang.org/en/latest/installing-solidity.html#versioning) for more details.
 18 |    - For production deployments, it is recommended to lock the version to avoid unexpected compatibility issues.
 19 |    - For library development, using a loose version specification (e.g., `^0.8.24`) is acceptable to ensure compatibility across different projects. Ensure to define and test the compatible version range clearly.
 20 | 
 21 | ## Naming Conventions
 22 | 
 23 | ### Contracts and Libraries
 24 | - Use ***PascalCase***
 25 |   - Example: `MyContract`, `TextDAOLibrary`
 26 | 
 27 | ### Interfaces
 28 | - Prefix with `I` and use ***PascalCase***
 29 |   - Example: `IMyInterface`, `ITextDAO`
 30 | 
 31 | ### Functions
 32 | - Use ***camelCase***
 33 |   - Examples: `myFunction`, `calculateTotal`
 34 | - Prefix internal or private functions in contracts with an underscore (_).
 35 |   - Examples: `_internalFunction`
 36 | - Do not prefix internal functions in libraries with an underscore.
 37 |   - Examples: `Math.add`
 38 | 
 39 | ### Modifiers
 40 | - Use ***mixedCase***
 41 |   - Examples: `onlyOwner`, `nonReentrant`
 42 | 
 43 | ### Variables
 44 | - Use ***camelCase*** for function parameters, return variables, and local variables
 45 |   - Prefix storage variables with `$` (Note: This is a project-specific standard to clearly distinguish storage variables.)
 46 |   - Prefix local stack or memory variables with `_`
 47 |   - No prefix for function parameters and return variables
 48 |   - Examples: `uint256 $totalAmount`, `uint256 _localVariable`, `function myFunction(uint256 param) public returns (uint256 ret)`
 49 | 
 50 | ### Constants and Immutable Variables
 51 | - Use ***UPPER_CASE*** for constants and immutable variables
 52 |   - Examples: `uint256 public constant MAX_SUPPLY = 1000000`, `uint256 public immutable QUORUM_PERCENTAGE = 50`
 53 | 
 54 | ### Errors
 55 | - Prefer custom errors over revert strings for gas efficiency and clarity.
 56 | - Use ***PascalCase*** for error names and ***camelCase*** for error parameters
 57 |   - Examples: `InsufficientBalance`, `InvalidInput(uint256 value)`
 58 | 
 59 | ### Events
 60 | - Use ***PascalCase*** for event names and ***camelCase*** for event parameters
 61 |   - Use past tense for event names to indicate that the event has occurred.
 62 |   - Examples: `ProposalCreated(uint256 proposalId, address proposer)`
 63 | 
 64 | ### Enums
 65 | - Use ***PascalCase*** for enum name, and ***ALL_CAPS*** for values
 66 |   - Example:
 67 |     ```solidity
 68 |     enum Color { RED, GREEN, BLUE }
 69 |     ```
 70 | 
 71 | ### Struct
 72 | - Use ***PascalCase***
 73 |   - Example: `struct UserInfo { ... }`
 74 | 
 75 | ## Code Layout
 76 | 
 77 | - Use 4 spaces for indentation (not tabs).
 78 | - Maximum line length is 120 characters.
 79 | - Use double quotes for strings.
 80 | - Place the opening brace on the same line as the declaration.
 81 | - Place the closing brace on a new line.
 82 | 
 83 | Example:
 84 | 
 85 | ```solidity
 86 | contract MyContract {
 87 |     uint256 private constant MAX_VALUE = 100;
 88 | 
 89 |     function calculateSum(uint256 a, uint256 b) public pure returns (uint256) {
 90 |         if (a >= MAX_VALUE || b >= MAX_VALUE) revert InvalidInput(a, b);
 91 |         emit SumCalculated(a, b, a + b);
 92 |         return a + b;
 93 |     }
 94 | }
 95 | ```
 96 | 
 97 | ## Documentation
 98 | 
 99 | - Use [NatSpec](https://docs.soliditylang.org/en/latest/natspec-format.html) comments for all public and external functions and state variables.
100 | - Write clear and concise comments explaining complex logic.
101 | - Keep comments up-to-date when changing code.
102 | 
103 | Example:
104 | 
105 | ```solidity
106 | /// @notice Calculates the sum of two numbers
107 | /// @param a The first number
108 | /// @param b The second number
109 | /// @return The sum of a and b
110 | /// @dev This function will revert if the inputs are too large
111 | /// @dev This function emits a `SumCalculated` event with the sum of a and b
112 | function calculateSum(uint256 a, uint256 b) public pure returns (uint256) {
113 |     // Ensure inputs are within acceptable range
114 |     if (a >= MAX_VALUE || b >= MAX_VALUE) revert InvalidInput(a, b);
115 |     emit SumCalculated(a, b, a + b);
116 |     return a + b;
117 | }
118 | ```
119 | 
120 | ## Security Considerations
121 | 
122 | - Use the `Checks-Effects-Interactions` pattern to prevent reentrancy attacks. This pattern ensures that all checks are performed before any state changes, and external calls are made only after state changes are completed.
123 | - Be cautious with `delegatecall` as it executes code in the context of the calling contract, which can lead to unexpected behavior if not properly managed.
124 | - Use `transfer()` or `call{value: amount}()` for ETH transfers. Prefer the "withdraw" pattern over "send" to avoid issues with call stack depth and gas limits.
125 |   - **`send`**: Uses 2300 gas and returns `true` or `false`. Requires manual error handling and is generally not recommended due to its limitations.
126 |   - **`transfer`**: Also uses 2300 gas and throws an exception on failure, rolling back the transaction. It was previously recommended for its simplicity and safety, but recent gas limit changes may restrict its use.
127 |   - **`call`**: Allows using all remaining gas and returns `true` or `false`. It requires checking the return value for error handling. Due to recent gas limit changes, `call` is increasingly recommended, especially when the recipient may perform complex operations.
128 | - Avoid using `tx.origin` for authentication as it can be manipulated by malicious contracts. Use `msg.sender` instead for reliable authentication.
129 | - For Solidity versions < 0.8.0, use SafeMath to prevent integer overflows and underflows. For versions 0.8.0 and later, Solidity includes built-in overflow checks, making SafeMath unnecessary.
130 | - Consider implementing a fail-safe mode to handle unexpected contract behavior, allowing for emergency stops or controlled shutdowns.
131 | - Regularly review and test your contracts, and consider peer reviews to identify potential security vulnerabilities.
132 | 
133 | See [Solidity Security Considerations](https://docs.soliditylang.org/en/latest/security-considerations.html) for more details.
134 | 
135 | ## Gas Optimization
136 | 
137 | - Avoid loops with unbounded length.
138 | - Use `memory` for read-only arrays, `storage` for modifiable state.
139 | - Use events to store data that doesn't need to be accessed by smart contracts.
140 | - Use custom errors instead of `revert("...")` strings for gas efficiency.
141 | 
142 | ## Testing
143 | 
144 | - Write comprehensive unit tests for all functions.
145 | - Use the MC DevKit for enhanced testing capabilities.
146 | - Implement fuzzing tests for critical functions with foundry.
147 | - Test for edge cases and boundary conditions.
148 | 
149 | See [Test Strategy](./04-test-strategy.md) for more details.
150 | 
151 | ## Meta Contract (MC) Specific Guidelines
152 | 
153 | - Use the `MC DevKit` for testing and scripting.
154 | - Import the DevKit contracts (like `MCTest` or `MCScript`) from the flattened file `@mc-devkit/Flattened.sol` in order to reduce the resolution time of the compiler.
155 | - Use the `_use` function to set up contracts and selectors for testing.
156 | - Use proper storage management techniques to prevent storage conflicts.
157 |   - [Research on the Collisions issues between EVM Storage Layout and Upgrade Proxy Pattern](https://mirror.xyz/zer0luck.eth/-7_tRRhql4TOQp-y9GQS1jVf-ev_QmId9vTKEdbF2Hw)
158 | 
159 | Example of MC DevKit usage in tests:
160 | 
161 | ```solidity
162 | import {MCTest} from "@mc-devkit/Flattened.sol";
163 | 
164 | contract MyContractTest is MCTest {
165 |     function setUp() public {
166 |         _use(MyContract.someFunction.selector, address(new MyContract()));
167 |     }
168 | 
169 |     function test_someFunction_success() public {
170 |         // Test implementation
171 |         (bool success, ) = target.call(abi.encodeWithSelector(MyContract.someFunction.selector, arg1, arg2));
172 |         assertTrue(success);
173 |     }
174 | }
175 | ```
176 | 
177 | ## Continuous Integration
178 | 
179 | - Integrate automated testing into the CI/CD pipeline.
180 | - Ensure all tests pass before merging changes into the main branch.
181 | - Use static analysis tools (e.g., Slither, Mythril) as part of the CI process.
182 | 
183 | ## Conclusion
184 | 
185 | By adhering to these coding standards, we ensure consistency, readability, and maintainability across the Meta Contract smart contracts. These standards should be followed by all contributors to the project. Regular code reviews and automated linting tools should be used to enforce these standards.
186 | 
187 | Remember that while these guidelines are important, they should not impede productivity or innovation. Use your judgment and discuss with the team if you believe a deviation from these standards is warranted in a specific case.
188 | 


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
/src/devkit/core/Dictionary.sol:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1 | // SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT
  2 | pragma solidity ^0.8.23;
  3 | /**
  4 |  * ---------------------
  5 |  *     Support Methods
  6 |  * -----------------------
  7 |  */
  8 | 
  9 | import {Tracer, param} from "@mc-devkit/system/Tracer.sol";
 10 | import {Inspector} from "@mc-devkit/types/Inspector.sol";
 11 | import {TypeGuard, TypeStatus} from "@mc-devkit/types/TypeGuard.sol";
 12 | // Validation
 13 | import {Validator} from "@mc-devkit/system/Validator.sol";
 14 | // Util
 15 | import {ForgeHelper} from "@mc-devkit/utils/ForgeHelper.sol";
 16 | 
 17 | // External Libs
 18 | import {IDictionary} from "@ucs.mc/dictionary/interfaces/IDictionary.sol";
 19 | import {Dictionary as UCSDictionary} from "@ucs.mc/dictionary/Dictionary.sol";
 20 | import {ImmutableDictionary} from "@ucs.mc/dictionary/ImmutableDictionary.sol";
 21 | import {BeaconDictionary} from "@ucs.mc/dictionary/BeaconDictionary.sol";
 22 | // Mock
 23 | import {MockDictionary} from "@mc-devkit/test/mocks/MockDictionary.sol";
 24 | 
 25 | // Core Types
 26 | import {Function} from "@mc-devkit/core/Function.sol";
 27 | import {Bundle} from "@mc-devkit/core/Bundle.sol";
 28 | 
 29 | //////////////////////////////////////////////////
 30 | //  📚 Dictionary   //////////////////////////////
 31 | using DictionaryLib for Dictionary global;
 32 | using Tracer for Dictionary global;
 33 | using Inspector for Dictionary global;
 34 | using TypeGuard for Dictionary global;
 35 | //////////////////////////////////////////////////
 36 | 
 37 | struct Dictionary {
 38 |     string name;
 39 |     address addr;
 40 |     DictionaryKind kind;
 41 |     TypeStatus status;
 42 | }
 43 | 
 44 | library DictionaryLib {
 45 |     using Inspector for bytes4;
 46 |     /**
 47 |      * ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
 48 |      *     📛 Assign Name
 49 |      *     🚀 Deploy Dictionary
 50 |      *     📩 Load Dictionary
 51 |      *     🔂 Duplicate Dictionary
 52 |      *     🧩 Set Function or Bundle
 53 |      *     🪟 Upgrade Facade
 54 |      *     🤖 Create Dictionary Mock
 55 |      * ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
 56 |      */
 57 | 
 58 |     /**
 59 |      * --------------------
 60 |      *     📛 Assign Name
 61 |      * ----------------------
 62 |      */
 63 |     function assignName(Dictionary memory dictionary, string memory name) internal returns (Dictionary memory) {
 64 |         uint256 pid = dictionary.startProcess("assignName", param(name));
 65 |         dictionary.startBuilding();
 66 |         dictionary.name = name;
 67 |         dictionary.finishBuilding();
 68 |         return dictionary.finishProcess(pid);
 69 |     }
 70 | 
 71 |     /**
 72 |      * -------------------------
 73 |      *     🚀 Deploy Dictionary
 74 |      *         - Verifiable
 75 |      *         - Immutable
 76 |      *         - Beacon
 77 |      * ---------------------------
 78 |      */
 79 |     function deploy(address owner) internal returns (Dictionary memory dictionary) {
 80 |         uint256 pid = dictionary.startProcess("deploy", param(owner));
 81 |         Validator.SHOULD_OwnerIsNotZeroAddress(owner);
 82 |         dictionary.startBuilding();
 83 |         dictionary.addr = address(new UCSDictionary(owner));
 84 |         dictionary.kind = DictionaryKind.Verifiable;
 85 |         dictionary.finishBuilding();
 86 |         return dictionary.finishProcess(pid);
 87 |     }
 88 | 
 89 |     function deployImmutable(Function[] storage functions, address facade)
 90 |         internal
 91 |         returns (Dictionary memory dictionary)
 92 |     {
 93 |         uint256 pid = dictionary.startProcess("deployImmutable", param(functions, facade));
 94 |         Validator.SHOULD_FacadeIsContract(facade);
 95 |         dictionary.startBuilding();
 96 |         ImmutableDictionary.Function[] memory funcs;
 97 |         for (uint256 i; i < functions.length; ++i) {
 98 |             funcs[i] = ImmutableDictionary.Function(functions[i].selector, functions[i].implementation);
 99 |         }
100 |         dictionary.addr = address(new ImmutableDictionary(funcs, facade));
101 |         dictionary.kind = DictionaryKind.Immutable;
102 |         dictionary.finishBuilding();
103 |         return dictionary.finishProcess(pid);
104 |     }
105 | 
106 |     function deployBeacon(address implementation, address owner) internal returns (Dictionary memory dictionary) {
107 |         uint256 pid = dictionary.startProcess("deployBeacon", param(implementation, owner));
108 |         Validator.MUST_AddressIsContract(implementation);
109 |         Validator.SHOULD_OwnerIsNotZeroAddress(owner);
110 |         dictionary.startBuilding();
111 |         dictionary.addr = address(new BeaconDictionary(implementation, owner));
112 |         dictionary.kind = DictionaryKind.Beacon;
113 |         dictionary.finishBuilding();
114 |         return dictionary.finishProcess(pid);
115 |     }
116 | 
117 |     /**
118 |      * -----------------------
119 |      *     📩 Load Dictionary
120 |      * -------------------------
121 |      */
122 |     function load(string memory name, address dictionaryAddr) internal returns (Dictionary memory dictionary) {
123 |         uint256 pid = dictionary.startProcess("load", param(dictionaryAddr));
124 |         Validator.MUST_NotEmptyName(name);
125 |         Validator.MUST_AddressIsContract(dictionaryAddr);
126 |         // TODO Validate
127 |         dictionary.startBuilding();
128 |         dictionary.name = name;
129 |         dictionary.addr = dictionaryAddr;
130 |         dictionary.kind = DictionaryKind.Verifiable; // TODO
131 |         dictionary.finishBuilding();
132 |         return dictionary.finishProcess(pid);
133 |     }
134 | 
135 |     /**
136 |      * ----------------------------
137 |      *     🔂 Duplicate Dictionary
138 |      * ------------------------------
139 |      */
140 |     function duplicate(Dictionary storage dictionary, address owner)
141 |         internal
142 |         returns (Dictionary memory duplicatedDictionary)
143 |     {
144 |         uint256 pid = dictionary.startProcess("duplicate", param(dictionary));
145 |         Validator.MUST_Completed(dictionary);
146 | 
147 |         duplicatedDictionary = deploy(owner).assignName(dictionary.name);
148 | 
149 |         address fromAddr = dictionary.addr;
150 | 
151 |         bytes4[] memory _selectors = IDictionary(fromAddr).supportsInterfaces();
152 |         for (uint256 i; i < _selectors.length; ++i) {
153 |             bytes4 _selector = _selectors[i];
154 |             if (_selector.isEmpty()) continue;
155 |             duplicatedDictionary.set(_selector, IDictionary(fromAddr).getImplementation(_selector));
156 |         }
157 | 
158 |         dictionary.finishProcess(pid);
159 |     }
160 | 
161 |     /**
162 |      * -----------------------------
163 |      *     🧩 Set Function or Bundle
164 |      * -------------------------------
165 |      */
166 |     function set(Dictionary memory dictionary, bytes4 selector, address implementation)
167 |         internal
168 |         returns (Dictionary memory)
169 |     {
170 |         uint256 pid = dictionary.startProcess("set", param(selector, implementation));
171 |         Validator.MUST_Completed(dictionary);
172 |         Validator.SHOULD_NotEmptySelector(selector);
173 |         Validator.MUST_AddressIsContract(implementation);
174 |         IDictionary(dictionary.addr).setImplementation({functionSelector: selector, implementation: implementation});
175 |         return dictionary.finishProcess(pid);
176 |     }
177 | 
178 |     function set(Dictionary memory dictionary, Function memory func) internal returns (Dictionary memory) {
179 |         uint256 pid = dictionary.startProcess("set", param(func));
180 |         set(dictionary, func.selector, func.implementation);
181 |         return dictionary.finishProcess(pid);
182 |     }
183 | 
184 |     function set(Dictionary memory dictionary, Bundle storage bundle) internal returns (Dictionary memory) {
185 |         uint256 pid = dictionary.startProcess("set", param(bundle));
186 |         Validator.MUST_HaveFunction(bundle);
187 |         Function[] memory functions = bundle.functions;
188 |         for (uint256 i; i < functions.length; ++i) {
189 |             set(dictionary, functions[i]);
190 |         }
191 | 
192 |         // TODO Generate Facade
193 |         // if (dictionary.isVerifiable()) {
194 |         //     dictionary.upgradeFacade(bundle.facade);
195 |         // }
196 | 
197 |         return dictionary.finishProcess(pid);
198 |     }
199 | 
200 |     /**
201 |      * ----------------------
202 |      *     🪟 Upgrade Facade
203 |      * ------------------------
204 |      */
205 |     function upgradeFacade(Dictionary memory dictionary, address newFacade) internal returns (Dictionary memory) {
206 |         uint256 pid = dictionary.startProcess("upgradeFacade", param(dictionary, newFacade));
207 |         Validator.MUST_AddressIsContract(newFacade);
208 |         Validator.MUST_Verifiable(dictionary);
209 |         IDictionary(dictionary.addr).upgradeFacade(newFacade);
210 |         return dictionary.finishProcess(pid);
211 |     }
212 | 
213 |     /**
214 |      * ------------------------------
215 |      *     🤖 Create Dictionary Mock
216 |      * --------------------------------
217 |      */
218 |     function createMock(Bundle storage bundle, address owner) internal returns (Dictionary memory dictionary) {
219 |         uint256 pid = dictionary.startProcess("createMock", param(bundle, owner));
220 |         Validator.MUST_Completed(bundle);
221 |         Validator.SHOULD_OwnerIsNotZeroAddress(owner);
222 |         dictionary.startBuilding();
223 |         dictionary.addr = address(new MockDictionary(owner, bundle.functions));
224 |         dictionary.kind = DictionaryKind.Mock;
225 |         dictionary.finishBuilding();
226 |         return dictionary.finishProcess(pid);
227 |     }
228 | }
229 | 
230 | /**
231 |  * --------------------
232 |  *     Dictionary Kind
233 |  * ----------------------
234 |  */
235 | enum DictionaryKind {
236 |     undefined,
237 |     Verifiable,
238 |     Immutable,
239 |     Beacon,
240 |     Mock
241 | }
242 | 
243 | using Inspector for DictionaryKind global;
244 |

446 | function MUST_Building(StdFunctions storage std) internal view;
447 | ```
448 | 
449 | ### MUST_Built
450 | 
451 | 
452 | ```solidity
453 | function MUST_Built(StdFunctions memory std) internal view;
454 | ```
455 | 
456 | ### MUST_FoundInRange
457 | 
458 | =======================
459 | 🏷️ Name Generator
460 | =========================
461 | 
462 | 
463 | ```solidity
464 | function MUST_FoundInRange() internal view;
465 | ```
466 | 
467 | ### MUST_UseFunctionContract
468 | 
469 | ================
470 | 🧪 MCTest
471 | ==================
472 | 
473 | 
474 | ```solidity
475 | function MUST_UseFunctionContract(address implementation) internal view;
476 | ```
477 | 
478 | ## Enums
479 | ### Type
480 | 
481 | ```solidity
482 | enum Type {
483 |     MUST,
484 |     SHOULD,
485 |     COMPLETION
486 | }
487 | ```
488 |

  1 | # Validator

 27 | Type constant COMPLETION = Type.COMPLETION;
 28 | ```

 37 |     internal
 38 |     view
 39 |     returns (bool res);
 40 | ```

/src/devkit/utils/global/MCDeployLib.sol:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1 | // SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT
  2 | pragma solidity ^0.8.23;
  3 | 
  4 | import {MCDevKit} from "@mc-devkit/MCDevKit.sol";
  5 | import {ForgeHelper} from "@mc-devkit/utils/ForgeHelper.sol";
  6 | import {System} from "@mc-devkit/system/System.sol";
  7 | import {Inspector} from "@mc-devkit/types/Inspector.sol";
  8 | 
  9 | using Inspector for string;
 10 | // Validation
 11 | 
 12 | import {Validator} from "@mc-devkit/system/Validator.sol";
 13 | // Utils
 14 | import {param} from "@mc-devkit/system/Tracer.sol";
 15 | // Core
 16 | //  dictionary
 17 | import {Dictionary, DictionaryLib} from "@mc-devkit/core/Dictionary.sol";
 18 | //  functions
 19 | import {Bundle} from "@mc-devkit/core/Bundle.sol";
 20 | //  proxy
 21 | import {Proxy, ProxyLib} from "@mc-devkit/core/Proxy.sol";
 22 | 
 23 | import {NameGenerator} from "@mc-devkit/utils/mapping/NameGenerator.sol";
 24 | 
 25 | using NameGenerator for mapping(string => Dictionary);
 26 | using NameGenerator for mapping(string => Proxy);
 27 | 
 28 | /**
 29 |  *
 30 |  *  🚀 Deployment
 31 |  *      🌞 Deploy Meta Contract
 32 |  *          - Deploy
 33 |  *          - DeployImmutable
 34 |  *          - DeployRestrictedUpgradeable
 35 |  *          - DeployContractUpgradeable
 36 |  *      🏠 Deploy Proxy
 37 |  *      📚 Deploy Dictionary
 38 |  *      🔂 Duplicate Dictionary
 39 |  *      💽 Load Dictionary
 40 |  *
 41 |  */
 42 | library MCDeployLib {
 43 |     /**
 44 |      * -----------------------------
 45 |      *     🌞 Deploy Meta Contract
 46 |      * -------------------------------
 47 |      */
 48 |     function deploy(MCDevKit storage mc, Bundle storage bundle, address owner, bytes memory initData)
 49 |         internal
 50 |         returns (MCDevKit storage)
 51 |     {
 52 |         uint256 pid = mc.startProcess("deploy", param(bundle, owner, initData));
 53 |         Dictionary storage dictionary = mc.deployDictionary(bundle, owner);
 54 |         mc.deployProxy(dictionary, initData);
 55 |         return mc.finishProcess(pid);
 56 |     }
 57 |     // With Default Value
 58 | 
 59 |     function deploy(MCDevKit storage mc) internal returns (MCDevKit storage) {
 60 |         uint256 pid = mc.startProcess("deploy");
 61 |         mc.deploy(mc.bundle.findCurrent(), ForgeHelper.msgSender(), "");
 62 |         return mc.finishProcess(pid);
 63 |     }
 64 | 
 65 |     function deploy(MCDevKit storage mc, Bundle storage bundle) internal returns (MCDevKit storage) {
 66 |         uint256 pid = mc.startProcess("deploy", param(bundle));
 67 |         mc.deploy(bundle, ForgeHelper.msgSender(), "");
 68 |         return mc.finishProcess(pid);
 69 |     }
 70 | 
 71 |     function deploy(MCDevKit storage mc, Bundle storage bundle, address owner) internal returns (MCDevKit storage) {
 72 |         uint256 pid = mc.startProcess("deploy", param(bundle, owner));
 73 |         mc.deploy(bundle, owner, "");
 74 |         return mc.finishProcess(pid);
 75 |     }
 76 | 
 77 |     function deploy(MCDevKit storage mc, Bundle storage bundle, bytes memory initData)
 78 |         internal
 79 |         returns (MCDevKit storage)
 80 |     {
 81 |         uint256 pid = mc.startProcess("deploy", param(bundle, initData));
 82 |         mc.deploy(bundle, ForgeHelper.msgSender(), initData);
 83 |         return mc.finishProcess(pid);
 84 |     }
 85 | 
 86 |     function deploy(MCDevKit storage mc, address owner) internal returns (MCDevKit storage) {
 87 |         uint256 pid = mc.startProcess("deploy", param(owner));
 88 |         mc.deploy(mc.bundle.findCurrent(), owner, "");
 89 |         return mc.finishProcess(pid);
 90 |     }
 91 | 
 92 |     function deploy(MCDevKit storage mc, address owner, bytes memory initData) internal returns (MCDevKit storage) {
 93 |         uint256 pid = mc.startProcess("deploy", param(owner, initData));
 94 |         mc.deploy(mc.bundle.findCurrent(), owner, initData);
 95 |         return mc.finishProcess(pid);
 96 |     }
 97 | 
 98 |     function deploy(MCDevKit storage mc, bytes memory initData) internal returns (MCDevKit storage) {
 99 |         uint256 pid = mc.startProcess("deploy", param(initData));
100 |         mc.deploy(mc.bundle.findCurrent(), ForgeHelper.msgSender(), initData);
101 |         return mc.finishProcess(pid);
102 |     }
103 | 
104 |     /**
105 |      * ---------------------
106 |      *     🏠 Deploy Proxy
107 |      * -----------------------
108 |      */
109 |     function deployProxy(MCDevKit storage mc, Dictionary storage dictionary, bytes memory initData)
110 |         internal
111 |         returns (Proxy memory proxy)
112 |     {
113 |         uint256 pid = mc.startProcess("deployProxy", param(dictionary, initData));
114 |         Validator.MUST_Completed(dictionary);
115 |         /// @dev Accepts any initData as input
116 |         Proxy memory _proxy = ProxyLib.deploy(dictionary, initData);
117 |         proxy = mc.proxy.register(dictionary.name, _proxy);
118 |         mc.finishProcess(pid);
119 |     }
120 |     // With Default Value
121 | 
122 |     function deployProxy(MCDevKit storage mc) internal returns (Proxy memory proxy) {
123 |         uint256 pid = mc.startProcess("deployProxy");
124 |         proxy = mc.deployProxy(mc.dictionary.findCurrent(), "");
125 |         mc.finishProcess(pid);
126 |     }
127 | 
128 |     function deployProxy(MCDevKit storage mc, Dictionary storage dictionary) internal returns (Proxy memory proxy) {
129 |         uint256 pid = mc.startProcess("deployProxy", param(dictionary));
130 |         proxy = mc.deployProxy(dictionary, "");
131 |         mc.finishProcess(pid);
132 |     }
133 | 
134 |     function deployProxy(MCDevKit storage mc, bytes memory initData) internal returns (Proxy memory proxy) {
135 |         uint256 pid = mc.startProcess("deployProxy", param(initData));
136 |         proxy = mc.deployProxy(mc.dictionary.findCurrent(), initData);
137 |         mc.finishProcess(pid);
138 |     }
139 | 
140 |     /**
141 |      * -------------------------
142 |      *     📚 Deploy Dictionary
143 |      * ---------------------------
144 |      */
145 |     function deployDictionary(MCDevKit storage mc, Bundle storage bundle, address owner)
146 |         internal
147 |         returns (Dictionary storage dictionary)
148 |     {
149 |         uint256 pid = mc.startProcess("deployDictionary", param(bundle, owner));
150 |         Validator.MUST_Completed(bundle);
151 |         Validator.SHOULD_OwnerIsNotZeroAddress(owner);
152 |         Dictionary memory _dictionary =
153 |             DictionaryLib.deploy(owner).assignName(bundle.name).set(bundle).upgradeFacade(bundle.facade); // TODO gen and set facade
154 |         dictionary = mc.dictionary.register(_dictionary);
155 |         mc.finishProcess(pid);
156 |     }
157 |     // With Default Value
158 | 
159 |     function deployDictionary(MCDevKit storage mc) internal returns (Dictionary storage dictionary) {
160 |         uint256 pid = mc.startProcess("deployDictionary");
161 |         dictionary = mc.deployDictionary(mc.bundle.findCurrent(), ForgeHelper.msgSender());
162 |         mc.finishProcess(pid);
163 |     }
164 | 
165 |     function deployDictionary(MCDevKit storage mc, Bundle storage bundle)
166 |         internal
167 |         returns (Dictionary storage dictionary)
168 |     {
169 |         uint256 pid = mc.startProcess("deployDictionary", param(bundle));
170 |         dictionary = mc.deployDictionary(bundle, ForgeHelper.msgSender());
171 |         mc.finishProcess(pid);
172 |     }
173 | 
174 |     function deployDictionary(MCDevKit storage mc, address owner) internal returns (Dictionary storage dictionary) {
175 |         uint256 pid = mc.startProcess("deployDictionary", param(owner));
176 |         dictionary = mc.deployDictionary(mc.bundle.findCurrent(), owner);
177 |         mc.finishProcess(pid);
178 |     }
179 | 
180 |     /**
181 |      * ----------------------------
182 |      *     🔂 Duplicate Dictionary
183 |      * ------------------------------
184 |      */
185 |     function duplicateDictionary(MCDevKit storage mc, Dictionary storage dictionary, address owner)
186 |         internal
187 |         returns (Dictionary storage duplicatedDictionary)
188 |     {
189 |         uint256 pid = mc.startProcess("duplicateDictionary", param(dictionary, owner));
190 |         Dictionary memory _duplicatedDictionary = DictionaryLib.duplicate(dictionary, owner);
191 |         duplicatedDictionary = mc.dictionary.register(_duplicatedDictionary);
192 |         mc.finishProcess(pid);
193 |     }
194 |     // With Default Value
195 | 
196 |     function duplicateDictionary(MCDevKit storage mc) internal returns (Dictionary storage duplicatedDictionary) {
197 |         uint256 pid = mc.startProcess("duplicateDictionary");
198 |         duplicatedDictionary = mc.duplicateDictionary(mc.dictionary.findCurrent(), ForgeHelper.msgSender());
199 |         mc.finishProcess(pid);
200 |     }
201 | 
202 |     function duplicateDictionary(MCDevKit storage mc, Dictionary storage dictionary)
203 |         internal
204 |         returns (Dictionary storage duplicatedDictionary)
205 |     {
206 |         uint256 pid = mc.startProcess("duplicateDictionary", param(dictionary));
207 |         duplicatedDictionary = mc.duplicateDictionary(dictionary, ForgeHelper.msgSender());
208 |         mc.finishProcess(pid);
209 |     }
210 | 
211 |     function duplicateDictionary(MCDevKit storage mc, address owner)
212 |         internal
213 |         returns (Dictionary storage duplicatedDictionary)
214 |     {
215 |         uint256 pid = mc.startProcess("duplicateDictionary", param(owner));
216 |         duplicatedDictionary = mc.duplicateDictionary(mc.dictionary.findCurrent(), owner);
217 |         mc.finishProcess(pid);
218 |     }
219 | 
220 |     /**
221 |      * ------------------------
222 |      *     💽 Load Dictionary
223 |      * --------------------------
224 |      */
225 |     function loadDictionary(MCDevKit storage mc, string memory name, address dictionaryAddr)
226 |         internal
227 |         returns (Dictionary storage dictionary)
228 |     {
229 |         uint256 pid = mc.startProcess("load", param(name, dictionaryAddr));
230 |         Dictionary memory _dictionary = DictionaryLib.load(name, dictionaryAddr);
231 |         dictionary = mc.dictionary.register(_dictionary);
232 |         mc.finishProcess(pid);
233 |     }
234 | }
235 |

  9 | # DevKit API Details

  1 | // SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT

  4 | /// @title Message Body
  5 | library MessageBody {
  6 |     // Config
  7 |     string constant CONFIG_FILE_MISSING =
  8 |         "Please ensure that the configuration file is present in the project root directory. If the file is missing, create a new one or restore it from the 'lib/mc/mc.toml' template.";

 10 |         "The configuration file is required and must be present in the project root directory. Please create a new 'mc.toml' file or restore it from the 'lib/mc/mc.toml' template.";

 13 |         "The provided name cannot be an empty string. Please enter a non-empty value for the name and try again.";

 15 |         "The provided environment key cannot be an empty string. Please enter a non-empty value for the key and try again.";
 16 |     string constant SELECTOR_RECOMMENDED =
 17 |         "The provided function selector is empty (0x00000000). It is recommended to use a non-empty selector.";
 18 |     string constant ADDRESS_NOT_CONTRACT =

 24 |     // Current Context

 26 |     // Function

 43 |     string constant NO_FUNCTIONS_IN_BUNDLE =

 51 |     string constant BUNDLE_NOT_COMPLETE =

 66 |     // Proxy

219 | ### deployCode
220 | 
221 | 
222 | ```solidity
223 | function deployCode(string memory what) internal virtual returns (address addr);
224 | ```
225 | 
226 | ### deployCode
227 | 
228 | *deploy contract with value on construction*
229 | 
230 | 
231 | ```solidity
232 | function deployCode(string memory what, bytes memory args, uint256 val) internal virtual returns (address addr);
233 | ```
234 |

240 | ```

328 | 
329 | ## Structs
330 | ### RawTx1559
331 | 
332 | ```solidity
333 | struct RawTx1559 {
334 |     string[] arguments;
335 |     address contractAddress;
336 |     string contractName;
337 |     string functionSig;
338 |     bytes32 hash;
339 |     RawTx1559Detail txDetail;
340 |     string opcode;
341 | }
342 | ```
343 | 
344 | ### RawTx1559Detail
345 | 
346 | ```solidity
347 | struct RawTx1559Detail {
348 |     AccessList[] accessList;
349 |     bytes data;
350 |     address from;
351 |     bytes gas;
352 |     bytes nonce;
353 |     address to;
354 |     bytes txType;
355 |     bytes value;
356 | }
357 | ```
358 | 
359 | ### Tx1559
360 | 
361 | ```solidity
362 | struct Tx1559 {
363 |     string[] arguments;
364 |     address contractAddress;
365 |     string contractName;
366 |     string functionSig;
367 |     bytes32 hash;
368 |     Tx1559Detail txDetail;
369 |     string opcode;
370 | }
371 | ```
372 | 
373 | ### Tx1559Detail
374 | 
375 | ```solidity
376 | struct Tx1559Detail {
377 |     AccessList[] accessList;
378 |     bytes data;
379 |     address from;
380 |     uint256 gas;
381 |     uint256 nonce;
382 |     address to;
383 |     uint256 txType;
384 |     uint256 value;
385 | }
386 | ```
387 | 
388 | ### TxLegacy
389 | 
390 | ```solidity
391 | struct TxLegacy {
392 |     string[] arguments;
393 |     address contractAddress;
394 |     string contractName;
395 |     string functionSig;
396 |     string hash;
397 |     string opcode;
398 |     TxDetailLegacy transaction;
399 | }
400 | ```
401 | 
402 | ### TxDetailLegacy
403 | 
404 | ```solidity
405 | struct TxDetailLegacy {
406 |     AccessList[] accessList;
407 |     uint256 chainId;
408 |     bytes data;
409 |     address from;
410 |     uint256 gas;
411 |     uint256 gasPrice;
412 |     bytes32 hash;
413 |     uint256 nonce;
414 |     bytes1 opcode;
415 |     bytes32 r;
416 |     bytes32 s;
417 |     uint256 txType;
418 |     address to;
419 |     uint8 v;
420 |     uint256 value;
421 | }
422 | ```
423 | 
424 | ### AccessList
425 | 
426 | ```solidity
427 | struct AccessList {
428 |     address accessAddress;
429 |     bytes32[] storageKeys;
430 | }
431 | ```
432 | 
433 | ### RawReceipt
434 | 
435 | ```solidity
436 | struct RawReceipt {
437 |     bytes32 blockHash;
438 |     bytes blockNumber;
439 |     address contractAddress;
440 |     bytes cumulativeGasUsed;
441 |     bytes effectiveGasPrice;
442 |     address from;
443 |     bytes gasUsed;
444 |     RawReceiptLog[] logs;
445 |     bytes logsBloom;
446 |     bytes status;
447 |     address to;
448 |     bytes32 transactionHash;
449 |     bytes transactionIndex;
450 | }
451 | ```
452 | 
453 | ### Receipt
454 | 
455 | ```solidity
456 | struct Receipt {
457 |     bytes32 blockHash;
458 |     uint256 blockNumber;
459 |     address contractAddress;
460 |     uint256 cumulativeGasUsed;
461 |     uint256 effectiveGasPrice;
462 |     address from;
463 |     uint256 gasUsed;
464 |     ReceiptLog[] logs;
465 |     bytes logsBloom;
466 |     uint256 status;
467 |     address to;
468 |     bytes32 transactionHash;
469 |     uint256 transactionIndex;
470 | }
471 | ```
472 | 
473 | ### EIP1559ScriptArtifact
474 | 
475 | ```solidity
476 | struct EIP1559ScriptArtifact {
477 |     string[] libraries;
478 |     string path;
479 |     string[] pending;
480 |     Receipt[] receipts;
481 |     uint256 timestamp;
482 |     Tx1559[] transactions;
483 |     TxReturn[] txReturns;
484 | }
485 | ```
486 | 
487 | ### RawEIP1559ScriptArtifact
488 | 
489 | ```solidity
490 | struct RawEIP1559ScriptArtifact {
491 |     string[] libraries;
492 |     string path;
493 |     string[] pending;
494 |     RawReceipt[] receipts;
495 |     TxReturn[] txReturns;
496 |     uint256 timestamp;
497 |     RawTx1559[] transactions;
498 | }
499 | ```
500 | 
501 | ### RawReceiptLog
502 | 
503 | ```solidity
504 | struct RawReceiptLog {
505 |     address logAddress;
506 |     bytes32 blockHash;
507 |     bytes blockNumber;
508 |     bytes data;
509 |     bytes logIndex;
510 |     bool removed;
511 |     bytes32[] topics;
512 |     bytes32 transactionHash;
513 |     bytes transactionIndex;
514 |     bytes transactionLogIndex;
515 | }
516 | ```
517 | 
518 | ### ReceiptLog
519 | 
520 | ```solidity
521 | struct ReceiptLog {
522 |     address logAddress;
523 |     bytes32 blockHash;
524 |     uint256 blockNumber;
525 |     bytes data;
526 |     uint256 logIndex;
527 |     bytes32[] topics;
528 |     uint256 transactionIndex;
529 |     uint256 transactionLogIndex;
530 |     bool removed;
531 | }
532 | ```
533 | 
534 | ### TxReturn
535 | 
536 | ```solidity
537 | struct TxReturn {
538 |     string internalType;
539 |     string value;
540 | }
541 | ```
542 | 
543 | ### Account
544 | 
545 | ```solidity
546 | struct Account {
547 |     address addr;
548 |     uint256 key;
549 | }
550 | ```
551 | 
552 | ## Enums
553 | ### AddressType
554 | 
555 | ```solidity
556 | enum AddressType {
557 |     Payable,
558 |     NonPayable,
559 |     ZeroAddress,
560 |     Precompile,
561 |     ForgeAddress
562 | }
563 | ```

/site/docs/03-api/03-api-details/Flattened.sol/library.MessageBody.md:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1 | # MessageBody
  2 | [Git Source](https://github.com/metacontract/mc/blob/main/src/devkit/Flattened.sol)
  3 | 
  4 | 
  5 | ## State Variables
  6 | ### CONFIG_FILE_MISSING
  7 | 
  8 | ```solidity
  9 | string constant CONFIG_FILE_MISSING =
 10 |     "Please ensure that the configuration file is present in the project root directory. If the file is missing, create a new one or restore it from the 'lib/mc/mc.toml' template.";
 11 | ```
 12 | 
 13 | 
 14 | ### CONFIG_FILE_REQUIRED
 15 | 
 16 | ```solidity
 17 | string constant CONFIG_FILE_REQUIRED =
 18 |     "The configuration file is required and must be present in the project root directory. Please create a new 'mc.toml' file or restore it from the 'lib/mc/mc.toml' template.";
 19 | ```
 20 | 
 21 | 
 22 | ### NAME_REQUIRED
 23 | 
 24 | ```solidity
 25 | string constant NAME_REQUIRED =
 26 |     "The provided name cannot be an empty string. Please enter a non-empty value for the name and try again.";
 27 | ```
 28 | 
 29 | 
 30 | ### ENV_KEY_REQUIRED
 31 | 
 32 | ```solidity
 33 | string constant ENV_KEY_REQUIRED =
 34 |     "The provided environment key cannot be an empty string. Please enter a non-empty value for the key and try again.";
 35 | ```
 36 | 
 37 | 
 38 | ### SELECTOR_RECOMMENDED
 39 | 
 40 | ```solidity
 41 | string constant SELECTOR_RECOMMENDED =
 42 |     "The provided function selector is empty (0x00000000). It is recommended to use a non-empty selector.";

  5 | ## State Variables
  6 | ### CONFIG_FILE_MISSING
  7 | 
  8 | ```solidity
  9 | string constant CONFIG_FILE_MISSING =
 10 |     "Please ensure that the configuration file is present in the project root directory. If the file is missing, create a new one or restore it from the 'lib/mc/mc.toml' template.";
 11 | ```
 12 | 
 13 | 
 14 | ### CONFIG_FILE_REQUIRED
 15 | 
 16 | ```solidity

 18 |     "The configuration file is required and must be present in the project root directory. Please create a new 'mc.toml' file or restore it from the 'lib/mc/mc.toml' template.";
 19 | ```

327 | ```
328 | 
329 | 
330 | ### DICTIONARY_NOT_COMPLETE
331 | 
332 | ```solidity
333 | string constant DICTIONARY_NOT_COMPLETE =
334 |     "The dictionary object is not marked as complete. Please ensure all requirements are met before proceeding.";
335 | ```
336 | 
337 | 
338 | ### DICTIONARY_NOT_VERIFIABLE
339 | 
340 | ```solidity
341 | string constant DICTIONARY_NOT_VERIFIABLE =
342 |     "The dictionary is not verifiable. Please ensure all prerequisites are met for verification.";
343 | ```
344 | 
345 | 
346 | ### DICTIONARY_LOCKED
347 | 
348 | ```solidity
349 | string constant DICTIONARY_LOCKED = "The dictionary object is currently locked and cannot be modified.";
350 | ```
351 | 
352 | 
353 | ### DICTIONARY_NOT_BUILDING
354 | 
355 | ```solidity
356 | string constant DICTIONARY_NOT_BUILDING =
357 |     "The dictionary is not currently in the building state. Please initiate the building process before proceeding.";
358 | ```
359 | 
360 | 
361 | ### DICTIONARY_NOT_BUILT
362 | 
363 | ```solidity
364 | string constant DICTIONARY_NOT_BUILT =
365 |     "The dictionary has not been successfully built yet. Please complete the building process before attempting to use the dictionary.";
366 | ```
367 | 
368 | 
369 | ### DICTIONARY_ALREADY_REGISTERED
370 | 
371 | ```solidity
372 | string constant DICTIONARY_ALREADY_REGISTERED =
373 |     "The dictionary name is already registered in the registry. Please use a different name.";
374 | ```
375 | 
376 | 
377 | ### DICTIONARY_NOT_REGISTERED
378 | 
379 | ```solidity
380 | string constant DICTIONARY_NOT_REGISTERED =
381 |     "The dictionary name is not registered in the registry. Please register the dictionary name before proceeding.";
382 | ```
383 | 
384 |
