--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
/site/docs/02-guides/02-development/02-tdd.md:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1 | ---
  2 | keywords: [TDD, implementation, AI-assisted development, smart contracts, foundry, colocation]
  3 | tags: [TDD, implementation, AI-assisted development, smart contracts, foundry, colocation]
  4 | last_update:
  5 |   date: 2024-10-28
  6 |   author: Meta Contract Development Team
  7 | ---
  8 | 
  9 | # Test-Driven Development
 10 | 
 11 | This guide outlines our approach to Test-Driven Development (TDD) and implementation in Meta Contract projects, leveraging Foundry as our testing framework and incorporating AI assistance throughout the process.
 12 | 
 13 | ## Understanding Testing Challenges in Smart Contracts
 14 | 
 15 | Smart contract developers often face three major challenges:
 16 | 
 17 | 1. **Managing Uncertainty**: The ever-evolving nature of technology and security threats makes it challenging to develop provably secure software.
 18 | 2. **Managing Computational Resources**: Optimizing for gas efficiency (often called "gas golfing") can increase complexity and reduce readability.
 19 | 3. **Managing Software Complexity**: Especially when dealing with complex domain logic, balancing functionality with simplicity becomes crucial.
 20 | 
 21 | To address these challenges, our AI-assisted Test-Driven Development (AITDD) approach, integrated with the architecture of Meta Contract, provides a robust framework through automated testing and modular design.
 22 | 
 23 | ## AI-Assisted Test-Driven Development with Foundry
 24 | 
 25 | This section introduces an AI-assisted Test-Driven Development (TDD) approach using Foundry, enabling a more efficient and thorough development cycle.
 26 | 
 27 | ### Basic TDD Workflow
 28 | 
 29 | 1. **Specify & Analyze**: Define the feature or functionality you want to implement. Use AI to clarify project requirements and suggest test cases, identifying risks and challenges.
 30 | 2. **Write Tests**: Create Foundry tests that define the expected behavior.
 31 | 3. **Run Tests**: Execute the tests (they should fail initially).
 32 | 4. **Implement**: Write the minimum code necessary to pass the tests.
 33 | 5. **Refactor**: Improve the code while ensuring tests continue to pass.
 34 | 6. **Repeat**: Move on to the next feature or refinement.
 35 | 
 36 | ```mermaid
 37 | flowchart LR
 38 |    A[Specify & Analyze] --> B[Write & Run Tests]
 39 |    B --> C[Implement to Pass]
 40 |    C --> D[Refactor]
 41 |    D --> A
 42 | 
 43 |    style A color:#000000,fill:#ffffcc,stroke:#cccc00,stroke-width:2px
 44 |    style B color:#000000,fill:#ffcccc,stroke:#ff6666,stroke-width:2px
 45 |    style C color:#000000,fill:#ccffcc,stroke:#66ff66,stroke-width:2px
 46 |    style D color:#000000,fill:#ccccff,stroke:#6666ff,stroke-width:2px
 47 | ```
 48 | 
 49 | ### Leveraging AI
 50 | 
 51 | 1. **AI-Assisted Specification**: Utilize AI to articulate and refine project requirements and test cases.
 52 | 2. **Continuous AI Feedback**: Leverage AI for code review and improvement suggestions, optimizing computational resources and enhancing security.
 53 | 3. **Iterative Development**: Continuously refine tests and implementations based on AI insights, ensuring adaptability and robustness in the face of evolving challenges.
 54 | 
 55 | ## Example Workflow
 56 | 
 57 | Here are practical ways to integrate AI into your TDD workflow.
 58 | 
 59 | ### 1. Setting Up the Project
 60 | 
 61 | Create a new Meta Contract project. For details, refer to the [Setup Guide](../01-setup/index.md).
 62 | 
 63 | ### 2. Defining Features and Analyzing Requirements
 64 | 
 65 | Clearly define the feature you want to implement, such as "allow users to vote on proposals" in a voting system. Gather requirements from stakeholders or documentation, and use AI to refine these requirements and suggest test cases. Identify any risks or challenges, like security concerns, and set success criteria for the feature's expected behavior and outcomes. This prepares you for writing tests in the next step.
 66 | 
 67 | ### 3. Writing Unit Tests and Implementations
 68 | 
 69 | #### Colocation in Meta Contract Development
 70 | 
 71 | The architecture of Meta Contract allows for function-level granularity, enabling developers to manage functions in separate files. This feature facilitates a colocated TDD approach, where tests are placed in the same file as the implementation.
 72 | 
 73 | ##### Benefits of Colocation
 74 | 
 75 | 1. **Improved Maintainability**: Keep related code and tests together for easier updates.
 76 | 2. **Enhanced Readability**: Developers can easily understand the expected behavior alongside the implementation.
 77 | 3. **Faster Development Cycle**: Quickly iterate between writing tests and implementation.
 78 | 
 79 | #### Code Generation & Review with AI
 80 | 
 81 | 1. **Test Case Generation with AI**
 82 | 
 83 |    Use AI to suggest potential test cases based on your function specifications.
 84 | 
 85 |    Example:
 86 |    ```
 87 |    Human: I'm writing a vote function for a voting system. What test cases should I consider?
 88 | 
 89 |    AI: For a vote function in a voting system, consider the following test cases:
 90 |    1. Successful vote cast
 91 |    2. Voting on a non-existent proposal
 92 |    3. Voting twice from the same address
 93 |    4. Voting after the proposal deadline
 94 |    5. Voting with insufficient voting power
 95 |    6. Correct event emission after voting
 96 |    7. Voting power accurately reflected in the vote count
 97 |    8. Boundary conditions (e.g., first vote, last vote)
 98 |    ```
 99 | 
100 | 2. **Code Review Assistance**
101 | 
102 |    After implementing a feature, use AI to review your code and suggest improvements.
103 | 
104 |    Example:
105 |    ```
106 |    Human: Can you review this vote function implementation?
107 | 
108 |    [Paste your implementation & tests here]
109 | 
110 |    AI: Here's a review of your vote function:
111 |    1. Gas Optimization: Consider using uint256 instead of uint for better gas efficiency.
112 |    2. Security: Add a check to ensure msg.sender has not voted before.
113 |    3. Event Emission: Make sure to emit a VoteCast event for off-chain tracking.
114 |    4. Error Handling: Use custom errors instead of require statements for better gas efficiency and more informative error messages.
115 |    ```
116 | 
117 | #### Example of Colocated Test and Implementation
118 | 
119 | ```solidity
120 | // File: src/voting-system/functions/Vote.sol
121 | 
122 | // SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT
123 | pragma solidity ^0.8.24;
124 | 
125 | import {Storage, Schema} from "bundle/voting-system/storages/Storage.sol";
126 | 
127 | contract Vote {
128 |     // Implementation
129 |     function vote(uint256 proposalId) public {
130 |         Schema.Proposal storage $proposal = Storage.Proposals().getProposal(proposalId);
131 | 
132 |         // Check if the proposal exists
133 |         if (!$proposal.exists()) revert VotingSystemErrors.ProposalNotFound();
134 | 
135 |         // Check if the voter has already voted
136 |         if ($proposal.hasVoted(msg.sender)) revert VotingSystemErrors.AlreadyVoted();
137 | 
138 |         // Record the vote
139 |         $proposal.setVote(msg.sender, true);
140 | 
141 |         // Emit event
142 |         emit VoteCast(proposalId, msg.sender);
143 |     }
144 | }
145 | 
146 | // Unit Testing
147 | import {MCTest} from "@mc-devkit/Flattened.sol";
148 | import {VotingSystemErrors} from "bundle/voting-system/interfaces/VotingSystemErrors.sol";
149 | import {VotingSystemEvents} from "bundle/voting-system/interfaces/VotingSystemEvents.sol";
150 | 
151 | contract VoteTest is MCTest {
152 |     function setUp() public {
153 |         address _vote = address(new Vote());
154 |         _use(Vote.vote.selector, _vote);
155 |     }
156 | 
157 |     function test_vote_success() public {
158 |         // Setup: Create a proposal
159 |         uint256 proposalId = 1;
160 |         Storage.Proposals().createProposal(proposalId, Schema.Proposal({exists: true, ...}));
161 | 
162 |         // Test: Expect VoteCast event
163 |         vm.expectEmit();
164 |         emit VoteCast(proposalId, address(this));
165 | 
166 |         // Action: Cast a vote
167 |         Vote(target).vote(proposalId);
168 | 
169 |         // Assert: Check that the vote was recorded
170 |         assertTrue(Storage.Proposals().getProposal(proposalId).hasVoted(address(this)));
171 |     }
172 | 
173 |     function test_vote_alreadyVoted() public {
174 |         // Setup: Create a proposal and record a vote
175 |         uint256 proposalId = 1;
176 |         Storage.Proposals().createProposal(proposalId, Schema.Proposal({exists: true, ...}));
177 |         Storage.Proposals().setVote(proposalId, address(this), true);
178 | 
179 |         // Test: Expect revert
180 |         vm.expectRevert(VotingSystemErrors.AlreadyVoted.selector);
181 | 
182 |         // Action: Attempt to vote again
183 |         Vote(target).vote(proposalId);
184 |     }
185 | }
186 | ```
187 | 
188 | Then, run tests:
189 | ```bash
190 | forge test -mc VoteTest
191 | ```
192 | 
193 | This example demonstrates:
194 | - The implementation of the `vote` function
195 | - Two unit tests: one for successful voting and one for the "already voted" scenario
196 | - Use of Meta Contract's storage patterns
197 | - Event emission and checking
198 | - Error handling and testing
199 | 
200 | ### 4. Writing Integration Tests
201 | 
202 | Integration tests are crucial for ensuring that different components of your system work together correctly. They differ from unit tests in that they test the interaction between multiple functions or contracts.
203 | 
204 | 1. Create a test file (e.g., `test/VotingSystem.t.sol`):
205 | 
206 |    ```solidity
207 |     // SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT
208 |     pragma solidity ^0.8.24;
209 | 
210 |     import {MCTest} from "@mc-devkit/Flattened.sol";
211 |     import {IVotingSystem} from "bundle/voting-system/interfaces/IVotingSystem.sol";
212 |     import {VotingSystemErrors} from "bundle/voting-system/interfaces/VotingSystemErrors.sol";
213 |     import {VotingSystemEvents} from "bundle/voting-system/interfaces/VotingSystemEvents.sol";
214 | 
215 |     contract VotingSystemTest is Test {
216 |         IVotingSystem public votingSystem = IVotingSystem(target);
217 | 
218 |         function setUp() public {
219 |             address _vote = address(new Vote());
220 |             _use(Vote.vote.selector, _vote);
221 |             address _tally = address(new Tally());
222 |             _use(Tally.tally.selector, _tally);
223 |         }
224 | 
225 |         function test_scenario_votingWithTie() public {
226 |             // Setup: Create a proposal
227 |             uint256 proposalId = votingSystem.createProposal("Test Proposal");
228 | 
229 |             // Action: Two users vote on the proposal
230 |             vm.prank(address(0x1));
231 |             votingSystem.vote(proposalId, true);
232 |             vm.prank(address(0x2));
233 |             votingSystem.vote(proposalId, false);
234 | 
235 |             // Test: Expect TalliedWithTie event
236 |             vm.expectEmit();
237 |             emit VotingSystemEvents.TalliedWithTie(proposalId);
238 | 
239 |             // Action & Assert: Tally votes and check for tie
240 |             votingSystem.tally(proposalId);
241 |         }
242 |     }
243 |    ```
244 | 
245 | 2. Run tests:
246 |    ```bash
247 |    forge test
248 |    ```
249 | 
250 | 3. Get test coverage:
251 |    ```bash
252 |    forge coverage
253 |    ```
254 | 
255 | This integration test demonstrates:
256 | - Setting up multiple functions (`vote` and `tally`)
257 | - Testing a complete voting scenario
258 | - Checking interactions between different parts of the system
259 | 
260 | ### 5. Refactoring and Iteration
261 | 
262 | Refactoring is essential in TDD to improve code structure without changing its behavior. Focus on simplifying code, removing redundancies, and enhancing readability. Break down large functions into smaller, reusable components, and ensure variable and function names are descriptive. Apply the DRY principle to eliminate duplicate code and optimize performance, especially for gas efficiency in smart contracts. Always update documentation to reflect changes. For example, refactor a vote calculation by creating a [helper function](./04-using-internal-library.md) to sum votes, promoting clarity and reuse.
263 | 
264 | ## Best Practices
265 | 
266 | 1. **Comprehensive Testing**: Aim for high test coverage, including edge cases and failure scenarios.
267 | 2. **Gas Optimization**: Use Foundry's gas reporting feature to optimize contracts while maintaining readability.
268 | 3. **Regular AI Code Review**: Periodically review code with AI assistance to catch potential issues early.
269 | 4. **Security-First Approach**: Utilize Foundry's built-in security analysis tools and consider additional audits for critical contracts.
270 | 5. **Documentation Consistency**: Keep documentation up-to-date with code changes, including inline comments explaining complex logic.
271 | 6. **Community Involvement**: Engage with the Meta Contract community to share testing strategies and stay updated on best practices.
272 | 7. **Leverage Function-Level Granularity**: Take advantage of Meta Contract's architecture to write focused, granular tests for each function.
273 | 8. **Use Meta Contract DevKit**: Utilize the tools provided in the Meta Contract DevKit for more efficient testing and development.
274 | 9. **Consistent Naming Conventions**: Follow Meta Contract's naming conventions for functions, events, and errors to maintain consistency across your project.
275 | 
276 | By following this AI-assisted TDD approach with Foundry and leveraging the architecture of Meta Contract for colocation, you can develop more robust, efficient, and well-tested smart contract projects.
277 | 
278 | ## Troubleshooting Common Issues
279 | 
280 | 1. **"Function selector not found" error**:
281 |    - Ensure that you've correctly used the `_use` function in your test setup to map function selectors to their implementations.
282 | 
283 | 2. **Gas estimation failed**:
284 |    - Check for infinite loops or extremely gas-intensive operations in your code.
285 |    - Ensure you're not accidentally calling non-existent functions.
286 | 
287 | 3. **Storage conflicts**:
288 |    - Verify that you're using the correct storage slots and following Meta Contract's storage patterns.
289 | 
290 | 4. **Event emission tests failing**:
291 |    - Double-check the event signature and parameters.
292 |    - Ensure you're using `vm.expectEmit` correctly, matching the number of indexed parameters.
293 | 
294 | 5. **Unexpected reverts in tests**:
295 |    - Check that all necessary setup steps (e.g., creating a proposal before voting) are performed in your tests.
296 |    - Verify that you're calling functions with the correct parameters and from the correct addresses (use `vm.prank` when necessary).
297 | 
298 | If you encounter persistent issues, don't hesitate to reach out to the [Meta Contract community](https://github.com/metacontract/mc/discussions) for support.
299 | 


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
/src/devkit/system/Tracer.sol:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1 | // SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT
  2 | pragma solidity ^0.8.23;
  3 | 
  4 | // System
  5 | import {System} from "@mc-devkit/system/System.sol";
  6 | import {Logger} from "@mc-devkit/system/Logger.sol";
  7 | // Types
  8 | import {Inspector} from "@mc-devkit/types/Inspector.sol";
  9 | 
 10 | using Inspector for bool;
 11 | 
 12 | import {Formatter} from "@mc-devkit/types/Formatter.sol";
 13 | 
 14 | using Formatter for Process global;
 15 | using Formatter for bytes4;
 16 | using Formatter for address;
 17 | using Formatter for string;
 18 | // Core Types
 19 | 
 20 | import {MCDevKit} from "@mc-devkit/MCDevKit.sol";
 21 | import {Function} from "@mc-devkit/core/Function.sol";
 22 | import {FunctionRegistry} from "@mc-devkit/registry/FunctionRegistry.sol";
 23 | import {Bundle} from "@mc-devkit/core/Bundle.sol";
 24 | import {BundleRegistry} from "@mc-devkit/registry/BundleRegistry.sol";
 25 | import {StdRegistry} from "@mc-devkit/registry/StdRegistry.sol";
 26 | import {StdFunctions} from "@mc-devkit/registry/StdFunctions.sol";
 27 | import {Proxy} from "@mc-devkit/core/Proxy.sol";
 28 | import {ProxyRegistry} from "@mc-devkit/registry/ProxyRegistry.sol";
 29 | import {Dictionary} from "@mc-devkit/core/Dictionary.sol";
 30 | import {DictionaryRegistry} from "@mc-devkit/registry/DictionaryRegistry.sol";
 31 | import {Current} from "@mc-devkit/registry/context/Current.sol";
 32 | 
 33 | /**
 34 |  * =================
 35 |  *     ⛓️ Process
 36 |  * ===================
 37 |  */
 38 | /// @custom:storage-location erc7201:mc.devkit.tracer
 39 | struct Trace {
 40 |     Process[] processStack;
 41 |     uint256 nextPid;
 42 |     uint256 currentNest;
 43 | }
 44 | 
 45 | struct Process {
 46 |     string libName;
 47 |     string funcName;
 48 |     string params;
 49 |     uint256 nest;
 50 |     bool isFinished;
 51 | }
 52 | 
 53 | library Tracer {
 54 |     /**
 55 |      * ----------------------------
 56 |      *     📈 Execution Tracking
 57 |      * ------------------------------
 58 |      */
 59 |     function start(string memory libName, string memory funcName, string memory params)
 60 |         internal
 61 |         returns (uint256 pid)
 62 |     {
 63 |         if (Logger.isDisable()) return 0;
 64 |         Trace storage trace = System.Tracer();
 65 |         pid = trace.nextPid;
 66 |         Process memory process = Process(libName, funcName, params, trace.currentNest, false);
 67 |         trace.processStack.push(process);
 68 |         trace.currentNest++;
 69 |         Logger.logInfo(process.toStart(pid));
 70 |         trace.nextPid++;
 71 |     }
 72 | 
 73 |     function finish(uint256 pid) internal {
 74 |         if (Logger.isDisable()) return;
 75 |         Trace storage trace = System.Tracer();
 76 |         Process storage process = trace.processStack[pid];
 77 |         process.isFinished = true;
 78 |         Logger.logInfo(process.toFinish(pid));
 79 |         trace.currentNest--;
 80 |     }
 81 | 
 82 |     function traceErrorLocations() internal view returns (string memory locations) {
 83 |         Process[] memory processStack = System.Tracer().processStack;
 84 |         for (uint256 i = processStack.length; i > 0; --i) {
 85 |             Process memory process = processStack[i - 1];
 86 |             if (process.isFinished) continue;
 87 |             locations = locations.append(process.toLocation());
 88 |         }
 89 |     }
 90 | 
 91 |     /**
 92 |      * -----------
 93 |      *     🌞 mc
 94 |      * -------------
 95 |      */
 96 |     function startProcess(MCDevKit storage, string memory name, string memory params) internal returns (uint256) {
 97 |         return start("mc", name, params);
 98 |     }
 99 | 
100 |     function startProcess(MCDevKit storage mc, string memory name) internal returns (uint256) {
101 |         return startProcess(mc, name, "");
102 |     }
103 | 
104 |     function finishProcess(MCDevKit storage mc, uint256 pid) internal returns (MCDevKit storage) {
105 |         finish(pid);
106 |         return mc;
107 |     }
108 | 
109 |     // String
110 |     function finishProcess(string memory str, uint256 pid) internal returns (string memory) {
111 |         finish(pid);
112 |         return str;
113 |     }
114 | 
115 |     /**
116 |      * ------------------
117 |      *     🧩 Function
118 |      * --------------------
119 |      */
120 |     function startProcess(Function storage, string memory name, string memory params) internal returns (uint256) {
121 |         return start("Function", name, params);
122 |     }
123 | 
124 |     function startProcess(Function storage func, string memory name) internal returns (uint256) {
125 |         return startProcess(func, name, "");
126 |     }
127 | 
128 |     function finishProcess(Function storage func, uint256 pid) internal returns (Function storage) {
129 |         finish(pid);
130 |         return func;
131 |     }
132 | 
133 |     /**
134 |      * --------------------------
135 |      *     🧩 Functions Registry
136 |      * ----------------------------
137 |      */
138 |     function startProcess(FunctionRegistry storage, string memory name, string memory params)
139 |         internal
140 |         returns (uint256)
141 |     {
142 |         return start("FunctionRegistry", name, params);
143 |     }
144 | 
145 |     function startProcess(FunctionRegistry storage functions, string memory name) internal returns (uint256) {
146 |         return functions.startProcess(name, "");
147 |     }
148 | 
149 |     function finishProcess(FunctionRegistry storage functions, uint256 pid)
150 |         internal
151 |         returns (FunctionRegistry storage)
152 |     {
153 |         finish(pid);
154 |         return functions;
155 |     }
156 | 
157 |     /**
158 |      * ----------------
159 |      *     🗂️ Bundle
160 |      * ------------------
161 |      */
162 |     function startProcess(Bundle storage, string memory name, string memory params) internal returns (uint256) {
163 |         return start("Bundle", name, params);
164 |     }
165 | 
166 |     function startProcess(Bundle storage bundle, string memory name) internal returns (uint256) {
167 |         return bundle.startProcess(name, "");
168 |     }
169 | 
170 |     function finishProcess(Bundle storage bundle, uint256 pid) internal returns (Bundle storage) {
171 |         finish(pid);
172 |         return bundle;
173 |     }
174 | 
175 |     /**
176 |      * --------------------------
177 |      *     🧩 Bundle Registry
178 |      * ----------------------------
179 |      */
180 |     function startProcess(BundleRegistry storage, string memory name, string memory params)
181 |         internal
182 |         returns (uint256)
183 |     {
184 |         return start("BundleRegistry", name, params);
185 |     }
186 | 
187 |     function startProcess(BundleRegistry storage bundle, string memory name) internal returns (uint256) {
188 |         return bundle.startProcess(name, "");
189 |     }
190 | 
191 |     function finishProcess(BundleRegistry storage bundle, uint256 pid) internal returns (BundleRegistry storage) {
192 |         finish(pid);
193 |         return bundle;
194 |     }
195 | 
196 |     /**
197 |      * -------------------------
198 |      *     🏛 Standard Registry
199 |      * ---------------------------
200 |      */
201 |     function startProcess(StdRegistry storage, string memory name, string memory params) internal returns (uint256) {
202 |         return start("StdRegistryLib", name, params);
203 |     }
204 | 
205 |     function startProcess(StdRegistry storage std, string memory name) internal returns (uint256) {
206 |         return std.startProcess(name, "");
207 |     }
208 | 
209 |     function finishProcess(StdRegistry storage std, uint256 pid) internal returns (StdRegistry storage) {
210 |         finish(pid);
211 |         return std;
212 |     }
213 | 
214 |     /**
215 |      * --------------------------
216 |      *     🏰 Standard Functions
217 |      * ----------------------------
218 |      */
219 |     function startProcess(StdFunctions storage, string memory name, string memory params) internal returns (uint256) {
220 |         return start("StdFunctionsLib", name, params);
221 |     }
222 | 
223 |     function startProcess(StdFunctions storage std, string memory name) internal returns (uint256) {
224 |         return std.startProcess(name, "");
225 |     }
226 | 
227 |     function finishProcess(StdFunctions storage std, uint256 pid) internal returns (StdFunctions storage) {
228 |         finish(pid);
229 |         return std;
230 |     }
231 | 
232 |     /**
233 |      * ---------------
234 |      *     🏠 Proxy
235 |      * -----------------
236 |      */
237 |     function startProcess(Proxy memory, string memory name, string memory params) internal returns (uint256) {
238 |         return start("Proxy", name, params);
239 |     }
240 | 
241 |     function startProcess(Proxy memory, string memory name) internal returns (uint256) {
242 |         return start("Proxy", name, "");
243 |     }
244 | 
245 |     function finishProcess(Proxy memory proxy, uint256 pid) internal returns (Proxy memory) {
246 |         finish(pid);
247 |         return proxy;
248 |     }
249 | 
250 |     function finishProcessInStorage(Proxy storage proxy, uint256 pid) internal returns (Proxy storage) {
251 |         finish(pid);
252 |         return proxy;
253 |     }
254 | 
255 |     /**
256 |      * ----------------------
257 |      *     🏠 Proxy Registry
258 |      * ------------------------
259 |      */
260 |     function startProcess(ProxyRegistry storage, string memory name, string memory params) internal returns (uint256) {
261 |         return start("ProxyRegistryLib", name, params);
262 |     }
263 | 
264 |     function startProcess(ProxyRegistry storage proxies, string memory name) internal returns (uint256) {
265 |         return proxies.startProcess(name, "");
266 |     }
267 | 
268 |     function finishProcess(ProxyRegistry storage proxies, uint256 pid) internal returns (ProxyRegistry storage) {
269 |         finish(pid);
270 |         return proxies;
271 |     }
272 | 
273 |     /**
274 |      * -------------------
275 |      *     📚 Dictionary
276 |      * ---------------------
277 |      */
278 |     function startProcess(Dictionary memory, string memory name, string memory params) internal returns (uint256) {
279 |         return start("Dictionary", name, params);
280 |     }
281 | 
282 |     function startProcess(Dictionary memory, string memory name) internal returns (uint256) {
283 |         return start("Dictionary", name, "");
284 |     }
285 | 
286 |     function finishProcess(Dictionary memory dictionary, uint256 pid) internal returns (Dictionary memory) {
287 |         finish(pid);
288 |         return dictionary;
289 |     }
290 | 
291 |     function finishProcessInStorage(Dictionary storage dictionary, uint256 pid) internal returns (Dictionary storage) {
292 |         finish(pid);
293 |         return dictionary;
294 |     }
295 | 
296 |     /**
297 |      * ----------------------------
298 |      *     📚 Dictionary Registry
299 |      * ------------------------------
300 |      */
301 |     function startProcess(DictionaryRegistry storage, string memory name, string memory params)
302 |         internal
303 |         returns (uint256)
304 |     {
305 |         return start("DictionaryRegistryLib", name, params);
306 |     }
307 | 
308 |     function startProcess(DictionaryRegistry storage dictionaries, string memory name) internal returns (uint256) {
309 |         return dictionaries.startProcess(name, "");
310 |     }
311 | 
312 |     function finishProcess(DictionaryRegistry storage dictionaries, uint256 pid)
313 |         internal
314 |         returns (DictionaryRegistry storage)
315 |     {
316 |         finish(pid);
317 |         return dictionaries;
318 |     }
319 | 
320 |     /**
321 |      * ------------------------
322 |      *     📸 Current Context
323 |      * --------------------------
324 |      */
325 |     function startProcess(Current storage, string memory name, string memory params) internal returns (uint256) {
326 |         return start("Current", name, params);
327 |     }
328 | 
329 |     function startProcess(Current storage current, string memory name) internal returns (uint256) {
330 |         return current.startProcess(name, "");
331 |     }
332 | 
333 |     function finishProcess(Current storage current, uint256 pid) internal returns (Current storage) {
334 |         finish(pid);
335 |         return current;
336 |     }
337 | }
338 | 
339 | /**
340 |  * Params
341 |  */
342 | /* solhint-disable 2519 */
343 | function param(string memory str) pure returns (string memory) {
344 |     return str;
345 | }
346 | 
347 | function param(string memory str, address addr) pure returns (string memory) {
348 |     return str.comma(addr);
349 | }
350 | 
351 | function param(string memory str, address addr, Function[] memory funcs) pure returns (string memory) {
352 |     return str.comma(addr).comma(param(funcs));
353 | }
354 | 
355 | function param(string memory str, bytes4 b4, address addr) pure returns (string memory) {
356 |     return str.comma(b4).comma(addr);
357 | }
358 | 
359 | function param(string memory str, Proxy memory proxy) pure returns (string memory) {
360 |     return str.comma(proxy.addr);
361 | }
362 | 
363 | function param(string memory str, Dictionary memory dictionary) pure returns (string memory) {
364 |     return str.comma(dictionary.addr);
365 | }
366 | 
367 | function param(string memory str, Dictionary memory dictionary, bytes memory b) pure returns (string memory) {
368 |     return str.comma(dictionary.addr).comma(string(b));
369 | }
370 | 
371 | function param(string memory str, Function[] memory funcs) pure returns (string memory) {
372 |     return str.comma(param(funcs));
373 | }
374 | 
375 | function param(string memory str, bytes memory b) pure returns (string memory) {
376 |     return str.comma(string(b));
377 | }
378 | 
379 | function param(bytes4 b4) pure returns (string memory) {
380 |     return b4.toString();
381 | }
382 | 
383 | function param(bytes4 b4, address addr) pure returns (string memory) {
384 |     return b4.toString().comma(addr);
385 | }
386 | 
387 | function param(address addr) pure returns (string memory) {
388 |     return addr.toString();
389 | }
390 | 
391 | function param(address addr, address addr2) pure returns (string memory) {
392 |     return addr.toString().comma(addr2);
393 | }
394 | 
395 | function param(address addr, string memory str) pure returns (string memory) {
396 |     return addr.toString().comma(str);
397 | }
398 | 
399 | function param(Dictionary memory dict) pure returns (string memory) {
400 |     return param(dict.name);
401 | }
402 | 
403 | function param(Dictionary memory dict, address addr) pure returns (string memory) {
404 |     return param(dict.addr, addr);
405 | }
406 | 
407 | function param(Dictionary memory dict, bytes4 b4, address addr) pure returns (string memory) {
408 |     return param(dict.addr).comma(b4).comma(addr);
409 | }
410 | 
411 | function param(Dictionary memory dict, bytes memory b) pure returns (string memory) {
412 |     return param(dict.addr, string(b));
413 | }
414 | 
415 | function param(Dictionary memory dict1, Dictionary memory dict2) pure returns (string memory) {
416 |     return param(dict1.addr, dict2.addr);
417 | }
418 | 
419 | function param(Function memory func) pure returns (string memory) {
420 |     return func.name;
421 | }
422 | 
423 | function param(Function[] memory functions) pure returns (string memory res) {
424 |     for (uint256 i; i < functions.length; ++i) {
425 |         res = res.comma(functions[i].name);
426 |     }
427 | }
428 | 
429 | function param(Function[] memory functions, address facade) pure returns (string memory res) {
430 |     return param(functions).comma(facade);
431 | }
432 | 
433 | function param(Bundle memory bundle) pure returns (string memory) {
434 |     return bundle.name;
435 | }
436 | 
437 | function param(Bundle memory bundle, address addr) pure returns (string memory) {
438 |     return bundle.name.comma(addr);
439 | }
440 | 
441 | function param(Bundle memory bundle, bytes memory b) pure returns (string memory) {
442 |     return bundle.name.comma(string(b));
443 | }
444 | 
445 | function param(Bundle memory bundle, address addr, bytes memory b) pure returns (string memory) {
446 |     return bundle.name.comma(addr).comma(string(b));
447 | }
448 | 
449 | function param(address addr, bytes memory b) pure returns (string memory) {
450 |     return param(addr).comma(string(b));
451 | }
452 | 
453 | function param(bytes memory b) pure returns (string memory) {
454 |     return string(b);
455 | }
456 | 


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
/src/devkit/system/Validator.sol:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1 | // SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT
  2 | pragma solidity ^0.8.23;
  3 | 
  4 | import {vm, ForgeHelper} from "@mc-devkit/utils/ForgeHelper.sol";
  5 | import {MessageHead as HEAD} from "@mc-devkit/system/message/MessageHead.sol";
  6 | import {MessageBody as BODY} from "@mc-devkit/system/message/MessageBody.sol";
  7 | import {Formatter} from "@mc-devkit/types/Formatter.sol";
  8 | 
  9 | using Formatter for string;
 10 | 
 11 | import {Logger} from "@mc-devkit/system/Logger.sol";
 12 | import {Inspector} from "@mc-devkit/types/Inspector.sol";
 13 | 
 14 | using Inspector for string;
 15 | using Inspector for bytes4;
 16 | using Inspector for address;
 17 | using Inspector for bool;
 18 | using Inspector for uint256;
 19 | // Utils
 20 | 
 21 | import {TypeStatus} from "@mc-devkit/types/TypeGuard.sol";
 22 | import {System} from "@mc-devkit/system/System.sol";
 23 | // Core Types
 24 | import {Function} from "@mc-devkit/core/Function.sol";
 25 | import {FunctionRegistry} from "@mc-devkit/registry/FunctionRegistry.sol";
 26 | import {Bundle} from "@mc-devkit/core/Bundle.sol";
 27 | import {BundleRegistry} from "@mc-devkit/registry/BundleRegistry.sol";
 28 | import {Proxy, ProxyKind} from "@mc-devkit/core/Proxy.sol";
 29 | import {ProxyRegistry} from "@mc-devkit/registry/ProxyRegistry.sol";
 30 | import {Dictionary, DictionaryKind} from "@mc-devkit/core/Dictionary.sol";
 31 | import {DictionaryRegistry} from "@mc-devkit/registry/DictionaryRegistry.sol";
 32 | import {StdRegistry} from "@mc-devkit/registry/StdRegistry.sol";
 33 | import {StdFunctions} from "@mc-devkit/registry/StdFunctions.sol";
 34 | import {Current} from "@mc-devkit/registry/context/Current.sol";
 35 | 
 36 | /**
 37 |  * ==================
 38 |  *     ✅ Validator
 39 |  * ====================
 40 |  */
 41 | library Validator {
 42 |     enum Type {
 43 |         MUST,
 44 |         SHOULD,
 45 |         COMPLETION
 46 |     }
 47 | 
 48 |     Type constant MUST = Type.MUST;
 49 |     Type constant SHOULD = Type.SHOULD;
 50 |     Type constant COMPLETION = Type.COMPLETION;
 51 | 
 52 |     function validate(Type T, bool condition, string memory messageHead, string memory messageBody)
 53 |         internal
 54 |         view
 55 |         returns (bool res)
 56 |     {
 57 |         if (condition) return true;
 58 |         if (T == COMPLETION) Logger.logDebug(Formatter.toMessage(messageHead, messageBody));
 59 |         if (T == SHOULD) Logger.logWarn(Formatter.toMessage(messageHead, messageBody));
 60 |         if (T == MUST) System.Exit(messageHead, messageBody);
 61 |     }
 62 | 
 63 |     // Validate without broadcast
 64 |     modifier noBroadcast() {
 65 |         (bool isBroadcasting, address currentSender) = ForgeHelper.pauseBroadcast();
 66 |         _;
 67 |         ForgeHelper.resumeBroadcast(isBroadcasting, currentSender);
 68 |     }
 69 | 
 70 |     /**
 71 |      * ================
 72 |      *     📝 Config
 73 |      * ==================
 74 |      */
 75 |     function SHOULD_FileExists(string memory path) internal returns (bool condition) {
 76 |         condition = vm.exists(path);
 77 |         validate(SHOULD, condition, HEAD.CONFIG_FILE_MISSING, BODY.CONFIG_FILE_MISSING);
 78 |     }
 79 | 
 80 |     function MUST_FileExists(string memory path) internal {
 81 |         validate(MUST, vm.exists(path), HEAD.CONFIG_FILE_REQUIRED, BODY.CONFIG_FILE_REQUIRED);
 82 |     }
 83 | 
 84 |     /**
 85 |      * ===================
 86 |      *     🧱 Primitives
 87 |      * =====================
 88 |      */
 89 |     function MUST_NotEmptyName(string memory name) internal view {
 90 |         validate(MUST, name.isNotEmpty(), HEAD.NAME_REQUIRED, BODY.NAME_REQUIRED);
 91 |     }
 92 | 
 93 |     function MUST_NotEmptyEnvKey(string memory envKey) internal view {
 94 |         validate(MUST, envKey.isNotEmpty(), HEAD.ENV_KEY_REQUIRED, BODY.ENV_KEY_REQUIRED);
 95 |     }
 96 | 
 97 |     function SHOULD_NotEmptySelector(bytes4 selector) internal view {
 98 |         validate(SHOULD, selector.isNotEmpty(), HEAD.SELECTOR_RECOMMENDED, BODY.SELECTOR_RECOMMENDED);
 99 |     }
100 | 
101 |     function MUST_AddressIsContract(address addr) internal view {
102 |         validate(MUST, addr.isContract(), HEAD.ADDRESS_NOT_CONTRACT, BODY.ADDRESS_NOT_CONTRACT);
103 |     }
104 | 
105 |     function SHOULD_FacadeIsContract(address facade) internal view {
106 |         validate(SHOULD, facade.isContract(), HEAD.FACADE_NOT_CONTRACT, BODY.FACADE_NOT_CONTRACT);
107 |     }
108 | 
109 |     function SHOULD_OwnerIsNotZeroAddress(address owner) internal view {
110 |         validate(MUST, owner.isNotZero(), HEAD.OWNER_ZERO_ADDRESS_RECOMMENDED, BODY.OWNER_ZERO_ADDRESS_RECOMMENDED);
111 |     }
112 | 
113 |     /**
114 |      * ======================
115 |      *     📸 Current Context
116 |      * ========================
117 |      */
118 |     function MUST_NameFound(Current storage current) internal view {
119 |         validate(MUST, current.name.isAssigned(), HEAD.CURRENT_NAME_NOT_FOUND, BODY.CURRENT_NAME_NOT_FOUND);
120 |     }
121 | 
122 |     /**
123 |      * ==================
124 |      *     🧩 Function
125 |      * ====================
126 |      */
127 |     function ValidateBuilder(Function storage func) internal view returns (bool) {
128 |         return (
129 |             validate(COMPLETION, func.name.isAssigned(), HEAD.FUNC_NAME_UNASSIGNED, BODY.FUNC_NAME_UNASSIGNED)
130 |                 && validate(
131 |                     COMPLETION,
132 |                     func.implementation.isContract(),
133 |                     HEAD.FUNC_CONTRACT_UNASSIGNED,
134 |                     BODY.FUNC_CONTRACT_UNASSIGNED
135 |                 )
136 |         );
137 |     }
138 | 
139 |     function MUST_Completed(Function memory func) internal view {
140 |         validate(MUST, func.isComplete(), HEAD.FUNC_NOT_COMPLETE, BODY.FUNC_NOT_COMPLETE);
141 |     }
142 | 
143 |     function MUST_NotLocked(Function storage func) internal view {
144 |         validate(MUST, func.status.isNotLocked(), HEAD.FUNC_LOCKED, BODY.FUNC_LOCKED);
145 |     }
146 | 
147 |     function MUST_Building(Function storage func) internal view {
148 |         validate(MUST, func.status.isBuilding(), HEAD.FUNC_NOT_BUILDING, BODY.FUNC_NOT_BUILDING);
149 |     }
150 | 
151 |     function MUST_Built(Function storage func) internal view {
152 |         validate(MUST, func.status.isBuilt(), HEAD.FUNC_NOT_BUILT, BODY.FUNC_NOT_BUILT);
153 |     }
154 |     /* 📗 Functions Registry */
155 | 
156 |     function MUST_Registered(FunctionRegistry storage registry, string memory name) internal view {
157 |         validate(MUST, registry.functions[name].isComplete(), HEAD.FUNC_NOT_REGISTERED, BODY.FUNC_NOT_REGISTERED);
158 |     }
159 | 
160 |     /**
161 |      * ===============
162 |      *     🗂️ Bundle
163 |      * =================
164 |      */
165 |     function ValidateBuilder(Bundle storage bundle) internal view returns (bool) {
166 |         return (
167 |             validate(COMPLETION, bundle.name.isNotEmpty(), HEAD.BUNDLE_NAME_UNASSIGNED, BODY.BUNDLE_NAME_UNASSIGNED)
168 |                 && validate(
169 |                     COMPLETION,
170 |                     bundle.functions.length.isNotZero(),
171 |                     HEAD.NO_FUNCTIONS_IN_BUNDLE,
172 |                     BODY.NO_FUNCTIONS_IN_BUNDLE
173 |                 )
174 |                 && validate(
175 |                     COMPLETION, bundle.facade.isContract(), HEAD.BUNDLE_FACADE_UNASSIGNED, BODY.BUNDLE_FACADE_UNASSIGNED
176 |                 )
177 |         );
178 |     }
179 | 
180 |     function MUST_NotInitialized(Bundle storage bundle) internal view {
181 |         validate(MUST, bundle.status.isUninitialized(), HEAD.BUNDLE_NOT_INITIALIZED, BODY.BUNDLE_NOT_INITIALIZED);
182 |     }
183 | 
184 |     function SHOULD_Completed(Bundle storage bundle) internal view {
185 |         validate(SHOULD, bundle.isComplete(), HEAD.BUNDLE_NOT_COMPLETE, BODY.BUNDLE_NOT_COMPLETE);
186 |     }
187 | 
188 |     function MUST_Completed(Bundle storage bundle) internal view {
189 |         validate(MUST, bundle.name.isNotEmpty(), HEAD.BUNDLE_NAME_UNASSIGNED, BODY.BUNDLE_NAME_UNASSIGNED);
190 |         validate(MUST, bundle.functions.length.isNotZero(), HEAD.NO_FUNCTIONS_IN_BUNDLE, BODY.NO_FUNCTIONS_IN_BUNDLE);
191 |         validate(MUST, bundle.facade.isContract(), HEAD.BUNDLE_FACADE_UNASSIGNED, BODY.BUNDLE_FACADE_UNASSIGNED);
192 |     }
193 | 
194 |     function MUST_HaveFunction(Bundle storage bundle) internal view {
195 |         validate(
196 |             MUST, bundle.functions.length.isNotZero(), HEAD.NO_FUNCTIONS_IN_BUNDLE, BODY.NO_FUNCTIONS_IN_BUNDLE_REQUIRED
197 |         );
198 |     }
199 | 
200 |     function MUST_HaveUniqueSelector(Bundle storage bundle, Function storage func) internal view {
201 |         validate(
202 |             MUST,
203 |             bundle.hasNotSameSelector(func),
204 |             HEAD.BUNDLE_CONTAINS_SAME_SELECTOR,
205 |             BODY.BUNDLE_CONTAINS_SAME_SELECTOR
206 |         );
207 |     }
208 | 
209 |     function MUST_NotLocked(Bundle storage bundle) internal view {
210 |         validate(MUST, bundle.status.isNotLocked(), HEAD.BUNDLE_LOCKED, BODY.BUNDLE_LOCKED);
211 |     }
212 | 
213 |     function MUST_Building(Bundle storage bundle) internal view {
214 |         validate(MUST, bundle.status.isBuilding(), HEAD.BUNDLE_NOT_BUILDING, BODY.BUNDLE_NOT_BUILDING);
215 |     }
216 | 
217 |     function MUST_Built(Bundle storage bundle) internal view {
218 |         validate(MUST, bundle.status.isBuilt(), HEAD.BUNDLE_NOT_BUILT, BODY.BUNDLE_NOT_BUILT);
219 |     }
220 |     /* 📙 Bundle Registry */
221 | 
222 |     function SHOULD_ExistCurrentBundle(BundleRegistry storage registry) internal view returns (bool condition) {
223 |         condition = registry.current.name.isNotEmpty();
224 |         validate(SHOULD, condition, HEAD.CURRENT_BUNDLE_NOT_EXIST, BODY.CURRENT_BUNDLE_NOT_EXIST);
225 |     }
226 | 
227 |     function MUST_ExistCurrentName(BundleRegistry storage registry) internal view {
228 |         validate(
229 |             MUST,
230 |             registry.current.name.isAssigned(),
231 |             HEAD.CURRENT_BUNDLE_NOT_EXIST,
232 |             BODY.CURRENT_BUNDLE_NOT_EXIST_REQUIRED
233 |         );
234 |     }
235 | 
236 |     /**
237 |      * ==============
238 |      *     🏠 Proxy
239 |      * ================
240 |      */
241 |     function ValidateBuilder(Proxy memory proxy) internal view returns (bool) {
242 |         return (
243 |             validate(MUST, proxy.addr.isContract(), HEAD.PROXY_ADDR_UNASSIGNED, BODY.PROXY_ADDR_UNASSIGNED)
244 |                 && validate(MUST, proxy.kind.isNotUndefined(), HEAD.PROXY_KIND_UNDEFINED, BODY.PROXY_KIND_UNDEFINED)
245 |         );
246 |     }
247 | 
248 |     function MUST_Completed(Proxy memory proxy) internal view {
249 |         validate(MUST, proxy.isComplete(), HEAD.PROXY_NOT_COMPLETE, BODY.PROXY_NOT_COMPLETE);
250 |     }
251 | 
252 |     function MUST_NotLocked(Proxy memory proxy) internal view {
253 |         validate(MUST, proxy.status.isNotLocked(), HEAD.PROXY_LOCKED, BODY.PROXY_LOCKED);
254 |     }
255 | 
256 |     function MUST_Building(Proxy memory proxy) internal view {
257 |         validate(MUST, proxy.status.isBuilding(), HEAD.PROXY_NOT_BUILDING, BODY.PROXY_NOT_BUILDING);
258 |     }
259 | 
260 |     function MUST_Built(Proxy memory proxy) internal view {
261 |         validate(MUST, proxy.status.isBuilt(), HEAD.PROXY_NOT_BUILT, BODY.PROXY_NOT_BUILT);
262 |     }
263 |     /* 📕 Proxy Registry */
264 | 
265 |     function MUST_Registered(ProxyRegistry storage registry, string memory name) internal view {
266 |         validate(MUST, registry.proxies[name].isComplete(), HEAD.PROXY_NOT_REGISTERED, BODY.PROXY_NOT_REGISTERED);
267 |     }
268 | 
269 |     function MUST_NotRegistered(ProxyRegistry storage registry, string memory name) internal view {
270 |         validate(
271 |             MUST, registry.proxies[name].isUninitialized(), HEAD.PROXY_ALREADY_REGISTERED, BODY.PROXY_ALREADY_REGISTERED
272 |         );
273 |     }
274 | 
275 |     function MUST_ExistCurrentName(ProxyRegistry storage registry) internal view {
276 |         validate(MUST, registry.current.name.isAssigned(), HEAD.CURRENT_PROXY_NOT_EXIST, BODY.CURRENT_PROXY_NOT_EXIST);
277 |     }
278 | 
279 |     /**
280 |      * ====================
281 |      *     📚 Dictionary
282 |      * ======================
283 |      */
284 |     function ValidateBuilder(Dictionary memory dictionary) internal view returns (bool) {
285 |         return (
286 |             validate(
287 |                 COMPLETION,
288 |                 dictionary.name.isNotEmpty(),
289 |                 HEAD.DICTIONARY_NAME_UNASSIGNED,
290 |                 BODY.DICTIONARY_NAME_UNASSIGNED
291 |             )
292 |                 && validate(
293 |                     COMPLETION,
294 |                     dictionary.addr.isContract(),
295 |                     HEAD.DICTIONARY_ADDR_UNASSIGNED,
296 |                     BODY.DICTIONARY_ADDR_UNASSIGNED
297 |                 )
298 |                 && validate(
299 |                     COMPLETION,
300 |                     dictionary.kind.isNotUndefined(),
301 |                     HEAD.DICTIONARY_KIND_UNDEFINED,
302 |                     BODY.DICTIONARY_KIND_UNDEFINED
303 |                 )
304 |         );
305 |     }
306 | 
307 |     function MUST_Completed(Dictionary memory dictionary) internal view {
308 |         validate(MUST, dictionary.isComplete(), HEAD.DICTIONARY_NOT_COMPLETE, BODY.DICTIONARY_NOT_COMPLETE);
309 |     }
310 | 
311 |     function MUST_Verifiable(Dictionary memory dictionary) internal noBroadcast {
312 |         validate(MUST, dictionary.isVerifiable(), HEAD.DICTIONARY_NOT_VERIFIABLE, BODY.DICTIONARY_NOT_VERIFIABLE);
313 |     }
314 | 
315 |     function MUST_NotLocked(Dictionary memory dictionary) internal view {
316 |         validate(MUST, dictionary.status.isNotLocked(), HEAD.DICTIONARY_LOCKED, BODY.DICTIONARY_LOCKED);
317 |     }
318 | 
319 |     function MUST_Building(Dictionary memory dictionary) internal view {
320 |         validate(MUST, dictionary.status.isBuilding(), HEAD.DICTIONARY_NOT_BUILDING, BODY.DICTIONARY_NOT_BUILDING);
321 |     }
322 | 
323 |     function MUST_Built(Dictionary memory dictionary) internal view {
324 |         validate(MUST, dictionary.status.isBuilt(), HEAD.DICTIONARY_NOT_BUILT, BODY.DICTIONARY_NOT_BUILT);
325 |     }
326 |     /* 📘 Dictionary Registry */
327 | 
328 |     function MUST_Registered(DictionaryRegistry storage registry, string memory name) internal view {
329 |         validate(
330 |             MUST,
331 |             registry.dictionaries[name].isComplete(),
332 |             HEAD.DICTIONARY_NOT_REGISTERED,
333 |             BODY.DICTIONARY_NOT_REGISTERED
334 |         );
335 |     }
336 | 
337 |     function MUST_NotRegistered(DictionaryRegistry storage registry, string memory name) internal view {
338 |         validate(
339 |             MUST,
340 |             registry.dictionaries[name].isUninitialized(),
341 |             HEAD.DICTIONARY_ALREADY_REGISTERED,
342 |             BODY.DICTIONARY_ALREADY_REGISTERED
343 |         );
344 |     }
345 | 
346 |     function MUST_ExistCurrentName(DictionaryRegistry storage registry) internal view {
347 |         validate(
348 |             MUST,
349 |             registry.current.name.isAssigned(),
350 |             HEAD.CURRENT_DICTIONARY_NOT_EXIST,
351 |             BODY.CURRENT_DICTIONARY_NOT_EXIST
352 |         );
353 |     }
354 | 
355 |     /**
356 |      * ==========================
357 |      *     🏛 Standard Registry
358 |      * ============================
359 |      */
360 |     function ValidateBuilder(StdRegistry storage registry) internal view returns (bool) {
361 |         return (Validator.ValidateBuilder(registry.functions) && Validator.ValidateBuilder(registry.all));
362 |     }
363 | 
364 |     function MUST_Completed(StdRegistry storage registry) internal view {
365 |         validate(MUST, registry.status.isComplete(), HEAD.STD_REGISTRY_NOT_COMPLETE, BODY.STD_REGISTRY_NOT_COMPLETE);
366 |     }
367 | 
368 |     function MUST_NotLocked(StdRegistry storage registry) internal view {
369 |         validate(MUST, registry.status.isNotLocked(), HEAD.STD_REGISTRY_LOCKED, BODY.STD_REGISTRY_LOCKED);
370 |     }
371 | 
372 |     function MUST_Building(StdRegistry storage registry) internal view {
373 |         validate(MUST, registry.status.isBuilding(), HEAD.STD_REGISTRY_NOT_BUILDING, BODY.STD_REGISTRY_NOT_BUILDING);
374 |     }
375 | 
376 |     function MUST_Built(StdRegistry memory registry) internal view {
377 |         validate(MUST, registry.status.isBuilt(), HEAD.STD_REGISTRY_NOT_BUILT, BODY.STD_REGISTRY_NOT_BUILT);
378 |     }
379 |     /**
380 |      * ==========================
381 |      *     🏰 Standard Functions
382 |      * ============================
383 |      */
384 | 
385 |     function ValidateBuilder(StdFunctions storage std) internal view returns (bool) {
386 |         return (
387 |             Validator.ValidateBuilder(std.initSetAdmin) && Validator.ValidateBuilder(std.getFunctions)
388 |                 && Validator.ValidateBuilder(std.clone)
389 |         );
390 |     }
391 | 
392 |     function MUST_Completed(StdFunctions storage std) internal view {
393 |         validate(MUST, std.status.isComplete(), HEAD.STD_FUNCTIONS_NOT_COMPLETE, BODY.STD_FUNCTIONS_NOT_COMPLETE);
394 |     }
395 | 
396 |     function MUST_NotLocked(StdFunctions storage std) internal view {
397 |         validate(MUST, std.status.isNotLocked(), HEAD.STD_FUNCTIONS_LOCKED, BODY.STD_FUNCTIONS_LOCKED);
398 |     }
399 | 
400 |     function MUST_Building(StdFunctions storage std) internal view {
401 |         validate(MUST, std.status.isBuilding(), HEAD.STD_FUNCTIONS_NOT_BUILDING, BODY.STD_FUNCTIONS_NOT_BUILDING);
402 |     }
403 | 
404 |     function MUST_Built(StdFunctions memory std) internal view {
405 |         validate(MUST, std.status.isBuilt(), HEAD.STD_FUNCTIONS_NOT_BUILT, BODY.STD_FUNCTIONS_NOT_BUILT);
406 |     }
407 | 
408 |     /**
409 |      * =======================
410 |      *     🏷️ Name Generator
411 |      * =========================
412 |      */
413 |     function MUST_FoundInRange() internal view {
414 |         validate(MUST, false, HEAD.NOT_FOUND_IN_RANGE, BODY.NOT_FOUND_IN_RANGE);
415 |     }
416 | 
417 |     /**
418 |      * ================
419 |      *     🧪 MCTest
420 |      * ==================
421 |      */
422 |     function MUST_UseFunctionContract(address implementation) internal view {
423 |         validate(MUST, implementation.isContract(), HEAD.TEST_MUST_USE_FUNCTION, BODY.TEST_MUST_USE_FUNCTION);
424 |     }
425 | }
426 | 


--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
/site/docs/03-api/03-api-details/Flattened.sol/interface.Vm.md:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  1 | # Vm
  2 | [Git Source](https://github.com/metacontract/mc/blob/main/src/devkit/Flattened.sol)
  3 | 
  4 | **Inherits:**
  5 | [VmSafe](interface.VmSafe.md)
  6 | 
  7 | The `Vm` interface does allow manipulation of the EVM state. These are all intended to be used
  8 | in tests, but it is not recommended to use these cheats in scripts.
  9 | 
 10 | 
 11 | ## Functions
 12 | ### activeFork
 13 | 
 14 | Returns the identifier of the currently active fork. Reverts if no fork is currently active.
 15 | 
 16 | 
 17 | ```solidity
 18 | function activeFork() external view returns (uint256 forkId);
 19 | ```
 20 | 
 21 | ### allowCheatcodes
 22 | 
 23 | In forking mode, explicitly grant the given address cheatcode access.
 24 | 
 25 | 
 26 | ```solidity
 27 | function allowCheatcodes(address account) external;
 28 | ```
 29 | 
 30 | ### blobBaseFee
 31 | 
 32 | Sets `block.blobbasefee`
 33 | 
 34 | 
 35 | ```solidity
 36 | function blobBaseFee(uint256 newBlobBaseFee) external;
 37 | ```
 38 | 
 39 | ### blobhashes
 40 | 
 41 | Sets the blobhashes in the transaction.
 42 | Not available on EVM versions before Cancun.
 43 | If used on unsupported EVM versions it will revert.
 44 | 
 45 | 
 46 | ```solidity
 47 | function blobhashes(bytes32[] calldata hashes) external;
 48 | ```
 49 | 
 50 | ### chainId
 51 | 
 52 | Sets `block.chainid`.
 53 | 
 54 | 
 55 | ```solidity
 56 | function chainId(uint256 newChainId) external;
 57 | ```
 58 | 
 59 | ### clearMockedCalls
 60 | 
 61 | Clears all mocked calls.
 62 | 
 63 | 
 64 | ```solidity
 65 | function clearMockedCalls() external;
 66 | ```
 67 | 
 68 | ### coinbase
 69 | 
 70 | Sets `block.coinbase`.
 71 | 
 72 | 
 73 | ```solidity
 74 | function coinbase(address newCoinbase) external;
 75 | ```
 76 | 
 77 | ### createFork
 78 | 
 79 | Creates a new fork with the given endpoint and the _latest_ block and returns the identifier of the fork.
 80 | 
 81 | 
 82 | ```solidity
 83 | function createFork(string calldata urlOrAlias) external returns (uint256 forkId);
 84 | ```
 85 | 
 86 | ### createFork
 87 | 
 88 | Creates a new fork with the given endpoint and block and returns the identifier of the fork.
 89 | 
 90 | 
 91 | ```solidity
 92 | function createFork(string calldata urlOrAlias, uint256 blockNumber) external returns (uint256 forkId);
 93 | ```
 94 | 
 95 | ### createFork
 96 | 
 97 | Creates a new fork with the given endpoint and at the block the given transaction was mined in,
 98 | replays all transaction mined in the block before the transaction, and returns the identifier of the fork.
 99 | 
100 | 
101 | ```solidity
102 | function createFork(string calldata urlOrAlias, bytes32 txHash) external returns (uint256 forkId);
103 | ```
104 | 
105 | ### createSelectFork
106 | 
107 | Creates and also selects a new fork with the given endpoint and the latest block and returns the identifier of the fork.
108 | 
109 | 
110 | ```solidity
111 | function createSelectFork(string calldata urlOrAlias) external returns (uint256 forkId);
112 | ```
113 | 
114 | ### createSelectFork
115 | 
116 | Creates and also selects a new fork with the given endpoint and block and returns the identifier of the fork.
117 | 
118 | 
119 | ```solidity
120 | function createSelectFork(string calldata urlOrAlias, uint256 blockNumber) external returns (uint256 forkId);
121 | ```
122 | 
123 | ### createSelectFork
124 | 
125 | Creates and also selects new fork with the given endpoint and at the block the given transaction was mined in,
126 | replays all transaction mined in the block before the transaction, returns the identifier of the fork.
127 | 
128 | 
129 | ```solidity
130 | function createSelectFork(string calldata urlOrAlias, bytes32 txHash) external returns (uint256 forkId);
131 | ```
132 | 
133 | ### deal
134 | 
135 | Sets an address' balance.
136 | 
137 | 
138 | ```solidity
139 | function deal(address account, uint256 newBalance) external;
140 | ```
141 | 
142 | ### deleteSnapshot
143 | 
144 | Removes the snapshot with the given ID created by `snapshot`.
145 | Takes the snapshot ID to delete.
146 | Returns `true` if the snapshot was successfully deleted.
147 | Returns `false` if the snapshot does not exist.
148 | 
149 | 
150 | ```solidity
151 | function deleteSnapshot(uint256 snapshotId) external returns (bool success);
152 | ```
153 | 
154 | ### deleteSnapshots
155 | 
156 | Removes _all_ snapshots previously created by `snapshot`.
157 | 
158 | 
159 | ```solidity
160 | function deleteSnapshots() external;
161 | ```
162 | 
163 | ### difficulty
164 | 
165 | Sets `block.difficulty`.
166 | Not available on EVM versions from Paris onwards. Use `prevrandao` instead.
167 | Reverts if used on unsupported EVM versions.
168 | 
169 | 
170 | ```solidity
171 | function difficulty(uint256 newDifficulty) external;
172 | ```
173 | 
174 | ### dumpState
175 | 
176 | Dump a genesis JSON file's `allocs` to disk.
177 | 
178 | 
179 | ```solidity
180 | function dumpState(string calldata pathToStateJson) external;
181 | ```
182 | 
183 | ### etch
184 | 
185 | Sets an address' code.
186 | 
187 | 
188 | ```solidity
189 | function etch(address target, bytes calldata newRuntimeBytecode) external;
190 | ```
191 | 
192 | ### fee
193 | 
194 | Sets `block.basefee`.
195 | 
196 | 
197 | ```solidity
198 | function fee(uint256 newBasefee) external;
199 | ```
200 | 
201 | ### getBlobhashes
202 | 
203 | Gets the blockhashes from the current transaction.
204 | Not available on EVM versions before Cancun.
205 | If used on unsupported EVM versions it will revert.
206 | 
207 | 
208 | ```solidity
209 | function getBlobhashes() external view returns (bytes32[] memory hashes);
210 | ```
211 | 
212 | ### isPersistent
213 | 
214 | Returns true if the account is marked as persistent.
215 | 
216 | 
217 | ```solidity
218 | function isPersistent(address account) external view returns (bool persistent);
219 | ```
220 | 
221 | ### loadAllocs
222 | 
223 | Load a genesis JSON file's `allocs` into the in-memory revm state.
224 | 
225 | 
226 | ```solidity
227 | function loadAllocs(string calldata pathToAllocsJson) external;
228 | ```
229 | 
230 | ### makePersistent
231 | 
232 | Marks that the account(s) should use persistent storage across fork swaps in a multifork setup
233 | Meaning, changes made to the state of this account will be kept when switching forks.
234 | 
235 | 
236 | ```solidity
237 | function makePersistent(address account) external;
238 | ```
239 | 
240 | ### makePersistent
241 | 
242 | See `makePersistent(address)`.
243 | 
244 | 
245 | ```solidity
246 | function makePersistent(address account0, address account1) external;
247 | ```
248 | 
249 | ### makePersistent
250 | 
251 | See `makePersistent(address)`.
252 | 
253 | 
254 | ```solidity
255 | function makePersistent(address account0, address account1, address account2) external;
256 | ```
257 | 
258 | ### makePersistent
259 | 
260 | See `makePersistent(address)`.
261 | 
262 | 
263 | ```solidity
264 | function makePersistent(address[] calldata accounts) external;
265 | ```
266 | 
267 | ### mockCallRevert
268 | 
269 | Reverts a call to an address with specified revert data.
270 | 
271 | 
272 | ```solidity
273 | function mockCallRevert(address callee, bytes calldata data, bytes calldata revertData) external;
274 | ```
275 | 
276 | ### mockCallRevert
277 | 
278 | Reverts a call to an address with a specific `msg.value`, with specified revert data.
279 | 
280 | 
281 | ```solidity
282 | function mockCallRevert(address callee, uint256 msgValue, bytes calldata data, bytes calldata revertData) external;
283 | ```
284 | 
285 | ### mockCall
286 | 
287 | Mocks a call to an address, returning specified data.
288 | Calldata can either be strict or a partial match, e.g. if you only
289 | pass a Solidity selector to the expected calldata, then the entire Solidity
290 | function will be mocked.
291 | 
292 | 
293 | ```solidity
294 | function mockCall(address callee, bytes calldata data, bytes calldata returnData) external;
295 | ```
296 | 
297 | ### mockCall
298 | 
299 | Mocks a call to an address with a specific `msg.value`, returning specified data.
300 | Calldata match takes precedence over `msg.value` in case of ambiguity.
301 | 
302 | 
303 | ```solidity
304 | function mockCall(address callee, uint256 msgValue, bytes calldata data, bytes calldata returnData) external;
305 | ```
306 | 
307 | ### mockFunction
308 | 
309 | Whenever a call is made to `callee` with calldata `data`, this cheatcode instead calls
310 | `target` with the same calldata. This functionality is similar to a delegate call made to
311 | `target` contract from `callee`.
312 | Can be used to substitute a call to a function with another implementation that captures
313 | the primary logic of the original function but is easier to reason about.
314 | If calldata is not a strict match then partial match by selector is attempted.
315 | 
316 | 
317 | ```solidity
318 | function mockFunction(address callee, address target, bytes calldata data) external;
319 | ```
320 | 
321 | ### prank
322 | 
323 | Sets the *next* call's `msg.sender` to be the input address.
324 | 
325 | 
326 | ```solidity
327 | function prank(address msgSender) external;
328 | ```
329 | 
330 | ### prank
331 | 
332 | Sets the *next* call's `msg.sender` to be the input address, and the `tx.origin` to be the second input.
333 | 
334 | 
335 | ```solidity
336 | function prank(address msgSender, address txOrigin) external;
337 | ```
338 | 
339 | ### prevrandao
340 | 
341 | Sets `block.prevrandao`.
342 | Not available on EVM versions before Paris. Use `difficulty` instead.
343 | If used on unsupported EVM versions it will revert.
344 | 
345 | 
346 | ```solidity
347 | function prevrandao(bytes32 newPrevrandao) external;
348 | ```
349 | 
350 | ### prevrandao
351 | 
352 | Sets `block.prevrandao`.
353 | Not available on EVM versions before Paris. Use `difficulty` instead.
354 | If used on unsupported EVM versions it will revert.
355 | 
356 | 
357 | ```solidity
358 | function prevrandao(uint256 newPrevrandao) external;
359 | ```
360 | 
361 | ### readCallers
362 | 
363 | Reads the current `msg.sender` and `tx.origin` from state and reports if there is any active caller modification.
364 | 
365 | 
366 | ```solidity
367 | function readCallers() external returns (CallerMode callerMode, address msgSender, address txOrigin);
368 | ```
369 | 
370 | ### resetNonce
371 | 
372 | Resets the nonce of an account to 0 for EOAs and 1 for contract accounts.
373 | 
374 | 
375 | ```solidity
376 | function resetNonce(address account) external;
377 | ```
378 | 
379 | ### revertTo
380 | 
381 | Revert the state of the EVM to a previous snapshot
382 | Takes the snapshot ID to revert to.
383 | Returns `true` if the snapshot was successfully reverted.
384 | Returns `false` if the snapshot does not exist.
385 | **Note:** This does not automatically delete the snapshot. To delete the snapshot use `deleteSnapshot`.
386 | 
387 | 
388 | ```solidity
389 | function revertTo(uint256 snapshotId) external returns (bool success);
390 | ```
391 | 
392 | ### revertToAndDelete
393 | 
394 | Revert the state of the EVM to a previous snapshot and automatically deletes the snapshots
395 | Takes the snapshot ID to revert to.
396 | Returns `true` if the snapshot was successfully reverted and deleted.
397 | Returns `false` if the snapshot does not exist.
398 | 
399 | 
400 | ```solidity
401 | function revertToAndDelete(uint256 snapshotId) external returns (bool success);
402 | ```
403 | 
404 | ### revokePersistent
405 | 
406 | Revokes persistent status from the address, previously added via `makePersistent`.
407 | 
408 | 
409 | ```solidity
410 | function revokePersistent(address account) external;
411 | ```
412 | 
413 | ### revokePersistent
414 | 
415 | See `revokePersistent(address)`.
416 | 
417 | 
418 | ```solidity
419 | function revokePersistent(address[] calldata accounts) external;
420 | ```
421 | 
422 | ### roll
423 | 
424 | Sets `block.height`.
425 | 
426 | 
427 | ```solidity
428 | function roll(uint256 newHeight) external;
429 | ```
430 | 
431 | ### rollFork
432 | 
433 | Updates the currently active fork to given block number
434 | This is similar to `roll` but for the currently active fork.
435 | 
436 | 
437 | ```solidity
438 | function rollFork(uint256 blockNumber) external;
439 | ```
440 | 
441 | ### rollFork
442 | 
443 | Updates the currently active fork to given transaction. This will `rollFork` with the number
444 | of the block the transaction was mined in and replays all transaction mined before it in the block.
445 | 
446 | 
447 | ```solidity
448 | function rollFork(bytes32 txHash) external;
449 | ```
450 | 
451 | ### rollFork
452 | 
453 | Updates the given fork to given block number.
454 | 
455 | 
456 | ```solidity
457 | function rollFork(uint256 forkId, uint256 blockNumber) external;
458 | ```
459 | 
460 | ### rollFork
461 | 
462 | Updates the given fork to block number of the given transaction and replays all transaction mined before it in the block.
463 | 
464 | 
465 | ```solidity
466 | function rollFork(uint256 forkId, bytes32 txHash) external;
467 | ```
468 | 
469 | ### selectFork
470 | 
471 | Takes a fork identifier created by `createFork` and sets the corresponding forked state as active.
472 | 
473 | 
474 | ```solidity
475 | function selectFork(uint256 forkId) external;
476 | ```
477 | 
478 | ### setBlockhash
479 | 
480 | Set blockhash for the current block.
481 | It only sets the blockhash for blocks where `block.number - 256 <= number < block.number`.
482 | 
483 | 
484 | ```solidity
485 | function setBlockhash(uint256 blockNumber, bytes32 blockHash) external;
486 | ```
487 | 
488 | ### setNonce
489 | 
490 | Sets the nonce of an account. Must be higher than the current nonce of the account.
491 | 
492 | 
493 | ```solidity
494 | function setNonce(address account, uint64 newNonce) external;
495 | ```
496 | 
497 | ### setNonceUnsafe
498 | 
499 | Sets the nonce of an account to an arbitrary value.
500 | 
501 | 
502 | ```solidity
503 | function setNonceUnsafe(address account, uint64 newNonce) external;
504 | ```
505 | 
506 | ### snapshot
507 | 
508 | Snapshot the current state of the evm.
509 | Returns the ID of the snapshot that was created.
510 | To revert a snapshot use `revertTo`.
511 | 
512 | 
513 | ```solidity
514 | function snapshot() external returns (uint256 snapshotId);
515 | ```
516 | 
517 | ### startPrank
518 | 
519 | Sets all subsequent calls' `msg.sender` to be the input address until `stopPrank` is called.
520 | 
521 | 
522 | ```solidity
523 | function startPrank(address msgSender) external;
524 | ```
525 | 
526 | ### startPrank
527 | 
528 | Sets all subsequent calls' `msg.sender` to be the input address until `stopPrank` is called, and the `tx.origin` to be the second input.
529 | 
530 | 
531 | ```solidity
532 | function startPrank(address msgSender, address txOrigin) external;
533 | ```
534 | 
535 | ### stopPrank
536 | 
537 | Resets subsequent calls' `msg.sender` to be `address(this)`.
538 | 
539 | 
540 | ```solidity
541 | function stopPrank() external;
542 | ```
543 | 
544 | ### store
545 | 
546 | Stores a value to an address' storage slot.
547 | 
548 | 
549 | ```solidity
550 | function store(address target, bytes32 slot, bytes32 value) external;
551 | ```
552 | 
553 | ### transact
554 | 
555 | Fetches the given transaction from the active fork and executes it on the current state.
556 | 
557 | 
558 | ```solidity
559 | function transact(bytes32 txHash) external;
560 | ```
561 | 
562 | ### transact
563 | 
564 | Fetches the given transaction from the given fork and executes it on the current state.
565 | 
566 | 
567 | ```solidity
568 | function transact(uint256 forkId, bytes32 txHash) external;
569 | ```
570 | 
571 | ### txGasPrice
572 | 
573 | Sets `tx.gasprice`.
574 | 
575 | 
576 | ```solidity
577 | function txGasPrice(uint256 newGasPrice) external;
578 | ```
579 | 
580 | ### warp
581 | 
582 | Sets `block.timestamp`.
583 | 
584 | 
585 | ```solidity
586 | function warp(uint256 newTimestamp) external;
587 | ```
588 | 
589 | ### expectCallMinGas
590 | 
591 | Expect a call to an address with the specified `msg.value` and calldata, and a *minimum* amount of gas.
592 | 
593 | 
594 | ```solidity
595 | function expectCallMinGas(address callee, uint256 msgValue, uint64 minGas, bytes calldata data) external;
596 | ```
597 | 
598 | ### expectCallMinGas
599 | 
600 | Expect given number of calls to an address with the specified `msg.value` and calldata, and a *minimum* amount of gas.
601 | 
602 | 
603 | ```solidity
604 | function expectCallMinGas(address callee, uint256 msgValue, uint64 minGas, bytes calldata data, uint64 count)
605 |     external;
606 | ```
607 | 
608 | ### expectCall
609 | 
610 | Expects a call to an address with the specified calldata.
611 | Calldata can either be a strict or a partial match.
612 | 
613 | 
614 | ```solidity
615 | function expectCall(address callee, bytes calldata data) external;
616 | ```
617 | 
618 | ### expectCall
619 | 
620 | Expects given number of calls to an address with the specified calldata.
621 | 
622 | 
623 | ```solidity
624 | function expectCall(address callee, bytes calldata data, uint64 count) external;
625 | ```
626 | 
627 | ### expectCall
628 | 
629 | Expects a call to an address with the specified `msg.value` and calldata.
630 | 
631 | 
632 | ```solidity
633 | function expectCall(address callee, uint256 msgValue, bytes calldata data) external;
634 | ```
635 | 
636 | ### expectCall
637 | 
638 | Expects given number of calls to an address with the specified `msg.value` and calldata.
639 | 
640 | 
641 | ```solidity
642 | function expectCall(address callee, uint256 msgValue, bytes calldata data, uint64 count) external;
643 | ```
644 | 
645 | ### expectCall
646 | 
647 | Expect a call to an address with the specified `msg.value`, gas, and calldata.
648 | 
649 | 
650 | ```solidity
651 | function expectCall(address callee, uint256 msgValue, uint64 gas, bytes calldata data) external;
652 | ```
653 | 
654 | ### expectCall
655 | 
656 | Expects given number of calls to an address with the specified `msg.value`, gas, and calldata.
657 | 
658 | 
659 | ```solidity
660 | function expectCall(address callee, uint256 msgValue, uint64 gas, bytes calldata data, uint64 count) external;
661 | ```
662 | 
663 | ### expectEmitAnonymous
664 | 
665 | Prepare an expected anonymous log with (bool checkTopic1, bool checkTopic2, bool checkTopic3, bool checkData.).
666 | Call this function, then emit an anonymous event, then call a function. Internally after the call, we check if
667 | logs were emitted in the expected order with the expected topics and data (as specified by the booleans).
668 | 
669 | 
670 | ```solidity
671 | function expectEmitAnonymous(bool checkTopic0, bool checkTopic1, bool checkTopic2, bool checkTopic3, bool checkData)
672 |     external;
673 | ```
674 | 
675 | ### expectEmitAnonymous
676 | 
677 | Same as the previous method, but also checks supplied address against emitting contract.
678 | 
679 | 
680 | ```solidity
681 | function expectEmitAnonymous(
682 |     bool checkTopic0,
683 |     bool checkTopic1,
684 |     bool checkTopic2,
685 |     bool checkTopic3,
686 |     bool checkData,
687 |     address emitter
688 | ) external;
689 | ```
690 | 
691 | ### expectEmitAnonymous
692 | 
693 | Prepare an expected anonymous log with all topic and data checks enabled.
694 | Call this function, then emit an anonymous event, then call a function. Internally after the call, we check if
695 | logs were emitted in the expected order with the expected topics and data.
696 | 
697 | 
698 | ```solidity
699 | function expectEmitAnonymous() external;
700 | ```
701 | 
702 | ### expectEmitAnonymous
703 | 
704 | Same as the previous method, but also checks supplied address against emitting contract.
705 | 
706 | 
707 | ```solidity
708 | function expectEmitAnonymous(address emitter) external;
709 | ```
710 | 
711 | ### expectEmit
712 | 
713 | Prepare an expected log with (bool checkTopic1, bool checkTopic2, bool checkTopic3, bool checkData.).
714 | Call this function, then emit an event, then call a function. Internally after the call, we check if
715 | logs were emitted in the expected order with the expected topics and data (as specified by the booleans).
716 | 
717 | 
718 | ```solidity
719 | function expectEmit(bool checkTopic1, bool checkTopic2, bool checkTopic3, bool checkData) external;
720 | ```
721 | 
722 | ### expectEmit
723 | 
724 | Same as the previous method, but also checks supplied address against emitting contract.
725 | 
726 | 
727 | ```solidity
728 | function expectEmit(bool checkTopic1, bool checkTopic2, bool checkTopic3, bool checkData, address emitter) external;
729 | ```
730 | 
731 | ### expectEmit
732 | 
733 | Prepare an expected log with all topic and data checks enabled.
734 | Call this function, then emit an event, then call a function. Internally after the call, we check if
735 | logs were emitted in the expected order with the expected topics and data.
736 | 
737 | 
738 | ```solidity
739 | function expectEmit() external;
740 | ```
741 | 
742 | ### expectEmit
743 | 
744 | Same as the previous method, but also checks supplied address against emitting contract.
745 | 
746 | 
747 | ```solidity
748 | function expectEmit(address emitter) external;
749 | ```
750 | 
751 | ### expectPartialRevert
752 | 
753 | Expects an error on next call that starts with the revert data.
754 | 
755 | 
756 | ```solidity
757 | function expectPartialRevert(bytes4 revertData) external;
758 | ```
759 | 
760 | ### expectRevert
761 | 
762 | Expects an error on next call with any revert data.
763 | 
764 | 
765 | ```solidity
766 | function expectRevert() external;
767 | ```
768 | 
769 | ### expectRevert
770 | 
771 | Expects an error on next call that exactly matches the revert data.
772 | 
773 | 
774 | ```solidity
775 | function expectRevert(bytes4 revertData) external;
776 | ```
777 | 
778 | ### expectRevert
779 | 
780 | Expects an error on next call that exactly matches the revert data.
781 | 
782 | 
783 | ```solidity
784 | function expectRevert(bytes calldata revertData) external;
785 | ```
786 | 
787 | ### expectSafeMemory
788 | 
789 | Only allows memory writes to offsets [0x00, 0x60) ∪ [min, max) in the current subcontext. If any other
790 | memory is written to, the test will fail. Can be called multiple times to add more ranges to the set.
791 | 
792 | 
793 | ```solidity
794 | function expectSafeMemory(uint64 min, uint64 max) external;
795 | ```
796 | 
797 | ### expectSafeMemoryCall
798 | 
799 | Only allows memory writes to offsets [0x00, 0x60) ∪ [min, max) in the next created subcontext.
800 | If any other memory is written to, the test will fail. Can be called multiple times to add more ranges
801 | to the set.
802 | 
803 | 
804 | ```solidity
805 | function expectSafeMemoryCall(uint64 min, uint64 max) external;
806 | ```
807 | 
808 | ### skip
809 | 
810 | Marks a test as skipped. Must be called at the top of the test.
811 | 
812 | 
813 | ```solidity
814 | function skip(bool skipTest) external;
815 | ```
816 | 
817 | ### stopExpectSafeMemory
818 | 
819 | Stops all safe memory expectation in the current subcontext.
820 | 
821 | 
822 | ```solidity
823 | function stopExpectSafeMemory() external;
824 | ```
825 | 
826 |

2398 | 
2399 | ### log
2400 | 
2401 | 
2402 | ```solidity
2403 | function log(bytes32 p0, bytes32 p1, uint256 p2, bytes32 p3) internal pure;
2404 | ```
2405 | 
2406 | ### log
2407 |

2410 | function log(bytes32 p0, bytes32 p1, bytes32 p2, address p3) internal pure;
2411 | ```
2412 | 
2413 | ### log
2414 | 
2415 | 
2416 | ```solidity
2417 | function log(bytes32 p0, bytes32 p1, bytes32 p2, bool p3) internal pure;
2418 | ```
2419 | 
2420 | ### log
2421 | 
2422 | 
2423 | ```solidity
2424 | function log(bytes32 p0, bytes32 p1, bytes32 p2, uint256 p3) internal pure;
2425 | ```
2426 | 
2427 | ### log
2428 | 
2429 | 
2430 | ```solidity
2431 | function log(bytes32 p0, bytes32 p1, bytes32 p2, bytes32 p3) internal pure;
2432 | ```

   5 | ## State Variables
   6 | ### CONSOLE_ADDRESS
   7 | 
   8 | ```solidity
   9 | address constant CONSOLE_ADDRESS = address(0x000000000000000000636F6e736F6c652e6c6f67);
  10 | ```
  11 | 
  12 | 
  13 | ## Functions
  14 | ### _castLogPayloadViewToPure
  15 | 
  16 | 
  17 | ```solidity
  18 | function _castLogPayloadViewToPure(function(bytes memory) internal view fnIn)
  19 |     internal
  20 |     pure
  21 |     returns (function(bytes memory) internal pure fnOut);
  22 | ```
  23 |

2639 | function log(address p0, address p1, string memory p2, bool p3) internal pure;
2640 | ```
2641 | 
2642 | ### log
2643 | 
2644 | 
2645 | ```solidity
2646 | function log(address p0, address p1, string memory p2, address p3) internal pure;
2647 | ```
2648 | 
2649 | ### log
2650 | 
2651 | 
2652 | ```solidity
2653 | function log(address p0, address p1, bool p2, uint256 p3) internal pure;
2654 | ```
2655 | 
2656 | ### log
2657 | 
2658 | 
2659 | ```solidity
2660 | function log(address p0, address p1, bool p2, string memory p3) internal pure;
2661 | ```
2662 | 
2663 | ### log
2664 | 
2665 | 
2666 | ```solidity

2668 | ```
2669 |

2672 |

2675 | ```
2676 | 
2677 | ### log

2682 | ```
2683 | 
2684 | ### log

2689 | ```
2690 |

2696 | ```
2697 |

2703 | ```
