--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
/site/docs/03-api/03-api-details/Flattened.sol/interface.VmSafe.md:
--------------------------------------------------------------------------------
   1 | # VmSafe
   2 | [Git Source](https://github.com/metacontract/mc/blob/main/src/devkit/Flattened.sol)
   3 | 
   4 | The `VmSafe` interface does not allow manipulation of the EVM state or other actions that may
   5 | result in Script simulations differing from on-chain execution. It is recommended to only use
   6 | these cheats in scripts.
   7 | 
   8 | 
   9 | ## Functions
  10 | ### createWallet
  11 | 
  12 | Derives a private key from the name, labels the account with that name, and returns the wallet.
  13 | 
  14 | 
  15 | ```solidity
  16 | function createWallet(string calldata walletLabel) external returns (Wallet memory wallet);
  17 | ```
  18 | 
  19 | ### createWallet
  20 | 
  21 | Generates a wallet from the private key and returns the wallet.
  22 | 
  23 | 
  24 | ```solidity
  25 | function createWallet(uint256 privateKey) external returns (Wallet memory wallet);
  26 | ```
  27 | 
  28 | ### createWallet
  29 | 
  30 | Generates a wallet from the private key, labels the account with that name, and returns the wallet.
  31 | 
  32 | 
  33 | ```solidity
  34 | function createWallet(uint256 privateKey, string calldata walletLabel) external returns (Wallet memory wallet);
  35 | ```
  36 | 
  37 | ### deriveKey
  38 | 
  39 | Derive a private key from a provided mnenomic string (or mnenomic file path)
  40 | at the derivation path `m/44'/60'/0'/0/{index}`.
  41 | 
  42 | 
  43 | ```solidity
  44 | function deriveKey(string calldata mnemonic, uint32 index) external pure returns (uint256 privateKey);
  45 | ```
  46 | 
  47 | ### deriveKey
  48 | 
  49 | Derive a private key from a provided mnenomic string (or mnenomic file path)
  50 | at `{derivationPath}{index}`.
  51 | 
  52 | 
  53 | ```solidity
  54 | function deriveKey(string calldata mnemonic, string calldata derivationPath, uint32 index)
  55 |     external
  56 |     pure
  57 |     returns (uint256 privateKey);
  58 | ```
  59 | 
  60 | ### deriveKey
  61 | 
  62 | Derive a private key from a provided mnenomic string (or mnenomic file path) in the specified language
  63 | at the derivation path `m/44'/60'/0'/0/{index}`.
  64 | 
  65 | 
  66 | ```solidity
  67 | function deriveKey(string calldata mnemonic, uint32 index, string calldata language)
  68 |     external
  69 |     pure
  70 |     returns (uint256 privateKey);
  71 | ```
  72 | 
  73 | ### deriveKey
  74 | 
  75 | Derive a private key from a provided mnenomic string (or mnenomic file path) in the specified language
  76 | at `{derivationPath}{index}`.
  77 | 
  78 | 
  79 | ```solidity
  80 | function deriveKey(string calldata mnemonic, string calldata derivationPath, uint32 index, string calldata language)
  81 |     external
  82 |     pure
  83 |     returns (uint256 privateKey);
  84 | ```
  85 | 
  86 | ### publicKeyP256
  87 | 
  88 | Derives secp256r1 public key from the provided `privateKey`.
  89 | 
  90 | 
  91 | ```solidity
  92 | function publicKeyP256(uint256 privateKey) external pure returns (uint256 publicKeyX, uint256 publicKeyY);
  93 | ```
  94 | 
  95 | ### rememberKey
  96 | 
  97 | Adds a private key to the local forge wallet and returns the address.
  98 | 
  99 | 
 100 | ```solidity
 101 | function rememberKey(uint256 privateKey) external returns (address keyAddr);
 102 | ```
 103 | 
 104 | ### signCompact
 105 | 
 106 | Signs data with a `Wallet`.
 107 | Returns a compact signature (`r`, `vs`) as per EIP-2098, where `vs` encodes both the
 108 | signature's `s` value, and the recovery id `v` in a single bytes32.
 109 | This format reduces the signature size from 65 to 64 bytes.
 110 | 
 111 | 
 112 | ```solidity
 113 | function signCompact(Wallet calldata wallet, bytes32 digest) external returns (bytes32 r, bytes32 vs);
 114 | ```
 115 | 
 116 | ### signCompact
 117 | 
 118 | Signs `digest` with `privateKey` using the secp256k1 curve.
 119 | Returns a compact signature (`r`, `vs`) as per EIP-2098, where `vs` encodes both the
 120 | signature's `s` value, and the recovery id `v` in a single bytes32.
 121 | This format reduces the signature size from 65 to 64 bytes.
 122 | 
 123 | 
 124 | ```solidity
 125 | function signCompact(uint256 privateKey, bytes32 digest) external pure returns (bytes32 r, bytes32 vs);
 126 | ```
 127 | 
 128 | ### signCompact
 129 | 
 130 | Signs `digest` with signer provided to script using the secp256k1 curve.
 131 | Returns a compact signature (`r`, `vs`) as per EIP-2098, where `vs` encodes both the
 132 | signature's `s` value, and the recovery id `v` in a single bytes32.
 133 | This format reduces the signature size from 65 to 64 bytes.
 134 | If `--sender` is provided, the signer with provided address is used, otherwise,
 135 | if exactly one signer is provided to the script, that signer is used.
 136 | Raises error if signer passed through `--sender` does not match any unlocked signers or
 137 | if `--sender` is not provided and not exactly one signer is passed to the script.
 138 | 
 139 | 
 140 | ```solidity
 141 | function signCompact(bytes32 digest) external pure returns (bytes32 r, bytes32 vs);
 142 | ```
 143 | 
 144 | ### signCompact
 145 | 
 146 | Signs `digest` with signer provided to script using the secp256k1 curve.
 147 | Returns a compact signature (`r`, `vs`) as per EIP-2098, where `vs` encodes both the
 148 | signature's `s` value, and the recovery id `v` in a single bytes32.
 149 | This format reduces the signature size from 65 to 64 bytes.
 150 | Raises error if none of the signers passed into the script have provided address.
 151 | 
 152 | 
 153 | ```solidity
 154 | function signCompact(address signer, bytes32 digest) external pure returns (bytes32 r, bytes32 vs);
 155 | ```
 156 | 
 157 | ### signP256
 158 | 
 159 | Signs `digest` with `privateKey` using the secp256r1 curve.
 160 | 
 161 | 
 162 | ```solidity
 163 | function signP256(uint256 privateKey, bytes32 digest) external pure returns (bytes32 r, bytes32 s);
 164 | ```
 165 | 
 166 | ### sign
 167 | 
 168 | Signs data with a `Wallet`.
 169 | 
 170 | 
 171 | ```solidity
 172 | function sign(Wallet calldata wallet, bytes32 digest) external returns (uint8 v, bytes32 r, bytes32 s);
 173 | ```
 174 | 
 175 | ### sign
 176 | 
 177 | Signs `digest` with `privateKey` using the secp256k1 curve.
 178 | 
 179 | 
 180 | ```solidity
 181 | function sign(uint256 privateKey, bytes32 digest) external pure returns (uint8 v, bytes32 r, bytes32 s);
 182 | ```
 183 | 
 184 | ### sign
 185 | 
 186 | Signs `digest` with signer provided to script using the secp256k1 curve.
 187 | If `--sender` is provided, the signer with provided address is used, otherwise,
 188 | if exactly one signer is provided to the script, that signer is used.
 189 | Raises error if signer passed through `--sender` does not match any unlocked signers or
 190 | if `--sender` is not provided and not exactly one signer is passed to the script.
 191 | 
 192 | 
 193 | ```solidity
 194 | function sign(bytes32 digest) external pure returns (uint8 v, bytes32 r, bytes32 s);
 195 | ```
 196 | 
 197 | ### sign
 198 | 
 199 | Signs `digest` with signer provided to script using the secp256k1 curve.
 200 | Raises error if none of the signers passed into the script have provided address.
 201 | 
 202 | 
 203 | ```solidity
 204 | function sign(address signer, bytes32 digest) external pure returns (uint8 v, bytes32 r, bytes32 s);
 205 | ```
 206 | 
 207 | ### envAddress
 208 | 
 209 | Gets the environment variable `name` and parses it as `address`.
 210 | Reverts if the variable was not found or could not be parsed.
 211 | 
 212 | 
 213 | ```solidity
 214 | function envAddress(string calldata name) external view returns (address value);
 215 | ```
 216 | 
 217 | ### envAddress
 218 | 
 219 | Gets the environment variable `name` and parses it as an array of `address`, delimited by `delim`.
 220 | Reverts if the variable was not found or could not be parsed.
 221 | 
 222 | 
 223 | ```solidity
 224 | function envAddress(string calldata name, string calldata delim) external view returns (address[] memory value);
 225 | ```
 226 |

 231 | 
 232 | 
 233 | ```solidity
 234 | function envBool(string calldata name) external view returns (bool value);
 235 | ```

 245 | ```

 292 | ```solidity

 294 | ```

 316 | ### envOr
 317 | 
 318 | Gets the environment variable `name` and parses it as `bool`.
 319 | Reverts if the variable could not be parsed.
 320 | Returns `defaultValue` if the variable was not found.
 321 | 
 322 | 
 323 | ```solidity
 324 | function envOr(string calldata name, bool defaultValue) external view returns (bool value);
 325 | ```
 326 |

 336 | ```

 347 |     external
 348 |     view
 349 |     returns (address[] memory value);
 350 | ```

 532 |

 534 | 
 535 | 
 536 | ```solidity
 537 | function isContext(ForgeContext context) external view returns (bool result);
 538 | ```

 541 | 
 542 | Sets environment variables.
 543 | 
 544 | 
 545 | ```solidity
 546 | function setEnv(string calldata name, string calldata value) external;
 547 | ```
 548 | 
 549 | ### accesses
 550 | 
 551 | Gets all accessed reads and write slot from a `vm.record` session, for a given address.
 552 | 
 553 | 
 554 | ```solidity
 555 | function accesses(address target) external returns (bytes32[] memory readSlots, bytes32[] memory writeSlots);
 556 | ```
 557 | 
 558 | ### addr
 559 | 
 560 | Gets the address for a given private key.
 561 | 
 562 | 
 563 | ```solidity
 564 | function addr(uint256 privateKey) external pure returns (address keyAddr);
 565 | ```
 566 | 
 567 | ### eth_getLogs
 568 | 
 569 | Gets all the logs according to specified filter.
 570 | 
 571 | 
 572 | ```solidity
 573 | function eth_getLogs(uint256 fromBlock, uint256 toBlock, address target, bytes32[] calldata topics)
 574 |     external
 575 |     returns (EthGetLogs[] memory logs);
 576 | ```
 577 | 
 578 | ### getBlobBaseFee
 579 | 
 580 | Gets the current `block.blobbasefee`.
 581 | You should use this instead of `block.blobbasefee` if you use `vm.blobBaseFee`, as `block.blobbasefee` is assumed to be constant across a transaction,
 582 | and as a result will get optimized out by the compiler.
 583 | See https://github.com/foundry-rs/foundry/issues/6180
 584 | 
 585 | 
 586 | ```solidity
 587 | function getBlobBaseFee() external view returns (uint256 blobBaseFee);
 588 | ```
 589 | 
 590 | ### getBlockNumber
 591 | 
 592 | Gets the current `block.number`.
 593 | You should use this instead of `block.number` if you use `vm.roll`, as `block.number` is assumed to be constant across a transaction,
 594 | and as a result will get optimized out by the compiler.
 595 | See https://github.com/foundry-rs/foundry/issues/6180
 596 | 
 597 | 
 598 | ```solidity
 599 | function getBlockNumber() external view returns (uint256 height);
 600 | ```
 601 | 
 602 | ### getBlockTimestamp
 603 | 
 604 | Gets the current `block.timestamp`.
 605 | You should use this instead of `block.timestamp` if you use `vm.warp`, as `block.timestamp` is assumed to be constant across a transaction,
 606 | and as a result will get optimized out by the compiler.
 607 | See https://github.com/foundry-rs/foundry/issues/6180
 608 | 
 609 | 
 610 | ```solidity
 611 | function getBlockTimestamp() external view returns (uint256 timestamp);
 612 | ```
 613 | 
 614 | ### getMappingKeyAndParentOf
 615 | 
 616 | Gets the map key and parent of a mapping at a given slot, for a given address.
 617 | 
 618 | 
 619 | ```solidity
 620 | function getMappingKeyAndParentOf(address target, bytes32 elementSlot)
 621 |     external
 622 |     returns (bool found, bytes32 key, bytes32 parent);
 623 | ```
 624 | 
 625 | ### getMappingLength
 626 | 
 627 | Gets the number of elements in the mapping at the given slot, for a given address.
 628 | 
 629 | 
 630 | ```solidity
 631 | function getMappingLength(address target, bytes32 mappingSlot) external returns (uint256 length);
 632 | ```
 633 | 
 634 | ### getMappingSlotAt
 635 | 
 636 | Gets the elements at index idx of the mapping at the given slot, for a given address. The
 637 | index must be less than the length of the mapping (i.e. the number of keys in the mapping).
 638 | 
 639 | 
 640 | ```solidity
 641 | function getMappingSlotAt(address target, bytes32 mappingSlot, uint256 idx) external returns (bytes32 value);
 642 | ```
 643 |

 645 |

 647 | 
 648 | 
 649 | ```solidity
 650 | function getNonce(address account) external view returns (uint64 nonce);
 651 | ```
 652 |

 655 | Get the nonce of a `Wallet`.
 656 | 
 657 | 
 658 | ```solidity
 659 | function getNonce(Wallet calldata wallet) external returns (uint64 nonce);
 660 | ```

 678 | ```
 679 | 
 680 | ### load
 681 | 
 682 | Loads a storage slot from an address.
 683 | 
 684 | 
 685 | ```solidity
 686 | function load(address target, bytes32 slot) external view returns (bytes32 data);
 687 | ```
 688 | 
 689 | ### pauseGasMetering
 690 | 
 691 | Pauses gas metering (i.e. gas usage is not counted). Noop if already paused.
 692 | 
 693 | 
 694 | ```solidity
 695 | function pauseGasMetering() external;
 696 | ```
 697 |

 699 | 
 700 | Records all storage reads and writes.
 701 | 
 702 | 
 703 | ```solidity
 704 | function record() external;
 705 | ```

 713 | function recordLogs() external;
 714 | ```

 716 | ### resetGasMetering
 717 | 
 718 | Reset gas metering (i.e. gas usage is set to gas limit).
 719 | 
 720 | 
 721 | ```solidity
 722 | function resetGasMetering() external;
 723 | ```
 724 |

 728 | 
 729 | 
 730 | ```solidity
 731 | function resumeGasMetering() external;
 732 | ```

 741 | ```

 750 |     external
 751 |     returns (bytes memory data);
 752 | ```

 757 | 
 758 | 
 759 | ```solidity
 760 | function startMappingRecording() external;
 761 | ```
 762 | 
 763 | ### startStateDiffRecording
 764 | 
 765 | Record all account accesses as part of CREATE, CALL or SELFDESTRUCT opcodes in order,
 766 | along with the context of the calls
 767 | 
 768 | 
 769 | ```solidity
 770 | function startStateDiffRecording() external;
 771 | ```
 772 |

 774 |

 776 | 
 777 | 
 778 | ```solidity
 779 | function stopAndReturnStateDiff() external returns (AccountAccess[] memory accountAccesses);
 780 | ```
 781 | 
 782 | ### stopMappingRecording
 783 | 
 784 | Stops recording all map SSTOREs for later retrieval and clears the recorded data.
 785 | 
 786 | 
 787 | ```solidity
 788 | function stopMappingRecording() external;
 789 | ```
 790 | 
 791 | ### closeFile
 792 | 
 793 | Closes file for reading, resetting the offset and allowing to read it from beginning with readLine.
 794 | `path` is relative to the project root.
 795 | 
 796 | 
 797 | ```solidity
 798 | function closeFile(string calldata path) external;
 799 | ```
 800 | 
 801 | ### copyFile
 802 | 
 803 | Copies the contents of one file to another. This function will **overwrite** the contents of `to`.
 804 | On success, the total number of bytes copied is returned and it is equal to the length of the `to` file as reported by `metadata`.
 805 | Both `from` and `to` are relative to the project root.
 806 | 
 807 | 
 808 | ```solidity
 809 | function copyFile(string calldata from, string calldata to) external returns (uint64 copied);
 810 | ```
 811 | 
 812 | ### createDir
 813 | 
 814 | Creates a new, empty directory at the provided path.
 815 | This cheatcode will revert in the following situations, but is not limited to just these cases:
 816 | - User lacks permissions to modify `path`.
 817 | - A parent of the given path doesn't exist and `recursive` is false.
 818 | - `path` already exists and `recursive` is false.
 819 | `path` is relative to the project root.
 820 | 
 821 | 
 822 | ```solidity
 823 | function createDir(string calldata path, bool recursive) external;
 824 | ```
 825 | 
 826 | ### deployCode
 827 | 
 828 | Deploys a contract from an artifact file. Takes in the relative path to the json file or the path to the
 829 | artifact in the form of <path>:<contract>:<version> where <contract> and <version> parts are optional.
 830 | 
 831 | 
 832 | ```solidity
 833 | function deployCode(string calldata artifactPath) external returns (address deployedAddress);
 834 | ```
 835 | 
 836 | ### deployCode
 837 | 
 838 | Deploys a contract from an artifact file. Takes in the relative path to the json file or the path to the
 839 | artifact in the form of <path>:<contract>:<version> where <contract> and <version> parts are optional.
 840 | Additionaly accepts abi-encoded constructor arguments.
 841 | 
 842 | 
 843 | ```solidity
 844 | function deployCode(string calldata artifactPath, bytes calldata constructorArgs)
 845 |     external
 846 |     returns (address deployedAddress);
 847 | ```
 848 |

 853 | 
 854 | ```solidity
 855 | function exists(string calldata path) external returns (bool result);
 856 | ```

 894 | ```

 967 | 
 968 | ### readDir
 969 | 
 970 | Reads the directory at the given path recursively, up to `maxDepth`.
 971 | `maxDepth` defaults to 1, meaning only the direct children of the given directory will be returned.
 972 | Follows symbolic links if `followLinks` is true.
 973 | 
 974 | 
 975 | ```solidity
 976 | function readDir(string calldata path) external view returns (DirEntry[] memory entries);
 977 | ```
 978 | 
 979 | ### readDir
 980 | 
 981 | See `readDir(string)`.
 982 | 
 983 | 
 984 | ```solidity
 985 | function readDir(string calldata path, uint64 maxDepth) external view returns (DirEntry[] memory entries);
 986 | ```
 987 | 
 988 | ### readDir
 989 | 
 990 | See `readDir(string)`.
 991 | 
 992 | 
 993 | ```solidity
 994 | function readDir(string calldata path, uint64 maxDepth, bool followLinks)
 995 |     external
 996 |     view
 997 |     returns (DirEntry[] memory entries);
 998 | ```
 999 | 
1000 | ### readFile
1001 | 
1002 | Reads the entire content of file to string. `path` is relative to the project root.
1003 | 
1004 | 
1005 | ```solidity
1006 | function readFile(string calldata path) external view returns (string memory data);
1007 | ```
1008 | 
1009 | ### readFileBinary
1010 | 
1011 | Reads the entire content of file as binary. `path` is relative to the project root.
1012 | 
1013 | 
1014 | ```solidity
1015 | function readFileBinary(string calldata path) external view returns (bytes memory data);
1016 | ```
1017 |

1019 | 
1020 | Reads next line of file to string.
1021 | 
1022 | 
1023 | ```solidity
1024 | function readLine(string calldata path) external view returns (string memory line);
1025 | ```
1026 | 
1027 | ### readLink
1028 | 
1029 | Reads a symbolic link, returning the path that the link points to.
1030 | This cheatcode will revert in the following situations, but is not limited to just these cases:
1031 | - `path` is not a symbolic link.
1032 | - `path` does not exist.
1033 | 
1034 | 
1035 | ```solidity
1036 | function readLink(string calldata linkPath) external view returns (string memory targetPath);
1037 | ```
1038 | 
1039 | ### removeDir
1040 | 
1041 | Removes a directory at the provided path.
1042 | This cheatcode will revert in the following situations, but is not limited to just these cases:
1043 | - `path` doesn't exist.
1044 | - `path` isn't a directory.
1045 | - User lacks permissions to modify `path`.
1046 | - The directory is not empty and `recursive` is false.
1047 | `path` is relative to the project root.
1048 | 
1049 | 
1050 | ```solidity
1051 | function removeDir(string calldata path, bool recursive) external;
1052 | ```
1053 | 
1054 | ### removeFile
1055 | 
1056 | Removes a file from the filesystem.
1057 | This cheatcode will revert in the following situations, but is not limited to just these cases:
1058 | - `path` points to a directory.
1059 | - The file doesn't exist.
1060 | - The user lacks permissions to remove the file.
1061 | `path` is relative to the project root.
1062 | 
1063 | 
1064 | ```solidity
1065 | function removeFile(string calldata path) external;
1066 | ```
1067 |

1071 | 
1072 | 
1073 | ```solidity
1074 | function tryFfi(string[] calldata commandInput) external returns (FfiResult memory result);
1075 | ```

1431 | ### serializeJson
1432 | 
1433 | Serializes a key and value to a JSON object stored in-memory that can be later written to a file.
1434 | Returns the stringified version of the specific JSON file up to that moment.
1435 | 
1436 | 
1437 | ```solidity
1438 | function serializeJson(string calldata objectKey, string calldata value) external returns (string memory json);
1439 | ```

1460 |     string calldata objectKey,
1461 |     string calldata valueKey,
1462 |     string calldata typeDescription,
1463 |     bytes calldata value
1464 | ) external returns (string memory json);
1465 | ```
1466 | 
1467 | ### serializeString
1468 | 
1469 | See `serializeJson`.
1470 | 
1471 | 
1472 | ```solidity
1473 | function serializeString(string calldata objectKey, string calldata valueKey, string calldata value)
1474 |     external
1475 |     returns (string memory json);
1476 | ```

1487 | ```

1521 | 
1522 | ### writeJson
1523 | 
1524 | Write a serialized JSON object to a file. If the file exists, it will be overwritten.
1525 | 
1526 | 
1527 | ```solidity
1528 | function writeJson(string calldata json, string calldata path) external;
1529 | ```
1530 | 
1531 | ### writeJson
1532 | 
1533 | Write a serialized JSON object to an **existing** JSON file, replacing a value with key = <value_key.>
1534 | This is useful to replace a specific value of a JSON file, without having to parse the entire thing.
1535 | 
1536 | 
1537 | ```solidity
1538 | function writeJson(string calldata json, string calldata path, string calldata valueKey) external;
1539 | ```
1540 | 
1541 | ### broadcastRawTransaction
1542 | 
1543 | Takes a signed transaction and broadcasts it to the network.
1544 | 
1545 | 
1546 | ```solidity
1547 | function broadcastRawTransaction(bytes calldata data) external;
1548 | ```
1549 | 
1550 | ### broadcast
1551 | 
1552 | Has the next call (at this call depth only) create transactions that can later be signed and sent onchain.
1553 | Broadcasting address is determined by checking the following in order:
1554 | 1. If `--sender` argument was provided, that address is used.
1555 | 2. If exactly one signer (e.g. private key, hw wallet, keystore) is set when `forge broadcast` is invoked, that signer is used.
1556 | 3. Otherwise, default foundry sender (1804c8AB1F12E6bbf3894d4083f33e07309d1f38) is used.
1557 | 
1558 | 
1559 | ```solidity
1560 | function broadcast() external;
1561 | ```
1562 | 
1563 | ### broadcast
1564 | 
1565 | Has the next call (at this call depth only) create a transaction with the address provided
1566 | as the sender that can later be signed and sent onchain.
1567 | 
1568 | 
1569 | ```solidity
1570 | function broadcast(address signer) external;
1571 | ```
1572 | 
1573 | ### broadcast
1574 | 
1575 | Has the next call (at this call depth only) create a transaction with the private key
1576 | provided as the sender that can later be signed and sent onchain.
1577 | 
1578 | 
1579 | ```solidity
1580 | function broadcast(uint256 privateKey) external;
1581 | ```
1582 | 
1583 | ### startBroadcast
1584 | 
1585 | Has all subsequent calls (at this call depth only) create transactions that can later be signed and sent onchain.
1586 | Broadcasting address is determined by checking the following in order:
1587 | 1. If `--sender` argument was provided, that address is used.
1588 | 2. If exactly one signer (e.g. private key, hw wallet, keystore) is set when `forge broadcast` is invoked, that signer is used.
1589 | 3. Otherwise, default foundry sender (1804c8AB1F12E6bbf3894d4083f33e07309d1f38) is used.
1590 | 
1591 | 
1592 | ```solidity
1593 | function startBroadcast() external;
1594 | ```
1595 | 
1596 | ### startBroadcast
1597 | 
1598 | Has all subsequent calls (at this call depth only) create transactions with the address
1599 | provided that can later be signed and sent onchain.
1600 | 
1601 | 
1602 | ```solidity
1603 | function startBroadcast(address signer) external;
1604 | ```
1605 | 
1606 | ### startBroadcast
1607 | 
1608 | Has all subsequent calls (at this call depth only) create transactions with the private key
1609 | provided that can later be signed and sent onchain.
1610 | 
1611 | 
1612 | ```solidity
1613 | function startBroadcast(uint256 privateKey) external;
1614 | ```
1615 | 
1616 | ### stopBroadcast
1617 | 
1618 | Stops collecting onchain transactions.
1619 | 
1620 | 
1621 | ```solidity
1622 | function stopBroadcast() external;
1623 | ```
1624 | 
1625 | ### indexOf
1626 | 
1627 | Returns the index of the first occurrence of a `key` in an `input` string.
1628 | Returns `NOT_FOUND` (i.e. `type(uint256).max`) if the `key` is not found.
1629 | Returns 0 in case of an empty `key`.
1630 | 
1631 | 
1632 | ```solidity
1633 | function indexOf(string calldata input, string calldata key) external pure returns (uint256);
1634 | ```

1815 | ) external pure;

1878 | ### assertApproxEqRelDecimal
1879 | 
1880 | Compares two `uint256` values. Expects relative difference in percents to be less than or equal to `maxPercentDelta`.
1881 | `maxPercentDelta` is an 18 decimal fixed point number, where 1e18 == 100%
1882 | Formats values with decimals in failure message.
1883 | 
1884 | 
1885 | ```solidity
1886 | function assertApproxEqRelDecimal(uint256 left, uint256 right, uint256 maxPercentDelta, uint256 decimals)
1887 |     external
1888 |     pure;
1889 | ```
1890 | 
1891 | ### assertApproxEqRelDecimal

1895 | Formats values with decimals in failure message. Includes error message into revert string on failure.
1896 | 
1897 | 
1898 | ```solidity
1899 | function assertApproxEqRelDecimal(
1900 |     uint256 left,
1901 |     uint256 right,
1902 |     uint256 maxPercentDelta,
1903 |     uint256 decimals,
1904 |     string calldata error
1905 | ) external pure;
1906 | ```

2906 | ### assume
2907 | 
2908 | If the condition is false, discard this run's fuzz inputs and generate new ones.
2909 | 
2910 | 
2911 | ```solidity
2912 | function assume(bool condition) external pure;
2913 | ```
2914 | 
2915 | ### assumeNoRevert
2916 | 
2917 | Discard this run's fuzz inputs and generate new ones if next call reverted.
2918 | 
2919 | 
2920 | ```solidity
2921 | function assumeNoRevert() external pure;
2922 | ```
2923 | 
2924 | ### breakpoint

2927 | 
2928 | 
2929 | ```solidity
2930 | function breakpoint(string calldata char) external;
2931 | ```
2932 | 
2933 | ### breakpoint
2934 | 
2935 | Writes a conditional breakpoint to jump to in the debugger.
2936 | 
2937 | 
2938 | ```solidity
2939 | function breakpoint(string calldata char, bool value) external;
2940 | ```
2941 | 
2942 | ### getFoundryVersion
2943 | 
2944 | Returns the Foundry version.
2945 | Format: <cargo_version>+<git_sha>+<build_timestamp>
2946 | Sample output: 0.2.0+faa94c384+202407110019
2947 | Note: Build timestamps may vary slightly across platforms due to separate CI jobs.
2948 | For reliable version comparisons, use YYYYMMDD0000 format (e.g., >= 202407110000)
2949 | to compare timestamps while ignoring minor time differences.
2950 | 
2951 | 
2952 | ```solidity
2953 | function getFoundryVersion() external view returns (string memory version);
2954 | ```
2955 | 
2956 | ### rpcUrl
2957 | 
2958 | Returns the RPC url for the given alias.
2959 | 
2960 | 
2961 | ```solidity
2962 | function rpcUrl(string calldata rpcAlias) external view returns (string memory json);
2963 | ```

3163 | ### writeToml
3164 | 
3165 | Takes serialized JSON, converts to TOML and write a serialized TOML table to an **existing** TOML file, replacing a value with key = <value_key.>
3166 | This is useful to replace a specific value of a TOML file, without having to parse the entire thing.
3167 | 
3168 | 
3169 | ```solidity
3170 | function writeToml(string calldata json, string calldata path, string calldata valueKey) external;
3171 | ```

3327 | ## Structs
3328 | ### Log
3329 | An Ethereum log. Returned by `getRecordedLogs`.
3330 | 
3331 | 
3332 | ```solidity
3333 | struct Log {
3334 |     bytes32[] topics;
3335 |     bytes data;
3336 |     address emitter;
3337 | }
3338 | ```
3339 | 
3340 | ### Rpc
3341 | An RPC URL and its alias. Returned by `rpcUrlStructs`.
3342 | 
3343 | 
3344 | ```solidity
3345 | struct Rpc {
3346 |     string key;
3347 |     string url;
3348 | }
3349 | ```
3350 | 
3351 | ### EthGetLogs
3352 | An RPC log object. Returned by `eth_getLogs`.
3353 | 
3354 | 
3355 | ```solidity
3356 | struct EthGetLogs {
3357 |     address emitter;
3358 |     bytes32[] topics;
3359 |     bytes data;
3360 |     bytes32 blockHash;
3361 |     uint64 blockNumber;
3362 |     bytes32 transactionHash;
3363 |     uint64 transactionIndex;
3364 |     uint256 logIndex;
3365 |     bool removed;
3366 | }
3367 | ```
3368 | 
3369 | ### DirEntry
3370 | A single entry in a directory listing. Returned by `readDir`.
3371 | 
3372 | 
3373 | ```solidity
3374 | struct DirEntry {
3375 |     string errorMessage;
3376 |     string path;
3377 |     uint64 depth;
3378 |     bool isDir;
3379 |     bool isSymlink;
3380 | }
3381 | ```
3382 | 
3383 | ### FsMetadata
3384 | Metadata information about a file.
3385 | This structure is returned from the `fsMetadata` function and represents known
3386 | metadata about a file such as its permissions, size, modification
3387 | times, etc.
3388 | 
3389 | 
3390 | ```solidity
3391 | struct FsMetadata {
3392 |     bool isDir;
3393 |     bool isSymlink;
3394 |     uint256 length;
3395 |     bool readOnly;
3396 |     uint256 modified;
3397 |     uint256 accessed;
3398 |     uint256 created;
3399 | }
3400 | ```
3401 | 
3402 | ### Wallet

3407 | struct Wallet {
3408 |     address addr;

3410 |     uint256 publicKeyY;
3411 |     uint256 privateKey;
3412 | }
3413 | ```

3443 | struct AccountAccess {

3445 |     AccountAccessKind kind;

3486 | }
3487 | ```
3488 | 
3489 | ## Enums
3490 | ### CallerMode
3491 | A modification applied to either `msg.sender` or `tx.origin`. Returned by `readCallers`.
3492 | 
3493 | 
3494 | ```solidity
3495 | enum CallerMode {
3496 |     None,
3497 |     Broadcast,
3498 |     RecurrentBroadcast,
3499 |     Prank,
3500 |     RecurrentPrank
3501 | }
3502 | ```
3503 | 
3504 | ### AccountAccessKind
3505 | The kind of account access that occurred.
3506 | 
3507 | 
3508 | ```solidity
3509 | enum AccountAccessKind {
3510 |     Call,
3511 |     DelegateCall,
3512 |     CallCode,
3513 |     StaticCall,
3514 |     Create,
3515 |     SelfDestruct,
3516 |     Resume,
3517 |     Balance,
3518 |     Extcodesize,
3519 |     Extcodehash,
3520 |     Extcodecopy
3521 | }
3522 | ```
3523 | 
3524 | ### ForgeContext

3526 | 
3527 | 
3528 | ```solidity
3529 | enum ForgeContext {
3530 |     TestGroup,
3531 |     Test,
3532 |     Coverage,
3533 |     Snapshot,
3534 |     ScriptGroup,
3535 |     ScriptDryRun,
3536 |     ScriptBroadcast,
3537 |     ScriptResume,
3538 |     Unknown
3539 | }
3540 | ```

/src/devkit/Flattened.sol:

    1 | // SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT
    2 | pragma solidity <0.9.0 >=0.4.22 >=0.6.0 >=0.6.2 ^0.8.20 ^0.8.22 ^0.8.23;
    3 | pragma experimental ABIEncoderV2;
    4 | 
    5 | // lib/forge-std/src/StdError.sol
    6 | 
    7 | // Panics work for versions >=0.8.0, but we lowered the pragma to make this compatible with Test
    8 | 
    9 | library stdError {
   10 |     bytes public constant assertionError = abi.encodeWithSignature("Panic(uint256)", 0x01);
   11 |     bytes public constant arithmeticError = abi.encodeWithSignature("Panic(uint256)", 0x11);
   12 |     bytes public constant divisionError = abi.encodeWithSignature("Panic(uint256)", 0x12);
   13 |     bytes public constant enumConversionError = abi.encodeWithSignature("Panic(uint256)", 0x21);
   14 |     bytes public constant encodeStorageError = abi.encodeWithSignature("Panic(uint256)", 0x22);
   15 |     bytes public constant popError = abi.encodeWithSignature("Panic(uint256)", 0x31);
   16 |     bytes public constant indexOOBError = abi.encodeWithSignature("Panic(uint256)", 0x32);
   17 |     bytes public constant memOverflowError = abi.encodeWithSignature("Panic(uint256)", 0x41);
   18 |     bytes public constant zeroVarError = abi.encodeWithSignature("Panic(uint256)", 0x51);
   19 | }
   20 | 
   21 | // lib/forge-std/src/StdInvariant.sol
   22 | 
   23 | abstract contract StdInvariant {
   24 |     struct FuzzSelector {
   25 |         address addr;
   26 |         bytes4[] selectors;
   27 |     }
   28 | 
   29 |     struct FuzzArtifactSelector {
   30 |         string artifact;
   31 |         bytes4[] selectors;
   32 |     }
   33 | 
   34 |     struct FuzzInterface {
   35 |         address addr;
   36 |         string[] artifacts;
   37 |     }
   38 | 
   39 |     address[] private _excludedContracts;
   40 |     address[] private _excludedSenders;
   41 |     address[] private _targetedContracts;
   42 |     address[] private _targetedSenders;
   43 | 
   44 |     string[] private _excludedArtifacts;
   45 |     string[] private _targetedArtifacts;
   46 | 
   47 |     FuzzArtifactSelector[] private _targetedArtifactSelectors;
   48 | 
   49 |     FuzzSelector[] private _excludedSelectors;
   50 |     FuzzSelector[] private _targetedSelectors;
   51 | 
   52 |     FuzzInterface[] private _targetedInterfaces;
   53 | 
   54 |     // Functions for users:
   55 |     // These are intended to be called in tests.
   56 | 
   57 |     function excludeContract(address newExcludedContract_) internal {
   58 |         _excludedContracts.push(newExcludedContract_);
   59 |     }
   60 | 
   61 |     function excludeSelector(FuzzSelector memory newExcludedSelector_) internal {
   62 |         _excludedSelectors.push(newExcludedSelector_);
   63 |     }
   64 | 
   65 |     function excludeSender(address newExcludedSender_) internal {
   66 |         _excludedSenders.push(newExcludedSender_);
   67 |     }
   68 | 
   69 |     function excludeArtifact(string memory newExcludedArtifact_) internal {
   70 |         _excludedArtifacts.push(newExcludedArtifact_);
   71 |     }
   72 | 
   73 |     function targetArtifact(string memory newTargetedArtifact_) internal {
   74 |         _targetedArtifacts.push(newTargetedArtifact_);
   75 |     }
   76 | 
   77 |     function targetArtifactSelector(FuzzArtifactSelector memory newTargetedArtifactSelector_) internal {
   78 |         _targetedArtifactSelectors.push(newTargetedArtifactSelector_);
   79 |     }
   80 | 
   81 |     function targetContract(address newTargetedContract_) internal {
   82 |         _targetedContracts.push(newTargetedContract_);
   83 |     }
   84 | 
   85 |     function targetSelector(FuzzSelector memory newTargetedSelector_) internal {
   86 |         _targetedSelectors.push(newTargetedSelector_);
   87 |     }
   88 | 
   89 |     function targetSender(address newTargetedSender_) internal {
   90 |         _targetedSenders.push(newTargetedSender_);
   91 |     }
   92 | 
   93 |     function targetInterface(FuzzInterface memory newTargetedInterface_) internal {
   94 |         _targetedInterfaces.push(newTargetedInterface_);
   95 |     }
   96 | 
   97 |     // Functions for forge:
   98 |     // These are called by forge to run invariant tests and don't need to be called in tests.
   99 | 
  100 |     function excludeArtifacts() public view returns (string[] memory excludedArtifacts_) {
  101 |         excludedArtifacts_ = _excludedArtifacts;
  102 |     }
  103 | 
  104 |     function excludeContracts() public view returns (address[] memory excludedContracts_) {
  105 |         excludedContracts_ = _excludedContracts;
  106 |     }
  107 | 
  108 |     function excludeSelectors() public view returns (FuzzSelector[] memory excludedSelectors_) {
  109 |         excludedSelectors_ = _excludedSelectors;
  110 |     }
  111 | 
  112 |     function excludeSenders() public view returns (address[] memory excludedSenders_) {
  113 |         excludedSenders_ = _excludedSenders;
  114 |     }
  115 | 
  116 |     function targetArtifacts() public view returns (string[] memory targetedArtifacts_) {
  117 |         targetedArtifacts_ = _targetedArtifacts;
  118 |     }
  119 | 
  120 |     function targetArtifactSelectors() public view returns (FuzzArtifactSelector[] memory targetedArtifactSelectors_) {
  121 |         targetedArtifactSelectors_ = _targetedArtifactSelectors;
  122 |     }
  123 | 
  124 |     function targetContracts() public view returns (address[] memory targetedContracts_) {
  125 |         targetedContracts_ = _targetedContracts;
  126 |     }
  127 | 
  128 |     function targetSelectors() public view returns (FuzzSelector[] memory targetedSelectors_) {
  129 |         targetedSelectors_ = _targetedSelectors;
  130 |     }
  131 | 
  132 |     function targetSenders() public view returns (address[] memory targetedSenders_) {
  133 |         targetedSenders_ = _targetedSenders;
  134 |     }
  135 | 
  136 |     function targetInterfaces() public view returns (FuzzInterface[] memory targetedInterfaces_) {
  137 |         targetedInterfaces_ = _targetedInterfaces;
  138 |     }
  139 | }
  140 | 
  141 | // lib/forge-std/src/StdMath.sol
  142 | 
  143 | library stdMath {
  144 |     int256 private constant INT256_MIN = -57896044618658097711785492504343953926634992332820282019728792003956564819968;
  145 | 
  146 |     function abs(int256 a) internal pure returns (uint256) {
  147 |         // Required or it will fail when `a = type(int256).min`
  148 |         if (a == INT256_MIN) {
  149 |             return 57896044618658097711785492504343953926634992332820282019728792003956564819968;
  150 |         }
  151 | 
  152 |         return uint256(a > 0 ? a : -a);
  153 |     }
  154 | 
  155 |     function delta(uint256 a, uint256 b) internal pure returns (uint256) {
  156 |         return a > b ? a - b : b - a;
  157 |     }
  158 | 
  159 |     function delta(int256 a, int256 b) internal pure returns (uint256) {
  160 |         // a and b are of the same sign
  161 |         // this works thanks to two's complement, the left-most bit is the sign bit
  162 |         if ((a ^ b) > -1) {
  163 |             return delta(abs(a), abs(b));
  164 |         }
  165 | 
  166 |         // a and b are of opposite signs
  167 |         return abs(a) + abs(b);
  168 |     }
  169 | 
  170 |     function percentDelta(uint256 a, uint256 b) internal pure returns (uint256) {
  171 |         uint256 absDelta = delta(a, b);
  172 | 
  173 |         return absDelta * 1e18 / b;
  174 |     }
  175 | 
  176 |     function percentDelta(int256 a, int256 b) internal pure returns (uint256) {
  177 |         uint256 absDelta = delta(a, b);
  178 |         uint256 absB = abs(b);
  179 | 
  180 |         return absDelta * 1e18 / absB;
  181 |     }
  182 | }
  183 | 
  184 | // lib/forge-std/src/Vm.sol
  185 | // Automatically @generated by scripts/vm.py. Do not modify manually.
  186 | 
  187 | /// The `VmSafe` interface does not allow manipulation of the EVM state or other actions that may
  188 | /// result in Script simulations differing from on-chain execution. It is recommended to only use
  189 | /// these cheats in scripts.
  190 | interface VmSafe {
  191 |     /// A modification applied to either `msg.sender` or `tx.origin`. Returned by `readCallers`.
  192 |     enum CallerMode {
  193 |         // No caller modification is currently active.
  194 |         None,
  195 |         // A one time broadcast triggered by a `vm.broadcast()` call is currently active.
  196 |         Broadcast,
  197 |         // A recurrent broadcast triggered by a `vm.startBroadcast()` call is currently active.
  198 |         RecurrentBroadcast,
  199 |         // A one time prank triggered by a `vm.prank()` call is currently active.
  200 |         Prank,
  201 |         // A recurrent prank triggered by a `vm.startPrank()` call is currently active.
  202 |         RecurrentPrank
  203 |     }
  204 | 
  205 |     /// The kind of account access that occurred.
  206 |     enum AccountAccessKind {
  207 |         // The account was called.
  208 |         Call,
  209 |         // The account was called via delegatecall.
  210 |         DelegateCall,
  211 |         // The account was called via callcode.
  212 |         CallCode,
  213 |         // The account was called via staticcall.
  214 |         StaticCall,
  215 |         // The account was created.
  216 |         Create,
  217 |         // The account was selfdestructed.
  218 |         SelfDestruct,
  219 |         // Synthetic access indicating the current context has resumed after a previous sub-context (AccountAccess).
  220 |         Resume,
  221 |         // The account's balance was read.
  222 |         Balance,
  223 |         // The account's codesize was read.
  224 |         Extcodesize,
  225 |         // The account's codehash was read.
  226 |         Extcodehash,
  227 |         // The account's code was copied.
  228 |         Extcodecopy
  229 |     }
  230 | 
  231 |     /// Forge execution contexts.
  232 |     enum ForgeContext {
  233 |         // Test group execution context (test, coverage or snapshot).
  234 |         TestGroup,
  235 |         // `forge test` execution context.
  236 |         Test,
  237 |         // `forge coverage` execution context.
  238 |         Coverage,
  239 |         // `forge snapshot` execution context.
  240 |         Snapshot,
  241 |         // Script group execution context (dry run, broadcast or resume).
  242 |         ScriptGroup,
  243 |         // `forge script` execution context.
  244 |         ScriptDryRun,
  245 |         // `forge script --broadcast` execution context.
  246 |         ScriptBroadcast,
  247 |         // `forge script --resume` execution context.
  248 |         ScriptResume,
  249 |         // Unknown `forge` execution context.
  250 |         Unknown
  251 |     }
  252 | 
  253 |     /// An Ethereum log. Returned by `getRecordedLogs`.
  254 |     struct Log {
  255 |         // The topics of the log, including the signature, if any.
  256 |         bytes32[] topics;
  257 |         // The raw data of the log.
  258 |         bytes data;
  259 |         // The address of the log's emitter.
  260 |         address emitter;
  261 |     }
  262 | 
  263 |     /// An RPC URL and its alias. Returned by `rpcUrlStructs`.
  264 |     struct Rpc {
  265 |         // The alias of the RPC URL.
  266 |         string key;
  267 |         // The RPC URL.
  268 |         string url;
  269 |     }
  270 | 
  271 |     /// An RPC log object. Returned by `eth_getLogs`.
  272 |     struct EthGetLogs {
  273 |         // The address of the log's emitter.
  274 |         address emitter;
  275 |         // The topics of the log, including the signature, if any.
  276 |         bytes32[] topics;
  277 |         // The raw data of the log.
  278 |         bytes data;
  279 |         // The block hash.
  280 |         bytes32 blockHash;
  281 |         // The block number.
  282 |         uint64 blockNumber;
  283 |         // The transaction hash.
  284 |         bytes32 transactionHash;
  285 |         // The transaction index in the block.
  286 |         uint64 transactionIndex;
  287 |         // The log index.
  288 |         uint256 logIndex;
  289 |         // Whether the log was removed.
  290 |         bool removed;
  291 |     }
  292 | 
  293 |     /// A single entry in a directory listing. Returned by `readDir`.
  294 |     struct DirEntry {
  295 |         // The error message, if any.
  296 |         string errorMessage;
  297 |         // The path of the entry.
  298 |         string path;
  299 |         // The depth of the entry.
  300 |         uint64 depth;
  301 |         // Whether the entry is a directory.
  302 |         bool isDir;
  303 |         // Whether the entry is a symlink.
  304 |         bool isSymlink;
  305 |     }
  306 | 
  307 |     /// Metadata information about a file.
  308 |     /// This structure is returned from the `fsMetadata` function and represents known
  309 |     /// metadata about a file such as its permissions, size, modification
  310 |     /// times, etc.
  311 |     struct FsMetadata {
  312 |         // True if this metadata is for a directory.
  313 |         bool isDir;
  314 |         // True if this metadata is for a symlink.
  315 |         bool isSymlink;
  316 |         // The size of the file, in bytes, this metadata is for.
  317 |         uint256 length;
  318 |         // True if this metadata is for a readonly (unwritable) file.
  319 |         bool readOnly;
  320 |         // The last modification time listed in this metadata.
  321 |         uint256 modified;
  322 |         // The last access time of this metadata.
  323 |         uint256 accessed;
  324 |         // The creation time listed in this metadata.
  325 |         uint256 created;
  326 |     }
  327 | 
  328 |     /// A wallet with a public and private key.
  329 |     struct Wallet {
  330 |         // The wallet's address.
  331 |         address addr;
  332 |         // The wallet's public key `X`.
  333 |         uint256 publicKeyX;
  334 |         // The wallet's public key `Y`.
  335 |         uint256 publicKeyY;
  336 |         // The wallet's private key.
  337 |         uint256 privateKey;
  338 |     }
  339 | 
  340 |     /// The result of a `tryFfi` call.
  341 |     struct FfiResult {
  342 |         // The exit code of the call.
  343 |         int32 exitCode;
  344 |         // The optionally hex-decoded `stdout` data.
  345 |         bytes stdout;
  346 |         // The `stderr` data.
  347 |         bytes stderr;
  348 |     }
  349 | 
  350 |     /// Information on the chain and fork.
  351 |     struct ChainInfo {
  352 |         // The fork identifier. Set to zero if no fork is active.
  353 |         uint256 forkId;
  354 |         // The chain ID of the current fork.
  355 |         uint256 chainId;
  356 |     }
  357 | 
  358 |     /// The result of a `stopAndReturnStateDiff` call.
  359 |     struct AccountAccess {
  360 |         // The chain and fork the access occurred.
  361 |         ChainInfo chainInfo;
  362 |         // The kind of account access that determines what the account is.
  363 |         // If kind is Call, DelegateCall, StaticCall or CallCode, then the account is the callee.
  364 |         // If kind is Create, then the account is the newly created account.
  365 |         // If kind is SelfDestruct, then the account is the selfdestruct recipient.
  366 |         // If kind is a Resume, then account represents a account context that has resumed.
  367 |         AccountAccessKind kind;
  368 |         // The account that was accessed.
  369 |         // It's either the account created, callee or a selfdestruct recipient for CREATE, CALL or SELFDESTRUCT.
  370 |         address account;
  371 |         // What accessed the account.
  372 |         address accessor;
  373 |         // If the account was initialized or empty prior to the access.
  374 |         // An account is considered initialized if it has code, a
  375 |         // non-zero nonce, or a non-zero balance.
  376 |         bool initialized;
  377 |         // The previous balance of the accessed account.
  378 |         uint256 oldBalance;
  379 |         // The potential new balance of the accessed account.
  380 |         // That is, all balance changes are recorded here, even if reverts occurred.
  381 |         uint256 newBalance;
  382 |         // Code of the account deployed by CREATE.
  383 |         bytes deployedCode;
  384 |         // Value passed along with the account access
  385 |         uint256 value;
  386 |         // Input data provided to the CREATE or CALL
  387 |         bytes data;
  388 |         // If this access reverted in either the current or parent context.
  389 |         bool reverted;
  390 |         // An ordered list of storage accesses made during an account access operation.
  391 |         StorageAccess[] storageAccesses;
  392 |         // Call depth traversed during the recording of state differences
  393 |         uint64 depth;
  394 |     }
  395 | 
  396 |     /// The storage accessed during an `AccountAccess`.
  397 |     struct StorageAccess {
  398 |         // The account whose storage was accessed.
  399 |         address account;
  400 |         // The slot that was accessed.
  401 |         bytes32 slot;
  402 |         // If the access was a write.
  403 |         bool isWrite;
  404 |         // The previous value of the slot.
  405 |         bytes32 previousValue;
  406 |         // The new value of the slot.
  407 |         bytes32 newValue;
  408 |         // If the access was reverted.
  409 |         bool reverted;
  410 |     }
  411 | 
  412 |     /// Gas used. Returned by `lastCallGas`.
  413 |     struct Gas {
  414 |         // The gas limit of the call.
  415 |         uint64 gasLimit;
  416 |         // The total gas used.
  417 |         uint64 gasTotalUsed;
  418 |         // DEPRECATED: The amount of gas used for memory expansion. Ref: <https://github.com/foundry-rs/foundry/pull/7934#pullrequestreview-2069236939>
  419 |         uint64 gasMemoryUsed;
  420 |         // The amount of gas refunded.
  421 |         int64 gasRefunded;
  422 |         // The amount of gas remaining.
  423 |         uint64 gasRemaining;
  424 |     }

  462 |     /// Derives secp256r1 public key from the provided `privateKey`.
  463 |     function publicKeyP256(uint256 privateKey) external pure returns (uint256 publicKeyX, uint256 publicKeyY);
  464 | 
  465 |     /// Adds a private key to the local forge wallet and returns the address.
  466 |     function rememberKey(uint256 privateKey) external returns (address keyAddr);
  467 | 
  468 |     /// Signs data with a `Wallet`.
  469 |     /// Returns a compact signature (`r`, `vs`) as per EIP-2098, where `vs` encodes both the
  470 |     /// signature's `s` value, and the recovery id `v` in a single bytes32.
  471 |     /// This format reduces the signature size from 65 to 64 bytes.
  472 |     function signCompact(Wallet calldata wallet, bytes32 digest) external returns (bytes32 r, bytes32 vs);
  473 | 
  474 |     /// Signs `digest` with `privateKey` using the secp256k1 curve.
  475 |     /// Returns a compact signature (`r`, `vs`) as per EIP-2098, where `vs` encodes both the
  476 |     /// signature's `s` value, and the recovery id `v` in a single bytes32.
  477 |     /// This format reduces the signature size from 65 to 64 bytes.
  478 |     function signCompact(uint256 privateKey, bytes32 digest) external pure returns (bytes32 r, bytes32 vs);
  479 | 
  480 |     /// Signs `digest` with signer provided to script using the secp256k1 curve.
  481 |     /// Returns a compact signature (`r`, `vs`) as per EIP-2098, where `vs` encodes both the
  482 |     /// signature's `s` value, and the recovery id `v` in a single bytes32.
  483 |     /// This format reduces the signature size from 65 to 64 bytes.
  484 |     /// If `--sender` is provided, the signer with provided address is used, otherwise,
  485 |     /// if exactly one signer is provided to the script, that signer is used.
  486 |     /// Raises error if signer passed through `--sender` does not match any unlocked signers or
  487 |     /// if `--sender` is not provided and not exactly one signer is passed to the script.
  488 |     function signCompact(bytes32 digest) external pure returns (bytes32 r, bytes32 vs);
  489 | 
  490 |     /// Signs `digest` with signer provided to script using the secp256k1 curve.
  491 |     /// Returns a compact signature (`r`, `vs`) as per EIP-2098, where `vs` encodes both the
  492 |     /// signature's `s` value, and the recovery id `v` in a single bytes32.
  493 |     /// This format reduces the signature size from 65 to 64 bytes.
  494 |     /// Raises error if none of the signers passed into the script have provided address.
  495 |     function signCompact(address signer, bytes32 digest) external pure returns (bytes32 r, bytes32 vs);
  496 | 
  497 |     /// Signs `digest` with `privateKey` using the secp256r1 curve.
  498 |     function signP256(uint256 privateKey, bytes32 digest) external pure returns (bytes32 r, bytes32 s);
  499 | 
  500 |     /// Signs data with a `Wallet`.
  501 |     function sign(Wallet calldata wallet, bytes32 digest) external returns (uint8 v, bytes32 r, bytes32 s);
  502 | 
  503 |     /// Signs `digest` with `privateKey` using the secp256k1 curve.
  504 |     function sign(uint256 privateKey, bytes32 digest) external pure returns (uint8 v, bytes32 r, bytes32 s);
  505 | 
  506 |     /// Signs `digest` with signer provided to script using the secp256k1 curve.
  507 |     /// If `--sender` is provided, the signer with provided address is used, otherwise,
  508 |     /// if exactly one signer is provided to the script, that signer is used.
  509 |     /// Raises error if signer passed through `--sender` does not match any unlocked signers or
  510 |     /// if `--sender` is not provided and not exactly one signer is passed to the script.
  511 |     function sign(bytes32 digest) external pure returns (uint8 v, bytes32 r, bytes32 s);
  512 | 
  513 |     /// Signs `digest` with signer provided to script using the secp256k1 curve.
  514 |     /// Raises error if none of the signers passed into the script have provided address.
  515 |     function sign(address signer, bytes32 digest) external pure returns (uint8 v, bytes32 r, bytes32 s);
  516 |

  675 |     // ======== EVM ========
  676 | 
  677 |     /// Gets all accessed reads and write slot from a `vm.record` session, for a given address.
  678 |     function accesses(address target) external returns (bytes32[] memory readSlots, bytes32[] memory writeSlots);

  680 |     /// Gets the address for a given private key.
  681 |     function addr(uint256 privateKey) external pure returns (address keyAddr);
  682 | 
  683 |     /// Gets all the logs according to specified filter.
  684 |     function eth_getLogs(uint256 fromBlock, uint256 toBlock, address target, bytes32[] calldata topics)
  685 |         external
  686 |         returns (EthGetLogs[] memory logs);
  687 | 
  688 |     /// Gets the current `block.blobbasefee`.
  689 |     /// You should use this instead of `block.blobbasefee` if you use `vm.blobBaseFee`, as `block.blobbasefee` is assumed to be constant across a transaction,
  690 |     /// and as a result will get optimized out by the compiler.
  691 |     /// See https://github.com/foundry-rs/foundry/issues/6180
  692 |     function getBlobBaseFee() external view returns (uint256 blobBaseFee);
  693 | 
  694 |     /// Gets the current `block.number`.
  695 |     /// You should use this instead of `block.number` if you use `vm.roll`, as `block.number` is assumed to be constant across a transaction,
  696 |     /// and as a result will get optimized out by the compiler.
  697 |     /// See https://github.com/foundry-rs/foundry/issues/6180
  698 |     function getBlockNumber() external view returns (uint256 height);
  699 | 
  700 |     /// Gets the current `block.timestamp`.
  701 |     /// You should use this instead of `block.timestamp` if you use `vm.warp`, as `block.timestamp` is assumed to be constant across a transaction,
  702 |     /// and as a result will get optimized out by the compiler.
  703 |     /// See https://github.com/foundry-rs/foundry/issues/6180
  704 |     function getBlockTimestamp() external view returns (uint256 timestamp);
  705 | 
  706 |     /// Gets the map key and parent of a mapping at a given slot, for a given address.
  707 |     function getMappingKeyAndParentOf(address target, bytes32 elementSlot)
  708 |         external
  709 |         returns (bool found, bytes32 key, bytes32 parent);
  710 | 
  711 |     /// Gets the number of elements in the mapping at the given slot, for a given address.
  712 |     function getMappingLength(address target, bytes32 mappingSlot) external returns (uint256 length);
  713 | 
  714 |     /// Gets the elements at index idx of the mapping at the given slot, for a given address. The
  715 |     /// index must be less than the length of the mapping (i.e. the number of keys in the mapping).
  716 |     function getMappingSlotAt(address target, bytes32 mappingSlot, uint256 idx) external returns (bytes32 value);
  717 | 
  718 |     /// Gets the nonce of an account.
  719 |     function getNonce(address account) external view returns (uint64 nonce);
  720 | 
  721 |     /// Get the nonce of a `Wallet`.
  722 |     function getNonce(Wallet calldata wallet) external returns (uint64 nonce);
  723 | 
  724 |     /// Gets all the recorded logs.
  725 |     function getRecordedLogs() external returns (Log[] memory logs);
  726 | 
  727 |     /// Gets the gas used in the last call.
  728 |     function lastCallGas() external view returns (Gas memory gas);
  729 | 
  730 |     /// Loads a storage slot from an address.
  731 |     function load(address target, bytes32 slot) external view returns (bytes32 data);
  732 | 
  733 |     /// Pauses gas metering (i.e. gas usage is not counted). Noop if already paused.
  734 |     function pauseGasMetering() external;
  735 | 
  736 |     /// Records all storage reads and writes.
  737 |     function record() external;
  738 | 
  739 |     /// Record all the transaction logs.
  740 |     function recordLogs() external;
  741 | 
  742 |     /// Reset gas metering (i.e. gas usage is set to gas limit).
  743 |     function resetGasMetering() external;
  744 | 
  745 |     /// Resumes gas metering (i.e. gas usage is counted again). Noop if already on.
  746 |     function resumeGasMetering() external;
  747 | 
  748 |     /// Performs an Ethereum JSON-RPC request to the current fork URL.
  749 |     function rpc(string calldata method, string calldata params) external returns (bytes memory data);
  750 | 
  751 |     /// Performs an Ethereum JSON-RPC request to the given endpoint.
  752 |     function rpc(string calldata urlOrAlias, string calldata method, string calldata params)
  753 |         external
  754 |         returns (bytes memory data);
  755 | 
  756 |     /// Starts recording all map SSTOREs for later retrieval.
  757 |     function startMappingRecording() external;
  758 | 
  759 |     /// Record all account accesses as part of CREATE, CALL or SELFDESTRUCT opcodes in order,
  760 |     /// along with the context of the calls
  761 |     function startStateDiffRecording() external;
  762 | 
  763 |     /// Returns an ordered array of all account accesses from a `vm.startStateDiffRecording` session.
  764 |     function stopAndReturnStateDiff() external returns (AccountAccess[] memory accountAccesses);
  765 | 
  766 |     /// Stops recording all map SSTOREs for later retrieval and clears the recorded data.
  767 |     function stopMappingRecording() external;
  768 | 
  769 |     // ======== Filesystem ========
  770 | 
  771 |     /// Closes file for reading, resetting the offset and allowing to read it from beginning with readLine.
  772 |     /// `path` is relative to the project root.
  773 |     function closeFile(string calldata path) external;
  774 | 
  775 |     /// Copies the contents of one file to another. This function will **overwrite** the contents of `to`.
  776 |     /// On success, the total number of bytes copied is returned and it is equal to the length of the `to` file as reported by `metadata`.
  777 |     /// Both `from` and `to` are relative to the project root.
  778 |     function copyFile(string calldata from, string calldata to) external returns (uint64 copied);
  779 | 
  780 |     /// Creates a new, empty directory at the provided path.
  781 |     /// This cheatcode will revert in the following situations, but is not limited to just these cases:
  782 |     /// - User lacks permissions to modify `path`.
  783 |     /// - A parent of the given path doesn't exist and `recursive` is false.
  784 |     /// - `path` already exists and `recursive` is false.
  785 |     /// `path` is relative to the project root.
  786 |     function createDir(string calldata path, bool recursive) external;
  787 | 
  788 |     /// Deploys a contract from an artifact file. Takes in the relative path to the json file or the path to the
  789 |     /// artifact in the form of <path>:<contract>:<version> where <contract> and <version> parts are optional.
  790 |     function deployCode(string calldata artifactPath) external returns (address deployedAddress);
  791 | 
  792 |     /// Deploys a contract from an artifact file. Takes in the relative path to the json file or the path to the
  793 |     /// artifact in the form of <path>:<contract>:<version> where <contract> and <version> parts are optional.
  794 |     /// Additionaly accepts abi-encoded constructor arguments.
  795 |     function deployCode(string calldata artifactPath, bytes calldata constructorArgs)
  796 |         external
  797 |         returns (address deployedAddress);
  798 | 
  799 |     /// Returns true if the given path points to an existing entity, else returns false.
  800 |     function exists(string calldata path) external returns (bool result);
  801 | 
  802 |     /// Performs a foreign function call via the terminal.
  803 |     function ffi(string[] calldata commandInput) external returns (bytes memory result);
  804 | 
  805 |     /// Given a path, query the file system to get information about a file, directory, etc.
  806 |     function fsMetadata(string calldata path) external view returns (FsMetadata memory metadata);
  807 | 
  808 |     /// Gets the creation bytecode from an artifact file. Takes in the relative path to the json file or the path to the
  809 |     /// artifact in the form of <path>:<contract>:<version> where <contract> and <version> parts are optional.
  810 |     function getCode(string calldata artifactPath) external view returns (bytes memory creationBytecode);
  811 | 
  812 |     /// Gets the deployed bytecode from an artifact file. Takes in the relative path to the json file or the path to the
  813 |     /// artifact in the form of <path>:<contract>:<version> where <contract> and <version> parts are optional.
  814 |     function getDeployedCode(string calldata artifactPath) external view returns (bytes memory runtimeBytecode);
  815 | 
  816 |     /// Returns true if the path exists on disk and is pointing at a directory, else returns false.
  817 |     function isDir(string calldata path) external returns (bool result);
  818 | 
  819 |     /// Returns true if the path exists on disk and is pointing at a regular file, else returns false.
  820 |     function isFile(string calldata path) external returns (bool result);
  821 | 
  822 |     /// Get the path of the current project root.
  823 |     function projectRoot() external view returns (string memory path);
  824 | 
  825 |     /// Prompts the user for a string value in the terminal.
  826 |     function prompt(string calldata promptText) external returns (string memory input);
  827 | 
  828 |     /// Prompts the user for an address in the terminal.
  829 |     function promptAddress(string calldata promptText) external returns (address);
  830 | 
  831 |     /// Prompts the user for a hidden string value in the terminal.
  832 |     function promptSecret(string calldata promptText) external returns (string memory input);
  833 | 
  834 |     /// Prompts the user for hidden uint256 in the terminal (usually pk).
  835 |     function promptSecretUint(string calldata promptText) external returns (uint256);
  836 | 
  837 |     /// Prompts the user for uint256 in the terminal.
  838 |     function promptUint(string calldata promptText) external returns (uint256);
  839 | 
  840 |     /// Reads the directory at the given path recursively, up to `maxDepth`.
  841 |     /// `maxDepth` defaults to 1, meaning only the direct children of the given directory will be returned.
  842 |     /// Follows symbolic links if `followLinks` is true.
  843 |     function readDir(string calldata path) external view returns (DirEntry[] memory entries);
  844 | 
  845 |     /// See `readDir(string)`.
  846 |     function readDir(string calldata path, uint64 maxDepth) external view returns (DirEntry[] memory entries);
  847 | 
  848 |     /// See `readDir(string)`.
  849 |     function readDir(string calldata path, uint64 maxDepth, bool followLinks)
  850 |         external
  851 |         view
  852 |         returns (DirEntry[] memory entries);
  853 | 
  854 |     /// Reads the entire content of file to string. `path` is relative to the project root.
  855 |     function readFile(string calldata path) external view returns (string memory data);
  856 | 
  857 |     /// Reads the entire content of file as binary. `path` is relative to the project root.
  858 |     function readFileBinary(string calldata path) external view returns (bytes memory data);
  859 | 
  860 |     /// Reads next line of file to string.
  861 |     function readLine(string calldata path) external view returns (string memory line);
  862 | 
  863 |     /// Reads a symbolic link, returning the path that the link points to.
  864 |     /// This cheatcode will revert in the following situations, but is not limited to just these cases:
  865 |     /// - `path` is not a symbolic link.
  866 |     /// - `path` does not exist.
  867 |     function readLink(string calldata linkPath) external view returns (string memory targetPath);
  868 | 
  869 |     /// Removes a directory at the provided path.
  870 |     /// This cheatcode will revert in the following situations, but is not limited to just these cases:
  871 |     /// - `path` doesn't exist.
  872 |     /// - `path` isn't a directory.
  873 |     /// - User lacks permissions to modify `path`.
  874 |     /// - The directory is not empty and `recursive` is false.
  875 |     /// `path` is relative to the project root.
  876 |     function removeDir(string calldata path, bool recursive) external;
  877 | 
  878 |     /// Removes a file from the filesystem.
  879 |     /// This cheatcode will revert in the following situations, but is not limited to just these cases:
  880 |     /// - `path` points to a directory.
  881 |     /// - The file doesn't exist.
  882 |     /// - The user lacks permissions to remove the file.
  883 |     /// `path` is relative to the project root.
  884 |     function removeFile(string calldata path) external;
  885 | 
  886 |     /// Performs a foreign function call via terminal and returns the exit code, stdout, and stderr.
  887 |     function tryFfi(string[] calldata commandInput) external returns (FfiResult memory result);
  888 | 
  889 |     /// Returns the time since unix epoch in milliseconds.
  890 |     function unixTime() external returns (uint256 milliseconds);
  891 | 
  892 |     /// Writes data to file, creating a file if it does not exist, and entirely replacing its contents if it does.
  893 |     /// `path` is relative to the project root.
  894 |     function writeFile(string calldata path, string calldata data) external;
  895 | 
  896 |     /// Writes binary data to a file, creating a file if it does not exist, and entirely replacing its contents if it does.
  897 |     /// `path` is relative to the project root.
  898 |     function writeFileBinary(string calldata path, bytes calldata data) external;
  899 | 
  900 |     /// Writes line to file, creating a file if it does not exist.
  901 |     /// `path` is relative to the project root.
  902 |     function writeLine(string calldata path, string calldata data) external;
  903 | 
  904 |     // ======== JSON ========
  905 | 
  906 |     /// Checks if `key` exists in a JSON object
  907 |     /// `keyExists` is being deprecated in favor of `keyExistsJson`. It will be removed in future versions.
  908 |     function keyExists(string calldata json, string calldata key) external view returns (bool);
  909 | 
  910 |     /// Checks if `key` exists in a JSON object.

  912 |

  915 |

  918 |         external
  919 |         pure
  920 |         returns (address[] memory);
  921 |

  924 | 
  925 |     /// Parses a string of JSON data at `key` and coerces it to `bool[]`.

  927 |

  930 |

  933 |

  937 |         pure
  938 |         returns (bytes32[] memory);
  939 |

  942 | 
  943 |     /// Parses a string of JSON data at `key` and coerces it to `int256`.

  945 | 
  946 |     /// Parses a string of JSON data at `key` and coerces it to `int256[]`.
  947 |     function parseJsonIntArray(string calldata json, string calldata key) external pure returns (int256[] memory);
  948 | 
  949 |     /// Returns an array of all the keys in a JSON object.
  950 |     function parseJsonKeys(string calldata json, string calldata key) external pure returns (string[] memory keys);
  951 | 
  952 |     /// Parses a string of JSON data at `key` and coerces it to `string`.

  954 |

  957 |

  959 |     function parseJsonTypeArray(string calldata json, string calldata key, string calldata typeDescription)
  960 |         external
  961 |         pure
  962 |         returns (bytes memory);
  963 |

  966 |         external
  967 |         pure
  968 |         returns (bytes memory);

  972 |         external
  973 |         pure
  974 |         returns (bytes memory);
  975 |

  978 | 
  979 |     /// Parses a string of JSON data at `key` and coerces it to `uint256[]`.

  981 |

  984 |

 1081 |     /// Write a serialized JSON object to a file. If the file exists, it will be overwritten.
 1082 |     function writeJson(string calldata json, string calldata path) external;
 1083 | 
 1084 |     /// Write a serialized JSON object to an **existing** JSON file, replacing a value with key = <value_key.>
 1085 |     /// This is useful to replace a specific value of a JSON file, without having to parse the entire thing.
 1086 |     function writeJson(string calldata json, string calldata path, string calldata valueKey) external;
 1087 | 
 1088 |     // ======== Scripting ========
 1089 | 
 1090 |     /// Takes a signed transaction and broadcasts it to the network.
 1091 |     function broadcastRawTransaction(bytes calldata data) external;
 1092 | 
 1093 |     /// Has the next call (at this call depth only) create transactions that can later be signed and sent onchain.
 1094 |     /// Broadcasting address is determined by checking the following in order:
 1095 |     /// 1. If `--sender` argument was provided, that address is used.
 1096 |     /// 2. If exactly one signer (e.g. private key, hw wallet, keystore) is set when `forge broadcast` is invoked, that signer is used.
 1097 |     /// 3. Otherwise, default foundry sender (1804c8AB1F12E6bbf3894d4083f33e07309d1f38) is used.
 1098 |     function broadcast() external;
 1099 | 
 1100 |     /// Has the next call (at this call depth only) create a transaction with the address provided
 1101 |     /// as the sender that can later be signed and sent onchain.
 1102 |     function broadcast(address signer) external;
 1103 | 
 1104 |     /// Has the next call (at this call depth only) create a transaction with the private key
 1105 |     /// provided as the sender that can later be signed and sent onchain.
 1106 |     function broadcast(uint256 privateKey) external;
 1107 | 
 1108 |     /// Has all subsequent calls (at this call depth only) create transactions that can later be signed and sent onchain.
 1109 |     /// Broadcasting address is determined by checking the following in order:
 1110 |     /// 1. If `--sender` argument was provided, that address is used.
 1111 |     /// 2. If exactly one signer (e.g. private key, hw wallet, keystore) is set when `forge broadcast` is invoked, that signer is used.
 1112 |     /// 3. Otherwise, default foundry sender (1804c8AB1F12E6bbf3894d4083f33e07309d1f38) is used.
 1113 |     function startBroadcast() external;
 1114 | 
 1115 |     /// Has all subsequent calls (at this call depth only) create transactions with the address
 1116 |     /// provided that can later be signed and sent onchain.
 1117 |     function startBroadcast(address signer) external;
 1118 | 
 1119 |     /// Has all subsequent calls (at this call depth only) create transactions with the private key
 1120 |     /// provided that can later be signed and sent onchain.
 1121 |     function startBroadcast(uint256 privateKey) external;
 1122 | 
 1123 |     /// Stops collecting onchain transactions.
 1124 |     function stopBroadcast() external;
 1125 | 
 1126 |     // ======== String ========
 1127 | 
 1128 |     /// Returns the index of the first occurrence of a `key` in an `input` string.
 1129 |     /// Returns `NOT_FOUND` (i.e. `type(uint256).max`) if the `key` is not found.
 1130 |     /// Returns 0 in case of an empty `key`.
 1131 |     function indexOf(string calldata input, string calldata key) external pure returns (uint256);
 1132 | 
 1133 |     /// Parses the given `string` into an `address`.
 1134 |     function parseAddress(string calldata stringifiedValue) external pure returns (address parsedValue);
 1135 | 
 1136 |     /// Parses the given `string` into a `bool`.
 1137 |     function parseBool(string calldata stringifiedValue) external pure returns (bool parsedValue);
 1138 | 
 1139 |     /// Parses the given `string` into `bytes`.
 1140 |     function parseBytes(string calldata stringifiedValue) external pure returns (bytes memory parsedValue);
 1141 | 
 1142 |     /// Parses the given `string` into a `bytes32`.
 1143 |     function parseBytes32(string calldata stringifiedValue) external pure returns (bytes32 parsedValue);
 1144 | 
 1145 |     /// Parses the given `string` into a `int256`.
 1146 |     function parseInt(string calldata stringifiedValue) external pure returns (int256 parsedValue);
 1147 | 
 1148 |     /// Parses the given `string` into a `uint256`.
 1149 |     function parseUint(string calldata stringifiedValue) external pure returns (uint256 parsedValue);
 1150 | 
 1151 |     /// Replaces occurrences of `from` in the given `string` with `to`.
 1152 |     function replace(string calldata input, string calldata from, string calldata to)
 1153 |         external
 1154 |         pure
 1155 |         returns (string memory output);
 1156 | 
 1157 |     /// Splits the given `string` into an array of strings divided by the `delimiter`.
 1158 |     function split(string calldata input, string calldata delimiter) external pure returns (string[] memory outputs);
 1159 |
