 1588 |     function assertNotEq(bytes[] calldata left, bytes[] calldata right, string calldata error) external pure;
 1589 | 
 1590 |     /// Asserts that two `uint256` values are not equal and includes error message into revert string on failure.
 1591 |     function assertNotEq(uint256 left, uint256 right, string calldata error) external pure;
 1592 | 
 1593 |     /// Asserts that two `int256` values are not equal.
 1594 |     function assertNotEq(int256 left, int256 right) external pure;
 1595 | 
 1596 |     /// Asserts that two `int256` values are not equal and includes error message into revert string on failure.
 1597 |     function assertNotEq(int256 left, int256 right, string calldata error) external pure;
 1598 | 
 1599 |     /// Asserts that two `address` values are not equal.
 1600 |     function assertNotEq(address left, address right) external pure;
 1601 | 
 1602 |     /// Asserts that two `address` values are not equal and includes error message into revert string on failure.
 1603 |     function assertNotEq(address left, address right, string calldata error) external pure;
 1604 | 
 1605 |     /// Asserts that two `bytes32` values are not equal.
 1606 |     function assertNotEq(bytes32 left, bytes32 right) external pure;
 1607 | 
 1608 |     /// Asserts that two `bytes32` values are not equal and includes error message into revert string on failure.
 1609 |     function assertNotEq(bytes32 left, bytes32 right, string calldata error) external pure;
 1610 | 
 1611 |     /// Asserts that the given condition is true.
 1612 |     function assertTrue(bool condition) external pure;
 1613 | 
 1614 |     /// Asserts that the given condition is true and includes error message into revert string on failure.
 1615 |     function assertTrue(bool condition, string calldata error) external pure;
 1616 | 
 1617 |     /// If the condition is false, discard this run's fuzz inputs and generate new ones.
 1618 |     function assume(bool condition) external pure;
 1619 | 
 1620 |     /// Discard this run's fuzz inputs and generate new ones if next call reverted.
 1621 |     function assumeNoRevert() external pure;
 1622 | 
 1623 |     /// Writes a breakpoint to jump to in the debugger.
 1624 |     function breakpoint(string calldata char) external;
 1625 | 
 1626 |     /// Writes a conditional breakpoint to jump to in the debugger.
 1627 |     function breakpoint(string calldata char, bool value) external;
 1628 | 
 1629 |     /// Returns the Foundry version.
 1630 |     /// Format: <cargo_version>+<git_sha>+<build_timestamp>
 1631 |     /// Sample output: 0.2.0+faa94c384+202407110019
 1632 |     /// Note: Build timestamps may vary slightly across platforms due to separate CI jobs.
 1633 |     /// For reliable version comparisons, use YYYYMMDD0000 format (e.g., >= 202407110000)
 1634 |     /// to compare timestamps while ignoring minor time differences.
 1635 |     function getFoundryVersion() external view returns (string memory version);
 1636 | 
 1637 |     /// Returns the RPC url for the given alias.
 1638 |     function rpcUrl(string calldata rpcAlias) external view returns (string memory json);
 1639 | 
 1640 |     /// Returns all rpc urls and their aliases as structs.
 1641 |     function rpcUrlStructs() external view returns (Rpc[] memory urls);
 1642 | 
 1643 |     /// Returns all rpc urls and their aliases `[alias, url][]`.
 1644 |     function rpcUrls() external view returns (string[2][] memory urls);
 1645 | 
 1646 |     /// Suspends execution of the main thread for `duration` milliseconds.
 1647 |     function sleep(uint256 duration) external;
 1648 | 
 1649 |     // ======== Toml ========
 1650 | 
 1651 |     /// Checks if `key` exists in a TOML table.
 1652 |     function keyExistsToml(string calldata toml, string calldata key) external view returns (bool);
 1653 | 
 1654 |     /// Parses a string of TOML data at `key` and coerces it to `address`.
 1655 |     function parseTomlAddress(string calldata toml, string calldata key) external pure returns (address);
 1656 | 
 1657 |     /// Parses a string of TOML data at `key` and coerces it to `address[]`.
 1658 |     function parseTomlAddressArray(string calldata toml, string calldata key)
 1659 |         external
 1660 |         pure
 1661 |         returns (address[] memory);
 1662 | 
 1663 |     /// Parses a string of TOML data at `key` and coerces it to `bool`.
 1664 |     function parseTomlBool(string calldata toml, string calldata key) external pure returns (bool);
 1665 | 
 1666 |     /// Parses a string of TOML data at `key` and coerces it to `bool[]`.
 1667 |     function parseTomlBoolArray(string calldata toml, string calldata key) external pure returns (bool[] memory);
 1668 | 
 1669 |     /// Parses a string of TOML data at `key` and coerces it to `bytes`.
 1670 |     function parseTomlBytes(string calldata toml, string calldata key) external pure returns (bytes memory);
 1671 | 
 1672 |     /// Parses a string of TOML data at `key` and coerces it to `bytes32`.
 1673 |     function parseTomlBytes32(string calldata toml, string calldata key) external pure returns (bytes32);
 1674 | 
 1675 |     /// Parses a string of TOML data at `key` and coerces it to `bytes32[]`.
 1676 |     function parseTomlBytes32Array(string calldata toml, string calldata key)
 1677 |         external
 1678 |         pure
 1679 |         returns (bytes32[] memory);
 1680 | 
 1681 |     /// Parses a string of TOML data at `key` and coerces it to `bytes[]`.
 1682 |     function parseTomlBytesArray(string calldata toml, string calldata key) external pure returns (bytes[] memory);
 1683 | 
 1684 |     /// Parses a string of TOML data at `key` and coerces it to `int256`.
 1685 |     function parseTomlInt(string calldata toml, string calldata key) external pure returns (int256);
 1686 | 
 1687 |     /// Parses a string of TOML data at `key` and coerces it to `int256[]`.
 1688 |     function parseTomlIntArray(string calldata toml, string calldata key) external pure returns (int256[] memory);
 1689 | 
 1690 |     /// Returns an array of all the keys in a TOML table.
 1691 |     function parseTomlKeys(string calldata toml, string calldata key) external pure returns (string[] memory keys);
 1692 | 
 1693 |     /// Parses a string of TOML data at `key` and coerces it to `string`.
 1694 |     function parseTomlString(string calldata toml, string calldata key) external pure returns (string memory);
 1695 | 
 1696 |     /// Parses a string of TOML data at `key` and coerces it to `string[]`.
 1697 |     function parseTomlStringArray(string calldata toml, string calldata key) external pure returns (string[] memory);
 1698 | 
 1699 |     /// Parses a string of TOML data at `key` and coerces it to `uint256`.
 1700 |     function parseTomlUint(string calldata toml, string calldata key) external pure returns (uint256);
 1701 | 
 1702 |     /// Parses a string of TOML data at `key` and coerces it to `uint256[]`.
 1703 |     function parseTomlUintArray(string calldata toml, string calldata key) external pure returns (uint256[] memory);
 1704 | 
 1705 |     /// ABI-encodes a TOML table.
 1706 |     function parseToml(string calldata toml) external pure returns (bytes memory abiEncodedData);
 1707 | 
 1708 |     /// ABI-encodes a TOML table at `key`.
 1709 |     function parseToml(string calldata toml, string calldata key) external pure returns (bytes memory abiEncodedData);
 1710 | 
 1711 |     /// Takes serialized JSON, converts to TOML and write a serialized TOML to a file.
 1712 |     function writeToml(string calldata json, string calldata path) external;
 1713 | 
 1714 |     /// Takes serialized JSON, converts to TOML and write a serialized TOML table to an **existing** TOML file, replacing a value with key = <value_key.>
 1715 |     /// This is useful to replace a specific value of a TOML file, without having to parse the entire thing.
 1716 |     function writeToml(string calldata json, string calldata path, string calldata valueKey) external;
 1717 | 
 1718 |     // ======== Utilities ========
 1719 | 
 1720 |     /// Compute the address of a contract created with CREATE2 using the given CREATE2 deployer.
 1721 |     function computeCreate2Address(bytes32 salt, bytes32 initCodeHash, address deployer)
 1722 |         external
 1723 |         pure
 1724 |         returns (address);
 1725 | 
 1726 |     /// Compute the address of a contract created with CREATE2 using the default CREATE2 deployer.
 1727 |     function computeCreate2Address(bytes32 salt, bytes32 initCodeHash) external pure returns (address);
 1728 | 
 1729 |     /// Compute the address a contract will be deployed at for a given deployer address and nonce.
 1730 |     function computeCreateAddress(address deployer, uint256 nonce) external pure returns (address);
 1731 | 
 1732 |     /// Utility cheatcode to copy storage of `from` contract to another `to` contract.
 1733 |     function copyStorage(address from, address to) external;
 1734 | 
 1735 |     /// Returns ENS namehash for provided string.
 1736 |     function ensNamehash(string calldata name) external pure returns (bytes32);
 1737 | 
 1738 |     /// Gets the label for the specified address.
 1739 |     function getLabel(address account) external view returns (string memory currentLabel);
 1740 | 
 1741 |     /// Labels an address in call traces.
 1742 |     function label(address account, string calldata newLabel) external;
 1743 | 
 1744 |     /// Pauses collection of call traces. Useful in cases when you want to skip tracing of
 1745 |     /// complex calls which are not useful for debugging.
 1746 |     function pauseTracing() external view;
 1747 | 
 1748 |     /// Returns a random `address`.
 1749 |     function randomAddress() external returns (address);
 1750 | 
 1751 |     /// Returns a random uint256 value.
 1752 |     function randomUint() external returns (uint256);
 1753 | 
 1754 |     /// Returns random uin256 value between the provided range (=min..=max).
 1755 |     function randomUint(uint256 min, uint256 max) external returns (uint256);
 1756 | 
 1757 |     /// Unpauses collection of call traces.
 1758 |     function resumeTracing() external view;
 1759 | 
 1760 |     /// Utility cheatcode to set arbitrary storage for given target address.
 1761 |     function setArbitraryStorage(address target) external;
 1762 | 
 1763 |     /// Encodes a `bytes` value to a base64url string.
 1764 |     function toBase64URL(bytes calldata data) external pure returns (string memory);
 1765 | 
 1766 |     /// Encodes a `string` value to a base64url string.
 1767 |     function toBase64URL(string calldata data) external pure returns (string memory);
 1768 | 
 1769 |     /// Encodes a `bytes` value to a base64 string.
 1770 |     function toBase64(bytes calldata data) external pure returns (string memory);
 1771 | 
 1772 |     /// Encodes a `string` value to a base64 string.
 1773 |     function toBase64(string calldata data) external pure returns (string memory);
 1774 | }
 1775 | 
 1776 | /// The `Vm` interface does allow manipulation of the EVM state. These are all intended to be used
 1777 | /// in tests, but it is not recommended to use these cheats in scripts.
 1778 | interface Vm is VmSafe {
 1779 |     // ======== EVM ========
 1780 | 
 1781 |     /// Returns the identifier of the currently active fork. Reverts if no fork is currently active.
 1782 |     function activeFork() external view returns (uint256 forkId);
 1783 | 
 1784 |     /// In forking mode, explicitly grant the given address cheatcode access.
 1785 |     function allowCheatcodes(address account) external;
 1786 | 
 1787 |     /// Sets `block.blobbasefee`
 1788 |     function blobBaseFee(uint256 newBlobBaseFee) external;
 1789 | 
 1790 |     /// Sets the blobhashes in the transaction.
 1791 |     /// Not available on EVM versions before Cancun.
 1792 |     /// If used on unsupported EVM versions it will revert.
 1793 |     function blobhashes(bytes32[] calldata hashes) external;
 1794 | 
 1795 |     /// Sets `block.chainid`.
 1796 |     function chainId(uint256 newChainId) external;
 1797 | 
 1798 |     /// Clears all mocked calls.
 1799 |     function clearMockedCalls() external;
 1800 | 
 1801 |     /// Sets `block.coinbase`.
 1802 |     function coinbase(address newCoinbase) external;
 1803 | 
 1804 |     /// Creates a new fork with the given endpoint and the _latest_ block and returns the identifier of the fork.
 1805 |     function createFork(string calldata urlOrAlias) external returns (uint256 forkId);
 1806 | 
 1807 |     /// Creates a new fork with the given endpoint and block and returns the identifier of the fork.
 1808 |     function createFork(string calldata urlOrAlias, uint256 blockNumber) external returns (uint256 forkId);
 1809 | 
 1810 |     /// Creates a new fork with the given endpoint and at the block the given transaction was mined in,
 1811 |     /// replays all transaction mined in the block before the transaction, and returns the identifier of the fork.
 1812 |     function createFork(string calldata urlOrAlias, bytes32 txHash) external returns (uint256 forkId);
 1813 | 
 1814 |     /// Creates and also selects a new fork with the given endpoint and the latest block and returns the identifier of the fork.
 1815 |     function createSelectFork(string calldata urlOrAlias) external returns (uint256 forkId);
 1816 | 
 1817 |     /// Creates and also selects a new fork with the given endpoint and block and returns the identifier of the fork.
 1818 |     function createSelectFork(string calldata urlOrAlias, uint256 blockNumber) external returns (uint256 forkId);
 1819 | 
 1820 |     /// Creates and also selects new fork with the given endpoint and at the block the given transaction was mined in,
 1821 |     /// replays all transaction mined in the block before the transaction, returns the identifier of the fork.
 1822 |     function createSelectFork(string calldata urlOrAlias, bytes32 txHash) external returns (uint256 forkId);
 1823 | 
 1824 |     /// Sets an address' balance.
 1825 |     function deal(address account, uint256 newBalance) external;
 1826 | 
 1827 |     /// Removes the snapshot with the given ID created by `snapshot`.
 1828 |     /// Takes the snapshot ID to delete.
 1829 |     /// Returns `true` if the snapshot was successfully deleted.
 1830 |     /// Returns `false` if the snapshot does not exist.
 1831 |     function deleteSnapshot(uint256 snapshotId) external returns (bool success);
 1832 | 
 1833 |     /// Removes _all_ snapshots previously created by `snapshot`.
 1834 |     function deleteSnapshots() external;
 1835 | 
 1836 |     /// Sets `block.difficulty`.
 1837 |     /// Not available on EVM versions from Paris onwards. Use `prevrandao` instead.
 1838 |     /// Reverts if used on unsupported EVM versions.
 1839 |     function difficulty(uint256 newDifficulty) external;
 1840 | 
 1841 |     /// Dump a genesis JSON file's `allocs` to disk.
 1842 |     function dumpState(string calldata pathToStateJson) external;
 1843 | 
 1844 |     /// Sets an address' code.
 1845 |     function etch(address target, bytes calldata newRuntimeBytecode) external;
 1846 | 
 1847 |     /// Sets `block.basefee`.
 1848 |     function fee(uint256 newBasefee) external;
 1849 | 
 1850 |     /// Gets the blockhashes from the current transaction.
 1851 |     /// Not available on EVM versions before Cancun.
 1852 |     /// If used on unsupported EVM versions it will revert.
 1853 |     function getBlobhashes() external view returns (bytes32[] memory hashes);
 1854 | 
 1855 |     /// Returns true if the account is marked as persistent.
 1856 |     function isPersistent(address account) external view returns (bool persistent);
 1857 | 
 1858 |     /// Load a genesis JSON file's `allocs` into the in-memory revm state.
 1859 |     function loadAllocs(string calldata pathToAllocsJson) external;
 1860 | 
 1861 |     /// Marks that the account(s) should use persistent storage across fork swaps in a multifork setup
 1862 |     /// Meaning, changes made to the state of this account will be kept when switching forks.
 1863 |     function makePersistent(address account) external;
 1864 | 
 1865 |     /// See `makePersistent(address)`.
 1866 |     function makePersistent(address account0, address account1) external;
 1867 | 
 1868 |     /// See `makePersistent(address)`.
 1869 |     function makePersistent(address account0, address account1, address account2) external;
 1870 | 
 1871 |     /// See `makePersistent(address)`.
 1872 |     function makePersistent(address[] calldata accounts) external;
 1873 | 
 1874 |     /// Reverts a call to an address with specified revert data.
 1875 |     function mockCallRevert(address callee, bytes calldata data, bytes calldata revertData) external;
 1876 | 
 1877 |     /// Reverts a call to an address with a specific `msg.value`, with specified revert data.
 1878 |     function mockCallRevert(address callee, uint256 msgValue, bytes calldata data, bytes calldata revertData)
 1879 |         external;
 1880 | 
 1881 |     /// Mocks a call to an address, returning specified data.
 1882 |     /// Calldata can either be strict or a partial match, e.g. if you only
 1883 |     /// pass a Solidity selector to the expected calldata, then the entire Solidity
 1884 |     /// function will be mocked.
 1885 |     function mockCall(address callee, bytes calldata data, bytes calldata returnData) external;
 1886 | 
 1887 |     /// Mocks a call to an address with a specific `msg.value`, returning specified data.
 1888 |     /// Calldata match takes precedence over `msg.value` in case of ambiguity.
 1889 |     function mockCall(address callee, uint256 msgValue, bytes calldata data, bytes calldata returnData) external;
 1890 | 
 1891 |     /// Whenever a call is made to `callee` with calldata `data`, this cheatcode instead calls
 1892 |     /// `target` with the same calldata. This functionality is similar to a delegate call made to
 1893 |     /// `target` contract from `callee`.
 1894 |     /// Can be used to substitute a call to a function with another implementation that captures
 1895 |     /// the primary logic of the original function but is easier to reason about.
 1896 |     /// If calldata is not a strict match then partial match by selector is attempted.
 1897 |     function mockFunction(address callee, address target, bytes calldata data) external;
 1898 | 
 1899 |     /// Sets the *next* call's `msg.sender` to be the input address.
 1900 |     function prank(address msgSender) external;
 1901 | 
 1902 |     /// Sets the *next* call's `msg.sender` to be the input address, and the `tx.origin` to be the second input.
 1903 |     function prank(address msgSender, address txOrigin) external;
 1904 | 
 1905 |     /// Sets `block.prevrandao`.
 1906 |     /// Not available on EVM versions before Paris. Use `difficulty` instead.
 1907 |     /// If used on unsupported EVM versions it will revert.
 1908 |     function prevrandao(bytes32 newPrevrandao) external;
 1909 | 
 1910 |     /// Sets `block.prevrandao`.
 1911 |     /// Not available on EVM versions before Paris. Use `difficulty` instead.
 1912 |     /// If used on unsupported EVM versions it will revert.
 1913 |     function prevrandao(uint256 newPrevrandao) external;
 1914 | 
 1915 |     /// Reads the current `msg.sender` and `tx.origin` from state and reports if there is any active caller modification.
 1916 |     function readCallers() external returns (CallerMode callerMode, address msgSender, address txOrigin);
 1917 | 
 1918 |     /// Resets the nonce of an account to 0 for EOAs and 1 for contract accounts.
 1919 |     function resetNonce(address account) external;
 1920 | 
 1921 |     /// Revert the state of the EVM to a previous snapshot
 1922 |     /// Takes the snapshot ID to revert to.
 1923 |     /// Returns `true` if the snapshot was successfully reverted.
 1924 |     /// Returns `false` if the snapshot does not exist.
 1925 |     /// **Note:** This does not automatically delete the snapshot. To delete the snapshot use `deleteSnapshot`.
 1926 |     function revertTo(uint256 snapshotId) external returns (bool success);
 1927 | 
 1928 |     /// Revert the state of the EVM to a previous snapshot and automatically deletes the snapshots
 1929 |     /// Takes the snapshot ID to revert to.
 1930 |     /// Returns `true` if the snapshot was successfully reverted and deleted.
 1931 |     /// Returns `false` if the snapshot does not exist.
 1932 |     function revertToAndDelete(uint256 snapshotId) external returns (bool success);
 1933 | 
 1934 |     /// Revokes persistent status from the address, previously added via `makePersistent`.
 1935 |     function revokePersistent(address account) external;
 1936 | 
 1937 |     /// See `revokePersistent(address)`.
 1938 |     function revokePersistent(address[] calldata accounts) external;
 1939 | 
 1940 |     /// Sets `block.height`.
 1941 |     function roll(uint256 newHeight) external;
 1942 | 
 1943 |     /// Updates the currently active fork to given block number
 1944 |     /// This is similar to `roll` but for the currently active fork.
 1945 |     function rollFork(uint256 blockNumber) external;
 1946 | 
 1947 |     /// Updates the currently active fork to given transaction. This will `rollFork` with the number
 1948 |     /// of the block the transaction was mined in and replays all transaction mined before it in the block.
 1949 |     function rollFork(bytes32 txHash) external;
 1950 | 
 1951 |     /// Updates the given fork to given block number.
 1952 |     function rollFork(uint256 forkId, uint256 blockNumber) external;
 1953 | 
 1954 |     /// Updates the given fork to block number of the given transaction and replays all transaction mined before it in the block.
 1955 |     function rollFork(uint256 forkId, bytes32 txHash) external;
 1956 | 
 1957 |     /// Takes a fork identifier created by `createFork` and sets the corresponding forked state as active.
 1958 |     function selectFork(uint256 forkId) external;
 1959 | 
 1960 |     /// Set blockhash for the current block.
 1961 |     /// It only sets the blockhash for blocks where `block.number - 256 <= number < block.number`.
 1962 |     function setBlockhash(uint256 blockNumber, bytes32 blockHash) external;
 1963 | 
 1964 |     /// Sets the nonce of an account. Must be higher than the current nonce of the account.
 1965 |     function setNonce(address account, uint64 newNonce) external;
 1966 | 
 1967 |     /// Sets the nonce of an account to an arbitrary value.
 1968 |     function setNonceUnsafe(address account, uint64 newNonce) external;
 1969 | 
 1970 |     /// Snapshot the current state of the evm.
 1971 |     /// Returns the ID of the snapshot that was created.
 1972 |     /// To revert a snapshot use `revertTo`.
 1973 |     function snapshot() external returns (uint256 snapshotId);
 1974 | 
 1975 |     /// Sets all subsequent calls' `msg.sender` to be the input address until `stopPrank` is called.
 1976 |     function startPrank(address msgSender) external;
 1977 | 
 1978 |     /// Sets all subsequent calls' `msg.sender` to be the input address until `stopPrank` is called, and the `tx.origin` to be the second input.
 1979 |     function startPrank(address msgSender, address txOrigin) external;
 1980 | 
 1981 |     /// Resets subsequent calls' `msg.sender` to be `address(this)`.
 1982 |     function stopPrank() external;
 1983 | 
 1984 |     /// Stores a value to an address' storage slot.
 1985 |     function store(address target, bytes32 slot, bytes32 value) external;
 1986 | 
 1987 |     /// Fetches the given transaction from the active fork and executes it on the current state.
 1988 |     function transact(bytes32 txHash) external;
 1989 | 
 1990 |     /// Fetches the given transaction from the given fork and executes it on the current state.
 1991 |     function transact(uint256 forkId, bytes32 txHash) external;
 1992 | 
 1993 |     /// Sets `tx.gasprice`.
 1994 |     function txGasPrice(uint256 newGasPrice) external;
 1995 | 
 1996 |     /// Sets `block.timestamp`.
 1997 |     function warp(uint256 newTimestamp) external;
 1998 | 
 1999 |     // ======== Testing ========
 2000 | 
 2001 |     /// Expect a call to an address with the specified `msg.value` and calldata, and a *minimum* amount of gas.
 2002 |     function expectCallMinGas(address callee, uint256 msgValue, uint64 minGas, bytes calldata data) external;
 2003 | 
 2004 |     /// Expect given number of calls to an address with the specified `msg.value` and calldata, and a *minimum* amount of gas.
 2005 |     function expectCallMinGas(address callee, uint256 msgValue, uint64 minGas, bytes calldata data, uint64 count)
 2006 |         external;
 2007 | 
 2008 |     /// Expects a call to an address with the specified calldata.
 2009 |     /// Calldata can either be a strict or a partial match.
 2010 |     function expectCall(address callee, bytes calldata data) external;
 2011 | 
 2012 |     /// Expects given number of calls to an address with the specified calldata.
 2013 |     function expectCall(address callee, bytes calldata data, uint64 count) external;
 2014 | 
 2015 |     /// Expects a call to an address with the specified `msg.value` and calldata.
 2016 |     function expectCall(address callee, uint256 msgValue, bytes calldata data) external;
 2017 | 
 2018 |     /// Expects given number of calls to an address with the specified `msg.value` and calldata.
 2019 |     function expectCall(address callee, uint256 msgValue, bytes calldata data, uint64 count) external;
 2020 | 
 2021 |     /// Expect a call to an address with the specified `msg.value`, gas, and calldata.
 2022 |     function expectCall(address callee, uint256 msgValue, uint64 gas, bytes calldata data) external;
 2023 | 
 2024 |     /// Expects given number of calls to an address with the specified `msg.value`, gas, and calldata.
 2025 |     function expectCall(address callee, uint256 msgValue, uint64 gas, bytes calldata data, uint64 count) external;
 2026 | 
 2027 |     /// Prepare an expected anonymous log with (bool checkTopic1, bool checkTopic2, bool checkTopic3, bool checkData.).
 2028 |     /// Call this function, then emit an anonymous event, then call a function. Internally after the call, we check if
 2029 |     /// logs were emitted in the expected order with the expected topics and data (as specified by the booleans).
 2030 |     function expectEmitAnonymous(bool checkTopic0, bool checkTopic1, bool checkTopic2, bool checkTopic3, bool checkData)
 2031 |         external;
 2032 | 
 2033 |     /// Same as the previous method, but also checks supplied address against emitting contract.
 2034 |     function expectEmitAnonymous(
 2035 |         bool checkTopic0,
 2036 |         bool checkTopic1,
 2037 |         bool checkTopic2,
 2038 |         bool checkTopic3,
 2039 |         bool checkData,
 2040 |         address emitter
 2041 |     ) external;
 2042 | 
 2043 |     /// Prepare an expected anonymous log with all topic and data checks enabled.
 2044 |     /// Call this function, then emit an anonymous event, then call a function. Internally after the call, we check if
 2045 |     /// logs were emitted in the expected order with the expected topics and data.
 2046 |     function expectEmitAnonymous() external;
 2047 | 
 2048 |     /// Same as the previous method, but also checks supplied address against emitting contract.
 2049 |     function expectEmitAnonymous(address emitter) external;
 2050 | 
 2051 |     /// Prepare an expected log with (bool checkTopic1, bool checkTopic2, bool checkTopic3, bool checkData.).
 2052 |     /// Call this function, then emit an event, then call a function. Internally after the call, we check if
 2053 |     /// logs were emitted in the expected order with the expected topics and data (as specified by the booleans).
 2054 |     function expectEmit(bool checkTopic1, bool checkTopic2, bool checkTopic3, bool checkData) external;
 2055 | 
 2056 |     /// Same as the previous method, but also checks supplied address against emitting contract.
 2057 |     function expectEmit(bool checkTopic1, bool checkTopic2, bool checkTopic3, bool checkData, address emitter)
 2058 |         external;
 2059 | 
 2060 |     /// Prepare an expected log with all topic and data checks enabled.
 2061 |     /// Call this function, then emit an event, then call a function. Internally after the call, we check if
 2062 |     /// logs were emitted in the expected order with the expected topics and data.
 2063 |     function expectEmit() external;
 2064 | 
 2065 |     /// Same as the previous method, but also checks supplied address against emitting contract.
 2066 |     function expectEmit(address emitter) external;
 2067 | 
 2068 |     /// Expects an error on next call that starts with the revert data.
 2069 |     function expectPartialRevert(bytes4 revertData) external;
 2070 | 
 2071 |     /// Expects an error on next call with any revert data.
 2072 |     function expectRevert() external;
 2073 | 
 2074 |     /// Expects an error on next call that exactly matches the revert data.
 2075 |     function expectRevert(bytes4 revertData) external;
 2076 | 
 2077 |     /// Expects an error on next call that exactly matches the revert data.
 2078 |     function expectRevert(bytes calldata revertData) external;
 2079 | 
 2080 |     /// Only allows memory writes to offsets [0x00, 0x60) ∪ [min, max) in the current subcontext. If any other
 2081 |     /// memory is written to, the test will fail. Can be called multiple times to add more ranges to the set.
 2082 |     function expectSafeMemory(uint64 min, uint64 max) external;
 2083 | 
 2084 |     /// Only allows memory writes to offsets [0x00, 0x60) ∪ [min, max) in the next created subcontext.
 2085 |     /// If any other memory is written to, the test will fail. Can be called multiple times to add more ranges
 2086 |     /// to the set.
 2087 |     function expectSafeMemoryCall(uint64 min, uint64 max) external;
 2088 | 
 2089 |     /// Marks a test as skipped. Must be called at the top of the test.
 2090 |     function skip(bool skipTest) external;
 2091 | 
 2092 |     /// Stops all safe memory expectation in the current subcontext.
 2093 |     function stopExpectSafeMemory() external;
 2094 | }
 2095 | 
 2096 | // lib/forge-std/src/console.sol
 2097 | 
 2098 | library console {
 2099 |     address constant CONSOLE_ADDRESS = address(0x000000000000000000636F6e736F6c652e6c6f67);
 2100 | 
 2101 |     function _castLogPayloadViewToPure(
 2102 |         function(bytes memory) internal view fnIn
 2103 |     ) internal pure returns (function(bytes memory) internal pure fnOut) {
 2104 |         assembly {
 2105 |             fnOut := fnIn
 2106 |         }
 2107 |     }
 2108 | 
 2109 |     function _sendLogPayload(bytes memory payload) internal pure {
 2110 |         _castLogPayloadViewToPure(_sendLogPayloadView)(payload);
 2111 |     }
 2112 | 
 2113 |     function _sendLogPayloadView(bytes memory payload) private view {
 2114 |         uint256 payloadLength = payload.length;
 2115 |         address consoleAddress = CONSOLE_ADDRESS;
 2116 |         /// @solidity memory-safe-assembly
 2117 |         assembly {
 2118 |             let payloadStart := add(payload, 32)
 2119 |             let r := staticcall(gas(), consoleAddress, payloadStart, payloadLength, 0, 0)
 2120 |         }
 2121 |     }
 2122 | 
 2123 |     function log() internal pure {
 2124 |         _sendLogPayload(abi.encodeWithSignature("log()"));
 2125 |     }
 2126 | 
 2127 |     function logInt(int p0) internal pure {

 2129 |     }

 2577 |     }
 2578 | 
 2579 |     function log(address p0, string memory p1, string memory p2) internal pure {

 2990 | 
 2991 |     function log(string memory p0, string memory p1, address p2, uint p3) internal pure {

 3648 | // lib/forge-std/src/interfaces/IERC165.sol
 3649 | 
 3650 | interface IERC165_0 {
 3651 |     /// @notice Query if a contract implements an interface
 3652 |     /// @param interfaceID The interface identifier, as specified in ERC-165
 3653 |     /// @dev Interface identification is specified in ERC-165. This function
 3654 |     /// uses less than 30,000 gas.
 3655 |     /// @return `true` if the contract implements `interfaceID` and
 3656 |     /// `interfaceID` is not 0xffffffff, `false` otherwise
 3657 |     function supportsInterface(bytes4 interfaceID) external view returns (bool);
 3658 | }
 3659 | 
 3660 | // lib/forge-std/src/interfaces/IERC20.sol
 3661 | 
 3662 | /// @dev Interface of the ERC20 standard as defined in the EIP.
 3663 | /// @dev This includes the optional name, symbol, and decimals metadata.
 3664 | interface IERC20 {
 3665 |     /// @dev Emitted when `value` tokens are moved from one account (`from`) to another (`to`).
 3666 |     event Transfer(address indexed from, address indexed to, uint256 value);
 3667 | 
 3668 |     /// @dev Emitted when the allowance of a `spender` for an `owner` is set, where `value`
 3669 |     /// is the new allowance.
 3670 |     event Approval(address indexed owner, address indexed spender, uint256 value);
 3671 | 
 3672 |     /// @notice Returns the amount of tokens in existence.
 3673 |     function totalSupply() external view returns (uint256);
 3674 | 
 3675 |     /// @notice Returns the amount of tokens owned by `account`.
 3676 |     function balanceOf(address account) external view returns (uint256);
 3677 | 
 3678 |     /// @notice Moves `amount` tokens from the caller's account to `to`.
 3679 |     function transfer(address to, uint256 amount) external returns (bool);
 3680 | 
 3681 |     /// @notice Returns the remaining number of tokens that `spender` is allowed
 3682 |     /// to spend on behalf of `owner`
 3683 |     function allowance(address owner, address spender) external view returns (uint256);
 3684 | 
 3685 |     /// @notice Sets `amount` as the allowance of `spender` over the caller's tokens.
 3686 |     /// @dev Be aware of front-running risks: https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/issues/20#issuecomment-263524729
 3687 |     function approve(address spender, uint256 amount) external returns (bool);
 3688 | 
 3689 |     /// @notice Moves `amount` tokens from `from` to `to` using the allowance mechanism.
 3690 |     /// `amount` is then deducted from the caller's allowance.
 3691 |     function transferFrom(address from, address to, uint256 amount) external returns (bool);
 3692 | 
 3693 |     /// @notice Returns the name of the token.
 3694 |     function name() external view returns (string memory);
 3695 | 
 3696 |     /// @notice Returns the symbol of the token.
 3697 |     function symbol() external view returns (string memory);
 3698 | 
 3699 |     /// @notice Returns the decimals places of the token.
 3700 |     function decimals() external view returns (uint8);
 3701 | }
 3702 | 
 3703 | // lib/forge-std/src/interfaces/IMulticall3.sol
 3704 | 
 3705 | interface IMulticall3 {
 3706 |     struct Call {
 3707 |         address target;
 3708 |         bytes callData;
 3709 |     }
 3710 | 
 3711 |     struct Call3 {
 3712 |         address target;
 3713 |         bool allowFailure;
 3714 |         bytes callData;
 3715 |     }
 3716 | 
 3717 |     struct Call3Value {
 3718 |         address target;
 3719 |         bool allowFailure;
 3720 |         uint256 value;
 3721 |         bytes callData;
 3722 |     }
 3723 | 
 3724 |     struct Result {
 3725 |         bool success;
 3726 |         bytes returnData;
 3727 |     }
 3728 | 
 3729 |     function aggregate(Call[] calldata calls)
 3730 |         external
 3731 |         payable
 3732 |         returns (uint256 blockNumber, bytes[] memory returnData);
 3733 | 
 3734 |     function aggregate3(Call3[] calldata calls) external payable returns (Result[] memory returnData);
 3735 | 
 3736 |     function aggregate3Value(Call3Value[] calldata calls) external payable returns (Result[] memory returnData);
 3737 | 
 3738 |     function blockAndAggregate(Call[] calldata calls)
 3739 |         external
 3740 |         payable
 3741 |         returns (uint256 blockNumber, bytes32 blockHash, Result[] memory returnData);
 3742 | 
 3743 |     function getBasefee() external view returns (uint256 basefee);
 3744 | 
 3745 |     function getBlockHash(uint256 blockNumber) external view returns (bytes32 blockHash);
 3746 | 
 3747 |     function getBlockNumber() external view returns (uint256 blockNumber);
 3748 | 
 3749 |     function getChainId() external view returns (uint256 chainid);
 3750 | 
 3751 |     function getCurrentBlockCoinbase() external view returns (address coinbase);
 3752 | 
 3753 |     function getCurrentBlockDifficulty() external view returns (uint256 difficulty);
 3754 | 
 3755 |     function getCurrentBlockGasLimit() external view returns (uint256 gaslimit);
 3756 | 
 3757 |     function getCurrentBlockTimestamp() external view returns (uint256 timestamp);
 3758 | 
 3759 |     function getEthBalance(address addr) external view returns (uint256 balance);
 3760 | 
 3761 |     function getLastBlockHash() external view returns (bytes32 blockHash);
 3762 | 
 3763 |     function tryAggregate(bool requireSuccess, Call[] calldata calls)
 3764 |         external
 3765 |         payable
 3766 |         returns (Result[] memory returnData);
 3767 | 
 3768 |     function tryBlockAndAggregate(bool requireSuccess, Call[] calldata calls)
 3769 |         external
 3770 |         payable
 3771 |         returns (uint256 blockNumber, bytes32 blockHash, Result[] memory returnData);
 3772 | }
 3773 | 
 3774 | // lib/forge-std/src/safeconsole.sol
 3775 | 
 3776 | /// @author philogy <https://github.com/philogy>
 3777 | /// @dev Code generated automatically by script.
 3778 | library safeconsole {
 3779 |     uint256 constant CONSOLE_ADDR = 0x000000000000000000000000000000000000000000636F6e736F6c652e6c6f67;
 3780 | 
 3781 |     // Credit to [0age](https://twitter.com/z0age/status/1654922202930888704) and [0xdapper](https://github.com/foundry-rs/forge-std/pull/374)
 3782 |     // for the view-to-pure log trick.
 3783 |     function _sendLogPayload(uint256 offset, uint256 size) private pure {
 3784 |         function(uint256, uint256) internal view fnIn = _sendLogPayloadView;
 3785 |         function(uint256, uint256) internal pure pureSendLogPayload;
 3786 |         /// @solidity memory-safe-assembly
 3787 |         assembly {
 3788 |             pureSendLogPayload := fnIn
 3789 |         }
 3790 |         pureSendLogPayload(offset, size);
 3791 |     }
 3792 | 
 3793 |     function _sendLogPayloadView(uint256 offset, uint256 size) private view {
 3794 |         /// @solidity memory-safe-assembly
 3795 |         assembly {
 3796 |             pop(staticcall(gas(), CONSOLE_ADDR, offset, size, 0x0, 0x0))
 3797 |         }
 3798 |     }
 3799 | 
 3800 |     function _memcopy(uint256 fromOffset, uint256 toOffset, uint256 length) private pure {
 3801 |         function(uint256, uint256, uint256) internal view fnIn = _memcopyView;
 3802 |         function(uint256, uint256, uint256) internal pure pureMemcopy;
 3803 |         /// @solidity memory-safe-assembly
 3804 |         assembly {
 3805 |             pureMemcopy := fnIn
 3806 |         }
 3807 |         pureMemcopy(fromOffset, toOffset, length);
 3808 |     }
 3809 | 
 3810 |     function _memcopyView(uint256 fromOffset, uint256 toOffset, uint256 length) private view {
 3811 |         /// @solidity memory-safe-assembly
 3812 |         assembly {
 3813 |             pop(staticcall(gas(), 0x4, fromOffset, length, toOffset, length))
 3814 |         }
 3815 |     }
 3816 | 
 3817 |     function logMemory(uint256 offset, uint256 length) internal pure {
 3818 |         if (offset >= 0x60) {
 3819 |             // Sufficient memory before slice to prepare call header.
 3820 |             bytes32 m0;
 3821 |             bytes32 m1;
 3822 |             bytes32 m2;
 3823 |             /// @solidity memory-safe-assembly
 3824 |             assembly {
 3825 |                 m0 := mload(sub(offset, 0x60))
 3826 |                 m1 := mload(sub(offset, 0x40))
 3827 |                 m2 := mload(sub(offset, 0x20))
 3828 |                 // Selector of `log(bytes)`.
 3829 |                 mstore(sub(offset, 0x60), 0x0be77f56)
 3830 |                 mstore(sub(offset, 0x40), 0x20)
 3831 |                 mstore(sub(offset, 0x20), length)
 3832 |             }
 3833 |             _sendLogPayload(offset - 0x44, length + 0x44);
 3834 |             /// @solidity memory-safe-assembly
 3835 |             assembly {
 3836 |                 mstore(sub(offset, 0x60), m0)
 3837 |                 mstore(sub(offset, 0x40), m1)
 3838 |                 mstore(sub(offset, 0x20), m2)
 3839 |             }
 3840 |         } else {
 3841 |             // Insufficient space, so copy slice forward, add header and reverse.
 3842 |             bytes32 m0;
 3843 |             bytes32 m1;
 3844 |             bytes32 m2;
 3845 |             uint256 endOffset = offset + length;
 3846 |             /// @solidity memory-safe-assembly
 3847 |             assembly {
 3848 |                 m0 := mload(add(endOffset, 0x00))
 3849 |                 m1 := mload(add(endOffset, 0x20))
 3850 |                 m2 := mload(add(endOffset, 0x40))
 3851 |             }
 3852 |             _memcopy(offset, offset + 0x60, length);
 3853 |             /// @solidity memory-safe-assembly
 3854 |             assembly {
 3855 |                 // Selector of `log(bytes)`.
 3856 |                 mstore(add(offset, 0x00), 0x0be77f56)
 3857 |                 mstore(add(offset, 0x20), 0x20)
 3858 |                 mstore(add(offset, 0x40), length)
 3859 |             }
 3860 |             _sendLogPayload(offset + 0x1c, length + 0x44);
 3861 |             _memcopy(offset + 0x60, offset, length);
 3862 |             /// @solidity memory-safe-assembly
 3863 |             assembly {
 3864 |                 mstore(add(endOffset, 0x00), m0)
 3865 |                 mstore(add(endOffset, 0x20), m1)
 3866 |                 mstore(add(endOffset, 0x40), m2)
 3867 |             }
 3868 |         }
 3869 |     }
 3870 | 
 3871 |     function log(address p0) internal pure {

 3928 |     function log(bytes32 p0) internal pure {
 3929 |         bytes32 m0;
 3930 |         bytes32 m1;
 3931 |         bytes32 m2;
 3932 |         bytes32 m3;
 3933 |         /// @solidity memory-safe-assembly
 3934 |         assembly {
 3935 |             function writeString(pos, w) {
 3936 |                 let length := 0
 3937 |                 for {} lt(length, 0x20) { length := add(length, 1) } { if iszero(byte(length, w)) { break } }
 3938 |                 mstore(pos, length)
 3939 |                 let shift := sub(256, shl(3, length))
 3940 |                 mstore(add(pos, 0x20), shl(shift, shr(shift, w)))
 3941 |             }
 3942 |             m0 := mload(0x00)
 3943 |             m1 := mload(0x20)
 3944 |             m2 := mload(0x40)
 3945 |             m3 := mload(0x60)
 3946 |             // Selector of `log(string)`.
 3947 |             mstore(0x00, 0x41304fac)
 3948 |             mstore(0x20, 0x20)
 3949 |             writeString(0x40, p0)
 3950 |         }
 3951 |         _sendLogPayload(0x1c, 0x64);
 3952 |         /// @solidity memory-safe-assembly
 3953 |         assembly {
 3954 |             mstore(0x00, m0)
 3955 |             mstore(0x20, m1)
 3956 |             mstore(0x40, m2)
 3957 |             mstore(0x60, m3)
 3958 |         }
 3959 |     }

 4390 |     function log(bytes32 p0, bytes32 p1) internal pure {
 4391 |         bytes32 m0;
 4392 |         bytes32 m1;
 4393 |         bytes32 m2;
 4394 |         bytes32 m3;
 4395 |         bytes32 m4;
 4396 |         bytes32 m5;
 4397 |         bytes32 m6;
 4398 |         /// @solidity memory-safe-assembly
 4399 |         assembly {
 4400 |             function writeString(pos, w) {
 4401 |                 let length := 0
 4402 |                 for {} lt(length, 0x20) { length := add(length, 1) } { if iszero(byte(length, w)) { break } }
 4403 |                 mstore(pos, length)
 4404 |                 let shift := sub(256, shl(3, length))
 4405 |                 mstore(add(pos, 0x20), shl(shift, shr(shift, w)))
 4406 |             }
 4407 |             m0 := mload(0x00)
 4408 |             m1 := mload(0x20)
 4409 |             m2 := mload(0x40)
 4410 |             m3 := mload(0x60)
 4411 |             m4 := mload(0x80)
 4412 |             m5 := mload(0xa0)
 4413 |             m6 := mload(0xc0)
 4414 |             // Selector of `log(string,string)`.
 4415 |             mstore(0x00, 0x4b5c4277)

 4417 |             mstore(0x40, 0x80)
 4418 |             writeString(0x60, p0)
 4419 |             writeString(0xa0, p1)
 4420 |         }
 4421 |         _sendLogPayload(0x1c, 0xc4);
 4422 |         /// @solidity memory-safe-assembly
 4423 |         assembly {
 4424 |             mstore(0x00, m0)
 4425 |             mstore(0x20, m1)
 4426 |             mstore(0x40, m2)
 4427 |             mstore(0x60, m3)
 4428 |             mstore(0x80, m4)
 4429 |             mstore(0xa0, m5)
 4430 |             mstore(0xc0, m6)
 4431 |         }
 4432 |     }
 4433 | 
 4434 |     function log(address p0, address p1, address p2) internal pure {
 4435 |         bytes32 m0;
 4436 |         bytes32 m1;
 4437 |         bytes32 m2;
 4438 |         bytes32 m3;
 4439 |         /// @solidity memory-safe-assembly
 4440 |         assembly {
 4441 |             m0 := mload(0x00)
 4442 |             m1 := mload(0x20)
 4443 |             m2 := mload(0x40)
 4444 |             m3 := mload(0x60)
 4445 |             // Selector of `log(address,address,address)`.
 4446 |             mstore(0x00, 0x018c84c2)
 4447 |             mstore(0x20, p0)
 4448 |             mstore(0x40, p1)
 4449 |             mstore(0x60, p2)
 4450 |         }
 4451 |         _sendLogPayload(0x1c, 0x64);
 4452 |         /// @solidity memory-safe-assembly
 4453 |         assembly {
 4454 |             mstore(0x00, m0)
 4455 |             mstore(0x20, m1)
 4456 |             mstore(0x40, m2)
 4457 |             mstore(0x60, m3)
 4458 |         }
 4459 |     }

 4515 |     function log(address p0, address p1, bytes32 p2) internal pure {
 4516 |         bytes32 m0;
 4517 |         bytes32 m1;
 4518 |         bytes32 m2;
 4519 |         bytes32 m3;
 4520 |         bytes32 m4;
 4521 |         bytes32 m5;
 4522 |         /// @solidity memory-safe-assembly
 4523 |         assembly {
 4524 |             function writeString(pos, w) {
 4525 |                 let length := 0
 4526 |                 for {} lt(length, 0x20) { length := add(length, 1) } { if iszero(byte(length, w)) { break } }
 4527 |                 mstore(pos, length)
 4528 |                 let shift := sub(256, shl(3, length))
 4529 |                 mstore(add(pos, 0x20), shl(shift, shr(shift, w)))
 4530 |             }
 4531 |             m0 := mload(0x00)
 4532 |             m1 := mload(0x20)
 4533 |             m2 := mload(0x40)
 4534 |             m3 := mload(0x60)
 4535 |             m4 := mload(0x80)
 4536 |             m5 := mload(0xa0)
 4537 |             // Selector of `log(address,address,string)`.
 4538 |             mstore(0x00, 0x007150be)
 4539 |             mstore(0x20, p0)
 4540 |             mstore(0x40, p1)
 4541 |             mstore(0x60, 0x60)
 4542 |             writeString(0x80, p2)
 4543 |         }
 4544 |         _sendLogPayload(0x1c, 0xa4);
 4545 |         /// @solidity memory-safe-assembly
 4546 |         assembly {
 4547 |             mstore(0x00, m0)
 4548 |             mstore(0x20, m1)
 4549 |             mstore(0x40, m2)
 4550 |             mstore(0x60, m3)
 4551 |             mstore(0x80, m4)
 4552 |             mstore(0xa0, m5)
 4553 |         }
 4554 |     }

 4998 |     function log(bool p0, address p1, bool p2) internal pure {
 4999 |         bytes32 m0;
 5000 |         bytes32 m1;
 5001 |         bytes32 m2;
 5002 |         bytes32 m3;
 5003 |         /// @solidity memory-safe-assembly
 5004 |         assembly {
 5005 |             m0 := mload(0x00)
 5006 |             m1 := mload(0x20)
 5007 |             m2 := mload(0x40)

 5013 |             mstore(0x60, p2)
 5014 |         }

 5085 |             mstore(0x20, m1)

 5568 |         assembly {
 5569 |             m0 := mload(0x00)
 5570 |             m1 := mload(0x20)
 5571 |             m2 := mload(0x40)
 5572 |             m3 := mload(0x60)
 5573 |             // Selector of `log(uint256,address,uint256)`.
 5574 |             mstore(0x00, 0x5a9b5ed5)
 5575 |             mstore(0x20, p0)
 5576 |             mstore(0x40, p1)
 5577 |             mstore(0x60, p2)
 5578 |         }
 5579 |         _sendLogPayload(0x1c, 0x64);
 5580 |         /// @solidity memory-safe-assembly
 5581 |         assembly {
 5582 |             mstore(0x00, m0)
 5583 |             mstore(0x20, m1)

 5589 |     function log(uint256 p0, address p1, bytes32 p2) internal pure {
 5590 |         bytes32 m0;
 5591 |         bytes32 m1;
 5592 |         bytes32 m2;
 5593 |         bytes32 m3;
 5594 |         bytes32 m4;
 5595 |         bytes32 m5;
 5596 |         /// @solidity memory-safe-assembly
 5597 |         assembly {
 5598 |             function writeString(pos, w) {
 5599 |                 let length := 0
 5600 |                 for {} lt(length, 0x20) { length := add(length, 1) } { if iszero(byte(length, w)) { break } }
 5601 |                 mstore(pos, length)
 5602 |                 let shift := sub(256, shl(3, length))
 5603 |                 mstore(add(pos, 0x20), shl(shift, shr(shift, w)))
 5604 |             }
 5605 |             m0 := mload(0x00)
 5606 |             m1 := mload(0x20)
 5607 |             m2 := mload(0x40)
 5608 |             m3 := mload(0x60)
 5609 |             m4 := mload(0x80)
 5610 |             m5 := mload(0xa0)
 5611 |             // Selector of `log(uint256,address,string)`.
 5612 |             mstore(0x00, 0x63cb41f9)
 5613 |             mstore(0x20, p0)
 5614 |             mstore(0x40, p1)
 5615 |             mstore(0x60, 0x60)
 5616 |             writeString(0x80, p2)
 5617 |         }
 5618 |         _sendLogPayload(0x1c, 0xa4);

 5622 |             mstore(0x20, m1)

 5624 |             mstore(0x60, m3)

 6133 |         bytes32 m5;

 6135 |         assembly {
 6136 |             function writeString(pos, w) {
 6137 |                 let length := 0

 6139 |                 mstore(pos, length)

 6142 |             }

 6665 |             function writeString(pos, w) {
 6666 |                 let length := 0
 6667 |                 for {} lt(length, 0x20) { length := add(length, 1) } { if iszero(byte(length, w)) { break } }
 6668 |                 mstore(pos, length)
 6669 |                 let shift := sub(256, shl(3, length))
 6670 |                 mstore(add(pos, 0x20), shl(shift, shr(shift, w)))
 6671 |             }
 6672 |             m0 := mload(0x00)
 6673 |             m1 := mload(0x20)
 6674 |             m2 := mload(0x40)
 6675 |             m3 := mload(0x60)
 6676 |             m4 := mload(0x80)
 6677 |             m5 := mload(0xa0)
 6678 |             m6 := mload(0xc0)
 6679 |             m7 := mload(0xe0)
 6680 |             // Selector of `log(string,string,uint256)`.
 6681 |             mstore(0x00, 0x5821efa1)
 6682 |             mstore(0x20, 0x60)
 6683 |             mstore(0x40, 0xa0)
 6684 |             mstore(0x60, p2)
 6685 |             writeString(0x80, p0)
 6686 |             writeString(0xc0, p1)
 6687 |         }
 6688 |         _sendLogPayload(0x1c, 0xe4);
 6689 |         /// @solidity memory-safe-assembly
 6690 |         assembly {
 6691 |             mstore(0x00, m0)
 6692 |             mstore(0x20, m1)
 6693 |             mstore(0x40, m2)
 6694 |             mstore(0x60, m3)
 6695 |             mstore(0x80, m4)
 6696 |             mstore(0xa0, m5)
 6697 |             mstore(0xc0, m6)
 6698 |             mstore(0xe0, m7)
 6699 |         }
 6700 |     }

 6702 |     function log(bytes32 p0, bytes32 p1, bytes32 p2) internal pure {
 6703 |         bytes32 m0;
 6704 |         bytes32 m1;
 6705 |         bytes32 m2;
 6706 |         bytes32 m3;
 6707 |         bytes32 m4;
 6708 |         bytes32 m5;
 6709 |         bytes32 m6;
 6710 |         bytes32 m7;
 6711 |         bytes32 m8;
 6712 |         bytes32 m9;
 6713 |         /// @solidity memory-safe-assembly
 6714 |         assembly {
 6715 |             function writeString(pos, w) {
 6716 |                 let length := 0
 6717 |                 for {} lt(length, 0x20) { length := add(length, 1) } { if iszero(byte(length, w)) { break } }
 6718 |                 mstore(pos, length)
 6719 |                 let shift := sub(256, shl(3, length))
 6720 |                 mstore(add(pos, 0x20), shl(shift, shr(shift, w)))
 6721 |             }

 6723 |             m1 := mload(0x20)
 6724 |             m2 := mload(0x40)

 6731 |             m9 := mload(0x120)

 6753 |             mstore(0x120, m9)

 7216 |     function log(address p0, address p1, bytes32 p2, bool p3) internal pure {
 7217 |         bytes32 m0;

 7219 |         bytes32 m2;
 7220 |         bytes32 m3;
 7221 |         bytes32 m4;
 7222 |         bytes32 m5;
 7223 |         bytes32 m6;
 7224 |         /// @solidity memory-safe-assembly
 7225 |         assembly {
 7226 |             function writeString(pos, w) {
 7227 |                 let length := 0
 7228 |                 for {} lt(length, 0x20) { length := add(length, 1) } { if iszero(byte(length, w)) { break } }
 7229 |                 mstore(pos, length)
 7230 |                 let shift := sub(256, shl(3, length))
 7231 |                 mstore(add(pos, 0x20), shl(shift, shr(shift, w)))
 7232 |             }
 7233 |             m0 := mload(0x00)
 7234 |             m1 := mload(0x20)
 7235 |             m2 := mload(0x40)
 7236 |             m3 := mload(0x60)
 7237 |             m4 := mload(0x80)
 7238 |             m5 := mload(0xa0)
 7239 |             m6 := mload(0xc0)
 7240 |             // Selector of `log(address,address,string,bool)`.
 7241 |             mstore(0x00, 0x6f1a594e)
 7242 |             mstore(0x20, p0)
 7243 |             mstore(0x40, p1)
 7244 |             mstore(0x60, 0x80)
 7245 |             mstore(0x80, p3)
 7246 |             writeString(0xa0, p2)
 7247 |         }
 7248 |         _sendLogPayload(0x1c, 0xc4);

 7251 |             mstore(0x00, m0)
 7252 |             mstore(0x20, m1)

 7772 |     function log(address p0, bool p1, bytes32 p2, address p3) internal pure {
 7773 |         bytes32 m0;
 7774 |         bytes32 m1;
 7775 |         bytes32 m2;
 7776 |         bytes32 m3;
 7777 |         bytes32 m4;
 7778 |         bytes32 m5;
 7779 |         bytes32 m6;
 7780 |         /// @solidity memory-safe-assembly
 7781 |         assembly {
 7782 |             function writeString(pos, w) {
 7783 |                 let length := 0
 7784 |                 for {} lt(length, 0x20) { length := add(length, 1) } { if iszero(byte(length, w)) { break } }
 7785 |                 mstore(pos, length)
 7786 |                 let shift := sub(256, shl(3, length))
 7787 |                 mstore(add(pos, 0x20), shl(shift, shr(shift, w)))
 7788 |             }

 7790 |             m1 := mload(0x20)

 7792 |             m3 := mload(0x60)
 7793 |             m4 := mload(0x80)
 7794 |             m5 := mload(0xa0)
 7795 |             m6 := mload(0xc0)
 7796 |             // Selector of `log(address,bool,string,address)`.
 7797 |             mstore(0x00, 0x19fd4956)
 7798 |             mstore(0x20, p0)
 7799 |             mstore(0x40, p1)
 7800 |             mstore(0x60, 0x80)

 7803 |         }

 8328 |     function log(address p0, uint256 p1, uint256 p2, bytes32 p3) internal pure {
 8329 |         bytes32 m0;
 8330 |         bytes32 m1;
 8331 |         bytes32 m2;
 8332 |         bytes32 m3;
 8333 |         bytes32 m4;
 8334 |         bytes32 m5;
 8335 |         bytes32 m6;
 8336 |         /// @solidity memory-safe-assembly
 8337 |         assembly {
 8338 |             function writeString(pos, w) {
 8339 |                 let length := 0
 8340 |                 for {} lt(length, 0x20) { length := add(length, 1) } { if iszero(byte(length, w)) { break } }
 8341 |                 mstore(pos, length)
 8342 |                 let shift := sub(256, shl(3, length))
 8343 |                 mstore(add(pos, 0x20), shl(shift, shr(shift, w)))
 8344 |             }
 8345 |             m0 := mload(0x00)
 8346 |             m1 := mload(0x20)
 8347 |             m2 := mload(0x40)
 8348 |             m3 := mload(0x60)
 8349 |             m4 := mload(0x80)
 8350 |             m5 := mload(0xa0)
 8351 |             m6 := mload(0xc0)
 8352 |             // Selector of `log(address,uint256,uint256,string)`.
 8353 |             mstore(0x00, 0x4a28c017)
 8354 |             mstore(0x20, p0)
 8355 |             mstore(0x40, p1)
 8356 |             mstore(0x60, p2)
 8357 |             mstore(0x80, 0x80)
 8358 |             writeString(0xa0, p3)
 8359 |         }
 8360 |         _sendLogPayload(0x1c, 0xc4);

 8362 |         assembly {
 8363 |             mstore(0x00, m0)
 8364 |             mstore(0x20, m1)

 8866 |             mstore(0x80, p3)
 8867 |             writeString(0xa0, p1)
 8868 |         }
 8869 |         _sendLogPayload(0x1c, 0xc4);
 8870 |         /// @solidity memory-safe-assembly
 8871 |         assembly {
 8872 |             mstore(0x00, m0)
 8873 |             mstore(0x20, m1)

 8875 |             mstore(0x60, m3)

 8882 |     function log(address p0, bytes32 p1, bool p2, bytes32 p3) internal pure {
 8883 |         bytes32 m0;

 8887 |         bytes32 m4;
 8888 |         bytes32 m5;
 8889 |         bytes32 m6;
 8890 |         bytes32 m7;
 8891 |         bytes32 m8;
 8892 |         /// @solidity memory-safe-assembly
 8893 |         assembly {
 8894 |             function writeString(pos, w) {
 8895 |                 let length := 0
 8896 |                 for {} lt(length, 0x20) { length := add(length, 1) } { if iszero(byte(length, w)) { break } }
 8897 |                 mstore(pos, length)
 8898 |                 let shift := sub(256, shl(3, length))
 8899 |                 mstore(add(pos, 0x20), shl(shift, shr(shift, w)))
 8900 |             }

 8902 |             m1 := mload(0x20)
 8903 |             m2 := mload(0x40)
 8904 |             m3 := mload(0x60)
 8905 |             m4 := mload(0x80)
 8906 |             m5 := mload(0xa0)

 8909 |             m8 := mload(0x100)

 8912 |             mstore(0x20, p0)
 8913 |             mstore(0x40, 0x80)
 8914 |             mstore(0x60, p2)
 8915 |             mstore(0x80, 0xc0)

10030 |     function log(bool p0, bool p1, address p2, bytes32 p3) internal pure {
10031 |         bytes32 m0;
10032 |         bytes32 m1;
10033 |         bytes32 m2;
10034 |         bytes32 m3;
10035 |         bytes32 m4;
10036 |         bytes32 m5;
10037 |         bytes32 m6;
10038 |         /// @solidity memory-safe-assembly
10039 |         assembly {
10040 |             function writeString(pos, w) {
10041 |                 let length := 0
10042 |                 for {} lt(length, 0x20) { length := add(length, 1) } { if iszero(byte(length, w)) { break } }
10043 |                 mstore(pos, length)
10044 |                 let shift := sub(256, shl(3, length))
10045 |                 mstore(add(pos, 0x20), shl(shift, shr(shift, w)))
10046 |             }
10047 |             m0 := mload(0x00)
10048 |             m1 := mload(0x20)
10049 |             m2 := mload(0x40)
10050 |             m3 := mload(0x60)
10051 |             m4 := mload(0x80)
10052 |             m5 := mload(0xa0)
10053 |             m6 := mload(0xc0)
10054 |             // Selector of `log(bool,bool,address,string)`.
10055 |             mstore(0x00, 0xa0a47963)
10056 |             mstore(0x20, p0)
10057 |             mstore(0x40, p1)
10058 |             mstore(0x60, p2)
10059 |             mstore(0x80, 0x80)
10060 |             writeString(0xa0, p3)
10061 |         }
10062 |         _sendLogPayload(0x1c, 0xc4);
10063 |         /// @solidity memory-safe-assembly
10064 |         assembly {
10065 |             mstore(0x00, m0)
10066 |             mstore(0x20, m1)
10067 |             mstore(0x40, m2)
10068 |             mstore(0x60, m3)
10069 |             mstore(0x80, m4)
10070 |             mstore(0xa0, m5)
10071 |             mstore(0xc0, m6)
10072 |         }
10073 |     }

10491 |         bytes32 m4;
10492 |         bytes32 m5;
10493 |         bytes32 m6;
10494 |         bytes32 m7;
10495 |         bytes32 m8;
10496 |         /// @solidity memory-safe-assembly
10497 |         assembly {
10498 |             function writeString(pos, w) {
10499 |                 let length := 0
10500 |                 for {} lt(length, 0x20) { length := add(length, 1) } { if iszero(byte(length, w)) { break } }
10501 |                 mstore(pos, length)
10502 |                 let shift := sub(256, shl(3, length))
10503 |                 mstore(add(pos, 0x20), shl(shift, shr(shift, w)))
10504 |             }
10505 |             m0 := mload(0x00)
10506 |             m1 := mload(0x20)

10510 |             m5 := mload(0xa0)
10511 |             m6 := mload(0xc0)
10512 |             m7 := mload(0xe0)
10513 |             m8 := mload(0x100)
10514 |             // Selector of `log(bool,bool,string,string)`.
10515 |             mstore(0x00, 0x6d1e8751)
10516 |             mstore(0x20, p0)
10517 |             mstore(0x40, p1)
10518 |             mstore(0x60, 0x80)
10519 |             mstore(0x80, 0xc0)
10520 |             writeString(0xa0, p2)
10521 |             writeString(0xe0, p3)
10522 |         }
10523 |         _sendLogPayload(0x1c, 0x104);
10524 |         /// @solidity memory-safe-assembly
10525 |         assembly {
10526 |             mstore(0x00, m0)
10527 |             mstore(0x20, m1)
10528 |             mstore(0x40, m2)
10529 |             mstore(0x60, m3)

10531 |             mstore(0xa0, m5)

10631 |     function log(bool p0, uint256 p1, address p2, bytes32 p3) internal pure {
10632 |         bytes32 m0;

10634 |         bytes32 m2;
10635 |         bytes32 m3;
10636 |         bytes32 m4;
10637 |         bytes32 m5;
10638 |         bytes32 m6;
10639 |         /// @solidity memory-safe-assembly
10640 |         assembly {
10641 |             function writeString(pos, w) {
10642 |                 let length := 0
10643 |                 for {} lt(length, 0x20) { length := add(length, 1) } { if iszero(byte(length, w)) { break } }
10644 |                 mstore(pos, length)
10645 |                 let shift := sub(256, shl(3, length))
10646 |                 mstore(add(pos, 0x20), shl(shift, shr(shift, w)))
10647 |             }
10648 |             m0 := mload(0x00)
10649 |             m1 := mload(0x20)
10650 |             m2 := mload(0x40)
10651 |             m3 := mload(0x60)
10652 |             m4 := mload(0x80)
10653 |             m5 := mload(0xa0)
10654 |             m6 := mload(0xc0)
10655 |             // Selector of `log(bool,uint256,address,string)`.
10656 |             mstore(0x00, 0x1bb3b09a)
10657 |             mstore(0x20, p0)
10658 |             mstore(0x40, p1)
10659 |             mstore(0x60, p2)
10660 |             mstore(0x80, 0x80)
10661 |             writeString(0xa0, p3)
10662 |         }
10663 |         _sendLogPayload(0x1c, 0xc4);
10664 |         /// @solidity memory-safe-assembly
10665 |         assembly {
10666 |             mstore(0x00, m0)
10667 |             mstore(0x20, m1)
10668 |             mstore(0x40, m2)
10669 |             mstore(0x60, m3)
10670 |             mstore(0x80, m4)
10671 |             mstore(0xa0, m5)
10672 |             mstore(0xc0, m6)
10673 |         }

11605 |         bytes32 m1;
11606 |         bytes32 m2;
11607 |         bytes32 m3;
11608 |         bytes32 m4;
11609 |         bytes32 m5;
11610 |         bytes32 m6;
11611 |         /// @solidity memory-safe-assembly
11612 |         assembly {
11613 |             function writeString(pos, w) {
11614 |                 let length := 0
11615 |                 for {} lt(length, 0x20) { length := add(length, 1) } { if iszero(byte(length, w)) { break } }
11616 |                 mstore(pos, length)
11617 |                 let shift := sub(256, shl(3, length))
11618 |                 mstore(add(pos, 0x20), shl(shift, shr(shift, w)))
11619 |             }
11620 |             m0 := mload(0x00)
11621 |             m1 := mload(0x20)
11622 |             m2 := mload(0x40)
11623 |             m3 := mload(0x60)
11624 |             m4 := mload(0x80)
11625 |             m5 := mload(0xa0)
11626 |             m6 := mload(0xc0)
11627 |             // Selector of `log(bool,string,uint256,uint256)`.
11628 |             mstore(0x00, 0x28863fcb)
11629 |             mstore(0x20, p0)
11630 |             mstore(0x40, 0x80)
11631 |             mstore(0x60, p2)
11632 |             mstore(0x80, p3)
11633 |             writeString(0xa0, p1)
11634 |         }
11635 |         _sendLogPayload(0x1c, 0xc4);

11638 |             mstore(0x00, m0)

12156 |             function writeString(pos, w) {
12157 |                 let length := 0
12158 |                 for {} lt(length, 0x20) { length := add(length, 1) } { if iszero(byte(length, w)) { break } }
12159 |                 mstore(pos, length)
12160 |                 let shift := sub(256, shl(3, length))
12161 |                 mstore(add(pos, 0x20), shl(shift, shr(shift, w)))
12162 |             }

12164 |             m1 := mload(0x20)
12165 |             m2 := mload(0x40)
12166 |             m3 := mload(0x60)
12167 |             m4 := mload(0x80)

12174 |             mstore(0x60, p2)
12175 |             mstore(0x80, 0x80)

12177 |         }
12178 |         _sendLogPayload(0x1c, 0xc4);

13348 |     function log(uint256 p0, uint256 p1, bool p2, bytes32 p3) internal pure {
13349 |         bytes32 m0;
13350 |         bytes32 m1;
13351 |         bytes32 m2;
13352 |         bytes32 m3;
13353 |         bytes32 m4;
13354 |         bytes32 m5;
13355 |         bytes32 m6;
13356 |         /// @solidity memory-safe-assembly
13357 |         assembly {
13358 |             function writeString(pos, w) {
13359 |                 let length := 0
13360 |                 for {} lt(length, 0x20) { length := add(length, 1) } { if iszero(byte(length, w)) { break } }
13361 |                 mstore(pos, length)
13362 |                 let shift := sub(256, shl(3, length))
13363 |                 mstore(add(pos, 0x20), shl(shift, shr(shift, w)))
13364 |             }
13365 |             m0 := mload(0x00)
13366 |             m1 := mload(0x20)
13367 |             m2 := mload(0x40)
13368 |             m3 := mload(0x60)
13369 |             m4 := mload(0x80)
13370 |             m5 := mload(0xa0)
13371 |             m6 := mload(0xc0)
13372 |             // Selector of `log(uint256,uint256,bool,string)`.
13373 |             mstore(0x00, 0xa5b4fc99)
13374 |             mstore(0x20, p0)
13375 |             mstore(0x40, p1)
13376 |             mstore(0x60, p2)
13377 |             mstore(0x80, 0x80)
13378 |             writeString(0xa0, p3)
13379 |         }
13380 |         _sendLogPayload(0x1c, 0xc4);
13381 |         /// @solidity memory-safe-assembly
13382 |         assembly {
13383 |             mstore(0x00, m0)
13384 |             mstore(0x20, m1)
13385 |             mstore(0x40, m2)
13386 |             mstore(0x60, m3)
13387 |             mstore(0x80, m4)

14342 |         assembly {
14343 |             function writeString(pos, w) {
14344 |                 let length := 0
14345 |                 for {} lt(length, 0x20) { length := add(length, 1) } { if iszero(byte(length, w)) { break } }
14346 |                 mstore(pos, length)
14347 |                 let shift := sub(256, shl(3, length))
14348 |                 mstore(add(pos, 0x20), shl(shift, shr(shift, w)))
14349 |             }

15935 |     function log(bytes32 p0, bool p1, bytes32 p2, uint256 p3) internal pure {
15936 |         bytes32 m0;
15937 |         bytes32 m1;
15938 |         bytes32 m2;
15939 |         bytes32 m3;
15940 |         bytes32 m4;
15941 |         bytes32 m5;
15942 |         bytes32 m6;
15943 |         bytes32 m7;
15944 |         bytes32 m8;
15945 |         /// @solidity memory-safe-assembly
15946 |         assembly {
15947 |             function writeString(pos, w) {
15948 |                 let length := 0
15949 |                 for {} lt(length, 0x20) { length := add(length, 1) } { if iszero(byte(length, w)) { break } }
15950 |                 mstore(pos, length)
15951 |                 let shift := sub(256, shl(3, length))
15952 |                 mstore(add(pos, 0x20), shl(shift, shr(shift, w)))
15953 |             }
15954 |             m0 := mload(0x00)
15955 |             m1 := mload(0x20)

15961 |             m7 := mload(0xe0)
15962 |             m8 := mload(0x100)

15964 |             mstore(0x00, 0x24f91465)
15965 |             mstore(0x20, 0x80)
15966 |             mstore(0x40, p1)
15967 |             mstore(0x60, 0xc0)

15971 |         }

15987 |     function log(bytes32 p0, bool p1, bytes32 p2, bytes32 p3) internal pure {
15988 |         bytes32 m0;

15990 |         bytes32 m2;

15992 |         bytes32 m4;
15993 |         bytes32 m5;
15994 |         bytes32 m6;
15995 |         bytes32 m7;
15996 |         bytes32 m8;
15997 |         bytes32 m9;
15998 |         bytes32 m10;
15999 |         /// @solidity memory-safe-assembly
16000 |         assembly {
16001 |             function writeString(pos, w) {
16002 |                 let length := 0
16003 |                 for {} lt(length, 0x20) { length := add(length, 1) } { if iszero(byte(length, w)) { break } }
16004 |                 mstore(pos, length)
16005 |                 let shift := sub(256, shl(3, length))
16006 |                 mstore(add(pos, 0x20), shl(shift, shr(shift, w)))
16007 |             }
16008 |             m0 := mload(0x00)
16009 |             m1 := mload(0x20)
16010 |             m2 := mload(0x40)
16011 |             m3 := mload(0x60)
16012 |             m4 := mload(0x80)

16014 |             m6 := mload(0xc0)
16015 |             m7 := mload(0xe0)
16016 |             m8 := mload(0x100)
16017 |             m9 := mload(0x120)
16018 |             m10 := mload(0x140)
16019 |             // Selector of `log(string,bool,string,string)`.
16020 |             mstore(0x00, 0xa826caeb)
16021 |             mstore(0x20, 0x80)
16022 |             mstore(0x40, p1)
16023 |             mstore(0x60, 0xc0)
16024 |             mstore(0x80, 0x100)
16025 |             writeString(0xa0, p0)
16026 |             writeString(0xe0, p2)
16027 |             writeString(0x120, p3)
16028 |         }
16029 |         _sendLogPayload(0x1c, 0x144);

16517 |         bytes32 m6;

16519 |         assembly {
16520 |             function writeString(pos, w) {
16521 |                 let length := 0
16522 |                 for {} lt(length, 0x20) { length := add(length, 1) } { if iszero(byte(length, w)) { break } }
16523 |                 mstore(pos, length)
16524 |                 let shift := sub(256, shl(3, length))
16525 |                 mstore(add(pos, 0x20), shl(shift, shr(shift, w)))
16526 |             }

17572 |             mstore(0x20, m1)
17573 |             mstore(0x40, m2)
17574 |             mstore(0x60, m3)
17575 |             mstore(0x80, m4)
17576 |             mstore(0xa0, m5)
17577 |             mstore(0xc0, m6)
17578 |             mstore(0xe0, m7)
17579 |             mstore(0x100, m8)
17580 |             mstore(0x120, m9)
17581 |             mstore(0x140, m10)
17582 |         }
17583 |     }
17584 | 
17585 |     function log(bytes32 p0, bytes32 p1, bytes32 p2, uint256 p3) internal pure {
17586 |         bytes32 m0;
17587 |         bytes32 m1;
17588 |         bytes32 m2;
17589 |         bytes32 m3;
17590 |         bytes32 m4;
17591 |         bytes32 m5;
17592 |         bytes32 m6;
17593 |         bytes32 m7;
17594 |         bytes32 m8;
17595 |         bytes32 m9;
17596 |         bytes32 m10;
17597 |         /// @solidity memory-safe-assembly
17598 |         assembly {
17599 |             function writeString(pos, w) {
17600 |                 let length := 0
17601 |                 for {} lt(length, 0x20) { length := add(length, 1) } { if iszero(byte(length, w)) { break } }
17602 |                 mstore(pos, length)
17603 |                 let shift := sub(256, shl(3, length))
17604 |                 mstore(add(pos, 0x20), shl(shift, shr(shift, w)))
17605 |             }
17606 |             m0 := mload(0x00)
17607 |             m1 := mload(0x20)
17608 |             m2 := mload(0x40)
17609 |             m3 := mload(0x60)
17610 |             m4 := mload(0x80)
17611 |             m5 := mload(0xa0)
17612 |             m6 := mload(0xc0)
17613 |             m7 := mload(0xe0)
17614 |             m8 := mload(0x100)
17615 |             m9 := mload(0x120)
17616 |             m10 := mload(0x140)
17617 |             // Selector of `log(string,string,string,uint256)`.
17618 |             mstore(0x00, 0x8eafb02b)
17619 |             mstore(0x20, 0x80)
17620 |             mstore(0x40, 0xc0)
17621 |             mstore(0x60, 0x100)
17622 |             mstore(0x80, p3)
17623 |             writeString(0xa0, p0)
17624 |             writeString(0xe0, p1)
17625 |             writeString(0x120, p2)
17626 |         }
17627 |         _sendLogPayload(0x1c, 0x144);
17628 |         /// @solidity memory-safe-assembly
17629 |         assembly {
17630 |             mstore(0x00, m0)
17631 |             mstore(0x20, m1)
17632 |             mstore(0x40, m2)
17633 |             mstore(0x60, m3)
17634 |             mstore(0x80, m4)
17635 |             mstore(0xa0, m5)
17636 |             mstore(0xc0, m6)
17637 |             mstore(0xe0, m7)
17638 |             mstore(0x100, m8)
17639 |             mstore(0x120, m9)
17640 |             mstore(0x140, m10)
17641 |         }
17642 |     }
17643 | 
17644 |     function log(bytes32 p0, bytes32 p1, bytes32 p2, bytes32 p3) internal pure {
17645 |         bytes32 m0;
17646 |         bytes32 m1;
17647 |         bytes32 m2;
17648 |         bytes32 m3;
17649 |         bytes32 m4;
17650 |         bytes32 m5;
17651 |         bytes32 m6;
17652 |         bytes32 m7;
17653 |         bytes32 m8;
17654 |         bytes32 m9;
17655 |         bytes32 m10;
17656 |         bytes32 m11;
17657 |         bytes32 m12;
17658 |         /// @solidity memory-safe-assembly
17659 |         assembly {
17660 |             function writeString(pos, w) {
17661 |                 let length := 0
17662 |                 for {} lt(length, 0x20) { length := add(length, 1) } { if iszero(byte(length, w)) { break } }
17663 |                 mstore(pos, length)
17664 |                 let shift := sub(256, shl(3, length))
17665 |                 mstore(add(pos, 0x20), shl(shift, shr(shift, w)))
17666 |             }
17667 |             m0 := mload(0x00)
17668 |             m1 := mload(0x20)
17669 |             m2 := mload(0x40)
17670 |             m3 := mload(0x60)
17671 |             m4 := mload(0x80)
17672 |             m5 := mload(0xa0)
17673 |             m6 := mload(0xc0)
17674 |             m7 := mload(0xe0)
17675 |             m8 := mload(0x100)
17676 |             m9 := mload(0x120)
17677 |             m10 := mload(0x140)
17678 |             m11 := mload(0x160)
17679 |             m12 := mload(0x180)
17680 |             // Selector of `log(string,string,string,string)`.
17681 |             mstore(0x00, 0xde68f20a)
17682 |             mstore(0x20, 0x80)
17683 |             mstore(0x40, 0xc0)
17684 |             mstore(0x60, 0x100)
17685 |             mstore(0x80, 0x140)
17686 |             writeString(0xa0, p0)
17687 |             writeString(0xe0, p1)
17688 |             writeString(0x120, p2)
17689 |             writeString(0x160, p3)
17690 |         }
17691 |         _sendLogPayload(0x1c, 0x184);
17692 |         /// @solidity memory-safe-assembly
17693 |         assembly {
17694 |             mstore(0x00, m0)
17695 |             mstore(0x20, m1)
17696 |             mstore(0x40, m2)
17697 |             mstore(0x60, m3)
17698 |             mstore(0x80, m4)
17699 |             mstore(0xa0, m5)
17700 |             mstore(0xc0, m6)
17701 |             mstore(0xe0, m7)
17702 |             mstore(0x100, m8)
17703 |             mstore(0x120, m9)
17704 |             mstore(0x140, m10)
17705 |             mstore(0x160, m11)
17706 |             mstore(0x180, m12)
17707 |         }
17708 |     }
17709 | }

17711 | // lib/ucs-contracts/lib/openzeppelin-contracts/contracts/proxy/Proxy.sol
17712 | 
17713 | // OpenZeppelin Contracts (last updated v5.0.0) (proxy/Proxy.sol)
17714 | 
17715 | /**
17716 |  * @dev This abstract contract provides a fallback function that delegates all calls to another contract using the EVM
17717 |  * instruction `delegatecall`. We refer to the second contract as the _implementation_ behind the proxy, and it has to
17718 |  * be specified by overriding the virtual {_implementation} function.
17719 |  *
17720 |  * Additionally, delegation to the implementation can be triggered manually through the {_fallback} function, or to a
17721 |  * different contract through the {_delegate} function.
17722 |  *
17723 |  * The success and return data of the delegated call will be returned back to the caller of the proxy.
17724 |  */
17725 | abstract contract Proxy_0 {
17726 |     /**
17727 |      * @dev Delegates the current call to `implementation`.
17728 |      *
17729 |      * This function does not return to its internal call site, it will return directly to the external caller.
17730 |      */
17731 |     function _delegate(address implementation) internal virtual {
17732 |         assembly {
17733 |             // Copy msg.data. We take full control of memory in this inline assembly
17734 |             // block because it will not return to Solidity code. We overwrite the
17735 |             // Solidity scratch pad at memory position 0.
17736 |             calldatacopy(0, 0, calldatasize())
17737 | 
17738 |             // Call the implementation.
17739 |             // out and outsize are 0 because we don't know the size yet.
17740 |             let result := delegatecall(gas(), implementation, 0, calldatasize(), 0, 0)
17741 | 
17742 |             // Copy the returned data.
17743 |             returndatacopy(0, 0, returndatasize())
17744 | 
17745 |             switch result
17746 |             // delegatecall returns 0 on error.
17747 |             case 0 {
17748 |                 revert(0, returndatasize())
17749 |             }
17750 |             default {
17751 |                 return(0, returndatasize())
17752 |             }
17753 |         }
17754 |     }
17755 | 
17756 |     /**
17757 |      * @dev This is a virtual function that should be overridden so it returns the address to which the fallback
17758 |      * function and {_fallback} should delegate.
17759 |      */
17760 |     function _implementation() internal view virtual returns (address);
17761 | 
17762 |     /**
17763 |      * @dev Delegates the current call to the address returned by `_implementation()`.
17764 |      *
17765 |      * This function does not return to its internal call site, it will return directly to the external caller.
17766 |      */
17767 |     function _fallback() internal virtual {
17768 |         _delegate(_implementation());
17769 |     }
17770 | 
17771 |     /**
17772 |      * @dev Fallback function that delegates calls to the address returned by `_implementation()`. Will run if no other
17773 |      * function in the contract matches the call data.
17774 |      */
17775 |     fallback() external payable virtual {
17776 |         _fallback();
17777 |     }
17778 | }
17779 | 
17780 | // lib/ucs-contracts/lib/openzeppelin-contracts/contracts/proxy/beacon/IBeacon.sol

17783 |
