17785 |  * @dev This is the interface that {BeaconProxy} expects of its beacon.
17786 |  */
17787 | interface IBeacon {
17788 |     /**
17789 |      * @dev Must return an address that can be used as a delegate call target.
17790 |      *
17791 |      * {UpgradeableBeacon} will check that this address is a contract.
17792 |      */
17793 |     function implementation() external view returns (address);
17794 | }
17795 | 
17796 | // lib/ucs-contracts/lib/openzeppelin-contracts/contracts/utils/Address.sol
17797 | 
17798 | // OpenZeppelin Contracts (last updated v5.0.0) (utils/Address.sol)
17799 | 
17800 | /**
17801 |  * @dev Collection of functions related to the address type
17802 |  */
17803 | library Address {
17804 |     /**
17805 |      * @dev The ETH balance of the account is not enough to perform the operation.
17806 |      */
17807 |     error AddressInsufficientBalance(address account);
17808 | 
17809 |     /**
17810 |      * @dev There's no code at `target` (it is not a contract).
17811 |      */
17812 |     error AddressEmptyCode(address target);
17813 | 
17814 |     /**
17815 |      * @dev A call to an address target failed. The target may have reverted.
17816 |      */
17817 |     error FailedInnerCall();
17818 | 
17819 |     /**
17820 |      * @dev Replacement for Solidity's `transfer`: sends `amount` wei to
17821 |      * `recipient`, forwarding all available gas and reverting on errors.
17822 |      *
17823 |      * https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-1884[EIP1884] increases the gas cost
17824 |      * of certain opcodes, possibly making contracts go over the 2300 gas limit
17825 |      * imposed by `transfer`, making them unable to receive funds via
17826 |      * `transfer`. {sendValue} removes this limitation.
17827 |      *
17828 |      * https://consensys.net/diligence/blog/2019/09/stop-using-soliditys-transfer-now/[Learn more].
17829 |      *
17830 |      * IMPORTANT: because control is transferred to `recipient`, care must be
17831 |      * taken to not create reentrancy vulnerabilities. Consider using
17832 |      * {ReentrancyGuard} or the
17833 |      * https://solidity.readthedocs.io/en/v0.8.20/security-considerations.html#use-the-checks-effects-interactions-pattern[checks-effects-interactions pattern].
17834 |      */
17835 |     function sendValue(address payable recipient, uint256 amount) internal {
17836 |         if (address(this).balance < amount) {
17837 |             revert AddressInsufficientBalance(address(this));
17838 |         }
17839 | 
17840 |         (bool success, ) = recipient.call{value: amount}("");
17841 |         if (!success) {
17842 |             revert FailedInnerCall();
17843 |         }
17844 |     }
17845 | 
17846 |     /**
17847 |      * @dev Performs a Solidity function call using a low level `call`. A
17848 |      * plain `call` is an unsafe replacement for a function call: use this
17849 |      * function instead.
17850 |      *
17851 |      * If `target` reverts with a revert reason or custom error, it is bubbled
17852 |      * up by this function (like regular Solidity function calls). However, if
17853 |      * the call reverted with no returned reason, this function reverts with a
17854 |      * {FailedInnerCall} error.
17855 |      *
17856 |      * Returns the raw returned data. To convert to the expected return value,
17857 |      * use https://solidity.readthedocs.io/en/latest/units-and-global-variables.html?highlight=abi.decode#abi-encoding-and-decoding-functions[`abi.decode`].
17858 |      *
17859 |      * Requirements:
17860 |      *
17861 |      * - `target` must be a contract.
17862 |      * - calling `target` with `data` must not revert.
17863 |      */
17864 |     function functionCall(address target, bytes memory data) internal returns (bytes memory) {
17865 |         return functionCallWithValue(target, data, 0);
17866 |     }
17867 | 
17868 |     /**
17869 |      * @dev Same as {xref-Address-functionCall-address-bytes-}[`functionCall`],
17870 |      * but also transferring `value` wei to `target`.
17871 |      *
17872 |      * Requirements:
17873 |      *
17874 |      * - the calling contract must have an ETH balance of at least `value`.
17875 |      * - the called Solidity function must be `payable`.
17876 |      */
17877 |     function functionCallWithValue(address target, bytes memory data, uint256 value) internal returns (bytes memory) {
17878 |         if (address(this).balance < value) {
17879 |             revert AddressInsufficientBalance(address(this));
17880 |         }
17881 |         (bool success, bytes memory returndata) = target.call{value: value}(data);
17882 |         return verifyCallResultFromTarget(target, success, returndata);
17883 |     }
17884 | 
17885 |     /**
17886 |      * @dev Same as {xref-Address-functionCall-address-bytes-}[`functionCall`],
17887 |      * but performing a static call.
17888 |      */
17889 |     function functionStaticCall(address target, bytes memory data) internal view returns (bytes memory) {
17890 |         (bool success, bytes memory returndata) = target.staticcall(data);
17891 |         return verifyCallResultFromTarget(target, success, returndata);
17892 |     }
17893 | 
17894 |     /**
17895 |      * @dev Same as {xref-Address-functionCall-address-bytes-}[`functionCall`],
17896 |      * but performing a delegate call.
17897 |      */
17898 |     function functionDelegateCall(address target, bytes memory data) internal returns (bytes memory) {
17899 |         (bool success, bytes memory returndata) = target.delegatecall(data);
17900 |         return verifyCallResultFromTarget(target, success, returndata);
17901 |     }
17902 | 
17903 |     /**
17904 |      * @dev Tool to verify that a low level call to smart-contract was successful, and reverts if the target
17905 |      * was not a contract or bubbling up the revert reason (falling back to {FailedInnerCall}) in case of an
17906 |      * unsuccessful call.
17907 |      */
17908 |     function verifyCallResultFromTarget(
17909 |         address target,
17910 |         bool success,
17911 |         bytes memory returndata
17912 |     ) internal view returns (bytes memory) {
17913 |         if (!success) {
17914 |             _revert(returndata);
17915 |         } else {
17916 |             // only check if target is a contract if the call was successful and the return data is empty
17917 |             // otherwise we already know that it was a contract
17918 |             if (returndata.length == 0 && target.code.length == 0) {
17919 |                 revert AddressEmptyCode(target);
17920 |             }
17921 |             return returndata;
17922 |         }
17923 |     }
17924 | 
17925 |     /**
17926 |      * @dev Tool to verify that a low level call was successful, and reverts if it wasn't, either by bubbling the
17927 |      * revert reason or with a default {FailedInnerCall} error.
17928 |      */
17929 |     function verifyCallResult(bool success, bytes memory returndata) internal pure returns (bytes memory) {
17930 |         if (!success) {
17931 |             _revert(returndata);
17932 |         } else {
17933 |             return returndata;
17934 |         }
17935 |     }
17936 | 
17937 |     /**
17938 |      * @dev Reverts with returndata if present. Otherwise reverts with {FailedInnerCall}.
17939 |      */
17940 |     function _revert(bytes memory returndata) private pure {
17941 |         // Look for revert reason and bubble it up if present
17942 |         if (returndata.length > 0) {
17943 |             // The easiest way to bubble the revert reason is using memory via assembly
17944 |             /// @solidity memory-safe-assembly
17945 |             assembly {
17946 |                 let returndata_size := mload(returndata)
17947 |                 revert(add(32, returndata), returndata_size)
17948 |             }
17949 |         } else {
17950 |             revert FailedInnerCall();
17951 |         }
17952 |     }
17953 | }
17954 | 
17955 | // lib/ucs-contracts/lib/openzeppelin-contracts/contracts/utils/Context.sol
17956 | 
17957 | // OpenZeppelin Contracts (last updated v5.0.1) (utils/Context.sol)
17958 | 
17959 | /**
17960 |  * @dev Provides information about the current execution context, including the
17961 |  * sender of the transaction and its data. While these are generally available
17962 |  * via msg.sender and msg.data, they should not be accessed in such a direct
17963 |  * manner, since when dealing with meta-transactions the account sending and
17964 |  * paying for execution may not be the actual sender (as far as an application
17965 |  * is concerned).
17966 |  *
17967 |  * This contract is only required for intermediate, library-like contracts.
17968 |  */
17969 | abstract contract Context {
17970 |     function _msgSender() internal view virtual returns (address) {
17971 |         return msg.sender;
17972 |     }
17973 | 
17974 |     function _msgData() internal view virtual returns (bytes calldata) {
17975 |         return msg.data;
17976 |     }
17977 | 
17978 |     function _contextSuffixLength() internal view virtual returns (uint256) {
17979 |         return 0;
17980 |     }
17981 | }
17982 | 
17983 | // lib/ucs-contracts/lib/openzeppelin-contracts/contracts/utils/StorageSlot.sol
17984 | 
17985 | // OpenZeppelin Contracts (last updated v5.0.0) (utils/StorageSlot.sol)
17986 | // This file was procedurally generated from scripts/generate/templates/StorageSlot.js.
17987 | 
17988 | /**
17989 |  * @dev Library for reading and writing primitive types to specific storage slots.
17990 |  *
17991 |  * Storage slots are often used to avoid storage conflict when dealing with upgradeable contracts.
17992 |  * This library helps with reading and writing to such slots without the need for inline assembly.
17993 |  *
17994 |  * The functions in this library return Slot structs that contain a `value` member that can be used to read or write.
17995 |  *
17996 |  * Example usage to set ERC1967 implementation slot:
17997 |  * ```solidity
17998 |  * contract ERC1967 {
17999 |  *     bytes32 internal constant _IMPLEMENTATION_SLOT = 0x360894a13ba1a3210667c828492db98dca3e2076cc3735a920a3ca505d382bbc;
18000 |  *
18001 |  *     function _getImplementation() internal view returns (address) {
18002 |  *         return StorageSlot.getAddressSlot(_IMPLEMENTATION_SLOT).value;
18003 |  *     }
18004 |  *
18005 |  *     function _setImplementation(address newImplementation) internal {
18006 |  *         require(newImplementation.code.length > 0);
18007 |  *         StorageSlot.getAddressSlot(_IMPLEMENTATION_SLOT).value = newImplementation;
18008 |  *     }
18009 |  * }
18010 |  * ```
18011 |  */
18012 | library StorageSlot {
18013 |     struct AddressSlot {
18014 |         address value;
18015 |     }
18016 | 
18017 |     struct BooleanSlot {
18018 |         bool value;
18019 |     }
18020 | 
18021 |     struct Bytes32Slot {
18022 |         bytes32 value;
18023 |     }
18024 | 
18025 |     struct Uint256Slot {
18026 |         uint256 value;
18027 |     }
18028 | 
18029 |     struct StringSlot {
18030 |         string value;
18031 |     }
18032 | 
18033 |     struct BytesSlot {
18034 |         bytes value;
18035 |     }
18036 | 
18037 |     /**
18038 |      * @dev Returns an `AddressSlot` with member `value` located at `slot`.
18039 |      */
18040 |     function getAddressSlot(bytes32 slot) internal pure returns (AddressSlot storage r) {
18041 |         /// @solidity memory-safe-assembly
18042 |         assembly {
18043 |             r.slot := slot
18044 |         }
18045 |     }
18046 | 
18047 |     /**
18048 |      * @dev Returns an `BooleanSlot` with member `value` located at `slot`.
18049 |      */
18050 |     function getBooleanSlot(bytes32 slot) internal pure returns (BooleanSlot storage r) {
18051 |         /// @solidity memory-safe-assembly
18052 |         assembly {
18053 |             r.slot := slot
18054 |         }
18055 |     }
18056 | 
18057 |     /**
18058 |      * @dev Returns an `Bytes32Slot` with member `value` located at `slot`.
18059 |      */
18060 |     function getBytes32Slot(bytes32 slot) internal pure returns (Bytes32Slot storage r) {
18061 |         /// @solidity memory-safe-assembly
18062 |         assembly {
18063 |             r.slot := slot
18064 |         }
18065 |     }
18066 | 
18067 |     /**
18068 |      * @dev Returns an `Uint256Slot` with member `value` located at `slot`.
18069 |      */
18070 |     function getUint256Slot(bytes32 slot) internal pure returns (Uint256Slot storage r) {
18071 |         /// @solidity memory-safe-assembly
18072 |         assembly {
18073 |             r.slot := slot
18074 |         }
18075 |     }
18076 | 
18077 |     /**
18078 |      * @dev Returns an `StringSlot` with member `value` located at `slot`.
18079 |      */
18080 |     function getStringSlot(bytes32 slot) internal pure returns (StringSlot storage r) {
18081 |         /// @solidity memory-safe-assembly
18082 |         assembly {
18083 |             r.slot := slot
18084 |         }
18085 |     }
18086 | 
18087 |     /**
18088 |      * @dev Returns an `StringSlot` representation of the string storage pointer `store`.
18089 |      */
18090 |     function getStringSlot(string storage store) internal pure returns (StringSlot storage r) {
18091 |         /// @solidity memory-safe-assembly
18092 |         assembly {
18093 |             r.slot := store.slot
18094 |         }
18095 |     }
18096 | 
18097 |     /**
18098 |      * @dev Returns an `BytesSlot` with member `value` located at `slot`.
18099 |      */
18100 |     function getBytesSlot(bytes32 slot) internal pure returns (BytesSlot storage r) {
18101 |         /// @solidity memory-safe-assembly
18102 |         assembly {
18103 |             r.slot := slot
18104 |         }
18105 |     }
18106 | 
18107 |     /**
18108 |      * @dev Returns an `BytesSlot` representation of the bytes storage pointer `store`.
18109 |      */
18110 |     function getBytesSlot(bytes storage store) internal pure returns (BytesSlot storage r) {
18111 |         /// @solidity memory-safe-assembly
18112 |         assembly {
18113 |             r.slot := store.slot
18114 |         }
18115 |     }
18116 | }

18122 | /**
18123 |  * @dev Interface of the ERC165 standard, as defined in the
18124 |  * https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-165[EIP].
18125 |  *
18126 |  * Implementers can declare support of contract interfaces, which can then be
18127 |  * queried by others ({ERC165Checker}).
18128 |  *
18129 |  * For an implementation, see {ERC165}.
18130 |  */
18131 | interface IERC165_1 {
18132 |     /**
18133 |      * @dev Returns true if this contract implements the interface defined by
18134 |      * `interfaceId`. See the corresponding
18135 |      * https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-165#how-interfaces-are-identified[EIP section]
18136 |      * to learn more about how these ids are created.
18137 |      *
18138 |      * This function call must use less than 30 000 gas.
18139 |      */
18140 |     function supportsInterface(bytes4 interfaceId) external view returns (bool);
18141 | }

18156 | // lib/ucs-contracts/src/proxy/IProxy.sol
18157 | 
18158 | interface IProxy {
18159 |     /**
18160 |      * @dev Emitted when the dictionary is changed.
18161 |      */
18162 |     event DictionaryUpgraded(address dictionary);
18163 | 
18164 |     /**
18165 |     * @dev The `dictionary` of the proxy is invalid.
18166 |      */
18167 |     // error ERC7546InvalidDictionary(address dictionary);
18168 |     error NON_CONTRACT();
18169 | }

18337 | // src/std/functions/Receive.sol
18338 | 
18339 | /** < MC Standard Function >
18340 |  *  @title Receive
18341 |  *  @custom:version v0.1.0
18342 |  *  @custom:schema none
18343 |  */
18344 | contract Receive {
18345 |     /// DO NOT USE STORAGE DIRECTLY !!!
18346 | 
18347 |     event Received(address from, uint256 amount);
18348 |     receive() external payable {
18349 |         emit Received(msg.sender, msg.value);
18350 |     }
18351 | 
18352 | }
18353 | 
18354 | // src/std/storage/Schema.sol
18355 | 
18356 | /**
18357 |  * Storage Schema v0.1.0
18358 |  */
18359 | interface Schema {
18360 |      /// @custom:storage-location erc7201:mc.std.admin
18361 |     struct $Admin {
18362 |         address admin;
18363 |     }
18364 | 
18365 |     /// @custom:storage-location erc7201:mc.std.clone
18366 |     struct $Clone {
18367 |         address dictionary;
18368 |     }
18369 | 
18370 |     /// @custom:storage-location erc7201:mc.std.proposal
18371 |     struct $Proposal {
18372 |         Proposal[] proposals;
18373 |     }
18374 |         struct Proposal {
18375 |             ProposalHeader header;
18376 |             ProposalBody[] bodies;
18377 |         }
18378 |             struct ProposalHeader {
18379 |                 ProposalType proposalType;
18380 |             }
18381 |             enum ProposalType {
18382 |                 Undefined,
18383 |                 MEMBERSHIP_STOCK_TOKEN_RULE,
18384 |                 MEMBERSHIP_REPS_MAJORITY_RULE,
18385 |                 LEGISLATION
18386 |             }
18387 |             struct ProposalBody {
18388 |                 uint80 forkRefIndex;
18389 |                 string overview;
18390 |                 Op[] ops;
18391 |             }
18392 |             struct Op {
18393 |                 bytes data;
18394 |             }
18395 | 
18396 |     /// @custom:storage-location erc7201:mc.std.member
18397 |     struct $Member {
18398 |         address[] members;
18399 |     }
18400 | 
18401 |     /// @custom:storage-location erc7201:mc.std.featureToggle
18402 |     struct $FeatureToggle {
18403 |         mapping(bytes4 selector => bool) disabledFeature;
18404 |     }
18405 | 
18406 |     /// @custom:storage-location erc7201:mc.std.initializer
18407 |     struct $Initialization {
18408 |         uint64 initialized;
18409 |         bool initializing;
18410 |     }
18411 | 
18412 | }
18413 | 
18414 | // lib/forge-std/src/StdAssertions.sol
18415 | 
18416 | abstract contract StdAssertions {
18417 |     Vm private constant vm = Vm(address(uint160(uint256(keccak256("hevm cheat code")))));
18418 | 
18419 |     event log(string);
18420 |     event logs(bytes);
18421 | 
18422 |     event log_address(address);
18423 |     event log_bytes32(bytes32);
18424 |     event log_int(int256);
18425 |     event log_uint(uint256);
18426 |     event log_bytes(bytes);
18427 |     event log_string(string);
18428 | 
18429 |     event log_named_address(string key, address val);
18430 |     event log_named_bytes32(string key, bytes32 val);
18431 |     event log_named_decimal_int(string key, int256 val, uint256 decimals);
18432 |     event log_named_decimal_uint(string key, uint256 val, uint256 decimals);
18433 |     event log_named_int(string key, int256 val);
18434 |     event log_named_uint(string key, uint256 val);
18435 |     event log_named_bytes(string key, bytes val);
18436 |     event log_named_string(string key, string val);
18437 | 
18438 |     event log_array(uint256[] val);
18439 |     event log_array(int256[] val);
18440 |     event log_array(address[] val);
18441 |     event log_named_array(string key, uint256[] val);
18442 |     event log_named_array(string key, int256[] val);
18443 |     event log_named_array(string key, address[] val);
18444 | 
18445 |     bool private _failed;
18446 | 
18447 |     function failed() public view returns (bool) {
18448 |         if (_failed) {
18449 |             return _failed;
18450 |         } else {
18451 |             return vm.load(address(vm), bytes32("failed")) != bytes32(0);
18452 |         }
18453 |     }
18454 | 
18455 |     function fail() internal virtual {
18456 |         vm.store(address(vm), bytes32("failed"), bytes32(uint256(1)));
18457 |         _failed = true;
18458 |     }
18459 | 
18460 |     function assertTrue(bool data) internal pure virtual {
18461 |         vm.assertTrue(data);
18462 |     }
18463 | 
18464 |     function assertTrue(bool data, string memory err) internal pure virtual {
18465 |         vm.assertTrue(data, err);
18466 |     }
18467 |

18469 |         vm.assertFalse(data);
18470 |     }

18638 |         internal
18639 |         pure
18640 |         virtual
18641 |     {
18642 |         vm.assertNotEqDecimal(left, right, decimals, err);
18643 |     }

19007 |     // Inherited from DSTest, not used but kept for backwards-compatibility
19008 |     function checkEq0(bytes memory left, bytes memory right) internal pure returns (bool) {
19009 |         return keccak256(left) == keccak256(right);
19010 |     }
19011 | 
19012 |     function assertEq0(bytes memory left, bytes memory right) internal pure virtual {
19013 |         assertEq(left, right);
19014 |     }
19015 | 
19016 |     function assertEq0(bytes memory left, bytes memory right, string memory err) internal pure virtual {
19017 |         assertEq(left, right, err);
19018 |     }
19019 | 
19020 |     function assertNotEq0(bytes memory left, bytes memory right) internal pure virtual {
19021 |         assertNotEq(left, right);
19022 |     }
19023 | 
19024 |     function assertNotEq0(bytes memory left, bytes memory right, string memory err) internal pure virtual {
19025 |         assertNotEq(left, right, err);
19026 |     }
19027 | 
19028 |     function assertEqCall(address target, bytes memory callDataA, bytes memory callDataB) internal virtual {
19029 |         assertEqCall(target, callDataA, target, callDataB, true);
19030 |     }
19031 | 
19032 |     function assertEqCall(address targetA, bytes memory callDataA, address targetB, bytes memory callDataB)
19033 |         internal
19034 |         virtual
19035 |     {
19036 |         assertEqCall(targetA, callDataA, targetB, callDataB, true);
19037 |     }
19038 | 
19039 |     function assertEqCall(address target, bytes memory callDataA, bytes memory callDataB, bool strictRevertData)
19040 |         internal
19041 |         virtual
19042 |     {
19043 |         assertEqCall(target, callDataA, target, callDataB, strictRevertData);
19044 |     }
19045 | 
19046 |     function assertEqCall(
19047 |         address targetA,
19048 |         bytes memory callDataA,
19049 |         address targetB,
19050 |         bytes memory callDataB,
19051 |         bool strictRevertData
19052 |     ) internal virtual {
19053 |         (bool successA, bytes memory returnDataA) = address(targetA).call(callDataA);
19054 |         (bool successB, bytes memory returnDataB) = address(targetB).call(callDataB);
19055 | 
19056 |         if (successA && successB) {
19057 |             assertEq(returnDataA, returnDataB, "Call return data does not match");
19058 |         }
19059 | 
19060 |         if (!successA && !successB && strictRevertData) {
19061 |             assertEq(returnDataA, returnDataB, "Call revert data does not match");
19062 |         }
19063 | 
19064 |         if (!successA && successB) {
19065 |             emit log("Error: Calls were not equal");
19066 |             emit log_named_bytes("  Left call revert data", returnDataA);
19067 |             emit log_named_bytes(" Right call return data", returnDataB);
19068 |             revert("assertion failed");
19069 |         }
19070 | 
19071 |         if (successA && !successB) {
19072 |             emit log("Error: Calls were not equal");
19073 |             emit log_named_bytes("  Left call return data", returnDataA);
19074 |             emit log_named_bytes(" Right call revert data", returnDataB);
19075 |             revert("assertion failed");
19076 |         }
19077 |     }
19078 | }
19079 | 
19080 | // lib/forge-std/src/StdChains.sol
19081 | 
19082 | /**
19083 |  * StdChains provides information about EVM compatible chains that can be used in scripts/tests.
19084 |  * For each chain, the chain's name, chain ID, and a default RPC URL are provided. Chains are
19085 |  * identified by their alias, which is the same as the alias in the `[rpc_endpoints]` section of
19086 |  * the `foundry.toml` file. For best UX, ensure the alias in the `foundry.toml` file match the
19087 |  * alias used in this contract, which can be found as the first argument to the
19088 |  * `setChainWithDefaultRpcUrl` call in the `initializeStdChains` function.
19089 |  *
19090 |  * There are two main ways to use this contract:
19091 |  *   1. Set a chain with `setChain(string memory chainAlias, ChainData memory chain)` or
19092 |  *      `setChain(string memory chainAlias, Chain memory chain)`
19093 |  *   2. Get a chain with `getChain(string memory chainAlias)` or `getChain(uint256 chainId)`.
19094 |  *
19095 |  * The first time either of those are used, chains are initialized with the default set of RPC URLs.
19096 |  * This is done in `initializeStdChains`, which uses `setChainWithDefaultRpcUrl`. Defaults are recorded in
19097 |  * `defaultRpcUrls`.
19098 |  *
19099 |  * The `setChain` function is straightforward, and it simply saves off the given chain data.
19100 |  *
19101 |  * The `getChain` methods use `getChainWithUpdatedRpcUrl` to return a chain. For example, let's say
19102 |  * we want to retrieve the RPC URL for `mainnet`:
19103 |  *   - If you have specified data with `setChain`, it will return that.
19104 |  *   - If you have configured a mainnet RPC URL in `foundry.toml`, it will return the URL, provided it
19105 |  *     is valid (e.g. a URL is specified, or an environment variable is given and exists).
19106 |  *   - If neither of the above conditions is met, the default data is returned.
19107 |  *
19108 |  * Summarizing the above, the prioritization hierarchy is `setChain` -> `foundry.toml` -> environment variable -> defaults.
19109 |  */
19110 | abstract contract StdChains {
19111 |     VmSafe private constant vm = VmSafe(address(uint160(uint256(keccak256("hevm cheat code")))));
19112 | 
19113 |     bool private stdChainsInitialized;
19114 | 
19115 |     struct ChainData {
19116 |         string name;
19117 |         uint256 chainId;
19118 |         string rpcUrl;
19119 |     }
19120 | 
19121 |     struct Chain {
19122 |         // The chain name.
19123 |         string name;
19124 |         // The chain's Chain ID.
19125 |         uint256 chainId;
19126 |         // The chain's alias. (i.e. what gets specified in `foundry.toml`).
19127 |         string chainAlias;
19128 |         // A default RPC endpoint for this chain.
19129 |         // NOTE: This default RPC URL is included for convenience to facilitate quick tests and
19130 |         // experimentation. Do not use this RPC URL for production test suites, CI, or other heavy
19131 |         // usage as you will be throttled and this is a disservice to others who need this endpoint.
19132 |         string rpcUrl;
19133 |     }
19134 | 
19135 |     // Maps from the chain's alias (matching the alias in the `foundry.toml` file) to chain data.
19136 |     mapping(string => Chain) private chains;
19137 |     // Maps from the chain's alias to it's default RPC URL.
19138 |     mapping(string => string) private defaultRpcUrls;
19139 |     // Maps from a chain ID to it's alias.
19140 |     mapping(uint256 => string) private idToAlias;
19141 | 
19142 |     bool private fallbackToDefaultRpcUrls = true;
19143 | 
19144 |     // The RPC URL will be fetched from config or defaultRpcUrls if possible.
19145 |     function getChain(string memory chainAlias) internal virtual returns (Chain memory chain) {
19146 |         require(bytes(chainAlias).length != 0, "StdChains getChain(string): Chain alias cannot be the empty string.");
19147 | 
19148 |         initializeStdChains();
19149 |         chain = chains[chainAlias];
19150 |         require(
19151 |             chain.chainId != 0,
19152 |             string(abi.encodePacked("StdChains getChain(string): Chain with alias \"", chainAlias, "\" not found."))
19153 |         );
19154 | 
19155 |         chain = getChainWithUpdatedRpcUrl(chainAlias, chain);
19156 |     }
19157 | 
19158 |     function getChain(uint256 chainId) internal virtual returns (Chain memory chain) {
19159 |         require(chainId != 0, "StdChains getChain(uint256): Chain ID cannot be 0.");
19160 |         initializeStdChains();
19161 |         string memory chainAlias = idToAlias[chainId];
19162 | 
19163 |         chain = chains[chainAlias];
19164 | 
19165 |         require(
19166 |             chain.chainId != 0,
19167 |             string(abi.encodePacked("StdChains getChain(uint256): Chain with ID ", vm.toString(chainId), " not found."))
19168 |         );
19169 | 
19170 |         chain = getChainWithUpdatedRpcUrl(chainAlias, chain);
19171 |     }
19172 | 
19173 |     // set chain info, with priority to argument's rpcUrl field.
19174 |     function setChain(string memory chainAlias, ChainData memory chain) internal virtual {
19175 |         require(
19176 |             bytes(chainAlias).length != 0,
19177 |             "StdChains setChain(string,ChainData): Chain alias cannot be the empty string."
19178 |         );
19179 | 
19180 |         require(chain.chainId != 0, "StdChains setChain(string,ChainData): Chain ID cannot be 0.");
19181 | 
19182 |         initializeStdChains();
19183 |         string memory foundAlias = idToAlias[chain.chainId];
19184 | 
19185 |         require(
19186 |             bytes(foundAlias).length == 0 || keccak256(bytes(foundAlias)) == keccak256(bytes(chainAlias)),
19187 |             string(
19188 |                 abi.encodePacked(
19189 |                     "StdChains setChain(string,ChainData): Chain ID ",
19190 |                     vm.toString(chain.chainId),
19191 |                     " already used by \"",
19192 |                     foundAlias,
19193 |                     "\"."
19194 |                 )
19195 |             )
19196 |         );
19197 | 
19198 |         uint256 oldChainId = chains[chainAlias].chainId;
19199 |         delete idToAlias[oldChainId];
19200 | 
19201 |         chains[chainAlias] =
19202 |             Chain({name: chain.name, chainId: chain.chainId, chainAlias: chainAlias, rpcUrl: chain.rpcUrl});
19203 |         idToAlias[chain.chainId] = chainAlias;
19204 |     }
19205 | 
19206 |     // set chain info, with priority to argument's rpcUrl field.
19207 |     function setChain(string memory chainAlias, Chain memory chain) internal virtual {
19208 |         setChain(chainAlias, ChainData({name: chain.name, chainId: chain.chainId, rpcUrl: chain.rpcUrl}));
19209 |     }
19210 | 
19211 |     function _toUpper(string memory str) private pure returns (string memory) {
19212 |         bytes memory strb = bytes(str);
19213 |         bytes memory copy = new bytes(strb.length);
19214 |         for (uint256 i = 0; i < strb.length; i++) {
19215 |             bytes1 b = strb[i];
19216 |             if (b >= 0x61 && b <= 0x7A) {
19217 |                 copy[i] = bytes1(uint8(b) - 32);
19218 |             } else {
19219 |                 copy[i] = b;
19220 |             }
19221 |         }
19222 |         return string(copy);
19223 |     }
19224 | 
19225 |     // lookup rpcUrl, in descending order of priority:
19226 |     // current -> config (foundry.toml) -> environment variable -> default
19227 |     function getChainWithUpdatedRpcUrl(string memory chainAlias, Chain memory chain)
19228 |         private
19229 |         view
19230 |         returns (Chain memory)
19231 |     {
19232 |         if (bytes(chain.rpcUrl).length == 0) {
19233 |             try vm.rpcUrl(chainAlias) returns (string memory configRpcUrl) {
19234 |                 chain.rpcUrl = configRpcUrl;
19235 |             } catch (bytes memory err) {
19236 |                 string memory envName = string(abi.encodePacked(_toUpper(chainAlias), "_RPC_URL"));
19237 |                 if (fallbackToDefaultRpcUrls) {
19238 |                     chain.rpcUrl = vm.envOr(envName, defaultRpcUrls[chainAlias]);
19239 |                 } else {
19240 |                     chain.rpcUrl = vm.envString(envName);
19241 |                 }
19242 |                 // Distinguish 'not found' from 'cannot read'
19243 |                 // The upstream error thrown by forge for failing cheats changed so we check both the old and new versions
19244 |                 bytes memory oldNotFoundError =
19245 |                     abi.encodeWithSignature("CheatCodeError", string(abi.encodePacked("invalid rpc url ", chainAlias)));
19246 |                 bytes memory newNotFoundError = abi.encodeWithSignature(
19247 |                     "CheatcodeError(string)", string(abi.encodePacked("invalid rpc url: ", chainAlias))
19248 |                 );
19249 |                 bytes32 errHash = keccak256(err);
19250 |                 if (
19251 |                     (errHash != keccak256(oldNotFoundError) && errHash != keccak256(newNotFoundError))
19252 |                         || bytes(chain.rpcUrl).length == 0
19253 |                 ) {
19254 |                     /// @solidity memory-safe-assembly
19255 |                     assembly {
19256 |                         revert(add(32, err), mload(err))
19257 |                     }
19258 |                 }
19259 |             }
19260 |         }
19261 |         return chain;
19262 |     }
19263 | 
19264 |     function setFallbackToDefaultRpcUrls(bool useDefault) internal {
19265 |         fallbackToDefaultRpcUrls = useDefault;
19266 |     }
19267 |

19331 |     // set chain info, with priority to chainAlias' rpc url in foundry.toml
19332 |     function setChainWithDefaultRpcUrl(string memory chainAlias, ChainData memory chain) private {
19333 |         string memory rpcUrl = chain.rpcUrl;
19334 |         defaultRpcUrls[chainAlias] = rpcUrl;
19335 |         chain.rpcUrl = "";
19336 |         setChain(chainAlias, chain);
19337 |         chain.rpcUrl = rpcUrl; // restore argument
19338 |     }

19340 | 
19341 | // lib/forge-std/src/StdJson.sol
19342 | 
19343 | // Helpers for parsing and writing JSON files
19344 | // To parse:
19345 | // ```
19346 | // using stdJson for string;
19347 | // string memory json = vm.readFile("<some_path>");
19348 | // json.readUint("<json_path>");
19349 | // ```
19350 | // To write:
19351 | // ```
19352 | // using stdJson for string;
19353 | // string memory json = "json";
19354 | // json.serialize("a", uint256(123));
19355 | // string memory semiFinal = json.serialize("b", string("test"));
19356 | // string memory finalJson = json.serialize("c", semiFinal);
19357 | // finalJson.write("<some_path>");
19358 | // ```
19359 | 
19360 | library stdJson {
19361 |     VmSafe private constant vm = VmSafe(address(uint160(uint256(keccak256("hevm cheat code")))));
19362 | 
19363 |     function keyExists(string memory json, string memory key) internal view returns (bool) {
19364 |         return vm.keyExistsJson(json, key);
19365 |     }
19366 | 
19367 |     function parseRaw(string memory json, string memory key) internal pure returns (bytes memory) {
19368 |         return vm.parseJson(json, key);
19369 |     }
19370 | 
19371 |     function readUint(string memory json, string memory key) internal pure returns (uint256) {
19372 |         return vm.parseJsonUint(json, key);
19373 |     }
19374 |

19376 |         return vm.parseJsonUintArray(json, key);
19377 |     }
19378 |

19380 |         return vm.parseJsonInt(json, key);
19381 |     }
19382 |

19384 |         return vm.parseJsonIntArray(json, key);
19385 |     }

19619 | 
19620 | // lib/forge-std/src/StdStorage.sol
19621 | 
19622 | struct FindData {
19623 |     uint256 slot;
19624 |     uint256 offsetLeft;
19625 |     uint256 offsetRight;
19626 |     bool found;
19627 | }
19628 | 
19629 | struct StdStorage {
19630 |     mapping(address => mapping(bytes4 => mapping(bytes32 => FindData))) finds;
19631 |     bytes32[] _keys;
19632 |     bytes4 _sig;
19633 |     uint256 _depth;
19634 |     address _target;
19635 |     bytes32 _set;
19636 |     bool _enable_packed_slots;
19637 |     bytes _calldata;
19638 | }
19639 | 
19640 | library stdStorageSafe {
19641 |     event SlotFound(address who, bytes4 fsig, bytes32 keysHash, uint256 slot);
19642 |     event WARNING_UninitedSlot(address who, uint256 slot);
19643 | 
19644 |     Vm private constant vm = Vm(address(uint160(uint256(keccak256("hevm cheat code")))));
19645 |     uint256 constant UINT256_MAX = 115792089237316195423570985008687907853269984665640564039457584007913129639935;
19646 | 
19647 |     function sigs(string memory sigStr) internal pure returns (bytes4) {
19648 |         return bytes4(keccak256(bytes(sigStr)));
19649 |     }
19650 | 
19651 |     function getCallParams(StdStorage storage self) internal view returns (bytes memory) {
19652 |         if (self._calldata.length == 0) {
19653 |             return flatten(self._keys);
19654 |         } else {
19655 |             return self._calldata;
19656 |         }
19657 |     }
19658 | 
19659 |     // Calls target contract with configured parameters
19660 |     function callTarget(StdStorage storage self) internal view returns (bool, bytes32) {
19661 |         bytes memory cald = abi.encodePacked(self._sig, getCallParams(self));
19662 |         (bool success, bytes memory rdat) = self._target.staticcall(cald);
19663 |         bytes32 result = bytesToBytes32(rdat, 32 * self._depth);
19664 | 
19665 |         return (success, result);
19666 |     }
19667 | 
19668 |     // Tries mutating slot value to determine if the targeted value is stored in it.
19669 |     // If current value is 0, then we are setting slot value to type(uint256).max
19670 |     // Otherwise, we set it to 0. That way, return value should always be affected.
19671 |     function checkSlotMutatesCall(StdStorage storage self, bytes32 slot) internal returns (bool) {
19672 |         bytes32 prevSlotValue = vm.load(self._target, slot);
19673 |         (bool success, bytes32 prevReturnValue) = callTarget(self);
19674 | 
19675 |         bytes32 testVal = prevReturnValue == bytes32(0) ? bytes32(UINT256_MAX) : bytes32(0);
19676 |         vm.store(self._target, slot, testVal);
19677 | 
19678 |         (, bytes32 newReturnValue) = callTarget(self);
19679 | 
19680 |         vm.store(self._target, slot, prevSlotValue);
19681 | 
19682 |         return (success && (prevReturnValue != newReturnValue));
19683 |     }
19684 | 
19685 |     // Tries setting one of the bits in slot to 1 until return value changes.
19686 |     // Index of resulted bit is an offset packed slot has from left/right side
19687 |     function findOffset(StdStorage storage self, bytes32 slot, bool left) internal returns (bool, uint256) {
19688 |         for (uint256 offset = 0; offset < 256; offset++) {
19689 |             uint256 valueToPut = left ? (1 << (255 - offset)) : (1 << offset);
19690 |             vm.store(self._target, slot, bytes32(valueToPut));
19691 | 
19692 |             (bool success, bytes32 data) = callTarget(self);
19693 | 
19694 |             if (success && (uint256(data) > 0)) {
19695 |                 return (true, offset);
19696 |             }
19697 |         }
19698 |         return (false, 0);
19699 |     }
19700 | 
19701 |     function findOffsets(StdStorage storage self, bytes32 slot) internal returns (bool, uint256, uint256) {
19702 |         bytes32 prevSlotValue = vm.load(self._target, slot);
19703 | 
19704 |         (bool foundLeft, uint256 offsetLeft) = findOffset(self, slot, true);
19705 |         (bool foundRight, uint256 offsetRight) = findOffset(self, slot, false);
19706 | 
19707 |         // `findOffset` may mutate slot value, so we are setting it to initial value
19708 |         vm.store(self._target, slot, prevSlotValue);
19709 |         return (foundLeft && foundRight, offsetLeft, offsetRight);
19710 |     }
19711 | 
19712 |     function find(StdStorage storage self) internal returns (FindData storage) {
19713 |         return find(self, true);
19714 |     }
19715 | 
19716 |     /// @notice find an arbitrary storage slot given a function sig, input data, address of the contract and a value to check against
19717 |     // slot complexity:
19718 |     //  if flat, will be bytes32(uint256(uint));
19719 |     //  if map, will be keccak256(abi.encode(key, uint(slot)));
19720 |     //  if deep map, will be keccak256(abi.encode(key1, keccak256(abi.encode(key0, uint(slot)))));
19721 |     //  if map struct, will be bytes32(uint256(keccak256(abi.encode(key1, keccak256(abi.encode(key0, uint(slot)))))) + structFieldDepth);
19722 |     function find(StdStorage storage self, bool _clear) internal returns (FindData storage) {
19723 |         address who = self._target;
19724 |         bytes4 fsig = self._sig;
19725 |         uint256 field_depth = self._depth;
19726 |         bytes memory params = getCallParams(self);
19727 | 
19728 |         // calldata to test against
19729 |         if (self.finds[who][fsig][keccak256(abi.encodePacked(params, field_depth))].found) {
19730 |             if (_clear) {
19731 |                 clear(self);
19732 |             }
19733 |             return self.finds[who][fsig][keccak256(abi.encodePacked(params, field_depth))];
19734 |         }
19735 |         vm.record();
19736 |         (, bytes32 callResult) = callTarget(self);
19737 |         (bytes32[] memory reads,) = vm.accesses(address(who));
19738 | 
19739 |         if (reads.length == 0) {
19740 |             revert("stdStorage find(StdStorage): No storage use detected for target.");
19741 |         } else {
19742 |             for (uint256 i = reads.length; --i >= 0;) {
19743 |                 bytes32 prev = vm.load(who, reads[i]);
19744 |                 if (prev == bytes32(0)) {
19745 |                     emit WARNING_UninitedSlot(who, uint256(reads[i]));
19746 |                 }
19747 | 
19748 |                 if (!checkSlotMutatesCall(self, reads[i])) {
19749 |                     continue;
19750 |                 }
19751 | 
19752 |                 (uint256 offsetLeft, uint256 offsetRight) = (0, 0);
19753 | 
19754 |                 if (self._enable_packed_slots) {
19755 |                     bool found;
19756 |                     (found, offsetLeft, offsetRight) = findOffsets(self, reads[i]);
19757 |                     if (!found) {
19758 |                         continue;
19759 |                     }
19760 |                 }
19761 | 
19762 |                 // Check that value between found offsets is equal to the current call result
19763 |                 uint256 curVal = (uint256(prev) & getMaskByOffsets(offsetLeft, offsetRight)) >> offsetRight;
19764 | 
19765 |                 if (uint256(callResult) != curVal) {
19766 |                     continue;
19767 |                 }
19768 | 
19769 |                 emit SlotFound(who, fsig, keccak256(abi.encodePacked(params, field_depth)), uint256(reads[i]));
19770 |                 self.finds[who][fsig][keccak256(abi.encodePacked(params, field_depth))] =
19771 |                     FindData(uint256(reads[i]), offsetLeft, offsetRight, true);
19772 |                 break;
19773 |             }
19774 |         }
19775 | 
19776 |         require(
19777 |             self.finds[who][fsig][keccak256(abi.encodePacked(params, field_depth))].found,
19778 |             "stdStorage find(StdStorage): Slot(s) not found."
19779 |         );
19780 | 
19781 |         if (_clear) {
19782 |             clear(self);
19783 |         }
19784 |         return self.finds[who][fsig][keccak256(abi.encodePacked(params, field_depth))];
19785 |     }
19786 | 
19787 |     function target(StdStorage storage self, address _target) internal returns (StdStorage storage) {
19788 |         self._target = _target;
19789 |         return self;
19790 |     }
19791 | 
19792 |     function sig(StdStorage storage self, bytes4 _sig) internal returns (StdStorage storage) {
19793 |         self._sig = _sig;
19794 |         return self;
19795 |     }
19796 |

19798 |         self._sig = sigs(_sig);
19799 |         return self;
19800 |     }

19803 |         self._calldata = _calldata;
19804 |         return self;
19805 |     }

19832 |     function read(StdStorage storage self) private returns (bytes memory) {
19833 |         FindData storage data = find(self, false);
19834 |         uint256 mask = getMaskByOffsets(data.offsetLeft, data.offsetRight);
19835 |         uint256 value = (uint256(vm.load(self._target, bytes32(data.slot))) & mask) >> data.offsetRight;
19836 |         clear(self);
19837 |         return abi.encode(value);
19838 |     }
19839 | 
19840 |     function read_bytes32(StdStorage storage self) internal returns (bytes32) {
19841 |         return abi.decode(read(self), (bytes32));
19842 |     }
19843 | 
19844 |     function read_bool(StdStorage storage self) internal returns (bool) {
19845 |         int256 v = read_int(self);
19846 |         if (v == 0) return false;
19847 |         if (v == 1) return true;
19848 |         revert("stdStorage read_bool(StdStorage): Cannot decode. Make sure you are reading a bool.");
19849 |     }
19850 | 
19851 |     function read_address(StdStorage storage self) internal returns (address) {
19852 |         return abi.decode(read(self), (address));
19853 |     }

19857 |     }

19861 |     }
19862 | 
19863 |     function parent(StdStorage storage self) internal returns (uint256, bytes32) {
19864 |         address who = self._target;
19865 |         uint256 field_depth = self._depth;
19866 |         vm.startMappingRecording();
19867 |         uint256 child = find(self, true).slot - field_depth;
19868 |         (bool found, bytes32 key, bytes32 parent_slot) = vm.getMappingKeyAndParentOf(who, bytes32(child));
19869 |         if (!found) {
19870 |             revert(
19871 |                 "stdStorage read_bool(StdStorage): Cannot find parent. Make sure you give a slot and startMappingRecording() has been called."
19872 |             );
19873 |         }
19874 |         return (uint256(parent_slot), key);
19875 |     }
19876 | 
19877 |     function root(StdStorage storage self) internal returns (uint256) {
19878 |         address who = self._target;
19879 |         uint256 field_depth = self._depth;
19880 |         vm.startMappingRecording();
19881 |         uint256 child = find(self, true).slot - field_depth;
19882 |         bool found;
19883 |         bytes32 root_slot;
19884 |         bytes32 parent_slot;
19885 |         (found,, parent_slot) = vm.getMappingKeyAndParentOf(who, bytes32(child));
19886 |         if (!found) {
19887 |             revert(
19888 |                 "stdStorage read_bool(StdStorage): Cannot find parent. Make sure you give a slot and startMappingRecording() has been called."
19889 |             );
19890 |         }
19891 |         while (found) {
19892 |             root_slot = parent_slot;
19893 |             (found,, parent_slot) = vm.getMappingKeyAndParentOf(who, bytes32(root_slot));
19894 |         }
19895 |         return uint256(root_slot);
19896 |     }
19897 | 
19898 |     function bytesToBytes32(bytes memory b, uint256 offset) private pure returns (bytes32) {
19899 |         bytes32 out;
19900 | 
19901 |         uint256 max = b.length > 32 ? 32 : b.length;
19902 |         for (uint256 i = 0; i < max; i++) {
19903 |             out |= bytes32(b[offset + i] & 0xFF) >> (i * 8);
19904 |         }
19905 |         return out;
19906 |     }
19907 | 
19908 |     function flatten(bytes32[] memory b) private pure returns (bytes memory) {
19909 |         bytes memory result = new bytes(b.length * 32);
19910 |         for (uint256 i = 0; i < b.length; i++) {
19911 |             bytes32 k = b[i];
19912 |             /// @solidity memory-safe-assembly
19913 |             assembly {
19914 |                 mstore(add(result, add(32, mul(32, i))), k)
19915 |             }
19916 |         }
19917 | 
19918 |         return result;
19919 |     }
19920 | 
19921 |     function clear(StdStorage storage self) internal {
19922 |         delete self._target;
19923 |         delete self._sig;
19924 |         delete self._keys;
19925 |         delete self._depth;
19926 |         delete self._enable_packed_slots;
19927 |         delete self._calldata;
19928 |     }
19929 | 
19930 |     // Returns mask which contains non-zero bits for values between `offsetLeft` and `offsetRight`
19931 |     // (slotValue & mask) >> offsetRight will be the value of the given packed variable
19932 |     function getMaskByOffsets(uint256 offsetLeft, uint256 offsetRight) internal pure returns (uint256 mask) {
19933 |         // mask = ((1 << (256 - (offsetRight + offsetLeft))) - 1) << offsetRight;
19934 |         // using assembly because (1 << 256) causes overflow
19935 |         assembly {
19936 |             mask := shl(offsetRight, sub(shl(sub(256, add(offsetRight, offsetLeft)), 1), 1))
19937 |         }
19938 |     }
19939 | 
19940 |     // Returns slot value with updated packed variable.
19941 |     function getUpdatedSlotValue(bytes32 curValue, uint256 varValue, uint256 offsetLeft, uint256 offsetRight)
19942 |         internal
19943 |         pure
19944 |         returns (bytes32 newValue)
19945 |     {
19946 |         return bytes32((uint256(curValue) & ~getMaskByOffsets(offsetLeft, offsetRight)) | (varValue << offsetRight));
19947 |     }
19948 | }

20007 |     }

20011 |     }

20014 |         checked_write(self, bytes32(uint256(val)));
20015 |     }
20016 | 
20017 |     function checked_write(StdStorage storage self, bool write) internal {
20018 |         bytes32 t;
20019 |         /// @solidity memory-safe-assembly
20020 |         assembly {
20021 |             t := write
20022 |         }
20023 |         checked_write(self, t);
20024 |     }
20025 | 
20026 |     function checked_write(StdStorage storage self, bytes32 set) internal {
20027 |         address who = self._target;
20028 |         bytes4 fsig = self._sig;
20029 |         uint256 field_depth = self._depth;
20030 |         bytes memory params = stdStorageSafe.getCallParams(self);
20031 | 
20032 |         if (!self.finds[who][fsig][keccak256(abi.encodePacked(params, field_depth))].found) {
20033 |             find(self, false);
20034 |         }
20035 |         FindData storage data = self.finds[who][fsig][keccak256(abi.encodePacked(params, field_depth))];
20036 |         if ((data.offsetLeft + data.offsetRight) > 0) {
20037 |             uint256 maxVal = 2 ** (256 - (data.offsetLeft + data.offsetRight));
20038 |             require(
20039 |                 uint256(set) < maxVal,
20040 |                 string(
20041 |                     abi.encodePacked(
20042 |                         "stdStorage find(StdStorage): Packed slot. We can't fit value greater than ",
20043 |                         vm.toString(maxVal)
20044 |                     )
20045 |                 )
20046 |             );
20047 |         }
20048 |         bytes32 curVal = vm.load(who, bytes32(data.slot));
20049 |         bytes32 valToSet = stdStorageSafe.getUpdatedSlotValue(curVal, uint256(set), data.offsetLeft, data.offsetRight);
20050 | 
20051 |         vm.store(who, bytes32(data.slot), valToSet);
20052 | 
20053 |         (bool success, bytes32 callResult) = stdStorageSafe.callTarget(self);
20054 | 
20055 |         if (!success || callResult != set) {
20056 |             vm.store(who, bytes32(data.slot), curVal);
20057 |             revert("stdStorage find(StdStorage): Failed to write value.");
20058 |         }
20059 |         clear(self);
20060 |     }
20061 | 
20062 |     function read_bytes32(StdStorage storage self) internal returns (bytes32) {
20063 |         return stdStorageSafe.read_bytes32(self);
20064 |     }
20065 | 
20066 |     function read_bool(StdStorage storage self) internal returns (bool) {
20067 |         return stdStorageSafe.read_bool(self);
20068 |     }
20069 | 
20070 |     function read_address(StdStorage storage self) internal returns (address) {
20071 |         return stdStorageSafe.read_address(self);
20072 |     }
20073 |

20076 |     }

20338 |         return styleConcat(ITALIC, self);
20339 |     }

20421 | 
20422 | // lib/forge-std/src/StdToml.sol
20423 | 
20424 | // Helpers for parsing and writing TOML files
20425 | // To parse:
20426 | // ```
20427 | // using stdToml for string;
20428 | // string memory toml = vm.readFile("<some_path>");
20429 | // toml.readUint("<json_path>");
20430 | // ```
20431 | // To write:
20432 | // ```
20433 | // using stdToml for string;
20434 | // string memory json = "json";
20435 | // json.serialize("a", uint256(123));
20436 | // string memory semiFinal = json.serialize("b", string("test"));
20437 | // string memory finalJson = json.serialize("c", semiFinal);
20438 | // finalJson.write("<some_path>");
20439 | // ```
20440 | 
20441 | library stdToml {
20442 |     VmSafe private constant vm = VmSafe(address(uint160(uint256(keccak256("hevm cheat code")))));
20443 | 
20444 |     function keyExists(string memory toml, string memory key) internal view returns (bool) {
20445 |         return vm.keyExistsToml(toml, key);
20446 |     }
20447 | 
20448 |     function parseRaw(string memory toml, string memory key) internal pure returns (bytes memory) {
20449 |         return vm.parseToml(toml, key);
20450 |     }
20451 | 
20452 |     function readUint(string memory toml, string memory key) internal pure returns (uint256) {
20453 |         return vm.parseTomlUint(toml, key);
20454 |     }
20455 | 
20456 |     function readUintArray(string memory toml, string memory key) internal pure returns (uint256[] memory) {
20457 |         return vm.parseTomlUintArray(toml, key);
20458 |     }
20459 | 
20460 |     function readInt(string memory toml, string memory key) internal pure returns (int256) {
20461 |         return vm.parseTomlInt(toml, key);
20462 |     }
20463 | 
20464 |     function readIntArray(string memory toml, string memory key) internal pure returns (int256[] memory) {
20465 |         return vm.parseTomlIntArray(toml, key);
20466 |     }
20467 | 
20468 |     function readBytes32(string memory toml, string memory key) internal pure returns (bytes32) {
20469 |         return vm.parseTomlBytes32(toml, key);
20470 |     }
20471 | 
20472 |     function readBytes32Array(string memory toml, string memory key) internal pure returns (bytes32[] memory) {
20473 |         return vm.parseTomlBytes32Array(toml, key);
20474 |     }
20475 | 
20476 |     function readString(string memory toml, string memory key) internal pure returns (string memory) {
20477 |         return vm.parseTomlString(toml, key);
20478 |     }
20479 | 
20480 |     function readStringArray(string memory toml, string memory key) internal pure returns (string[] memory) {
20481 |         return vm.parseTomlStringArray(toml, key);
20482 |     }
20483 | 
20484 |     function readAddress(string memory toml, string memory key) internal pure returns (address) {
20485 |         return vm.parseTomlAddress(toml, key);
20486 |     }
20487 | 
20488 |     function readAddressArray(string memory toml, string memory key) internal pure returns (address[] memory) {
20489 |         return vm.parseTomlAddressArray(toml, key);
20490 |     }
20491 | 
20492 |     function readBool(string memory toml, string memory key) internal pure returns (bool) {
20493 |         return vm.parseTomlBool(toml, key);
20494 |     }
20495 | 
20496 |     function readBoolArray(string memory toml, string memory key) internal pure returns (bool[] memory) {
20497 |         return vm.parseTomlBoolArray(toml, key);
20498 |     }
20499 | 
20500 |     function readBytes(string memory toml, string memory key) internal pure returns (bytes memory) {
20501 |         return vm.parseTomlBytes(toml, key);
20502 |     }
20503 | 
20504 |     function readBytesArray(string memory toml, string memory key) internal pure returns (bytes[] memory) {
20505 |         return vm.parseTomlBytesArray(toml, key);
20506 |     }
20507 | 
20508 |     function readUintOr(string memory toml, string memory key, uint256 defaultValue) internal view returns (uint256) {
20509 |         return keyExists(toml, key) ? readUint(toml, key) : defaultValue;
20510 |     }
20511 |

20513 |         internal

20518 |     }

20522 |     }
