20703 | // lib/forge-std/src/interfaces/IERC721.sol
20704 | 
20705 | /// @title ERC-721 Non-Fungible Token Standard
20706 | /// @dev See https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-721
20707 | /// Note: the ERC-165 identifier for this interface is 0x80ac58cd.
20708 | interface IERC721 is IERC165_0 {
20709 |     /// @dev This emits when ownership of any NFT changes by any mechanism.
20710 |     /// This event emits when NFTs are created (`from` == 0) and destroyed
20711 |     /// (`to` == 0). Exception: during contract creation, any number of NFTs
20712 |     /// may be created and assigned without emitting Transfer. At the time of
20713 |     /// any transfer, the approved address for that NFT (if any) is reset to none.
20714 |     event Transfer(address indexed _from, address indexed _to, uint256 indexed _tokenId);
20715 | 
20716 |     /// @dev This emits when the approved address for an NFT is changed or
20717 |     /// reaffirmed. The zero address indicates there is no approved address.
20718 |     /// When a Transfer event emits, this also indicates that the approved
20719 |     /// address for that NFT (if any) is reset to none.
20720 |     event Approval(address indexed _owner, address indexed _approved, uint256 indexed _tokenId);
20721 | 
20722 |     /// @dev This emits when an operator is enabled or disabled for an owner.
20723 |     /// The operator can manage all NFTs of the owner.
20724 |     event ApprovalForAll(address indexed _owner, address indexed _operator, bool _approved);
20725 | 
20726 |     /// @notice Count all NFTs assigned to an owner
20727 |     /// @dev NFTs assigned to the zero address are considered invalid, and this
20728 |     /// function throws for queries about the zero address.
20729 |     /// @param _owner An address for whom to query the balance
20730 |     /// @return The number of NFTs owned by `_owner`, possibly zero
20731 |     function balanceOf(address _owner) external view returns (uint256);
20732 | 
20733 |     /// @notice Find the owner of an NFT
20734 |     /// @dev NFTs assigned to zero address are considered invalid, and queries
20735 |     /// about them do throw.
20736 |     /// @param _tokenId The identifier for an NFT
20737 |     /// @return The address of the owner of the NFT
20738 |     function ownerOf(uint256 _tokenId) external view returns (address);
20739 | 
20740 |     /// @notice Transfers the ownership of an NFT from one address to another address
20741 |     /// @dev Throws unless `msg.sender` is the current owner, an authorized
20742 |     /// operator, or the approved address for this NFT. Throws if `_from` is
20743 |     /// not the current owner. Throws if `_to` is the zero address. Throws if
20744 |     /// `_tokenId` is not a valid NFT. When transfer is complete, this function
20745 |     /// checks if `_to` is a smart contract (code size > 0). If so, it calls
20746 |     /// `onERC721Received` on `_to` and throws if the return value is not
20747 |     /// `bytes4(keccak256("onERC721Received(address,address,uint256,bytes)"))`.
20748 |     /// @param _from The current owner of the NFT
20749 |     /// @param _to The new owner
20750 |     /// @param _tokenId The NFT to transfer
20751 |     /// @param data Additional data with no specified format, sent in call to `_to`
20752 |     function safeTransferFrom(address _from, address _to, uint256 _tokenId, bytes calldata data) external payable;
20753 | 
20754 |     /// @notice Transfers the ownership of an NFT from one address to another address
20755 |     /// @dev This works identically to the other function with an extra data parameter,
20756 |     /// except this function just sets data to "".
20757 |     /// @param _from The current owner of the NFT
20758 |     /// @param _to The new owner
20759 |     /// @param _tokenId The NFT to transfer
20760 |     function safeTransferFrom(address _from, address _to, uint256 _tokenId) external payable;
20761 | 
20762 |     /// @notice Transfer ownership of an NFT -- THE CALLER IS RESPONSIBLE
20763 |     /// TO CONFIRM THAT `_to` IS CAPABLE OF RECEIVING NFTS OR ELSE
20764 |     /// THEY MAY BE PERMANENTLY LOST
20765 |     /// @dev Throws unless `msg.sender` is the current owner, an authorized
20766 |     /// operator, or the approved address for this NFT. Throws if `_from` is
20767 |     /// not the current owner. Throws if `_to` is the zero address. Throws if
20768 |     /// `_tokenId` is not a valid NFT.
20769 |     /// @param _from The current owner of the NFT
20770 |     /// @param _to The new owner
20771 |     /// @param _tokenId The NFT to transfer
20772 |     function transferFrom(address _from, address _to, uint256 _tokenId) external payable;
20773 | 
20774 |     /// @notice Change or reaffirm the approved address for an NFT
20775 |     /// @dev The zero address indicates there is no approved address.
20776 |     /// Throws unless `msg.sender` is the current NFT owner, or an authorized
20777 |     /// operator of the current owner.
20778 |     /// @param _approved The new approved NFT controller
20779 |     /// @param _tokenId The NFT to approve
20780 |     function approve(address _approved, uint256 _tokenId) external payable;
20781 | 
20782 |     /// @notice Enable or disable approval for a third party ("operator") to manage
20783 |     /// all of `msg.sender`'s assets
20784 |     /// @dev Emits the ApprovalForAll event. The contract MUST allow
20785 |     /// multiple operators per owner.
20786 |     /// @param _operator Address to add to the set of authorized operators
20787 |     /// @param _approved True if the operator is approved, false to revoke approval
20788 |     function setApprovalForAll(address _operator, bool _approved) external;
20789 | 
20790 |     /// @notice Get the approved address for a single NFT
20791 |     /// @dev Throws if `_tokenId` is not a valid NFT.
20792 |     /// @param _tokenId The NFT to find the approved address for
20793 |     /// @return The approved address for this NFT, or the zero address if there is none
20794 |     function getApproved(uint256 _tokenId) external view returns (address);
20795 | 
20796 |     /// @notice Query if an address is an authorized operator for another address
20797 |     /// @param _owner The address that owns the NFTs
20798 |     /// @param _operator The address that acts on behalf of the owner
20799 |     /// @return True if `_operator` is an approved operator for `_owner`, false otherwise
20800 |     function isApprovedForAll(address _owner, address _operator) external view returns (bool);
20801 | }
20802 | 
20803 | /// @dev Note: the ERC-165 identifier for this interface is 0x150b7a02.
20804 | interface IERC721TokenReceiver {
20805 |     /// @notice Handle the receipt of an NFT
20806 |     /// @dev The ERC721 smart contract calls this function on the recipient
20807 |     /// after a `transfer`. This function MAY throw to revert and reject the
20808 |     /// transfer. Return of other than the magic value MUST result in the
20809 |     /// transaction being reverted.
20810 |     /// Note: the contract address is always the message sender.
20811 |     /// @param _operator The address which called `safeTransferFrom` function
20812 |     /// @param _from The address which previously owned the token
20813 |     /// @param _tokenId The NFT identifier which is being transferred
20814 |     /// @param _data Additional data with no specified format
20815 |     /// @return `bytes4(keccak256("onERC721Received(address,address,uint256,bytes)"))`
20816 |     ///  unless throwing
20817 |     function onERC721Received(address _operator, address _from, uint256 _tokenId, bytes calldata _data)
20818 |         external
20819 |         returns (bytes4);
20820 | }
20821 | 
20822 | /// @title ERC-721 Non-Fungible Token Standard, optional metadata extension
20823 | /// @dev See https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-721
20824 | /// Note: the ERC-165 identifier for this interface is 0x5b5e139f.
20825 | interface IERC721Metadata is IERC721 {
20826 |     /// @notice A descriptive name for a collection of NFTs in this contract
20827 |     function name() external view returns (string memory _name);
20828 | 
20829 |     /// @notice An abbreviated name for NFTs in this contract
20830 |     function symbol() external view returns (string memory _symbol);
20831 | 
20832 |     /// @notice A distinct Uniform Resource Identifier (URI) for a given asset.
20833 |     /// @dev Throws if `_tokenId` is not a valid NFT. URIs are defined in RFC
20834 |     /// 3986. The URI may point to a JSON file that conforms to the "ERC721
20835 |     /// Metadata JSON Schema".
20836 |     function tokenURI(uint256 _tokenId) external view returns (string memory);
20837 | }
20838 | 
20839 | /// @title ERC-721 Non-Fungible Token Standard, optional enumeration extension
20840 | /// @dev See https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-721
20841 | /// Note: the ERC-165 identifier for this interface is 0x780e9d63.
20842 | interface IERC721Enumerable is IERC721 {
20843 |     /// @notice Count NFTs tracked by this contract
20844 |     /// @return A count of valid NFTs tracked by this contract, where each one of
20845 |     /// them has an assigned and queryable owner not equal to the zero address
20846 |     function totalSupply() external view returns (uint256);
20847 | 
20848 |     /// @notice Enumerate valid NFTs
20849 |     /// @dev Throws if `_index` >= `totalSupply()`.
20850 |     /// @param _index A counter less than `totalSupply()`
20851 |     /// @return The token identifier for the `_index`th NFT,
20852 |     /// (sort order not specified)
20853 |     function tokenByIndex(uint256 _index) external view returns (uint256);
20854 | 
20855 |     /// @notice Enumerate NFTs assigned to an owner
20856 |     /// @dev Throws if `_index` >= `balanceOf(_owner)` or if
20857 |     /// `_owner` is the zero address, representing invalid NFTs.
20858 |     /// @param _owner An address where we are interested in NFTs owned by them
20859 |     /// @param _index A counter less than `balanceOf(_owner)`
20860 |     /// @return The token identifier for the `_index`th NFT assigned to `_owner`,
20861 |     /// (sort order not specified)
20862 |     function tokenOfOwnerByIndex(address _owner, uint256 _index) external view returns (uint256);
20863 | }
20864 | 
20865 | // lib/forge-std/src/mocks/MockERC20.sol
20866 | 
20867 | /// @notice This is a mock contract of the ERC20 standard for testing purposes only, it SHOULD NOT be used in production.
20868 | /// @dev Forked from: https://github.com/transmissions11/solmate/blob/0384dbaaa4fcb5715738a9254a7c0a4cb62cf458/src/tokens/ERC20.sol
20869 | contract MockERC20 is IERC20 {
20870 |     /*//////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
20871 |                             METADATA STORAGE
20872 |     //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////*/
20873 | 
20874 |     string internal _name;
20875 | 
20876 |     string internal _symbol;
20877 | 
20878 |     uint8 internal _decimals;
20879 | 
20880 |     function name() external view override returns (string memory) {
20881 |         return _name;
20882 |     }
20883 | 
20884 |     function symbol() external view override returns (string memory) {
20885 |         return _symbol;
20886 |     }
20887 | 
20888 |     function decimals() external view override returns (uint8) {
20889 |         return _decimals;
20890 |     }
20891 | 
20892 |     /*//////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
20893 |                               ERC20 STORAGE
20894 |     //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////*/
20895 | 
20896 |     uint256 internal _totalSupply;
20897 | 
20898 |     mapping(address => uint256) internal _balanceOf;
20899 | 
20900 |     mapping(address => mapping(address => uint256)) internal _allowance;
20901 | 
20902 |     function totalSupply() external view override returns (uint256) {
20903 |         return _totalSupply;
20904 |     }
20905 | 
20906 |     function balanceOf(address owner) external view override returns (uint256) {
20907 |         return _balanceOf[owner];
20908 |     }
20909 | 
20910 |     function allowance(address owner, address spender) external view override returns (uint256) {
20911 |         return _allowance[owner][spender];
20912 |     }
20913 | 
20914 |     /*//////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
20915 |                             EIP-2612 STORAGE
20916 |     //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////*/
20917 | 
20918 |     uint256 internal INITIAL_CHAIN_ID;
20919 | 
20920 |     bytes32 internal INITIAL_DOMAIN_SEPARATOR;
20921 | 
20922 |     mapping(address => uint256) public nonces;
20923 | 
20924 |     /*//////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
20925 |                                INITIALIZE
20926 |     //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////*/
20927 | 
20928 |     /// @dev A bool to track whether the contract has been initialized.
20929 |     bool private initialized;
20930 | 
20931 |     /// @dev To hide constructor warnings across solc versions due to different constructor visibility requirements and
20932 |     /// syntaxes, we add an initialization function that can be called only once.
20933 |     function initialize(string memory name_, string memory symbol_, uint8 decimals_) public {
20934 |         require(!initialized, "ALREADY_INITIALIZED");
20935 | 
20936 |         _name = name_;
20937 |         _symbol = symbol_;
20938 |         _decimals = decimals_;
20939 | 
20940 |         INITIAL_CHAIN_ID = _pureChainId();
20941 |         INITIAL_DOMAIN_SEPARATOR = computeDomainSeparator();
20942 | 
20943 |         initialized = true;
20944 |     }
20945 | 
20946 |     /*//////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
20947 |                                ERC20 LOGIC
20948 |     //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////*/
20949 | 
20950 |     function approve(address spender, uint256 amount) public virtual override returns (bool) {
20951 |         _allowance[msg.sender][spender] = amount;
20952 | 
20953 |         emit Approval(msg.sender, spender, amount);
20954 | 
20955 |         return true;
20956 |     }
20957 | 
20958 |     function transfer(address to, uint256 amount) public virtual override returns (bool) {
20959 |         _balanceOf[msg.sender] = _sub(_balanceOf[msg.sender], amount);
20960 |         _balanceOf[to] = _add(_balanceOf[to], amount);
20961 | 
20962 |         emit Transfer(msg.sender, to, amount);
20963 | 
20964 |         return true;
20965 |     }
20966 | 
20967 |     function transferFrom(address from, address to, uint256 amount) public virtual override returns (bool) {
20968 |         uint256 allowed = _allowance[from][msg.sender]; // Saves gas for limited approvals.
20969 | 
20970 |         if (allowed != ~uint256(0)) _allowance[from][msg.sender] = _sub(allowed, amount);
20971 | 
20972 |         _balanceOf[from] = _sub(_balanceOf[from], amount);
20973 |         _balanceOf[to] = _add(_balanceOf[to], amount);
20974 | 
20975 |         emit Transfer(from, to, amount);
20976 | 
20977 |         return true;
20978 |     }
20979 | 
20980 |     /*//////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
20981 |                              EIP-2612 LOGIC
20982 |     //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////*/
20983 | 
20984 |     function permit(address owner, address spender, uint256 value, uint256 deadline, uint8 v, bytes32 r, bytes32 s)
20985 |         public
20986 |         virtual
20987 |     {
20988 |         require(deadline >= block.timestamp, "PERMIT_DEADLINE_EXPIRED");
20989 | 
20990 |         address recoveredAddress = ecrecover(
20991 |             keccak256(
20992 |                 abi.encodePacked(
20993 |                     "\x19\x01",
20994 |                     DOMAIN_SEPARATOR(),
20995 |                     keccak256(
20996 |                         abi.encode(
20997 |                             keccak256(
20998 |                                 "Permit(address owner,address spender,uint256 value,uint256 nonce,uint256 deadline)"
20999 |                             ),
21000 |                             owner,
21001 |                             spender,
21002 |                             value,
21003 |                             nonces[owner]++,
21004 |                             deadline
21005 |                         )
21006 |                     )
21007 |                 )
21008 |             ),
21009 |             v,
21010 |             r,
21011 |             s
21012 |         );
21013 | 
21014 |         require(recoveredAddress != address(0) && recoveredAddress == owner, "INVALID_SIGNER");
21015 | 
21016 |         _allowance[recoveredAddress][spender] = value;
21017 | 
21018 |         emit Approval(owner, spender, value);
21019 |     }
21020 | 
21021 |     function DOMAIN_SEPARATOR() public view virtual returns (bytes32) {
21022 |         return _pureChainId() == INITIAL_CHAIN_ID ? INITIAL_DOMAIN_SEPARATOR : computeDomainSeparator();
21023 |     }
21024 | 
21025 |     function computeDomainSeparator() internal view virtual returns (bytes32) {
21026 |         return keccak256(
21027 |             abi.encode(
21028 |                 keccak256("EIP712Domain(string name,string version,uint256 chainId,address verifyingContract)"),
21029 |                 keccak256(bytes(_name)),
21030 |                 keccak256("1"),
21031 |                 _pureChainId(),
21032 |                 address(this)
21033 |             )
21034 |         );
21035 |     }
21036 | 
21037 |     /*//////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
21038 |                         INTERNAL MINT/BURN LOGIC
21039 |     //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////*/
21040 | 
21041 |     function _mint(address to, uint256 amount) internal virtual {
21042 |         _totalSupply = _add(_totalSupply, amount);
21043 |         _balanceOf[to] = _add(_balanceOf[to], amount);
21044 | 
21045 |         emit Transfer(address(0), to, amount);
21046 |     }
21047 | 
21048 |     function _burn(address from, uint256 amount) internal virtual {
21049 |         _balanceOf[from] = _sub(_balanceOf[from], amount);
21050 |         _totalSupply = _sub(_totalSupply, amount);
21051 | 
21052 |         emit Transfer(from, address(0), amount);
21053 |     }
21054 | 
21055 |     /*//////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
21056 |                         INTERNAL SAFE MATH LOGIC
21057 |     //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////*/
21058 | 
21059 |     function _add(uint256 a, uint256 b) internal pure returns (uint256) {
21060 |         uint256 c = a + b;
21061 |         require(c >= a, "ERC20: addition overflow");
21062 |         return c;
21063 |     }
21064 | 
21065 |     function _sub(uint256 a, uint256 b) internal pure returns (uint256) {
21066 |         require(a >= b, "ERC20: subtraction underflow");
21067 |         return a - b;
21068 |     }
21069 | 
21070 |     /*//////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
21071 |                                 HELPERS
21072 |     //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////*/
21073 | 
21074 |     // We use this complex approach of `_viewChainId` and `_pureChainId` to ensure there are no
21075 |     // compiler warnings when accessing chain ID in any solidity version supported by forge-std. We
21076 |     // can't simply access the chain ID in a normal view or pure function because the solc View Pure
21077 |     // Checker changed `chainid` from pure to view in 0.8.0.
21078 |     function _viewChainId() private view returns (uint256 chainId) {
21079 |         // Assembly required since `block.chainid` was introduced in 0.8.0.
21080 |         assembly {
21081 |             chainId := chainid()
21082 |         }
21083 | 
21084 |         address(this); // Silence warnings in older Solc versions.
21085 |     }
21086 | 
21087 |     function _pureChainId() private pure returns (uint256 chainId) {
21088 |         function() internal view returns (uint256) fnIn = _viewChainId;
21089 |         function() internal pure returns (uint256) pureChainId;
21090 |         assembly {
21091 |             pureChainId := fnIn
21092 |         }
21093 |         chainId = pureChainId();
21094 |     }
21095 | }
21096 | 
21097 | // lib/ucs-contracts/lib/openzeppelin-contracts/contracts/access/Ownable.sol
21098 | 
21099 | // OpenZeppelin Contracts (last updated v5.0.0) (access/Ownable.sol)
21100 | 
21101 | /**
21102 |  * @dev Contract module which provides a basic access control mechanism, where
21103 |  * there is an account (an owner) that can be granted exclusive access to
21104 |  * specific functions.
21105 |  *
21106 |  * The initial owner is set to the address provided by the deployer. This can
21107 |  * later be changed with {transferOwnership}.
21108 |  *
21109 |  * This module is used through inheritance. It will make available the modifier
21110 |  * `onlyOwner`, which can be applied to your functions to restrict their use to
21111 |  * the owner.
21112 |  */
21113 | abstract contract Ownable is Context {
21114 |     address private _owner;
21115 | 
21116 |     /**
21117 |      * @dev The caller account is not authorized to perform an operation.
21118 |      */
21119 |     error OwnableUnauthorizedAccount(address account);
21120 | 
21121 |     /**
21122 |      * @dev The owner is not a valid owner account. (eg. `address(0)`)
21123 |      */
21124 |     error OwnableInvalidOwner(address owner);
21125 | 
21126 |     event OwnershipTransferred(address indexed previousOwner, address indexed newOwner);
21127 | 
21128 |     /**
21129 |      * @dev Initializes the contract setting the address provided by the deployer as the initial owner.
21130 |      */
21131 |     constructor(address initialOwner) {
21132 |         if (initialOwner == address(0)) {
21133 |             revert OwnableInvalidOwner(address(0));
21134 |         }
21135 |         _transferOwnership(initialOwner);
21136 |     }
21137 | 
21138 |     /**
21139 |      * @dev Throws if called by any account other than the owner.
21140 |      */
21141 |     modifier onlyOwner() {
21142 |         _checkOwner();
21143 |         _;
21144 |     }
21145 | 
21146 |     /**
21147 |      * @dev Returns the address of the current owner.
21148 |      */
21149 |     function owner() public view virtual returns (address) {
21150 |         return _owner;
21151 |     }
21152 | 
21153 |     /**
21154 |      * @dev Throws if the sender is not the owner.
21155 |      */
21156 |     function _checkOwner() internal view virtual {
21157 |         if (owner() != _msgSender()) {
21158 |             revert OwnableUnauthorizedAccount(_msgSender());
21159 |         }
21160 |     }
21161 | 
21162 |     /**
21163 |      * @dev Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call
21164 |      * `onlyOwner` functions. Can only be called by the current owner.
21165 |      *
21166 |      * NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner,
21167 |      * thereby disabling any functionality that is only available to the owner.
21168 |      */
21169 |     function renounceOwnership() public virtual onlyOwner {
21170 |         _transferOwnership(address(0));
21171 |     }
21172 | 
21173 |     /**
21174 |      * @dev Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`).
21175 |      * Can only be called by the current owner.
21176 |      */
21177 |     function transferOwnership(address newOwner) public virtual onlyOwner {
21178 |         if (newOwner == address(0)) {
21179 |             revert OwnableInvalidOwner(address(0));
21180 |         }
21181 |         _transferOwnership(newOwner);
21182 |     }
21183 | 
21184 |     /**
21185 |      * @dev Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`).
21186 |      * Internal function without access restriction.
21187 |      */
21188 |     function _transferOwnership(address newOwner) internal virtual {
21189 |         address oldOwner = _owner;
21190 |         _owner = newOwner;
21191 |         emit OwnershipTransferred(oldOwner, newOwner);
21192 |     }
21193 | }
21194 |

21227 | // lib/forge-std/src/Base.sol
21228 | 
21229 | abstract contract CommonBase {
21230 |     // Cheat code address, 0x7109709ECfa91a80626fF3989D68f67F5b1DD12D.
21231 |     address internal constant VM_ADDRESS = address(uint160(uint256(keccak256("hevm cheat code"))));
21232 |     // console.sol and console2.sol work by executing a staticcall to this address.
21233 |     address internal constant CONSOLE = 0x000000000000000000636F6e736F6c652e6c6f67;
21234 |     // Used when deploying with create2, https://github.com/Arachnid/deterministic-deployment-proxy.
21235 |     address internal constant CREATE2_FACTORY = 0x4e59b44847b379578588920cA78FbF26c0B4956C;
21236 |     // Default address for tx.origin and msg.sender, 0x1804c8AB1F12E6bbf3894d4083f33e07309d1f38.
21237 |     address internal constant DEFAULT_SENDER = address(uint160(uint256(keccak256("foundry default caller"))));
21238 |     // Address of the test contract, deployed by the DEFAULT_SENDER.
21239 |     address internal constant DEFAULT_TEST_CONTRACT = 0x5615dEB798BB3E4dFa0139dFa1b3D433Cc23b72f;
21240 |     // Deterministic deployment address of the Multicall3 contract.
21241 |     address internal constant MULTICALL3_ADDRESS = 0xcA11bde05977b3631167028862bE2a173976CA11;
21242 |     // The order of the secp256k1 curve.
21243 |     uint256 internal constant SECP256K1_ORDER =
21244 |         115792089237316195423570985008687907852837564279074904382605163141518161494337;
21245 | 
21246 |     uint256 internal constant UINT256_MAX =
21247 |         115792089237316195423570985008687907853269984665640564039457584007913129639935;
21248 | 
21249 |     Vm internal constant vm = Vm(VM_ADDRESS);
21250 |     StdStorage internal stdstore;
21251 | }

21259 | // lib/forge-std/src/mocks/MockERC721.sol
21260 | 
21261 | /// @notice This is a mock contract of the ERC721 standard for testing purposes only, it SHOULD NOT be used in production.
21262 | /// @dev Forked from: https://github.com/transmissions11/solmate/blob/0384dbaaa4fcb5715738a9254a7c0a4cb62cf458/src/tokens/ERC721.sol
21263 | contract MockERC721 is IERC721Metadata {
21264 |     /*//////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
21265 |                          METADATA STORAGE/LOGIC
21266 |     //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////*/
21267 | 
21268 |     string internal _name;
21269 | 
21270 |     string internal _symbol;
21271 | 
21272 |     function name() external view override returns (string memory) {
21273 |         return _name;
21274 |     }
21275 | 
21276 |     function symbol() external view override returns (string memory) {
21277 |         return _symbol;
21278 |     }
21279 | 
21280 |     function tokenURI(uint256 id) public view virtual override returns (string memory) {}
21281 | 
21282 |     /*//////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
21283 |                       ERC721 BALANCE/OWNER STORAGE
21284 |     //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////*/
21285 | 
21286 |     mapping(uint256 => address) internal _ownerOf;
21287 | 
21288 |     mapping(address => uint256) internal _balanceOf;
21289 | 
21290 |     function ownerOf(uint256 id) public view virtual override returns (address owner) {
21291 |         require((owner = _ownerOf[id]) != address(0), "NOT_MINTED");
21292 |     }
21293 | 
21294 |     function balanceOf(address owner) public view virtual override returns (uint256) {
21295 |         require(owner != address(0), "ZERO_ADDRESS");
21296 | 
21297 |         return _balanceOf[owner];
21298 |     }
21299 | 
21300 |     /*//////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
21301 |                          ERC721 APPROVAL STORAGE
21302 |     //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////*/
21303 | 
21304 |     mapping(uint256 => address) internal _getApproved;
21305 | 
21306 |     mapping(address => mapping(address => bool)) internal _isApprovedForAll;
21307 | 
21308 |     function getApproved(uint256 id) public view virtual override returns (address) {
21309 |         return _getApproved[id];
21310 |     }
21311 | 
21312 |     function isApprovedForAll(address owner, address operator) public view virtual override returns (bool) {
21313 |         return _isApprovedForAll[owner][operator];
21314 |     }
21315 | 
21316 |     /*//////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
21317 |                                INITIALIZE
21318 |     //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////*/
21319 | 
21320 |     /// @dev A bool to track whether the contract has been initialized.
21321 |     bool private initialized;
21322 | 
21323 |     /// @dev To hide constructor warnings across solc versions due to different constructor visibility requirements and
21324 |     /// syntaxes, we add an initialization function that can be called only once.
21325 |     function initialize(string memory name_, string memory symbol_) public {
21326 |         require(!initialized, "ALREADY_INITIALIZED");
21327 | 
21328 |         _name = name_;
21329 |         _symbol = symbol_;
21330 | 
21331 |         initialized = true;
21332 |     }
21333 | 
21334 |     /*//////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
21335 |                               ERC721 LOGIC
21336 |     //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////*/
21337 | 
21338 |     function approve(address spender, uint256 id) public payable virtual override {
21339 |         address owner = _ownerOf[id];
21340 | 
21341 |         require(msg.sender == owner || _isApprovedForAll[owner][msg.sender], "NOT_AUTHORIZED");
21342 | 
21343 |         _getApproved[id] = spender;
21344 | 
21345 |         emit Approval(owner, spender, id);
21346 |     }
21347 | 
21348 |     function setApprovalForAll(address operator, bool approved) public virtual override {
21349 |         _isApprovedForAll[msg.sender][operator] = approved;
21350 | 
21351 |         emit ApprovalForAll(msg.sender, operator, approved);
21352 |     }
21353 | 
21354 |     function transferFrom(address from, address to, uint256 id) public payable virtual override {
21355 |         require(from == _ownerOf[id], "WRONG_FROM");
21356 | 
21357 |         require(to != address(0), "INVALID_RECIPIENT");
21358 | 
21359 |         require(
21360 |             msg.sender == from || _isApprovedForAll[from][msg.sender] || msg.sender == _getApproved[id],
21361 |             "NOT_AUTHORIZED"
21362 |         );
21363 | 
21364 |         // Underflow of the sender's balance is impossible because we check for
21365 |         // ownership above and the recipient's balance can't realistically overflow.
21366 |         _balanceOf[from]--;
21367 | 
21368 |         _balanceOf[to]++;
21369 | 
21370 |         _ownerOf[id] = to;
21371 | 
21372 |         delete _getApproved[id];
21373 | 
21374 |         emit Transfer(from, to, id);
21375 |     }
21376 | 
21377 |     function safeTransferFrom(address from, address to, uint256 id) public payable virtual override {
21378 |         transferFrom(from, to, id);
21379 | 
21380 |         require(
21381 |             !_isContract(to)
21382 |                 || IERC721TokenReceiver(to).onERC721Received(msg.sender, from, id, "")
21383 |                     == IERC721TokenReceiver.onERC721Received.selector,
21384 |             "UNSAFE_RECIPIENT"
21385 |         );
21386 |     }
21387 | 
21388 |     function safeTransferFrom(address from, address to, uint256 id, bytes memory data)
21389 |         public
21390 |         payable
21391 |         virtual
21392 |         override
21393 |     {
21394 |         transferFrom(from, to, id);
21395 | 
21396 |         require(
21397 |             !_isContract(to)
21398 |                 || IERC721TokenReceiver(to).onERC721Received(msg.sender, from, id, data)
21399 |                     == IERC721TokenReceiver.onERC721Received.selector,
21400 |             "UNSAFE_RECIPIENT"
21401 |         );
21402 |     }
21403 | 
21404 |     /*//////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
21405 |                               ERC165 LOGIC
21406 |     //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////*/
21407 | 
21408 |     function supportsInterface(bytes4 interfaceId) public view virtual override returns (bool) {
21409 |         return interfaceId == 0x01ffc9a7 // ERC165 Interface ID for ERC165
21410 |             || interfaceId == 0x80ac58cd // ERC165 Interface ID for ERC721
21411 |             || interfaceId == 0x5b5e139f; // ERC165 Interface ID for ERC721Metadata
21412 |     }
21413 | 
21414 |     /*//////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
21415 |                         INTERNAL MINT/BURN LOGIC
21416 |     //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////*/
21417 | 
21418 |     function _mint(address to, uint256 id) internal virtual {
21419 |         require(to != address(0), "INVALID_RECIPIENT");
21420 | 
21421 |         require(_ownerOf[id] == address(0), "ALREADY_MINTED");
21422 | 
21423 |         // Counter overflow is incredibly unrealistic.
21424 | 
21425 |         _balanceOf[to]++;
21426 | 
21427 |         _ownerOf[id] = to;
21428 | 
21429 |         emit Transfer(address(0), to, id);
21430 |     }
21431 | 
21432 |     function _burn(uint256 id) internal virtual {
21433 |         address owner = _ownerOf[id];
21434 | 
21435 |         require(owner != address(0), "NOT_MINTED");
21436 | 
21437 |         _balanceOf[owner]--;
21438 | 
21439 |         delete _ownerOf[id];
21440 | 
21441 |         delete _getApproved[id];
21442 | 
21443 |         emit Transfer(owner, address(0), id);
21444 |     }
21445 | 
21446 |     /*//////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
21447 |                         INTERNAL SAFE MINT LOGIC
21448 |     //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////*/
21449 | 
21450 |     function _safeMint(address to, uint256 id) internal virtual {
21451 |         _mint(to, id);
21452 | 
21453 |         require(
21454 |             !_isContract(to)
21455 |                 || IERC721TokenReceiver(to).onERC721Received(msg.sender, address(0), id, "")
21456 |                     == IERC721TokenReceiver.onERC721Received.selector,
21457 |             "UNSAFE_RECIPIENT"
21458 |         );
21459 |     }
21460 | 
21461 |     function _safeMint(address to, uint256 id, bytes memory data) internal virtual {
21462 |         _mint(to, id);
21463 | 
21464 |         require(
21465 |             !_isContract(to)
21466 |                 || IERC721TokenReceiver(to).onERC721Received(msg.sender, address(0), id, data)
21467 |                     == IERC721TokenReceiver.onERC721Received.selector,
21468 |             "UNSAFE_RECIPIENT"
21469 |         );
21470 |     }
21471 | 
21472 |     /*//////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
21473 |                                 HELPERS
21474 |     //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////*/
21475 | 
21476 |     function _isContract(address _addr) private view returns (bool) {
21477 |         uint256 codeLength;
21478 | 
21479 |         // Assembly required for versions < 0.8.0 to check extcodesize.
21480 |         assembly {
21481 |             codeLength := extcodesize(_addr)
21482 |         }
21483 | 
21484 |         return codeLength > 0;
21485 |     }
21486 | }
21487 | 
21488 | // lib/ucs-contracts/src/dictionary/interfaces/IVerifiable.sol
21489 | 
21490 | /// @dev Library version has been tested with version 5.0.0.
21491 | 
21492 | interface IVerifiable is IBeacon, IERC165_1 {
21493 |     event FacadeUpgraded(address newFacade);
21494 | 
21495 |     /// @dev from IBeacon
21496 |     // function implementation() external view returns(address);
21497 |     /// @dev from IERC165
21498 |     // function supportsInterface(bytes4 interfaceId) external view returns (bool);
21499 |     function supportsInterfaces() external view returns(bytes4[] memory);
21500 | }
21501 | 
21502 | // src/std/functions/protected/protection/Initialization.sol
21503 | 
21504 | library Initialization {
21505 |     error InvalidInitialization();
21506 |     function shouldNotBeCompleted() internal view {
21507 |         if (Storage.Initialization().initialized != 0) revert InvalidInitialization();
21508 |     }
21509 | 
21510 |     event Initialized(uint64 version);
21511 |     function willBeCompleted() internal {
21512 |         Storage.Initialization().initialized = 1;
21513 |         emit Initialized(1);
21514 |     }
21515 | }
21516 | 
21517 | // lib/ucs-contracts/lib/openzeppelin-contracts/contracts/proxy/ERC1967/ERC1967Utils.sol
21518 | 
21519 | // OpenZeppelin Contracts (last updated v5.0.0) (proxy/ERC1967/ERC1967Utils.sol)
21520 | 
21521 | /**
21522 |  * @dev This abstract contract provides getters and event emitting update functions for
21523 |  * https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-1967[EIP1967] slots.
21524 |  */
21525 | library ERC1967Utils {
21526 |     // We re-declare ERC-1967 events here because they can't be used directly from IERC1967.
21527 |     // This will be fixed in Solidity 0.8.21. At that point we should remove these events.
21528 |     /**
21529 |      * @dev Emitted when the implementation is upgraded.
21530 |      */
21531 |     event Upgraded(address indexed implementation);
21532 | 
21533 |     /**
21534 |      * @dev Emitted when the admin account has changed.
21535 |      */
21536 |     event AdminChanged(address previousAdmin, address newAdmin);
21537 | 
21538 |     /**
21539 |      * @dev Emitted when the beacon is changed.
21540 |      */
21541 |     event BeaconUpgraded(address indexed beacon);
21542 | 
21543 |     /**
21544 |      * @dev Storage slot with the address of the current implementation.
21545 |      * This is the keccak-256 hash of "eip1967.proxy.implementation" subtracted by 1.
21546 |      */
21547 |     // solhint-disable-next-line private-vars-leading-underscore
21548 |     bytes32 internal constant IMPLEMENTATION_SLOT = 0x360894a13ba1a3210667c828492db98dca3e2076cc3735a920a3ca505d382bbc;
21549 | 
21550 |     /**
21551 |      * @dev The `implementation` of the proxy is invalid.
21552 |      */
21553 |     error ERC1967InvalidImplementation(address implementation);
21554 | 
21555 |     /**
21556 |      * @dev The `admin` of the proxy is invalid.
21557 |      */
21558 |     error ERC1967InvalidAdmin(address admin);
21559 | 
21560 |     /**
21561 |      * @dev The `beacon` of the proxy is invalid.
21562 |      */
21563 |     error ERC1967InvalidBeacon(address beacon);
21564 | 
21565 |     /**
21566 |      * @dev An upgrade function sees `msg.value > 0` that may be lost.
21567 |      */
21568 |     error ERC1967NonPayable();
21569 | 
21570 |     /**
21571 |      * @dev Returns the current implementation address.
21572 |      */
21573 |     function getImplementation() internal view returns (address) {
21574 |         return StorageSlot.getAddressSlot(IMPLEMENTATION_SLOT).value;
21575 |     }
21576 | 
21577 |     /**
21578 |      * @dev Stores a new address in the EIP1967 implementation slot.
21579 |      */
21580 |     function _setImplementation(address newImplementation) private {
21581 |         if (newImplementation.code.length == 0) {
21582 |             revert ERC1967InvalidImplementation(newImplementation);
21583 |         }
21584 |         StorageSlot.getAddressSlot(IMPLEMENTATION_SLOT).value = newImplementation;
21585 |     }
21586 | 
21587 |     /**
21588 |      * @dev Performs implementation upgrade with additional setup call if data is nonempty.
21589 |      * This function is payable only if the setup call is performed, otherwise `msg.value` is rejected
21590 |      * to avoid stuck value in the contract.
21591 |      *
21592 |      * Emits an {IERC1967-Upgraded} event.
21593 |      */
21594 |     function upgradeToAndCall(address newImplementation, bytes memory data) internal {
21595 |         _setImplementation(newImplementation);
21596 |         emit Upgraded(newImplementation);
21597 | 
21598 |         if (data.length > 0) {
21599 |             Address.functionDelegateCall(newImplementation, data);
21600 |         } else {
21601 |             _checkNonPayable();
21602 |         }
21603 |     }
21604 | 
21605 |     /**
21606 |      * @dev Storage slot with the admin of the contract.
21607 |      * This is the keccak-256 hash of "eip1967.proxy.admin" subtracted by 1.
21608 |      */
21609 |     // solhint-disable-next-line private-vars-leading-underscore
21610 |     bytes32 internal constant ADMIN_SLOT = 0xb53127684a568b3173ae13b9f8a6016e243e63b6e8ee1178d6a717850b5d6103;
21611 | 
21612 |     /**
21613 |      * @dev Returns the current admin.
21614 |      *
21615 |      * TIP: To get this value clients can read directly from the storage slot shown below (specified by EIP1967) using
21616 |      * the https://eth.wiki/json-rpc/API#eth_getstorageat[`eth_getStorageAt`] RPC call.
21617 |      * `0xb53127684a568b3173ae13b9f8a6016e243e63b6e8ee1178d6a717850b5d6103`
21618 |      */
21619 |     function getAdmin() internal view returns (address) {
21620 |         return StorageSlot.getAddressSlot(ADMIN_SLOT).value;
21621 |     }
21622 | 
21623 |     /**
21624 |      * @dev Stores a new address in the EIP1967 admin slot.
21625 |      */
21626 |     function _setAdmin(address newAdmin) private {
21627 |         if (newAdmin == address(0)) {
21628 |             revert ERC1967InvalidAdmin(address(0));
21629 |         }
21630 |         StorageSlot.getAddressSlot(ADMIN_SLOT).value = newAdmin;
21631 |     }
21632 | 
21633 |     /**
21634 |      * @dev Changes the admin of the proxy.
21635 |      *
21636 |      * Emits an {IERC1967-AdminChanged} event.
21637 |      */
21638 |     function changeAdmin(address newAdmin) internal {
21639 |         emit AdminChanged(getAdmin(), newAdmin);
21640 |         _setAdmin(newAdmin);
21641 |     }
21642 | 
21643 |     /**
21644 |      * @dev The storage slot of the UpgradeableBeacon contract which defines the implementation for this proxy.
21645 |      * This is the keccak-256 hash of "eip1967.proxy.beacon" subtracted by 1.
21646 |      */
21647 |     // solhint-disable-next-line private-vars-leading-underscore
21648 |     bytes32 internal constant BEACON_SLOT = 0xa3f0ad74e5423aebfd80d3ef4346578335a9a72aeaee59ff6cb3582b35133d50;
21649 | 
21650 |     /**
21651 |      * @dev Returns the current beacon.
21652 |      */
21653 |     function getBeacon() internal view returns (address) {
21654 |         return StorageSlot.getAddressSlot(BEACON_SLOT).value;
21655 |     }
21656 | 
21657 |     /**
21658 |      * @dev Stores a new beacon in the EIP1967 beacon slot.
21659 |      */
21660 |     function _setBeacon(address newBeacon) private {
21661 |         if (newBeacon.code.length == 0) {
21662 |             revert ERC1967InvalidBeacon(newBeacon);
21663 |         }
21664 | 
21665 |         StorageSlot.getAddressSlot(BEACON_SLOT).value = newBeacon;
21666 | 
21667 |         address beaconImplementation = IBeacon(newBeacon).implementation();
21668 |         if (beaconImplementation.code.length == 0) {
21669 |             revert ERC1967InvalidImplementation(beaconImplementation);
21670 |         }
21671 |     }
21672 | 
21673 |     /**
21674 |      * @dev Change the beacon and trigger a setup call if data is nonempty.
21675 |      * This function is payable only if the setup call is performed, otherwise `msg.value` is rejected
21676 |      * to avoid stuck value in the contract.
21677 |      *
21678 |      * Emits an {IERC1967-BeaconUpgraded} event.
21679 |      *
21680 |      * CAUTION: Invoking this function has no effect on an instance of {BeaconProxy} since v5, since
21681 |      * it uses an immutable beacon without looking at the value of the ERC-1967 beacon slot for
21682 |      * efficiency.
21683 |      */
21684 |     function upgradeBeaconToAndCall(address newBeacon, bytes memory data) internal {
21685 |         _setBeacon(newBeacon);
21686 |         emit BeaconUpgraded(newBeacon);
21687 | 
21688 |         if (data.length > 0) {
21689 |             Address.functionDelegateCall(IBeacon(newBeacon).implementation(), data);
21690 |         } else {
21691 |             _checkNonPayable();
21692 |         }
21693 |     }
21694 | 
21695 |     /**
21696 |      * @dev Reverts if `msg.value` is not zero. It can be used to avoid `msg.value` stuck in the contract
21697 |      * if an upgrade doesn't perform an initialization call.
21698 |      */
21699 |     function _checkNonPayable() private {
21700 |         if (msg.value > 0) {
21701 |             revert ERC1967NonPayable();
21702 |         }
21703 |     }
21704 | }
21705 | 
21706 | // lib/ucs-contracts/lib/openzeppelin-contracts/contracts/proxy/beacon/UpgradeableBeacon.sol
21707 | 
21708 | // OpenZeppelin Contracts (last updated v5.0.0) (proxy/beacon/UpgradeableBeacon.sol)
21709 | 
21710 | /**
21711 |  * @dev This contract is used in conjunction with one or more instances of {BeaconProxy} to determine their
21712 |  * implementation contract, which is where they will delegate all function calls.
21713 |  *
21714 |  * An owner is able to change the implementation the beacon points to, thus upgrading the proxies that use this beacon.
21715 |  */
21716 | contract UpgradeableBeacon is IBeacon, Ownable {
21717 |     address private _implementation;
21718 | 
21719 |     /**
21720 |      * @dev The `implementation` of the beacon is invalid.
21721 |      */
21722 |     error BeaconInvalidImplementation(address implementation);
21723 | 
21724 |     /**
21725 |      * @dev Emitted when the implementation returned by the beacon is changed.
21726 |      */
21727 |     event Upgraded(address indexed implementation);
21728 | 
21729 |     /**
21730 |      * @dev Sets the address of the initial implementation, and the initial owner who can upgrade the beacon.
21731 |      */
21732 |     constructor(address implementation_, address initialOwner) Ownable(initialOwner) {
21733 |         _setImplementation(implementation_);
21734 |     }
21735 | 
21736 |     /**
21737 |      * @dev Returns the current implementation address.
21738 |      */
21739 |     function implementation() public view virtual returns (address) {
21740 |         return _implementation;
21741 |     }
21742 | 
21743 |     /**
21744 |      * @dev Upgrades the beacon to a new implementation.
21745 |      *
21746 |      * Emits an {Upgraded} event.
21747 |      *
21748 |      * Requirements:
21749 |      *
21750 |      * - msg.sender must be the owner of the contract.
21751 |      * - `newImplementation` must be a contract.
21752 |      */
21753 |     function upgradeTo(address newImplementation) public virtual onlyOwner {
21754 |         _setImplementation(newImplementation);
21755 |     }
21756 | 
21757 |     /**
21758 |      * @dev Sets the implementation contract address for this beacon
21759 |      *
21760 |      * Requirements:
21761 |      *
21762 |      * - `newImplementation` must be a contract.
21763 |      */
21764 |     function _setImplementation(address newImplementation) private {
21765 |         if (newImplementation.code.length == 0) {
21766 |             revert BeaconInvalidImplementation(newImplementation);
21767 |         }
21768 |         _implementation = newImplementation;
21769 |         emit Upgraded(newImplementation);
21770 |     }
21771 | }
21772 | 
21773 | // src/std/functions/protected/protection/MsgSender.sol
21774 | 
21775 | library MsgSender {
21776 |     error NotAdmin();
21777 |     function shouldBeAdmin() internal view {
21778 |         console.log(msg.sender);
21779 |         console.log(Storage.Admin().admin);
21780 |         if (msg.sender != Storage.Admin().admin) revert NotAdmin();
21781 |     }
21782 | 
21783 |     error NotMember();
21784 |     function shouldBeMember() internal view {
21785 |         bool _isMember;
21786 |         address[] memory _members = Storage.Member().members;
21787 |         for (uint i; i < _members.length; ++i) {
21788 |             if (msg.sender == _members[i]) {
21789 |                 _isMember = true;
21790 |                 break;
21791 |             }
21792 |         }
21793 |         if (!_isMember) revert NotMember();
21794 |     }
21795 | }
