21797 | // lib/forge-std/src/StdCheats.sol
21798 | 
21799 | abstract contract StdCheatsSafe {
21800 |     Vm private constant vm = Vm(address(uint160(uint256(keccak256("hevm cheat code")))));
21801 | 
21802 |     uint256 private constant UINT256_MAX =
21803 |         115792089237316195423570985008687907853269984665640564039457584007913129639935;
21804 | 
21805 |     bool private gasMeteringOff;
21806 | 
21807 |     // Data structures to parse Transaction objects from the broadcast artifact
21808 |     // that conform to EIP1559. The Raw structs is what is parsed from the JSON
21809 |     // and then converted to the one that is used by the user for better UX.
21810 | 
21811 |     struct RawTx1559 {
21812 |         string[] arguments;
21813 |         address contractAddress;
21814 |         string contractName;
21815 |         // json value name = function
21816 |         string functionSig;
21817 |         bytes32 hash;
21818 |         // json value name = tx
21819 |         RawTx1559Detail txDetail;
21820 |         // json value name = type
21821 |         string opcode;
21822 |     }
21823 | 
21824 |     struct RawTx1559Detail {
21825 |         AccessList[] accessList;
21826 |         bytes data;
21827 |         address from;
21828 |         bytes gas;
21829 |         bytes nonce;
21830 |         address to;
21831 |         bytes txType;
21832 |         bytes value;
21833 |     }
21834 | 
21835 |     struct Tx1559 {
21836 |         string[] arguments;
21837 |         address contractAddress;
21838 |         string contractName;
21839 |         string functionSig;
21840 |         bytes32 hash;
21841 |         Tx1559Detail txDetail;
21842 |         string opcode;
21843 |     }
21844 | 
21845 |     struct Tx1559Detail {
21846 |         AccessList[] accessList;
21847 |         bytes data;
21848 |         address from;
21849 |         uint256 gas;
21850 |         uint256 nonce;
21851 |         address to;
21852 |         uint256 txType;
21853 |         uint256 value;
21854 |     }
21855 | 
21856 |     // Data structures to parse Transaction objects from the broadcast artifact
21857 |     // that DO NOT conform to EIP1559. The Raw structs is what is parsed from the JSON
21858 |     // and then converted to the one that is used by the user for better UX.
21859 | 
21860 |     struct TxLegacy {
21861 |         string[] arguments;
21862 |         address contractAddress;
21863 |         string contractName;
21864 |         string functionSig;
21865 |         string hash;
21866 |         string opcode;
21867 |         TxDetailLegacy transaction;
21868 |     }
21869 | 
21870 |     struct TxDetailLegacy {
21871 |         AccessList[] accessList;
21872 |         uint256 chainId;
21873 |         bytes data;
21874 |         address from;
21875 |         uint256 gas;
21876 |         uint256 gasPrice;
21877 |         bytes32 hash;
21878 |         uint256 nonce;
21879 |         bytes1 opcode;
21880 |         bytes32 r;
21881 |         bytes32 s;
21882 |         uint256 txType;
21883 |         address to;
21884 |         uint8 v;
21885 |         uint256 value;
21886 |     }
21887 | 
21888 |     struct AccessList {
21889 |         address accessAddress;
21890 |         bytes32[] storageKeys;
21891 |     }
21892 | 
21893 |     // Data structures to parse Receipt objects from the broadcast artifact.
21894 |     // The Raw structs is what is parsed from the JSON
21895 |     // and then converted to the one that is used by the user for better UX.
21896 | 
21897 |     struct RawReceipt {
21898 |         bytes32 blockHash;
21899 |         bytes blockNumber;
21900 |         address contractAddress;
21901 |         bytes cumulativeGasUsed;
21902 |         bytes effectiveGasPrice;
21903 |         address from;
21904 |         bytes gasUsed;
21905 |         RawReceiptLog[] logs;
21906 |         bytes logsBloom;
21907 |         bytes status;
21908 |         address to;
21909 |         bytes32 transactionHash;
21910 |         bytes transactionIndex;
21911 |     }
21912 | 
21913 |     struct Receipt {
21914 |         bytes32 blockHash;
21915 |         uint256 blockNumber;
21916 |         address contractAddress;
21917 |         uint256 cumulativeGasUsed;
21918 |         uint256 effectiveGasPrice;
21919 |         address from;
21920 |         uint256 gasUsed;
21921 |         ReceiptLog[] logs;
21922 |         bytes logsBloom;
21923 |         uint256 status;
21924 |         address to;
21925 |         bytes32 transactionHash;
21926 |         uint256 transactionIndex;
21927 |     }
21928 | 
21929 |     // Data structures to parse the entire broadcast artifact, assuming the
21930 |     // transactions conform to EIP1559.
21931 | 
21932 |     struct EIP1559ScriptArtifact {
21933 |         string[] libraries;
21934 |         string path;
21935 |         string[] pending;
21936 |         Receipt[] receipts;
21937 |         uint256 timestamp;
21938 |         Tx1559[] transactions;
21939 |         TxReturn[] txReturns;
21940 |     }
21941 | 
21942 |     struct RawEIP1559ScriptArtifact {
21943 |         string[] libraries;
21944 |         string path;
21945 |         string[] pending;
21946 |         RawReceipt[] receipts;
21947 |         TxReturn[] txReturns;
21948 |         uint256 timestamp;
21949 |         RawTx1559[] transactions;
21950 |     }
21951 | 
21952 |     struct RawReceiptLog {
21953 |         // json value = address
21954 |         address logAddress;
21955 |         bytes32 blockHash;
21956 |         bytes blockNumber;
21957 |         bytes data;
21958 |         bytes logIndex;
21959 |         bool removed;
21960 |         bytes32[] topics;
21961 |         bytes32 transactionHash;
21962 |         bytes transactionIndex;
21963 |         bytes transactionLogIndex;
21964 |     }
21965 | 
21966 |     struct ReceiptLog {
21967 |         // json value = address
21968 |         address logAddress;
21969 |         bytes32 blockHash;
21970 |         uint256 blockNumber;
21971 |         bytes data;
21972 |         uint256 logIndex;
21973 |         bytes32[] topics;
21974 |         uint256 transactionIndex;
21975 |         uint256 transactionLogIndex;
21976 |         bool removed;
21977 |     }
21978 | 
21979 |     struct TxReturn {
21980 |         string internalType;
21981 |         string value;
21982 |     }
21983 | 
21984 |     struct Account {
21985 |         address addr;
21986 |         uint256 key;
21987 |     }
21988 | 
21989 |     enum AddressType {
21990 |         Payable,
21991 |         NonPayable,
21992 |         ZeroAddress,
21993 |         Precompile,
21994 |         ForgeAddress
21995 |     }
21996 | 
21997 |     // Checks that `addr` is not blacklisted by token contracts that have a blacklist.
21998 |     function assumeNotBlacklisted(address token, address addr) internal view virtual {
21999 |         // Nothing to check if `token` is not a contract.
22000 |         uint256 tokenCodeSize;
22001 |         assembly {
22002 |             tokenCodeSize := extcodesize(token)
22003 |         }
22004 |         require(tokenCodeSize > 0, "StdCheats assumeNotBlacklisted(address,address): Token address is not a contract.");
22005 | 
22006 |         bool success;
22007 |         bytes memory returnData;
22008 | 
22009 |         // 4-byte selector for `isBlacklisted(address)`, used by USDC.
22010 |         (success, returnData) = token.staticcall(abi.encodeWithSelector(0xfe575a87, addr));
22011 |         vm.assume(!success || abi.decode(returnData, (bool)) == false);
22012 | 
22013 |         // 4-byte selector for `isBlackListed(address)`, used by USDT.
22014 |         (success, returnData) = token.staticcall(abi.encodeWithSelector(0xe47d6060, addr));
22015 |         vm.assume(!success || abi.decode(returnData, (bool)) == false);
22016 |     }
22017 | 
22018 |     // Checks that `addr` is not blacklisted by token contracts that have a blacklist.
22019 |     // This is identical to `assumeNotBlacklisted(address,address)` but with a different name, for
22020 |     // backwards compatibility, since this name was used in the original PR which has already has
22021 |     // a release. This function can be removed in a future release once we want a breaking change.
22022 |     function assumeNoBlacklisted(address token, address addr) internal view virtual {
22023 |         assumeNotBlacklisted(token, addr);
22024 |     }
22025 | 
22026 |     function assumeAddressIsNot(address addr, AddressType addressType) internal virtual {
22027 |         if (addressType == AddressType.Payable) {
22028 |             assumeNotPayable(addr);
22029 |         } else if (addressType == AddressType.NonPayable) {
22030 |             assumePayable(addr);
22031 |         } else if (addressType == AddressType.ZeroAddress) {
22032 |             assumeNotZeroAddress(addr);
22033 |         } else if (addressType == AddressType.Precompile) {
22034 |             assumeNotPrecompile(addr);
22035 |         } else if (addressType == AddressType.ForgeAddress) {
22036 |             assumeNotForgeAddress(addr);
22037 |         }
22038 |     }
22039 | 
22040 |     function assumeAddressIsNot(address addr, AddressType addressType1, AddressType addressType2) internal virtual {
22041 |         assumeAddressIsNot(addr, addressType1);
22042 |         assumeAddressIsNot(addr, addressType2);
22043 |     }
22044 | 
22045 |     function assumeAddressIsNot(
22046 |         address addr,
22047 |         AddressType addressType1,
22048 |         AddressType addressType2,
22049 |         AddressType addressType3
22050 |     ) internal virtual {
22051 |         assumeAddressIsNot(addr, addressType1);
22052 |         assumeAddressIsNot(addr, addressType2);
22053 |         assumeAddressIsNot(addr, addressType3);
22054 |     }
22055 | 
22056 |     function assumeAddressIsNot(
22057 |         address addr,
22058 |         AddressType addressType1,
22059 |         AddressType addressType2,
22060 |         AddressType addressType3,
22061 |         AddressType addressType4
22062 |     ) internal virtual {
22063 |         assumeAddressIsNot(addr, addressType1);
22064 |         assumeAddressIsNot(addr, addressType2);
22065 |         assumeAddressIsNot(addr, addressType3);
22066 |         assumeAddressIsNot(addr, addressType4);
22067 |     }
22068 | 
22069 |     // This function checks whether an address, `addr`, is payable. It works by sending 1 wei to
22070 |     // `addr` and checking the `success` return value.
22071 |     // NOTE: This function may result in state changes depending on the fallback/receive logic
22072 |     // implemented by `addr`, which should be taken into account when this function is used.
22073 |     function _isPayable(address addr) private returns (bool) {
22074 |         require(
22075 |             addr.balance < UINT256_MAX,
22076 |             "StdCheats _isPayable(address): Balance equals max uint256, so it cannot receive any more funds"
22077 |         );
22078 |         uint256 origBalanceTest = address(this).balance;
22079 |         uint256 origBalanceAddr = address(addr).balance;
22080 | 
22081 |         vm.deal(address(this), 1);
22082 |         (bool success,) = payable(addr).call{value: 1}("");
22083 | 
22084 |         // reset balances
22085 |         vm.deal(address(this), origBalanceTest);
22086 |         vm.deal(addr, origBalanceAddr);
22087 | 
22088 |         return success;
22089 |     }
22090 | 
22091 |     // NOTE: This function may result in state changes depending on the fallback/receive logic
22092 |     // implemented by `addr`, which should be taken into account when this function is used. See the
22093 |     // `_isPayable` method for more information.
22094 |     function assumePayable(address addr) internal virtual {
22095 |         vm.assume(_isPayable(addr));
22096 |     }
22097 | 
22098 |     function assumeNotPayable(address addr) internal virtual {
22099 |         vm.assume(!_isPayable(addr));
22100 |     }
22101 | 
22102 |     function assumeNotZeroAddress(address addr) internal pure virtual {
22103 |         vm.assume(addr != address(0));
22104 |     }
22105 | 
22106 |     function assumeNotPrecompile(address addr) internal pure virtual {
22107 |         assumeNotPrecompile(addr, _pureChainId());
22108 |     }
22109 | 
22110 |     function assumeNotPrecompile(address addr, uint256 chainId) internal pure virtual {
22111 |         // Note: For some chains like Optimism these are technically predeploys (i.e. bytecode placed at a specific
22112 |         // address), but the same rationale for excluding them applies so we include those too.
22113 | 
22114 |         // These are reserved by Ethereum and may be on all EVM-compatible chains.
22115 |         vm.assume(addr < address(0x1) || addr > address(0xff));
22116 | 
22117 |         // forgefmt: disable-start
22118 |         if (chainId == 10 || chainId == 420) {
22119 |             // https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/blob/eaa371a0184b56b7ca6d9eb9cb0a2b78b2ccd864/op-bindings/predeploys/addresses.go#L6-L21
22120 |             vm.assume(addr < address(0x4200000000000000000000000000000000000000) || addr > address(0x4200000000000000000000000000000000000800));
22121 |         } else if (chainId == 42161 || chainId == 421613) {
22122 |             // https://developer.arbitrum.io/useful-addresses#arbitrum-precompiles-l2-same-on-all-arb-chains
22123 |             vm.assume(addr < address(0x0000000000000000000000000000000000000064) || addr > address(0x0000000000000000000000000000000000000068));
22124 |         } else if (chainId == 43114 || chainId == 43113) {
22125 |             // https://github.com/ava-labs/subnet-evm/blob/47c03fd007ecaa6de2c52ea081596e0a88401f58/precompile/params.go#L18-L59
22126 |             vm.assume(addr < address(0x0100000000000000000000000000000000000000) || addr > address(0x01000000000000000000000000000000000000ff));
22127 |             vm.assume(addr < address(0x0200000000000000000000000000000000000000) || addr > address(0x02000000000000000000000000000000000000FF));
22128 |             vm.assume(addr < address(0x0300000000000000000000000000000000000000) || addr > address(0x03000000000000000000000000000000000000Ff));
22129 |         }
22130 |         // forgefmt: disable-end
22131 |     }
22132 | 
22133 |     function assumeNotForgeAddress(address addr) internal pure virtual {
22134 |         // vm, console, and Create2Deployer addresses
22135 |         vm.assume(
22136 |             addr != address(vm) && addr != 0x000000000000000000636F6e736F6c652e6c6f67
22137 |                 && addr != 0x4e59b44847b379578588920cA78FbF26c0B4956C
22138 |         );
22139 |     }
22140 | 
22141 |     function readEIP1559ScriptArtifact(string memory path)
22142 |         internal
22143 |         view
22144 |         virtual
22145 |         returns (EIP1559ScriptArtifact memory)
22146 |     {
22147 |         string memory data = vm.readFile(path);
22148 |         bytes memory parsedData = vm.parseJson(data);
22149 |         RawEIP1559ScriptArtifact memory rawArtifact = abi.decode(parsedData, (RawEIP1559ScriptArtifact));
22150 |         EIP1559ScriptArtifact memory artifact;
22151 |         artifact.libraries = rawArtifact.libraries;
22152 |         artifact.path = rawArtifact.path;
22153 |         artifact.timestamp = rawArtifact.timestamp;
22154 |         artifact.pending = rawArtifact.pending;
22155 |         artifact.txReturns = rawArtifact.txReturns;
22156 |         artifact.receipts = rawToConvertedReceipts(rawArtifact.receipts);
22157 |         artifact.transactions = rawToConvertedEIPTx1559s(rawArtifact.transactions);
22158 |         return artifact;
22159 |     }
22160 | 
22161 |     function rawToConvertedEIPTx1559s(RawTx1559[] memory rawTxs) internal pure virtual returns (Tx1559[] memory) {
22162 |         Tx1559[] memory txs = new Tx1559[](rawTxs.length);
22163 |         for (uint256 i; i < rawTxs.length; i++) {
22164 |             txs[i] = rawToConvertedEIPTx1559(rawTxs[i]);
22165 |         }
22166 |         return txs;
22167 |     }
22168 | 
22169 |     function rawToConvertedEIPTx1559(RawTx1559 memory rawTx) internal pure virtual returns (Tx1559 memory) {
22170 |         Tx1559 memory transaction;
22171 |         transaction.arguments = rawTx.arguments;
22172 |         transaction.contractName = rawTx.contractName;
22173 |         transaction.functionSig = rawTx.functionSig;
22174 |         transaction.hash = rawTx.hash;
22175 |         transaction.txDetail = rawToConvertedEIP1559Detail(rawTx.txDetail);
22176 |         transaction.opcode = rawTx.opcode;
22177 |         return transaction;
22178 |     }
22179 | 
22180 |     function rawToConvertedEIP1559Detail(RawTx1559Detail memory rawDetail)
22181 |         internal
22182 |         pure
22183 |         virtual
22184 |         returns (Tx1559Detail memory)
22185 |     {
22186 |         Tx1559Detail memory txDetail;
22187 |         txDetail.data = rawDetail.data;
22188 |         txDetail.from = rawDetail.from;
22189 |         txDetail.to = rawDetail.to;
22190 |         txDetail.nonce = _bytesToUint(rawDetail.nonce);
22191 |         txDetail.txType = _bytesToUint(rawDetail.txType);
22192 |         txDetail.value = _bytesToUint(rawDetail.value);
22193 |         txDetail.gas = _bytesToUint(rawDetail.gas);
22194 |         txDetail.accessList = rawDetail.accessList;
22195 |         return txDetail;
22196 |     }
22197 | 
22198 |     function readTx1559s(string memory path) internal view virtual returns (Tx1559[] memory) {
22199 |         string memory deployData = vm.readFile(path);
22200 |         bytes memory parsedDeployData = vm.parseJson(deployData, ".transactions");
22201 |         RawTx1559[] memory rawTxs = abi.decode(parsedDeployData, (RawTx1559[]));
22202 |         return rawToConvertedEIPTx1559s(rawTxs);
22203 |     }
22204 | 
22205 |     function readTx1559(string memory path, uint256 index) internal view virtual returns (Tx1559 memory) {
22206 |         string memory deployData = vm.readFile(path);
22207 |         string memory key = string(abi.encodePacked(".transactions[", vm.toString(index), "]"));
22208 |         bytes memory parsedDeployData = vm.parseJson(deployData, key);
22209 |         RawTx1559 memory rawTx = abi.decode(parsedDeployData, (RawTx1559));
22210 |         return rawToConvertedEIPTx1559(rawTx);
22211 |     }
22212 | 
22213 |     // Analogous to readTransactions, but for receipts.
22214 |     function readReceipts(string memory path) internal view virtual returns (Receipt[] memory) {
22215 |         string memory deployData = vm.readFile(path);
22216 |         bytes memory parsedDeployData = vm.parseJson(deployData, ".receipts");
22217 |         RawReceipt[] memory rawReceipts = abi.decode(parsedDeployData, (RawReceipt[]));
22218 |         return rawToConvertedReceipts(rawReceipts);
22219 |     }
22220 | 
22221 |     function readReceipt(string memory path, uint256 index) internal view virtual returns (Receipt memory) {
22222 |         string memory deployData = vm.readFile(path);
22223 |         string memory key = string(abi.encodePacked(".receipts[", vm.toString(index), "]"));
22224 |         bytes memory parsedDeployData = vm.parseJson(deployData, key);
22225 |         RawReceipt memory rawReceipt = abi.decode(parsedDeployData, (RawReceipt));
22226 |         return rawToConvertedReceipt(rawReceipt);
22227 |     }
22228 | 
22229 |     function rawToConvertedReceipts(RawReceipt[] memory rawReceipts) internal pure virtual returns (Receipt[] memory) {
22230 |         Receipt[] memory receipts = new Receipt[](rawReceipts.length);
22231 |         for (uint256 i; i < rawReceipts.length; i++) {
22232 |             receipts[i] = rawToConvertedReceipt(rawReceipts[i]);
22233 |         }
22234 |         return receipts;
22235 |     }
22236 | 
22237 |     function rawToConvertedReceipt(RawReceipt memory rawReceipt) internal pure virtual returns (Receipt memory) {
22238 |         Receipt memory receipt;
22239 |         receipt.blockHash = rawReceipt.blockHash;
22240 |         receipt.to = rawReceipt.to;
22241 |         receipt.from = rawReceipt.from;
22242 |         receipt.contractAddress = rawReceipt.contractAddress;
22243 |         receipt.effectiveGasPrice = _bytesToUint(rawReceipt.effectiveGasPrice);
22244 |         receipt.cumulativeGasUsed = _bytesToUint(rawReceipt.cumulativeGasUsed);
22245 |         receipt.gasUsed = _bytesToUint(rawReceipt.gasUsed);
22246 |         receipt.status = _bytesToUint(rawReceipt.status);
22247 |         receipt.transactionIndex = _bytesToUint(rawReceipt.transactionIndex);
22248 |         receipt.blockNumber = _bytesToUint(rawReceipt.blockNumber);
22249 |         receipt.logs = rawToConvertedReceiptLogs(rawReceipt.logs);
22250 |         receipt.logsBloom = rawReceipt.logsBloom;
22251 |         receipt.transactionHash = rawReceipt.transactionHash;
22252 |         return receipt;
22253 |     }
22254 | 
22255 |     function rawToConvertedReceiptLogs(RawReceiptLog[] memory rawLogs)
22256 |         internal
22257 |         pure
22258 |         virtual
22259 |         returns (ReceiptLog[] memory)
22260 |     {
22261 |         ReceiptLog[] memory logs = new ReceiptLog[](rawLogs.length);
22262 |         for (uint256 i; i < rawLogs.length; i++) {
22263 |             logs[i].logAddress = rawLogs[i].logAddress;
22264 |             logs[i].blockHash = rawLogs[i].blockHash;
22265 |             logs[i].blockNumber = _bytesToUint(rawLogs[i].blockNumber);
22266 |             logs[i].data = rawLogs[i].data;
22267 |             logs[i].logIndex = _bytesToUint(rawLogs[i].logIndex);
22268 |             logs[i].topics = rawLogs[i].topics;
22269 |             logs[i].transactionIndex = _bytesToUint(rawLogs[i].transactionIndex);
22270 |             logs[i].transactionLogIndex = _bytesToUint(rawLogs[i].transactionLogIndex);
22271 |             logs[i].removed = rawLogs[i].removed;
22272 |         }
22273 |         return logs;
22274 |     }
22275 | 
22276 |     // Deploy a contract by fetching the contract bytecode from
22277 |     // the artifacts directory
22278 |     // e.g. `deployCode(code, abi.encode(arg1,arg2,arg3))`
22279 |     function deployCode(string memory what, bytes memory args) internal virtual returns (address addr) {
22280 |         bytes memory bytecode = abi.encodePacked(vm.getCode(what), args);
22281 |         /// @solidity memory-safe-assembly
22282 |         assembly {
22283 |             addr := create(0, add(bytecode, 0x20), mload(bytecode))
22284 |         }
22285 | 
22286 |         require(addr != address(0), "StdCheats deployCode(string,bytes): Deployment failed.");
22287 |     }
22288 | 
22289 |     function deployCode(string memory what) internal virtual returns (address addr) {
22290 |         bytes memory bytecode = vm.getCode(what);
22291 |         /// @solidity memory-safe-assembly
22292 |         assembly {
22293 |             addr := create(0, add(bytecode, 0x20), mload(bytecode))
22294 |         }
22295 | 
22296 |         require(addr != address(0), "StdCheats deployCode(string): Deployment failed.");
22297 |     }
22298 | 
22299 |     /// @dev deploy contract with value on construction
22300 |     function deployCode(string memory what, bytes memory args, uint256 val) internal virtual returns (address addr) {
22301 |         bytes memory bytecode = abi.encodePacked(vm.getCode(what), args);
22302 |         /// @solidity memory-safe-assembly
22303 |         assembly {
22304 |             addr := create(val, add(bytecode, 0x20), mload(bytecode))
22305 |         }
22306 | 
22307 |         require(addr != address(0), "StdCheats deployCode(string,bytes,uint256): Deployment failed.");
22308 |     }
22309 | 
22310 |     function deployCode(string memory what, uint256 val) internal virtual returns (address addr) {
22311 |         bytes memory bytecode = vm.getCode(what);
22312 |         /// @solidity memory-safe-assembly
22313 |         assembly {
22314 |             addr := create(val, add(bytecode, 0x20), mload(bytecode))
22315 |         }
22316 | 
22317 |         require(addr != address(0), "StdCheats deployCode(string,uint256): Deployment failed.");
22318 |     }
22319 | 
22320 |     // creates a labeled address and the corresponding private key
22321 |     function makeAddrAndKey(string memory name) internal virtual returns (address addr, uint256 privateKey) {
22322 |         privateKey = uint256(keccak256(abi.encodePacked(name)));
22323 |         addr = vm.addr(privateKey);
22324 |         vm.label(addr, name);
22325 |     }
22326 | 
22327 |     // creates a labeled address
22328 |     function makeAddr(string memory name) internal virtual returns (address addr) {
22329 |         (addr,) = makeAddrAndKey(name);
22330 |     }
22331 | 
22332 |     // Destroys an account immediately, sending the balance to beneficiary.
22333 |     // Destroying means: balance will be zero, code will be empty, and nonce will be 0
22334 |     // This is similar to selfdestruct but not identical: selfdestruct destroys code and nonce
22335 |     // only after tx ends, this will run immediately.
22336 |     function destroyAccount(address who, address beneficiary) internal virtual {
22337 |         uint256 currBalance = who.balance;
22338 |         vm.etch(who, abi.encode());
22339 |         vm.deal(who, 0);
22340 |         vm.resetNonce(who);
22341 | 
22342 |         uint256 beneficiaryBalance = beneficiary.balance;
22343 |         vm.deal(beneficiary, currBalance + beneficiaryBalance);
22344 |     }
22345 | 
22346 |     // creates a struct containing both a labeled address and the corresponding private key
22347 |     function makeAccount(string memory name) internal virtual returns (Account memory account) {
22348 |         (account.addr, account.key) = makeAddrAndKey(name);
22349 |     }
22350 | 
22351 |     function deriveRememberKey(string memory mnemonic, uint32 index)
22352 |         internal
22353 |         virtual
22354 |         returns (address who, uint256 privateKey)
22355 |     {
22356 |         privateKey = vm.deriveKey(mnemonic, index);
22357 |         who = vm.rememberKey(privateKey);
22358 |     }
22359 | 
22360 |     function _bytesToUint(bytes memory b) private pure returns (uint256) {
22361 |         require(b.length <= 32, "StdCheats _bytesToUint(bytes): Bytes length exceeds 32.");
22362 |         return abi.decode(abi.encodePacked(new bytes(32 - b.length), b), (uint256));
22363 |     }
22364 | 
22365 |     function isFork() internal view virtual returns (bool status) {
22366 |         try vm.activeFork() {
22367 |             status = true;
22368 |         } catch (bytes memory) {}
22369 |     }
22370 | 
22371 |     modifier skipWhenForking() {
22372 |         if (!isFork()) {
22373 |             _;
22374 |         }
22375 |     }
22376 | 
22377 |     modifier skipWhenNotForking() {
22378 |         if (isFork()) {
22379 |             _;
22380 |         }
22381 |     }
22382 | 
22383 |     modifier noGasMetering() {
22384 |         vm.pauseGasMetering();
22385 |         // To prevent turning gas monitoring back on with nested functions that use this modifier,
22386 |         // we check if gasMetering started in the off position. If it did, we don't want to turn
22387 |         // it back on until we exit the top level function that used the modifier
22388 |         //
22389 |         // i.e. funcA() noGasMetering { funcB() }, where funcB has noGasMetering as well.
22390 |         // funcA will have `gasStartedOff` as false, funcB will have it as true,
22391 |         // so we only turn metering back on at the end of the funcA
22392 |         bool gasStartedOff = gasMeteringOff;
22393 |         gasMeteringOff = true;
22394 | 
22395 |         _;
22396 | 
22397 |         // if gas metering was on when this modifier was called, turn it back on at the end
22398 |         if (!gasStartedOff) {
22399 |             gasMeteringOff = false;
22400 |             vm.resumeGasMetering();
22401 |         }
22402 |     }
22403 | 
22404 |     // We use this complex approach of `_viewChainId` and `_pureChainId` to ensure there are no
22405 |     // compiler warnings when accessing chain ID in any solidity version supported by forge-std. We
22406 |     // can't simply access the chain ID in a normal view or pure function because the solc View Pure
22407 |     // Checker changed `chainid` from pure to view in 0.8.0.
22408 |     function _viewChainId() private view returns (uint256 chainId) {
22409 |         // Assembly required since `block.chainid` was introduced in 0.8.0.
22410 |         assembly {
22411 |             chainId := chainid()
22412 |         }
22413 | 
22414 |         address(this); // Silence warnings in older Solc versions.
22415 |     }
22416 | 
22417 |     function _pureChainId() private pure returns (uint256 chainId) {
22418 |         function() internal view returns (uint256) fnIn = _viewChainId;
22419 |         function() internal pure returns (uint256) pureChainId;
22420 |         assembly {
22421 |             pureChainId := fnIn
22422 |         }
22423 |         chainId = pureChainId();
22424 |     }
22425 | }
22426 | 
22427 | // Wrappers around cheatcodes to avoid footguns
22428 | abstract contract StdCheats is StdCheatsSafe {
22429 |     using stdStorage for StdStorage;
22430 | 
22431 |     StdStorage private stdstore;
22432 |     Vm private constant vm = Vm(address(uint160(uint256(keccak256("hevm cheat code")))));
22433 |     address private constant CONSOLE2_ADDRESS = 0x000000000000000000636F6e736F6c652e6c6f67;
22434 | 
22435 |     // Skip forward or rewind time by the specified number of seconds
22436 |     function skip(uint256 time) internal virtual {
22437 |         vm.warp(block.timestamp + time);
22438 |     }
22439 | 
22440 |     function rewind(uint256 time) internal virtual {
22441 |         vm.warp(block.timestamp - time);
22442 |     }
22443 | 
22444 |     // Setup a prank from an address that has some ether
22445 |     function hoax(address msgSender) internal virtual {
22446 |         vm.deal(msgSender, 1 << 128);
22447 |         vm.prank(msgSender);
22448 |     }
22449 | 
22450 |     function hoax(address msgSender, uint256 give) internal virtual {
22451 |         vm.deal(msgSender, give);
22452 |         vm.prank(msgSender);
22453 |     }
22454 | 
22455 |     function hoax(address msgSender, address origin) internal virtual {
22456 |         vm.deal(msgSender, 1 << 128);
22457 |         vm.prank(msgSender, origin);
22458 |     }
22459 | 
22460 |     function hoax(address msgSender, address origin, uint256 give) internal virtual {
22461 |         vm.deal(msgSender, give);
22462 |         vm.prank(msgSender, origin);
22463 |     }
22464 | 
22465 |     // Start perpetual prank from an address that has some ether
22466 |     function startHoax(address msgSender) internal virtual {
22467 |         vm.deal(msgSender, 1 << 128);
22468 |         vm.startPrank(msgSender);
22469 |     }
22470 | 
22471 |     function startHoax(address msgSender, uint256 give) internal virtual {
22472 |         vm.deal(msgSender, give);
22473 |         vm.startPrank(msgSender);
22474 |     }
22475 | 
22476 |     // Start perpetual prank from an address that has some ether
22477 |     // tx.origin is set to the origin parameter
22478 |     function startHoax(address msgSender, address origin) internal virtual {
22479 |         vm.deal(msgSender, 1 << 128);
22480 |         vm.startPrank(msgSender, origin);
22481 |     }
22482 | 
22483 |     function startHoax(address msgSender, address origin, uint256 give) internal virtual {
22484 |         vm.deal(msgSender, give);
22485 |         vm.startPrank(msgSender, origin);
22486 |     }
22487 | 
22488 |     function changePrank(address msgSender) internal virtual {
22489 |         console2_log_StdCheats("changePrank is deprecated. Please use vm.startPrank instead.");
22490 |         vm.stopPrank();
22491 |         vm.startPrank(msgSender);
22492 |     }
22493 | 
22494 |     function changePrank(address msgSender, address txOrigin) internal virtual {
22495 |         vm.stopPrank();
22496 |         vm.startPrank(msgSender, txOrigin);
22497 |     }
22498 | 
22499 |     // The same as Vm's `deal`
22500 |     // Use the alternative signature for ERC20 tokens
22501 |     function deal(address to, uint256 give) internal virtual {
22502 |         vm.deal(to, give);
22503 |     }
22504 | 
22505 |     // Set the balance of an account for any ERC20 token
22506 |     // Use the alternative signature to update `totalSupply`
22507 |     function deal(address token, address to, uint256 give) internal virtual {
22508 |         deal(token, to, give, false);
22509 |     }
22510 | 
22511 |     // Set the balance of an account for any ERC1155 token
22512 |     // Use the alternative signature to update `totalSupply`
22513 |     function dealERC1155(address token, address to, uint256 id, uint256 give) internal virtual {
22514 |         dealERC1155(token, to, id, give, false);
22515 |     }
22516 | 
22517 |     function deal(address token, address to, uint256 give, bool adjust) internal virtual {
22518 |         // get current balance
22519 |         (, bytes memory balData) = token.staticcall(abi.encodeWithSelector(0x70a08231, to));
22520 |         uint256 prevBal = abi.decode(balData, (uint256));
22521 | 
22522 |         // update balance
22523 |         stdstore.target(token).sig(0x70a08231).with_key(to).checked_write(give);
22524 | 
22525 |         // update total supply
22526 |         if (adjust) {
22527 |             (, bytes memory totSupData) = token.staticcall(abi.encodeWithSelector(0x18160ddd));
22528 |             uint256 totSup = abi.decode(totSupData, (uint256));
22529 |             if (give < prevBal) {
22530 |                 totSup -= (prevBal - give);
22531 |             } else {
22532 |                 totSup += (give - prevBal);
22533 |             }
22534 |             stdstore.target(token).sig(0x18160ddd).checked_write(totSup);
22535 |         }
22536 |     }
22537 | 
22538 |     function dealERC1155(address token, address to, uint256 id, uint256 give, bool adjust) internal virtual {
22539 |         // get current balance
22540 |         (, bytes memory balData) = token.staticcall(abi.encodeWithSelector(0x00fdd58e, to, id));
22541 |         uint256 prevBal = abi.decode(balData, (uint256));
22542 | 
22543 |         // update balance
22544 |         stdstore.target(token).sig(0x00fdd58e).with_key(to).with_key(id).checked_write(give);
22545 | 
22546 |         // update total supply
22547 |         if (adjust) {
22548 |             (, bytes memory totSupData) = token.staticcall(abi.encodeWithSelector(0xbd85b039, id));
22549 |             require(
22550 |                 totSupData.length != 0,
22551 |                 "StdCheats deal(address,address,uint,uint,bool): target contract is not ERC1155Supply."
22552 |             );
22553 |             uint256 totSup = abi.decode(totSupData, (uint256));
22554 |             if (give < prevBal) {
22555 |                 totSup -= (prevBal - give);
22556 |             } else {
22557 |                 totSup += (give - prevBal);
22558 |             }
22559 |             stdstore.target(token).sig(0xbd85b039).with_key(id).checked_write(totSup);
22560 |         }
22561 |     }
22562 | 
22563 |     function dealERC721(address token, address to, uint256 id) internal virtual {
22564 |         // check if token id is already minted and the actual owner.
22565 |         (bool successMinted, bytes memory ownerData) = token.staticcall(abi.encodeWithSelector(0x6352211e, id));
22566 |         require(successMinted, "StdCheats deal(address,address,uint,bool): id not minted.");
22567 | 
22568 |         // get owner current balance
22569 |         (, bytes memory fromBalData) =
22570 |             token.staticcall(abi.encodeWithSelector(0x70a08231, abi.decode(ownerData, (address))));
22571 |         uint256 fromPrevBal = abi.decode(fromBalData, (uint256));
22572 | 
22573 |         // get new user current balance
22574 |         (, bytes memory toBalData) = token.staticcall(abi.encodeWithSelector(0x70a08231, to));
22575 |         uint256 toPrevBal = abi.decode(toBalData, (uint256));
22576 | 
22577 |         // update balances
22578 |         stdstore.target(token).sig(0x70a08231).with_key(abi.decode(ownerData, (address))).checked_write(--fromPrevBal);
22579 |         stdstore.target(token).sig(0x70a08231).with_key(to).checked_write(++toPrevBal);
22580 | 
22581 |         // update owner
22582 |         stdstore.target(token).sig(0x6352211e).with_key(id).checked_write(to);
22583 |     }
22584 | 
22585 |     function deployCodeTo(string memory what, address where) internal virtual {
22586 |         deployCodeTo(what, "", 0, where);
22587 |     }
22588 | 
22589 |     function deployCodeTo(string memory what, bytes memory args, address where) internal virtual {
22590 |         deployCodeTo(what, args, 0, where);
22591 |     }
22592 | 
22593 |     function deployCodeTo(string memory what, bytes memory args, uint256 value, address where) internal virtual {
22594 |         bytes memory creationCode = vm.getCode(what);
22595 |         vm.etch(where, abi.encodePacked(creationCode, args));
22596 |         (bool success, bytes memory runtimeBytecode) = where.call{value: value}("");
22597 |         require(success, "StdCheats deployCodeTo(string,bytes,uint256,address): Failed to create runtime bytecode.");
22598 |         vm.etch(where, runtimeBytecode);
22599 |     }
22600 | 
22601 |     // Used to prevent the compilation of console, which shortens the compilation time when console is not used elsewhere.
22602 |     function console2_log_StdCheats(string memory p0) private view {
22603 |         (bool status,) = address(CONSOLE2_ADDRESS).staticcall(abi.encodeWithSignature("log(string)", p0));
22604 |         status;
22605 |     }
22606 | }

22614 |     constructor(address implementation_, address initialOwner) UpgradeableBeacon(implementation_, initialOwner) {}
22615 | 
22616 |     function getImplementation(bytes4 selector) external view returns(address) {

22618 |     }

22622 | // lib/ucs-contracts/src/dictionary/base/DictionaryBase.sol
22623 | 
22624 | /**
22625 |     @title ERC7546: Dictionary Base Contract
22626 |  */
22627 | abstract contract DictionaryBase is IDictionaryCore, IVerifiable {
22628 |     mapping(bytes4 selector => address implementation) internal functions;
22629 |     bytes4[] internal functionSelectorList;
22630 |     address internal facade;
22631 | 
22632 |     function getImplementation(bytes4 selector) external view returns(address) {
22633 |         address _impl = functions[selector];
22634 |         if (_impl != address(0)) return _impl;
22635 |         _impl = functions[bytes4(0)];
22636 |         if (_impl != address(0)) return _impl;
22637 |         revert ImplementationNotFound(selector);
22638 |     }
22639 | 
22640 |     function implementation() external view returns(address) {
22641 |         return facade;
22642 |     }
22643 | 
22644 |     /**
22645 |      * @param interfaceId equals to the function selector
22646 |      */
22647 |     function supportsInterface(bytes4 interfaceId) external view returns(bool) {
22648 |         return functions[interfaceId] != address(0);
22649 |     }
22650 | 
22651 |     /**
22652 |      * @notice Specification 3.1.1.2
22653 |      */
22654 |     function supportsInterfaces() external view returns(bytes4[] memory) {
22655 |         return functionSelectorList;
22656 |     }
22657 | 
22658 |     //////  INTERNAL FUNCTIONS  ///////////////////////////
22659 | 
22660 |     function _setImplementation(bytes4 _selector, address _impl) internal virtual {
22661 |         if (_impl == address(0)) {
22662 |             __deleteImplementation(_selector);
22663 |             return;
22664 |         }
22665 | 
22666 |         __updateFunctionSelectorList(_selector);
22667 |         __updateImplementation(_selector, _impl);
22668 |     }
22669 | 
22670 |     function __deleteImplementation(bytes4 _selector) internal virtual {
22671 |         for (uint i; i < functionSelectorList.length; ++i) {
22672 |             if (functionSelectorList[i] == _selector) {
22673 |                 delete functionSelectorList[i];
22674 |                 break;
22675 |             }
22676 |         }
22677 |         delete functions[_selector];
22678 |         emit ImplementationDeleted(_selector);
22679 |     }
22680 | 
22681 |     function __updateFunctionSelectorList(bytes4 _selector) internal virtual {
22682 |         if (__existsSameSelector(_selector)) return;
22683 |         functionSelectorList.push(_selector);
22684 |         emit NewFunctionSelectorAdded(_selector);
22685 |     }
22686 | 
22687 |     function __existsSameSelector(bytes4 _selector) internal virtual returns(bool) {
22688 |         for (uint i; i < functionSelectorList.length; ++i) {
22689 |             if (functionSelectorList[i] == _selector) return true;
22690 |         }
22691 |         return false;
22692 |     }
22693 | 
22694 |     function __updateImplementation(bytes4 _selector, address _impl) internal virtual {
22695 |         if (_impl.code.length == 0) revert InvalidImplementation(_impl);
22696 |         functions[_selector] = _impl;
22697 |         emit ImplementationUpgraded(_selector, _impl);
22698 |     }
22699 | 
22700 |     function _upgradeFacade(address _newFacade) internal virtual {
22701 |         facade = _newFacade;
22702 |         emit FacadeUpgraded(_newFacade);
22703 |     }
22704 | 
22705 | }
22706 | 
22707 | // lib/ucs-contracts/src/dictionary/interfaces/IDictionary.sol
22708 | 
22709 | interface IDictionary is IDictionaryCore, IVerifiable {
22710 |     /// @dev from IDictionaryCore
22711 |     // event NewFunctionSelectorAdded(bytes4 newSelector);
22712 |     // event ImplementationUpgraded(bytes4 selector, address implementation);
22713 |     /// @dev from IVerifiable
22714 |     // event FacadeUpgraded(address newFacade);
22715 | 
22716 |     /// @dev from IDictionaryCore
22717 |     // error ImplementationNotFound(bytes4 selector);
22718 |     // error InvalidImplementation(address implementation);
22719 | 
22720 |     /// @dev from IDictionaryCore
22721 |     // function getImplementation(bytes4 selector) external view returns(address);
22722 |     /// @dev from IVerifiable
22723 |     // function implementation() external view returns(address);
22724 |     // function supportsInterface(bytes4 interfaceId) external view returns (bool);
22725 |     // function supportsInterfaces() external view returns(bytes4[] memory);
22726 |     function setImplementation(bytes4 functionSelector, address implementation) external;
22727 |     function upgradeFacade(address newFacade) external;
22728 | }

22734 |         Initialization.shouldNotBeCompleted();
22735 |         _;
22736 |         Initialization.willBeCompleted();
22737 |     }
22738 | 
22739 |     modifier onlyAdmin() {
22740 |         MsgSender.shouldBeMember();
22741 |         _;
22742 |     }
22743 | }

22785 | 
22786 | // lib/forge-std/src/StdUtils.sol
22787 | 
22788 | abstract contract StdUtils {
22789 |     /*//////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
22790 |                                      CONSTANTS
22791 |     //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////*/
22792 | 
22793 |     IMulticall3 private constant multicall = IMulticall3(0xcA11bde05977b3631167028862bE2a173976CA11);
22794 |     VmSafe private constant vm = VmSafe(address(uint160(uint256(keccak256("hevm cheat code")))));
22795 |     address private constant CONSOLE2_ADDRESS = 0x000000000000000000636F6e736F6c652e6c6f67;
22796 |     uint256 private constant INT256_MIN_ABS =
22797 |         57896044618658097711785492504343953926634992332820282019728792003956564819968;
22798 |     uint256 private constant SECP256K1_ORDER =
22799 |         115792089237316195423570985008687907852837564279074904382605163141518161494337;
22800 |     uint256 private constant UINT256_MAX =
22801 |         115792089237316195423570985008687907853269984665640564039457584007913129639935;
22802 | 
22803 |     // Used by default when deploying with create2, https://github.com/Arachnid/deterministic-deployment-proxy.
22804 |     address private constant CREATE2_FACTORY = 0x4e59b44847b379578588920cA78FbF26c0B4956C;
22805 | 
22806 |     /*//////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
22807 |                                  INTERNAL FUNCTIONS
22808 |     //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////*/
22809 | 
22810 |     function _bound(uint256 x, uint256 min, uint256 max) internal pure virtual returns (uint256 result) {
22811 |         require(min <= max, "StdUtils bound(uint256,uint256,uint256): Max is less than min.");
22812 |         // If x is between min and max, return x directly. This is to ensure that dictionary values
22813 |         // do not get shifted if the min is nonzero. More info: https://github.com/foundry-rs/forge-std/issues/188
22814 |         if (x >= min && x <= max) return x;
22815 | 
22816 |         uint256 size = max - min + 1;
22817 | 
22818 |         // If the value is 0, 1, 2, 3, wrap that to min, min+1, min+2, min+3. Similarly for the UINT256_MAX side.
22819 |         // This helps ensure coverage of the min/max values.
22820 |         if (x <= 3 && size > x) return min + x;
22821 |         if (x >= UINT256_MAX - 3 && size > UINT256_MAX - x) return max - (UINT256_MAX - x);
22822 | 
22823 |         // Otherwise, wrap x into the range [min, max], i.e. the range is inclusive.
22824 |         if (x > max) {
22825 |             uint256 diff = x - max;
22826 |             uint256 rem = diff % size;
22827 |             if (rem == 0) return max;
22828 |             result = min + rem - 1;
22829 |         } else if (x < min) {
22830 |             uint256 diff = min - x;
22831 |             uint256 rem = diff % size;
22832 |             if (rem == 0) return min;
22833 |             result = max - rem + 1;
22834 |         }
22835 |     }
22836 | 
22837 |     function bound(uint256 x, uint256 min, uint256 max) internal pure virtual returns (uint256 result) {
22838 |         result = _bound(x, min, max);
22839 |         console2_log_StdUtils("Bound result", result);
22840 |     }
22841 | 
22842 |     function _bound(int256 x, int256 min, int256 max) internal pure virtual returns (int256 result) {
22843 |         require(min <= max, "StdUtils bound(int256,int256,int256): Max is less than min.");
22844 | 
22845 |         // Shifting all int256 values to uint256 to use _bound function. The range of two types are:
22846 |         // int256 : -(2**255) ~ (2**255 - 1)
22847 |         // uint256:     0     ~ (2**256 - 1)
22848 |         // So, add 2**255, INT256_MIN_ABS to the integer values.
22849 |         //
22850 |         // If the given integer value is -2**255, we cannot use `-uint256(-x)` because of the overflow.
22851 |         // So, use `~uint256(x) + 1` instead.
22852 |         uint256 _x = x < 0 ? (INT256_MIN_ABS - ~uint256(x) - 1) : (uint256(x) + INT256_MIN_ABS);
22853 |         uint256 _min = min < 0 ? (INT256_MIN_ABS - ~uint256(min) - 1) : (uint256(min) + INT256_MIN_ABS);
22854 |         uint256 _max = max < 0 ? (INT256_MIN_ABS - ~uint256(max) - 1) : (uint256(max) + INT256_MIN_ABS);
22855 | 
22856 |         uint256 y = _bound(_x, _min, _max);
22857 | 
22858 |         // To move it back to int256 value, subtract INT256_MIN_ABS at here.
22859 |         result = y < INT256_MIN_ABS ? int256(~(INT256_MIN_ABS - y) + 1) : int256(y - INT256_MIN_ABS);
22860 |     }
22861 | 
22862 |     function bound(int256 x, int256 min, int256 max) internal pure virtual returns (int256 result) {
22863 |         result = _bound(x, min, max);
22864 |         console2_log_StdUtils("Bound result", vm.toString(result));
22865 |     }
22866 | 
22867 |     function boundPrivateKey(uint256 privateKey) internal pure virtual returns (uint256 result) {
22868 |         result = _bound(privateKey, 1, SECP256K1_ORDER - 1);
22869 |     }
22870 | 
22871 |     function bytesToUint(bytes memory b) internal pure virtual returns (uint256) {
22872 |         require(b.length <= 32, "StdUtils bytesToUint(bytes): Bytes length exceeds 32.");
22873 |         return abi.decode(abi.encodePacked(new bytes(32 - b.length), b), (uint256));
22874 |     }
22875 | 
22876 |     /// @dev Compute the address a contract will be deployed at for a given deployer address and nonce
22877 |     /// @notice adapted from Solmate implementation (https://github.com/Rari-Capital/solmate/blob/main/src/utils/LibRLP.sol)
22878 |     function computeCreateAddress(address deployer, uint256 nonce) internal pure virtual returns (address) {
22879 |         console2_log_StdUtils("computeCreateAddress is deprecated. Please use vm.computeCreateAddress instead.");
22880 |         return vm.computeCreateAddress(deployer, nonce);
22881 |     }
22882 | 
22883 |     function computeCreate2Address(bytes32 salt, bytes32 initcodeHash, address deployer)
22884 |         internal
22885 |         pure
22886 |         virtual
22887 |         returns (address)
22888 |     {
22889 |         console2_log_StdUtils("computeCreate2Address is deprecated. Please use vm.computeCreate2Address instead.");
22890 |         return vm.computeCreate2Address(salt, initcodeHash, deployer);
22891 |     }
22892 | 
22893 |     /// @dev returns the address of a contract created with CREATE2 using the default CREATE2 deployer
22894 |     function computeCreate2Address(bytes32 salt, bytes32 initCodeHash) internal pure returns (address) {
22895 |         console2_log_StdUtils("computeCreate2Address is deprecated. Please use vm.computeCreate2Address instead.");
22896 |         return vm.computeCreate2Address(salt, initCodeHash);
22897 |     }
22898 | 
22899 |     /// @dev returns an initialized mock ERC20 contract
22900 |     function deployMockERC20(string memory name, string memory symbol, uint8 decimals)
22901 |         internal
22902 |         returns (MockERC20 mock)
22903 |     {
22904 |         mock = new MockERC20();
22905 |         mock.initialize(name, symbol, decimals);
22906 |     }
22907 | 
22908 |     /// @dev returns an initialized mock ERC721 contract
22909 |     function deployMockERC721(string memory name, string memory symbol) internal returns (MockERC721 mock) {
22910 |         mock = new MockERC721();
22911 |         mock.initialize(name, symbol);
22912 |     }
22913 | 
22914 |     /// @dev returns the hash of the init code (creation code + no args) used in CREATE2 with no constructor arguments
22915 |     /// @param creationCode the creation code of a contract C, as returned by type(C).creationCode
22916 |     function hashInitCode(bytes memory creationCode) internal pure returns (bytes32) {
22917 |         return hashInitCode(creationCode, "");
22918 |     }
22919 | 
22920 |     /// @dev returns the hash of the init code (creation code + ABI-encoded args) used in CREATE2
22921 |     /// @param creationCode the creation code of a contract C, as returned by type(C).creationCode
22922 |     /// @param args the ABI-encoded arguments to the constructor of C
22923 |     function hashInitCode(bytes memory creationCode, bytes memory args) internal pure returns (bytes32) {
22924 |         return keccak256(abi.encodePacked(creationCode, args));
22925 |     }
22926 | 
22927 |     // Performs a single call with Multicall3 to query the ERC-20 token balances of the given addresses.
22928 |     function getTokenBalances(address token, address[] memory addresses)
22929 |         internal
22930 |         virtual
22931 |         returns (uint256[] memory balances)
22932 |     {
22933 |         uint256 tokenCodeSize;
22934 |         assembly {
22935 |             tokenCodeSize := extcodesize(token)
22936 |         }
22937 |         require(tokenCodeSize > 0, "StdUtils getTokenBalances(address,address[]): Token address is not a contract.");
22938 | 
22939 |         // ABI encode the aggregate call to Multicall3.
22940 |         uint256 length = addresses.length;
22941 |         IMulticall3.Call[] memory calls = new IMulticall3.Call[](length);
22942 |         for (uint256 i = 0; i < length; ++i) {
22943 |             // 0x70a08231 = bytes4("balanceOf(address)"))
22944 |             calls[i] = IMulticall3.Call({target: token, callData: abi.encodeWithSelector(0x70a08231, (addresses[i]))});
22945 |         }
22946 | 
22947 |         // Make the aggregate call.
22948 |         (, bytes[] memory returnData) = multicall.aggregate(calls);
22949 | 
22950 |         // ABI decode the return data and return the balances.
22951 |         balances = new uint256[](length);
22952 |         for (uint256 i = 0; i < length; ++i) {
22953 |             balances[i] = abi.decode(returnData[i], (uint256));
22954 |         }
22955 |     }
22956 | 
22957 |     /*//////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
22958 |                                  PRIVATE FUNCTIONS
22959 |     //////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////*/
22960 | 
22961 |     function addressFromLast20Bytes(bytes32 bytesValue) private pure returns (address) {
22962 |         return address(uint160(uint256(bytesValue)));
22963 |     }
22964 | 
22965 |     // This section is used to prevent the compilation of console, which shortens the compilation time when console is
22966 |     // not used elsewhere. We also trick the compiler into letting us make the console log methods as `pure` to avoid
22967 |     // any breaking changes to function signatures.
22968 |     function _castLogPayloadViewToPure(function(bytes memory) internal view fnIn)
22969 |         internal
22970 |         pure
22971 |         returns (function(bytes memory) internal pure fnOut)
22972 |     {
22973 |         assembly {
22974 |             fnOut := fnIn
22975 |         }
22976 |     }
22977 | 
22978 |     function _sendLogPayload(bytes memory payload) internal pure {
22979 |         _castLogPayloadViewToPure(_sendLogPayloadView)(payload);
22980 |     }
22981 | 
22982 |     function _sendLogPayloadView(bytes memory payload) private view {
22983 |         uint256 payloadLength = payload.length;
22984 |         address consoleAddress = CONSOLE2_ADDRESS;
22985 |         /// @solidity memory-safe-assembly
22986 |         assembly {
22987 |             let payloadStart := add(payload, 32)
22988 |             let r := staticcall(gas(), consoleAddress, payloadStart, payloadLength, 0, 0)
22989 |         }
22990 |     }
22991 | 
22992 |     function console2_log_StdUtils(string memory p0) private pure {
22993 |         _sendLogPayload(abi.encodeWithSignature("log(string)", p0));
22994 |     }
22995 | 
22996 |     function console2_log_StdUtils(string memory p0, uint256 p1) private pure {
22997 |         _sendLogPayload(abi.encodeWithSignature("log(string,uint256)", p0, p1));
22998 |     }
22999 | 
23000 |     function console2_log_StdUtils(string memory p0, string memory p1) private pure {
23001 |         _sendLogPayload(abi.encodeWithSignature("log(string,string)", p0, p1));
23002 |     }
23003 | }
23004 | 
23005 | // lib/ucs-contracts/src/dictionary/ImmutableDictionary.sol
23006 | 
23007 | /**
23008 |     @title ERC7546: Immutable Dictionary Contract
23009 |  */
23010 | contract ImmutableDictionary is DictionaryBase {
23011 |     struct Function {
23012 |         bytes4 selector;
23013 |         address implementation;
23014 |     }
23015 | 
23016 |     error SelectorAlreadyExists(bytes4 selector);
23017 | 
23018 |     constructor(Function[] memory _functions, address _facade) {
23019 |         for (uint i; i < _functions.length; ++i) {
23020 |             _setImplementation(_functions[i].selector, _functions[i].implementation);
23021 |         }
23022 |         _upgradeFacade(_facade);
23023 |     }
23024 | 
23025 |     function __existsSameSelector(bytes4 _selector) internal override returns(bool) {
23026 |         for (uint i; i < functionSelectorList.length; ++i) {
23027 |             if (functionSelectorList[i] == _selector) revert SelectorAlreadyExists(_selector);
23028 |         }
23029 |         return false;
23030 |     }
23031 | 
23032 | }

23038 |  */
23039 | contract Dictionary_0 is DictionaryBase, Ownable, IDictionary {

23052 | // lib/ucs-contracts/src/proxy/ProxyUtils.sol
23053 | 
23054 | /// @dev Library version has been tested with version 5.0.0.
23055 | 
23056 | /**
23057 |     @dev This ERC7546 helper constant & methods
23058 |  */
23059 | library ProxyUtils {
23060 |     /**
23061 |      * @dev The storage slot of the Dictionary contract which defines the dynamic implementations for this proxy.
23062 |      * This slot is the keccak-256 hash of "erc7546.proxy.dictionary" subtracted by 1.
23063 |      */
23064 |     // solhint-disable-next-line private-vars-leading-underscore
23065 |     bytes32 internal constant DICTIONARY_SLOT = 0x267691be3525af8a813d30db0c9e2bad08f63baecf6dceb85e2cf3676cff56f4;
23066 | 
23067 |     /**
23068 |      * @dev Returns the current dictionary address.
23069 |      */
23070 |     function getDictionary() internal view returns (address) {
23071 |         return StorageSlot.getAddressSlot(DICTIONARY_SLOT).value;
23072 |     }
23073 | 
23074 |     /**
23075 |      * Change the dictionary and trigger a setup call if data is nonempty.
23076 |      * This function is payable only if the setup call is performed, otherwise `msg.value` is rejected
23077 |      * to avoid stuck value in the contract.
23078 |      *
23079 |      * Emits an {IERC7546-DictionaryUpgraded} event.
23080 |      */
23081 |     function upgradeDictionaryToAndCall(address newDictionary, bytes memory data) internal {
23082 |         _setDictionary(newDictionary);
23083 |         emit IProxy.DictionaryUpgraded(newDictionary);
23084 | 
23085 |         if (data.length > 0) {
23086 |             Address.functionDelegateCall(IDictionary(newDictionary).getImplementation(bytes4(data)), data);
23087 |         } else {
23088 |             _checkNonPayable();
23089 |         }
23090 |     }
23091 | 
23092 |     /**
23093 |      * @dev Stores a new dictionary in the EIP0000 dictionary slot.
23094 |      */
23095 |     function _setDictionary(address newDictionary) private {
23096 |         if (newDictionary.code.length == 0) {
23097 |             // revert ERC7546InvalidDictionary(newDictionary);
23098 |             revert("NON_CONTRACT");
23099 |         }
23100 |         StorageSlot.getAddressSlot(DICTIONARY_SLOT).value = newDictionary;
23101 |     }
23102 | 
23103 |     function _checkNonPayable() private {
23104 |         if (msg.value > 0) {
23105 |             revert ERC1967Utils.ERC1967NonPayable();
23106 |         }
23107 |     }
23108 | 
23109 |     function setBeacon(address newBeacon) internal {
23110 |         StorageSlot.getAddressSlot(ERC1967Utils.BEACON_SLOT).value = newBeacon;
23111 |     }
23112 | 
23113 | }
23114 | 
23115 | // src/std/functions/GetFunctions.sol
23116 | 
23117 | /** < MC Standard Function >
23118 |  *  @title GetFunctions
23119 |  *  @custom:version v0.1.0
23120 |  *  @custom:schema none
23121 |  */
23122 | contract GetFunctions {
23123 |     /// DO NOT USE STORAGE DIRECTLY !!!
23124 |     struct Function {
23125 |         bytes4 selector;
23126 |         address implementation;
23127 |     }
23128 | 
23129 |     function getFunctions() external view returns(Function[] memory) {
23130 |         IDictionary dictionary = IDictionary(ProxyUtils.getDictionary());
23131 |         bytes4[] memory selectors = dictionary.supportsInterfaces();
23132 |         Function[] memory deps = new Function[](selectors.length);
23133 |         for (uint i; i < selectors.length; ++i) {
23134 |             deps[i].selector = selectors[i];
23135 |             deps[i].implementation = dictionary.getImplementation(selectors[i]);
23136 |         }
23137 |         return deps;
23138 |     }
23139 | }
23140 | 
23141 | // lib/ucs-contracts/src/proxy/Proxy.sol
23142 | 
23143 | /// @dev Library version has been tested with version 5.0.0.
23144 | 
23145 | /**
23146 |  * @title ERC7546: Proxy Contract
23147 |  */
23148 | contract Proxy_1 is Proxy_0 {
23149 |     constructor(address dictionary, bytes memory _data) payable {
23150 |         ProxyUtils.upgradeDictionaryToAndCall(dictionary, _data);
23151 |         ProxyUtils.setBeacon(dictionary);
23152 |     }
23153 | 
23154 |     /**
23155 |      * @dev Return the implementation address corresponding to the function selector.
23156 |      */
23157 |     function _implementation() internal view override returns (address) {
23158 |         return IDictionary(ProxyUtils.getDictionary()).getImplementation(msg.sig);
23159 |     }
23160 | 
23161 | }

23198 | // src/std/functions/Clone.sol
23199 | 
23200 | /** < MC Standard Function >
23201 |  *  @title Clone
23202 |  *  @custom:version v0.1.0
23203 |  *  @custom:schema none
23204 |  */
23205 | contract Clone {
23206 |     /// DO NOT USE STORAGE DIRECTLY !!!
23207 | 
23208 |     function clone(bytes calldata initData) external returns(address proxy) {
23209 |         proxy = ProxyCreator.create(ProxyUtils.getDictionary(), initData);
23210 |     }
23211 | 
23212 | }

23288 | // src/devkit/core/Bundle.sol
23289 |

23291 |     Support Methods
23292 | -----------------------*/
23293 | 
23294 | // Validation
23295 | 
23296 | // Core Type
23297 | 
23298 | ///////////////////////////////////////////
23299 | //  🗂️ Bundle   ///////////////////////////
23300 |     using BundleLib for Bundle global;
23301 |     using Tracer for Bundle global;
23302 |     using Inspector for Bundle global;
23303 |     using TypeGuard for Bundle global;
23304 | ///////////////////////////////////////////
23305 | struct Bundle {
23306 |     string name;
23307 |     Function[] functions;
23308 |     address facade;
23309 |     TypeStatus status;
23310 | }
23311 | library BundleLib {
23312 |     /**--------------------
23313 |         📛 Assign Name
23314 |     ----------------------*/
23315 |     function assignName(Bundle storage bundle, string memory name) internal returns(Bundle storage) {
23316 |         uint pid = bundle.startProcess("assignName", param_27(name));
23317 |         Validator.MUST_NotEmptyName(name);
23318 |         bundle.startBuilding();
23319 |         bundle.name = name;
23320 |         bundle.finishBuilding();
23321 |         return bundle.finishProcess(pid);
23322 |     }
23323 | 
23324 |     /**-------------------------
23325 |         🧩 Push Function(s)
23326 |     ---------------------------*/
23327 |     function pushFunction(Bundle storage bundle, Function storage func) internal returns(Bundle storage) {
23328 |         uint pid = bundle.startProcess("pushFunction", param_6(func));
23329 |         Validator.MUST_Completed(func);
23330 |         Validator.MUST_HaveUniqueSelector(bundle, func);
23331 |         bundle.startBuilding();
23332 |         bundle.functions.push(func);
23333 |         bundle.finishBuilding();
23334 |         return bundle.finishProcess(pid);
23335 |     }
23336 |     function pushFunctions(Bundle storage bundle, Function[] storage functions) internal returns(Bundle storage) {
23337 |         uint pid = bundle.startProcess("pushFunctions", param_18(functions));
23338 |         for (uint i; i < functions.length; ++i) {
23339 |             bundle.pushFunction(functions[i]);
23340 |         }
23341 |         return bundle.finishProcess(pid);
23342 |     }
23343 | 
23344 |     /**----------------------
23345 |         🪟 Assign Facade
23346 |     ------------------------*/
23347 |     function assignFacade(Bundle storage bundle, address facade) internal returns(Bundle storage) {
23348 |         uint pid = bundle.startProcess("assignFacade", param_0(facade));
23349 |         Validator.MUST_AddressIsContract(facade);
23350 |         bundle.startBuilding();
23351 |         bundle.facade = facade;
23352 |         bundle.finishBuilding();
23353 |         return bundle.finishProcess(pid);
23354 |     }
23355 | 
23356 | }

23358 | // src/devkit/core/Dictionary.sol
23359 | 
23360 | /**---------------------
23361 |     Support Methods
23362 | -----------------------*/
23363 | 
23364 | // Validation
23365 | 
23366 | // Util
23367 | 
23368 | // External Libs
23369 | 
23370 | // Mock
23371 | 
23372 | // Core Types
23373 | 
23374 | //////////////////////////////////////////////////
23375 | //  📚 Dictionary   //////////////////////////////
23376 |     using DictionaryLib for Dictionary_1 global;
23377 |     using Tracer for Dictionary_1 global;
23378 |     using Inspector for Dictionary_1 global;
23379 |     using TypeGuard for Dictionary_1 global;
23380 | //////////////////////////////////////////////////
23381 | struct Dictionary_1 {
23382 |     string name;
23383 |     address addr;
23384 |     DictionaryKind kind;
23385 |     TypeStatus status;
23386 | }
23387 | library DictionaryLib {
23388 |     using Inspector for bytes4;
23389 |     /**~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
23390 |         📛 Assign Name
23391 |         🚀 Deploy Dictionary
23392 |         📩 Load Dictionary
23393 |         🔂 Duplicate Dictionary
23394 |         🧩 Set Function or Bundle
23395 |         🪟 Upgrade Facade
23396 |         🤖 Create Dictionary Mock
23397 |     ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~*/
23398 | 
23399 |     /**--------------------
23400 |         📛 Assign Name
23401 |     ----------------------*/
23402 |     function assignName(Dictionary_1 memory dictionary, string memory name) internal returns(Dictionary_1 memory) {
23403 |         uint pid = dictionary.startProcess("assignName", param_27(name));
23404 |         dictionary.startBuilding();
23405 |         dictionary.name = name;
23406 |         dictionary.finishBuilding();
23407 |         return dictionary.finishProcess(pid);
23408 |     }
23409 | 
23410 |     /**-------------------------
23411 |         🚀 Deploy Dictionary
23412 |             - Verifiable
23413 |             - Immutable
23414 |             - Beacon
23415 |     ---------------------------*/
23416 |     function deploy(address owner) internal returns(Dictionary_1 memory dictionary) {
23417 |         uint pid = dictionary.startProcess("deploy", param_0(owner));
23418 |         Validator.SHOULD_OwnerIsNotZeroAddress(owner);
23419 |         dictionary.startBuilding();
23420 |         dictionary.addr = address(new Dictionary_0(owner));
23421 |         dictionary.kind = DictionaryKind.Verifiable;
23422 |         dictionary.finishBuilding();
23423 |         return dictionary.finishProcess(pid);
23424 |     }
23425 | 
23426 |     function deployImmutable(Function[] storage functions, address facade) internal returns(Dictionary_1 memory dictionary) {
23427 |         uint pid = dictionary.startProcess("deployImmutable", param_8(functions, facade));
23428 |         Validator.SHOULD_FacadeIsContract(facade);
23429 |         dictionary.startBuilding();
23430 |         ImmutableDictionary.Function[] memory funcs;
23431 |         for (uint i; i < functions.length; ++i) {
23432 |             funcs[i] = ImmutableDictionary.Function(functions[i].selector, functions[i].implementation);
23433 |         }
23434 |         dictionary.addr = address(new ImmutableDictionary(funcs, facade));
23435 |         dictionary.kind = DictionaryKind.Immutable;
23436 |         dictionary.finishBuilding();
23437 |         return dictionary.finishProcess(pid);
23438 |     }
23439 | 
23440 |     function deployBeacon(address implementation, address owner) internal returns(Dictionary_1 memory dictionary) {
23441 |         uint pid = dictionary.startProcess("deployBeacon", param_5(implementation, owner));
23442 |         Validator.MUST_AddressIsContract(implementation);
23443 |         Validator.SHOULD_OwnerIsNotZeroAddress(owner);
23444 |         dictionary.startBuilding();
23445 |         dictionary.addr = address(new BeaconDictionary(implementation, owner));
23446 |         dictionary.kind = DictionaryKind.Beacon;
23447 |         dictionary.finishBuilding();
23448 |         return dictionary.finishProcess(pid);
23449 | }
23450 | 
23451 |     /**-----------------------
23452 |         📩 Load Dictionary
23453 |     -------------------------*/
23454 |     function load(string memory name, address dictionaryAddr) internal returns(Dictionary_1 memory dictionary) {
23455 |         uint pid = dictionary.startProcess("load", param_0(dictionaryAddr));
23456 |         Validator.MUST_NotEmptyName(name);
23457 |         Validator.MUST_AddressIsContract(dictionaryAddr);
23458 |         // TODO Validate
23459 |         dictionary.startBuilding();
23460 |         dictionary.name = name;
23461 |         dictionary.addr = dictionaryAddr;
23462 |         dictionary.kind = DictionaryKind.Verifiable; // TODO
23463 |         dictionary.finishBuilding();
23464 |         return dictionary.finishProcess(pid);
23465 |     }
23466 | 
23467 |     /**----------------------------
23468 |         🔂 Duplicate Dictionary
23469 |     ------------------------------*/
23470 |     function duplicate(Dictionary_1 storage dictionary, address owner) internal returns(Dictionary_1 memory duplicatedDictionary) {
23471 |         uint pid = dictionary.startProcess("duplicate", param_11(dictionary));
23472 |         Validator.MUST_Completed(dictionary);
23473 | 
23474 |         duplicatedDictionary = deploy(owner).assignName(dictionary.name);
23475 | 
23476 |         address fromAddr = dictionary.addr;
23477 | 
23478 |         bytes4[] memory _selectors = IDictionary(fromAddr).supportsInterfaces();
23479 |         for (uint i; i < _selectors.length; ++i) {
23480 |             bytes4 _selector = _selectors[i];
23481 |             if (_selector.isEmpty()) continue;
23482 |             duplicatedDictionary.set(_selector, IDictionary(fromAddr).getImplementation(_selector));
23483 |         }
23484 | 
23485 |         dictionary.finishProcess(pid);
23486 |     }
23487 | 
23488 |     /**-----------------------------
23489 |         🧩 Set Function or Bundle
23490 |     -------------------------------*/
23491 |     function set(Dictionary_1 memory dictionary, bytes4 selector, address implementation) internal returns(Dictionary_1 memory) {
23492 |         uint pid = dictionary.startProcess("set", param_24(selector, implementation));
23493 |         Validator.MUST_Completed(dictionary);
23494 |         Validator.SHOULD_NotEmptySelector(selector);
23495 |         Validator.MUST_AddressIsContract(implementation);
23496 |         IDictionary(dictionary.addr).setImplementation({
23497 |             functionSelector: selector,
23498 |             implementation: implementation
23499 |         });
23500 |         return dictionary.finishProcess(pid);
23501 |     }
23502 |     function set(Dictionary_1 memory dictionary, Function memory func) internal returns(Dictionary_1 memory) {
23503 |         uint pid = dictionary.startProcess("set", param_6(func));
23504 |         set(dictionary, func.selector, func.implementation);
23505 |         return dictionary.finishProcess(pid);
23506 |     }
23507 |     function set(Dictionary_1 memory dictionary, Bundle storage bundle) internal returns(Dictionary_1 memory) {
23508 |         uint pid = dictionary.startProcess("set", param_25(bundle));
23509 |         Validator.MUST_HaveFunction(bundle);
23510 |         Function[] memory functions = bundle.functions;
23511 |         for (uint i; i < functions.length; ++i) {
23512 |             set(dictionary, functions[i]);
23513 |         }
23514 | 
23515 |         // TODO Generate Facade
23516 |         // if (dictionary.isVerifiable()) {
23517 |         //     dictionary.upgradeFacade(bundle.facade);
23518 |         // }
23519 | 
23520 |         return dictionary.finishProcess(pid);
23521 |     }
23522 | 
23523 |     /**----------------------
23524 |         🪟 Upgrade Facade
23525 |     ------------------------*/
23526 |     function upgradeFacade(Dictionary_1 memory dictionary, address newFacade) internal returns(Dictionary_1 memory) {
23527 |         uint pid = dictionary.startProcess("upgradeFacade", param_16(dictionary, newFacade));
23528 |         Validator.MUST_AddressIsContract(newFacade);
23529 |         Validator.MUST_Verifiable(dictionary);
23530 |         IDictionary(dictionary.addr).upgradeFacade(newFacade);
23531 |         return dictionary.finishProcess(pid);
23532 |     }
23533 | 
23534 |     /**------------------------------
23535 |         🤖 Create Dictionary Mock
23536 |     --------------------------------*/
23537 |     function createMock(Bundle storage bundle, address owner) internal returns(Dictionary_1 memory dictionary) {
23538 |         uint pid = dictionary.startProcess("createMock", param_7(bundle, owner));
23539 |         Validator.MUST_Completed(bundle);
23540 |         Validator.SHOULD_OwnerIsNotZeroAddress(owner);
23541 |         dictionary.startBuilding();
23542 |         dictionary.addr = address(new MockDictionary(owner, bundle.functions));
23543 |         dictionary.kind = DictionaryKind.Mock;
23544 |         dictionary.finishBuilding();
23545 |         return dictionary.finishProcess(pid);
23546 |     }
23547 | 
23548 | }

23551 |     Dictionary Kind
23552 | ----------------------*/

23555 |     Verifiable,
23556 |     Immutable,
23557 |     Beacon,
23558 |     Mock
23559 | }
23560 | using Inspector for DictionaryKind global;

23571 | 
23572 | //////////////////////////////////////////////
23573 | //  🧩 Function   ////////////////////////////
23574 |     using FunctionLib for Function global;
23575 |     using Tracer for Function global;
23576 |     using Inspector for Function global;
23577 |     using TypeGuard for Function global;
23578 |     using Formatter for Function global;
23579 | //////////////////////////////////////////////
23580 | struct Function { /// @dev TODO Function may be different depending on the op version.
23581 |     string name;
23582 |     bytes4 selector;
23583 |     address implementation;
23584 |     TypeStatus status;
23585 | }
23586 | library FunctionLib {
23587 |     /**--------------------
23588 |         📛 Assign Name
23589 |     ----------------------*/
23590 |     function assignName(Function storage func, string memory name) internal returns(Function storage) {
23591 |         uint pid = func.startProcess("assignName", param_27(name));
23592 |         func.startBuilding();
23593 |         func.name = name;
23594 |         func.finishBuilding();
23595 |         return func.finishProcess(pid);
23596 |     }
23597 | 
23598 |     /**------------------------
23599 |         🎯 Assign Selector
23600 |     --------------------------*/
23601 |     function assignSelector(Function storage func, bytes4 selector) internal returns(Function storage) {
23602 |         uint pid = func.startProcess("assignSelector", param_12(selector));
23603 |         func.startBuilding();
23604 |         func.selector = selector;
23605 |         func.finishBuilding();
23606 |         return func.finishProcess(pid);
23607 |     }
23608 | 
23609 |     /**------------------------------
23610 |         🎨 Assign Implementation
23611 |     --------------------------------*/
23612 |     function assignImplementation(Function storage func, address implementation) internal returns(Function storage) {
23613 |         uint pid = func.startProcess("assignImplementation", param_0(implementation));
23614 |         func.startBuilding();
23615 |         func.implementation = implementation;
23616 |         func.finishBuilding();
23617 |         return func.finishProcess(pid);
23618 |     }
23619 | 
23620 |     /**---------------
23621 |         🌈 Assign
23622 |     -----------------*/
23623 |     function assign(Function storage func, string memory name, bytes4 selector, address implementation) internal returns(Function storage) {
23624 |         uint pid = func.startProcess("assign", param_20(name, selector, implementation));
23625 |         func.assignName(name);
23626 |         func.assignSelector(selector);
23627 |         func.assignImplementation(implementation);
23628 |         return func.finishProcess(pid);
23629 |     }
23630 | 
23631 |     /**-----------------------
23632 |         📨 Fetch Function
23633 |     -------------------------*/
23634 |     function fetch(Function storage func, string memory envKey) internal returns(Function storage) {
23635 |         uint pid = func.startProcess("fetch", param_27(envKey));
23636 |         Validator.MUST_NotEmptyEnvKey(envKey);
23637 |         func.assignName(envKey);
23638 |         func.assignImplementation(loadAddressFrom(envKey));
23639 |         return func.finishProcess(pid);
23640 |     }
23641 | 
23642 | }

23662 |     using Inspector for Proxy_2 global;
23663 |     using TypeGuard for Proxy_2 global;
23664 | ///////////////////////////////////////////

23667 |     ProxyKind kind;
23668 |     TypeStatus status;
23669 | }
23670 | library ProxyLib {
23671 |     /**---------------------
23672 |         🚀 Deploy Proxy
23673 |     -----------------------*/
23674 |     function deploy(Dictionary_1 memory dictionary, bytes memory initData) internal returns(Proxy_2 memory proxy) {
23675 |         uint pid = proxy.startProcess("deploy", param_2(dictionary, initData));
23676 |         Validator.MUST_Completed(dictionary);
23677 |         proxy.startBuilding();
23678 |         proxy.addr = address(new Proxy_1(dictionary.addr, initData));
23679 |         proxy.kind = ProxyKind.Verifiable;
23680 |         proxy.finishBuilding();
23681 |         return proxy.finishProcess(pid);
23682 |     }
23683 | 
23684 |     /**--------------------------
23685 |         🤖 Create Proxy Mock
23686 |     ----------------------------*/
23687 |     function createSimpleMock(Function[] memory functions) internal returns(Proxy_2 memory mockProxy) {
23688 |         uint pid = mockProxy.startProcess("createSimpleMock", param_18(functions));
23689 |         for (uint i; i < functions.length; ++i) {
23690 |             Validator.MUST_Completed(functions[i]);
23691 |         }
23692 |         mockProxy.startBuilding();
23693 |         mockProxy.addr = address(new SimpleMockProxy(functions));
23694 |         mockProxy.kind = ProxyKind.Mock;
23695 |         mockProxy.finishBuilding();
23696 |         return mockProxy.finishProcess(pid);
23697 |     }
